<article_start> </s> barbados ( or ) is an island country in the lesser antilles of the west indie , in the caribbean region of north america . it is in length and up to in width , covering an area of . it is in the western area of the north atlantic and east of the windward island and the caribbean sea ; therein , barbados is the most easterly of the caribbean island . barbados is east of the windward , part of the lesser antilles , roughly at 13th parallel north 13n of the equator . it is about east of both the country of saint lucia and saint vincent and the grenadine and south-east of martinique and north-east of trinidad and tobago . barbados is outside the principal atlantic [ belt ] . it capital and largest city is bridgetown , barbados . </s> inhabited by island carib people since the 13th century , and prior to that by other amerindian , barbados wa visited by spanish navigator in the late 15th century and claimed for the monarchy of spain . it first appeared on a spanish map in 1511 . the portuguese empire claimed the island between 1532 and 1536 , but later abandoned it in 1620 with their only remnant being an introduction of wild boar for a good supply of meat whenever the island wa visited . an kingdom of england ship , the olive blossom , arrived in barbados on 14 may 1625 ; it men took possession of it in the name of james vi and i . in 1627 , the first permanent settler arrived from england , and it became an english overseas possession and later british colonisation of the america # british caribbean colony . a a wealthy sugar colony , it became an english centre of the african slave trade until that trade wa outlawed by the slave trade act 1807 , with final emancipation of slave in barbados occurring over a period of year following the slavery abolition act 1833. </s> on 30 november 1966 , barbados became an independent state and commonwealth realm with elizabeth ii a queen of barbados , though the country is set to remove her a it head of state and become a republic by 30 november 2021 . it ha a population of 287,010 people , predominantly of african descent . despite being classified a an atlantic island , barbados is considered to be a part of the caribbean , where it is ranked a a leading tourist destination . of the tourist , 40 % come from the uk , with the u and canada making up the next large group of visitor to the island . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name `` barbados `` is from either the portuguese language term o barbudos or the spanish language equivalent , los barbudos , both meaning `` the bearded one `` . it is unclear whether `` bearded `` refers to the long , hanging root of the bearded fig-tree ( ficus citrifolia ) , indigenous to the island , or to the allegedly bearded island carib who once inhabited the island , or , more fancifully , to a visual impression of a beard formed by the sea foam that spray over the outlying reef . in 1519 , a map produced by the genoa mapmaker visconte maggiolo showed and named barbados in it correct position . furthermore , the island of barbuda in the leeward island is very similar in name and wa once named `` la barbuda italic=unset `` by the spanish . </s> the original name for barbados in the pre-columbian era wa ichirouganaim , according to account by descendant of the indigenous arawakan languages-speaking tribe in other regional area , with possible translation including `` red land with white teeth `` or `` redstone island with teeth outside ( reef ) `` or simply `` teeth `` . </s> colloquially , barbadian refer to their home island a `` bim `` or other nickname associated with barbados , including `` bimshire `` . the origin is uncertain , but several theory exist . the national cultural foundation of barbados say that `` bim `` wa a word commonly used by slave , and that it derives from the igbo language term bm from b m meaning 'my home , kindred , kind ' , the igbo phoneme in the igbo orthography is very close to . the name could have arisen due to the relatively large percentage of enslaved igbo people from modern-day southeastern nigeria arriving in barbados in the 18th century . the word 'bim ' and 'bimshire ' are recorded in the oxford english dictionary and chamber dictionary . another possible source for 'bim ' is reported to be in the agricultural reporter of 25 april 1868 , where the rev . n. greenidge ( father of one of the island 's most famous scholar , abel hendy jones greenidge ) suggested the listing of bimshire a a county of england . expressly named were `` wiltshire , hampshire , berkshire and bimshire `` . lastly , in the daily argosy ( of demerara , i.e . guyana ) of 1652 , there is a reference to bim a a possible corruption of 'byam ' , the name of a royalist leader against the parliamentarian . that source suggested the follower of byam became known a 'bims ' and that this became a word for all barbadian . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period <section_title_end> </s> archeological evidence suggests human may have first settled or visited the island circa 1600 bc . more permanent amerindian settlement of barbados date to about the 4th to 7th century ad , by a group known a the saladoid-barrancoid . the two main group were the arawak from south america , who became dominant around 8001200 ad , and the more war-like kalinago ( island carib ) who arrived from south america in the 12th13th century </s> <section_title_start> european arrival <section_title_end> </s> it is uncertain which european nation arrived first in barbados , which probably would have been at some point in the 15th century or 16th century . one lesser-known source point to earlier revealed work predating contemporary source indicating it could have been the spanish . many , if not most , believe the history of portugal ( 1415-1542 ) , en route to brazil , were the first european to come upon the island . the island wa largely ignored by european , though spanish slave raiding is thought to have reduced the native population , with many fleeing to other island . </s> <section_title_start> english settlement in the 1600s <section_title_end> </s> the first english ship , which had arrived on 14 may 1625 , wa captained by john powell . the first settlement began on 17 february 1627 , near what is now holetown ( formerly jamestown ) , by a group led by john powell 's younger brother , henry , consisting of 80 settler and 10 english indentured laborer . some source state that some african were amongst these first settler . </s> the settlement wa established a a proprietary colony and funded by sir william courten , a city of london merchant who acquired the title to barbados and several other island . so the first colonist were actually tenant and much of the profit of their labour returned to courten and his company . courten 's title wa later transferred to james hay , 1st earl of carlisle , in what wa called the `` great barbados robbery . `` carlisle then chose a governor henry hawley ( governor ) , who established the barbados house of assembly in 1639 , in an effort to appease the planter , who might otherwise have opposed his controversial appointment . </s> in the period 164060 , the west indie attracted over two-thirds of the total number of english emigrant to the america . by 1650 there were 44,000 settler in the west indie , a compared to 12,000 on the chesapeake bay and 23,000 in new england . most english arrival were indentured . after five year of labour , they were given `` freedom due `` of about 10 , usually in good . before the mid-1630s , they also received of land , but after that time the island filled and there wa no more free land . during the interregnum ( england ) ( 1650s ) this included a large number of prisoners-of-war , vagrant and people who were illicitly kidnapped , who were forcibly transported to the island and sold a servant . these last two group were predominantly irish , a several thousand were infamously rounded up by english merchant and sold into servitude in barbados and other caribbean island during this period , a practice that came to be known a being barbadosed . cultivation of tobacco , cotton , ginger and indigo wa thus handled primarily by european indentured labour until the start of the sugar cane industry in the 1640s and the growing reliance on and importation of enslaved african . </s> life in the young colony wa not easy , with parish register from the 1650s show , for the white population , there were four time a many death a marriage . the mainstay of the infant colony 's economy wa the growth export of tobacco , but tobacco price eventually fell in the 1630s a chesapeake production expanded . </s> <section_title_start> effects of the english civil war <section_title_end> </s> around the same time , fighting during the war of the three kingdom and the interregnum ( england ) spilled over into barbados and barbadian territorial water . the island wa not english revolution in the colony until after the execution of charles i of england , when the island 's government fell under the control of royalist ( ironically the governor , philip bell , remaining loyal to parliament of england while the barbadian house of assembly , under the influence of humphrey walrond , supported charles ii of england ) . to try to bring the recalcitrant colony to heel , the rump parliament # commonwealth of england passed an act on 3 october 1650 prohibiting trade between england and barbados , and because the island also traded with the netherlands , further navigation act were passed prohibiting any but english vessel trading with dutch colony # atlantic . these act were a precursor to the first anglo-dutch war . the commonwealth of england sent an invasion force under the command of george ayscue , which arrived in october 1651 . ayscue with a smaller force which included scottish prisoner surprised a larger force of royalist , but had to resort to spying and diplomacy ultimately . on january 11 , 1652 , the royalist in the house of assembly led by francis willoughby , 5th baron willoughby of parham surrendered which marked the end of royalist privateering a a major threat . the condition of the surrender were incorporated into the charter of barbados ( treaty of oistins ) , which wa signed at the mermaid 's inn , oistins , on 17 january 1652. </s> lord nelson statue wa removed from bridgetown on november 16th , 2020. </s> <section_title_start> irish people in barbados <section_title_end> </s> starting with cromwell , a large percentage of the white labourer population were indentured servant and involuntarily transported people from ireland . irish servant in barbados were often treated poorly , and barbadian planter gained a reputation for cruelty . the decreased appeal of an indenture on barbados , combined with enormous demand for labour caused by sugar cultivation , led the use of involuntary transportation to barbados a a punishment for crime , or for political prisoner , and also to the kidnapping of labourer who were sent to barbados involuntarily . irish indentured servant were a significant portion of the population throughout the period when white servant were used for plantation labour in barbados , and while a `` steady stream `` of irish servant entered the barbados throughout the seventeenth century , cromwellian effort to pacify ireland created a `` veritable tidal wave `` of irish labourer who were sent to barbados during the 1650s . due to inadequate historical record , the total number of irish labourer sent to barbados is unknown , and estimate have been `` highly contentious . `` while one historical source estimated that a many a 50,000 irish people were transported to either barbados or virginia unwillingly during the 1650s , this estimate is `` quite likely exaggerated . `` another estimate that 12,000 irish prisoner had arrived in barbados by 1655 ha been described a `` probably exaggerated `` by historian richard b. sheridan . according to historian thomas bartlett , it is `` generally accepted `` that approximately 10,000 irish were sent to the west indie involuntarily , and approximately 40,000 came a voluntary indentured servant , while many also travelled a voluntary , un-indentured emigrant . </s> <section_title_start> the sugar revolution <section_title_end> </s> the introduction of sugar cane from dutch brazil in 1640 completely transformed society , the economy and the physical landscape . barbados eventually had one of the world 's biggest sugar industry . one group instrumental in ensuring the early success of the industry wa the sephardi jew , who had originally been expelled from the iberian peninsula , to end up in dutch brazil . a the effect of the new crop increased , so did the shift in the ethnic composition of barbados and surrounding island . the workable sugar plantation required a large investment and a great deal of heavy labour . at first , dutch trader supplied the equipment , financing , and enslaved african , in addition to transporting most of the sugar to europe . in 1644 the population of barbados wa estimated at 30,000 , of which about 800 were of african descent , with the remainder mainly of english descent . these english smallholder were eventually bought out and the island filled up with large sugar plantation worked by enslaved african . by 1660 there wa near parity with 27,000 black and 26,000 white . by 1666 at least 12,000 white smallholder had been bought out , died , or left the island , many choosing to emigrate to jamaica or the american colony ( notably the carolina ) . a a result , barbados enacted a barbados slave code a a way of legislatively controlling it black enslaved population . the law 's text wa influential in law in other colony . </s> by 1680 there were 20,000 free white and 46,000 enslaved african ; by 1724 , there were 18,000 free white and 55,000 enslaved african . </s> <section_title_start> 18th and 19th centuries <section_title_end> </s> the harsh condition endured by the slave resulted in several planned slave rebellion , the largest of which wa bussa 's rebellion in 1816 which wa suppressed by british troop . growing opposition to slavery led to it abolition in the british empire in 1833 . however the plantocracy class retained control of the political and economic situation on the island , with most worker living in relative poverty . </s> the great hurricane of 1780 killed over 4,000 people on barbados . in 1854 , a cholera epidemic killed over 20,000 inhabitant . </s> <section_title_start> 20th century colonial period <section_title_end> </s> deep dissatisfaction with the situation on barbados led many to emigrate . thing came to a head in the 1930s during the great depression , a barbadian began demanding better condition for worker , the legalisation of trade union and a widening of the franchise , which at that point wa limited to male property owner . a a result of the increasing unrest the british sent a commission ( the west indie royal commission , or moyne commission ) in 1938 , which recommended enacting many of the requested reform on the island . a a result , afro-barbadians began to play a much more prominent role in the colony 's politics , with universal suffrage being introduced in 1950. </s> prominent among these early activist wa grantley herbert adam , who helped found the barbados labour party ( blp ) in 1938 . he became the first premier of barbados in 1953 , followed by fellow blp-founder hugh gordon cummins from 1958 to 1961 . a group of left-leaning politician who advocated swifter move to independence broke off from the blp and founded the democratic labour party ( barbados ) ( dlp ) in 1955 . the dlp subsequently won the 1961 barbadian general election and their leader errol barrow became premier . </s> full internal self-government wa enacted in 1961 . barbados joined the short-lived west indie federation from 1958 to 1962 , later gaining full independence on 30 november 1966 . errol barrow became the country 's first prime minister . barbados opted to remain within the british commonwealth , retaining queen elizabeth a monarchy of barbados , represented locally by a governor-general of barbados governor-general . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence era <section_title_end> </s> the barrow government sought to diversify the economy away from agriculture , seeking to boost industry and the tourism sector . barbados wa also at forefront of regional integration effort , spearheading the creation of carifta and caricom . the dlp lost the 1976 barbadian general election to the blp under tom adam ( politician ) . adam adopted a more conservative and strongly pro-western stance , allowing the american to use barbados a the launchpad for their united state invasion of grenada in 1983 . adam died in office in 1985 and wa replaced by harold bernard st. john , however he lost the 1986 barbadian general election which saw the return of the dlp under errol barrow , who had been highly critical of the u intervention in grenada . however barrow too died in office , and wa replaced by lloyd erskine sandiford who remained prime minister until 1994. </s> owen arthur of the blp won the 1994 barbadian general election , remaining prime minister until 2008 . arthur wa a strong advocate of republicanism , though a planned referendum to replace queen elizabeth a head of state in 2008 never took place . the dlp won the 2008 barbadian general election , however the new prime minister david thompson ( barbadian politician ) died in 2010 and wa replaced by freundel stuart . the blp returned to power 2018 barbadian general election under mia mottley , who became barbados 's first female prime minister . </s> barbados announced on 15 september 2020 that it intends to become a republic by 30 november 2021 , the 55th anniversary of it independence . it plan to replace the queen with it own elected official a head of state . at this point , barbados will cease to be a commonwealth realm , but will maintain membership in the commonwealth of nation . critic claim that the move came about in part because china exerted pressure on barbados . </s> <section_title_start> geography and climate <section_title_end> </s> barbados is situated in the atlantic ocean , east of the other west indie island . barbados is the easternmost island in the lesser antilles . it is flat in comparison to it island neighbour to the west , the windward island . the island rise gently to the central highland region known a scotland district , with the high point of the nation being mount hillaby above sea level . </s> in the parish of saint michael , barbados lie barbados 's capital and main city , bridgetown , containing 1/3 of the country 's population . other major town scattered across the island include holetown , in the parish of saint james , barbados ; oistins , in the parish of christ church , barbados ; and speightstown , in the parish of saint peter , barbados . </s> <section_title_start> geology <section_title_end> </s> barbados lie on the boundary of the south american plate and the caribbean plate . the subduction of the south american plate beneath the caribbean plate scrape sediment from the south american plate and deposit it above the subduction zone forming an accretionary wedge . the rate of this depositing of material allows barbados to rise at a rate of about per 1,000 year . this subduction mean geology the island is composed of coral roughly thick , where reef formed above the sediment . the land slope in a series of `` terrace `` in the west and go into an incline in the east . a large proportion of the island is circled by coral reef . </s> the erosion of limestone in the northeast of the island , in the scotland district , ha resulted in the formation of various cave and gully . on the atlantic ocean east coast of the island coastal landforms , including stack , have been created due to the limestone composition of the area . also notable in the island is the rocky cape known a pico teneriffe ( barbados ) or pico de tenerife , which is named after the fact that the island of tenerife in spain is the first land east of barbados according to the belief of the local . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the country generally experience two season , one of which includes noticeably higher rainfall . known a the `` wet season `` , this period run from june to december . by contrast , the `` dry season `` run from december to may . annual precipitation range between . </s> from december to may the average temperature range from , while between june and november , they range from . </s> on the kppen climate classification scale , much of barbados is regarded a a tropical monsoon climate ( am ) . however , breeze of abound throughout the year and give barbados a climate which is moderately tropical . </s> infrequent natural hazard include earthquake , landslip , and [ barbados is often spared the worst effect of the region 's tropical storm ] s and [ during the rainy season . it location in the south-east of the caribbean region put the country just outside the principal [ [ hurricane strike zone ] . on average , a major hurricane strike about once every 26 year . the last significant hit from a hurricane to cause severe damage to barbados wa [ [ hurricane janet in 1955 ; in 2010 the island wa struck by hurricane tomas , but this caused only minor damage across the country a it wa only at tropical storm level of formation . </s> <section_title_start> environmental issue <section_title_end> </s> barbados is susceptible to environmental pressure . a one of the world 's most list of island country by population density , the government worked during the 1990s to aggressively integrate the growing south coast of the island into the bridgetown sewage treatment plant to reduce contamination of offshore coral reef . a of the first decade of the 21st century , a second treatment plant ha been proposed along the island 's west coast . being so densely populated , barbados ha made great effort to protect it underground aquifer . </s> a a coral-limestone island , barbados is highly permeable to seepage of surface water into the earth . the government ha placed great emphasis on protecting the catchment area that lead directly into the huge network of underground aquifer and stream . on occasion illegal squatter have breached these area , and the government ha removed squatter to preserve the cleanliness of the underground spring which provide the island 's drinking water . </s> the government ha placed a huge emphasis on keeping barbados clean with the aim of protecting the environment and preserving offshore coral reef which surround the island . many initiative to mitigate human pressure on the coastal region of barbados and sea come from the coastal zone management unit ( czmu ) . barbados ha nearly of coral reef just offshore and two protected marine park have been established off the west coast . overfishing is another threat which face barbados . </s> although on the opposite side of the atlantic , and some west of africa , barbados is one of many place in the american continent that experience heightened level of mineral dust from the sahara desert . some particularly intense dust episode have been blamed partly for the impact on the health of coral reef surrounding barbados or asthmatic episode , but evidence ha not wholly supported the former such claim . </s> access to biocapacity in barbados is much lower than world average . in 2016 , barbados had 0.17 global hectare of biocapacity per person within it territory , much le than the world average of 1.6 global hectare per person . in 2016 barbados used 0.84 global hectare of biocapacity per person - their ecological footprint of consumption . this mean they use approximately five time a much biocapacity a barbados contains . a a result , barbados is running a biocapacity deficit . </s> <section_title_start> wildlife <section_title_end> </s> barbados is host to four specie of nesting turtle ( green turtle , loggerhead sea turtle , [ turtle ] s , and leatherback ) and ha the second-largest hawksbill turtle-breeding population in the caribbean . the driving of vehicle on beach can crush nest buried in the sand and such activity is discouraged in nesting area . </s> barbados is also the host to the green monkey . the green monkey is found in west africa from senegal to the volta river . it ha been introduced to the cape verde island off north-western africa , and the west indian island of saint kitts , nevis , saint martin , and barbados . it wa introduced to the west indie in the late 17th century when slave trade ship travelled to the caribbean from west africa . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> the 2010 national census conducted by the barbados statistical service reported a resident population of 277,821 , of which 144,803 were female and 133,018 were male . </s> the life expectancy for barbados resident is 79 year . the average life expectancy is 83 year for female and 78 year for male ( 2019 ) . barbados and japan have the highest per caput occurrence of centenarian in the world . </s> the crude birth rate is 12.23 birth per 1,000 people , and the crude death rate is 8.39 death per 1,000 people . the infant mortality rate is 11.63 infant death per 1,000 live birth . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> close to 90 % of all barbadian ( also known colloquially a `` bajan `` ) are of afro-caribbean descent ( `` afro-barbadian afro-bajans `` ) and mixed descent . the remainder of the population includes group of european ( `` anglo-bajans `` / `` euro-bajans `` ) mainly from the united kingdom and ireland , italian , and asian , predominantly chinese and indian ( both hindu and muslim ) . </s> other group in barbados include people from the united kingdom , united state and canada . barbadian who return after year of residence in the united state and child born in america to bajan parent are called `` bajan yankee `` , a term considered derogatory by some . generally , bajans recognise and accept all `` child of the island `` a bajans , and refer to each other a such . </s> the biggest community outside the afro-caribbean community are : </s> # the indo-guyanese , an important part of the economy due to the increase of immigrant from partner country guyana . there are report of a growing indian in barbados indo-bajans diaspora originating from guyana and india starting around 1990 . predominantly from southern india , they are growing in size but are smaller than the equivalent community in trinidad and guyana . people who are indian in the caribbean are also referred to a coolie who are indian that came from east india to the america a labourer . they sometimes get mixed up with dougla who have african and indian ancestry while cooly are full blooded indian . the muslim barbadian of indian origin are largely of gujarati ancestry . many small business in barbados are run and operated by muslim-indian bajans . </s> # euro-bajans ( 5 % of the population ) have settled in barbados since the 17th century , originating from england , ireland , portugal , and scotland . in 1643 , there were 37,200 white in barbados ( 86 % of the population ) . more commonly they are known a `` white barbadian `` . euro-bajans introduced folk music , such a irish music and highland music , and certain place name , such a `` scotland district `` , a hilly region in the parish of st. andrew . among white barbadian there exists an underclass known a redlegs comprising follower of the duke of monmouth after his defeat at the battle of sedgemoor , a well a the descendant of irish people indentured labourer and prisoner imported to the island . many additionally moved on to become the earliest settler of modern-day province of carolina and colonial period of south carolina in the united state . today the redlegs only number around 400. </s> # chinese-barbadians are a small portion of barbados 's wider asian population . most if not all first arrived in the 1940s from hong kong during the second world war . many chinese-bajans have the surname chin , chynn or lee , although other surname prevail in certain area of the island . chinese food and culture is becoming part of everyday bajan culture . </s> # lebanese and syrian form the island 's arab barbadian community , which is overwhelmingly christian arab . the muslim arab minority among arab barbadian make up a small percentage of the overall minority muslim barbadian population . the majority of the lebanese and syrian arrived in barbados through trade opportunity . their number are falling due to emigration to other country . </s> # jew arrived in barbados just after the first settler in 1627 . bridgetown is the home of nidhe israel synagogue , one of the oldest jewish synagogue in the america , dating from 1654 , though the current structure wa erected in 1833 , replacing one ruined by the hurricane of 1831 . tombstone in the neighbouring cemetery date from the 1630s . now under the care of the barbados national trust , the site wa deserted in 1929 but wa saved and restored by the jewish community beginning in 1986. </s> # in the seventeenth century , romani people were sent from the united kingdom to work a slave in the plantation in barbados . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> english is the official language of barbados , and is used for communication , administration , and public service all over the island . in it capacity a the official language of the country , the standard of english tends to conform to the vocabulary , pronunciation , spelling , and convention akin to , but not exactly the same a , those of british english . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> most barbadian of african and european descent are christian ( 95 % ) , the largest denomination being anglican communion ( 40 % ) . other christian denomination with significant following in barbados are the catholic church ( administered by roman catholic diocese of bridgetown ) , pentecostal , jehovah 's witness , the seventh-day adventist church and spiritual baptist . the church of england wa the official state religion until it legal disestablishment by the parliament of barbados following independence . </s> other religion in barbados include hinduism , islam in barbados , the bah faith , and history of the jew in barbados . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> barbados ha been an independent country since 30 november 1966 . it function a a constitutional monarchy and parliamentary democracy modelled on the british westminster system . the queen of barbados , elizabeth ii , is [ of state ] and is represented locally by the governor-general of barbadospresently sandra mason . both are advised on matter of the barbadian state by the prime minister of barbados , who is [ of government ] . there are 30 representative within the barbados house of assembly . </s> the constitution of barbados is the supreme law of the nation . the attorney general head judiciary of barbados . new act are passed by the barbadian parliament and require royal assent by the governor-general to become law . </s> during the 1990s at the suggestion of trinidad and tobago 's patrick manning , barbados attempted a political union with trinidad and tobago and guyana . the project stalled after the then prime minister of barbados , lloyd erskine sandiford , became ill and his democratic labour party ( barbados ) lost the next general election . barbados continues to share close tie with trinidad and tobago and with guyana , claiming the highest number of guyanese immigrant after the united state , canada and the united kingdom . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> barbados function a a two-party system . the dominant political party are the democratic labour party ( barbados ) and the incumbent barbados labour party . since independence on 30 november 1966 , the democratic labour party ( dlp ) ha governed from 1966 to 1976 ; 1986 to 1994 ; and from 2008 to 2018 ; and the barbados labour party ( blp ) ha also governed from 1976 to 1986 ; 1994 to 2008 ; and from 2018 to present . the democratic labour party government ( dlp ) held office with the then premier of barbados became prime minister of barbados , errol barrow for three successive term from 4 december 1961 to 2 september 1976 ; and again from 28 may 1986 until his sudden death in office on 1 june 1987 . the 4th prime minister , sir . lloyd sandiford took over with the democratic labour party government ( dlp ) from 1 june 1987 to 20 january 1991 ; and from 20 january 1991 to 6 september 1994 . the barbados labour party ( blp ) held office with the then prime minister , tom adam from 2 september 1976 to 18 june 1981 ; and from 18 june 1981 until his sudden death in office on 11 march 1985 . the 3rd prime minister , sir . harold st. john took over with the barbados labour party government ( blp ) from 11 march 1985 to 28 may 1986 . the blp held power from 6 september 1994 to 15 january 2008 . the democratic labour party government ( dlp ) held power with the then 6th prime minister , david thompson from 15 january 2008 until his death in office on 23 october 2010 . the 7th prime minister , freundel stuart took over with the democratic labour party government ( dlp ) from 23 october 2010 to 21 february 2013 ; and from 21 february 2013 to 24 may 2018 for the general election for the new barbados labour party ( blp ) . all of barbados ' prime minister , except freundel stuart , held under the ministry of finance 's portfolio . the barbados labour party government ( blp ) held power with the now 8th prime minister of barbados , mia mottley from 24 may 2018 to present until the next general election on 24 may 2023. </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> barbados follows a policy of non-aligned movement and seek cooperative relation with all friendly state . barbados is a full and participating member of the caribbean community ( caricom ) , caricom single market and economy ( csme ) , and the association of caribbean state ( ac ) . organization of american state ( oas ) , commonwealth of nation , and the caribbean court of justice ( ccj ) . in 2005 the parliament of barbados voted on a measure replacing the uk 's judicial committee of the privy council with the caribbean court of justice based in port of spain , trinidad and tobago . </s> <section_title_start> world trade organization , european commission , cariforum <section_title_end> </s> barbados is an original member ( 1995 ) of the world trade organization ( wto ) and participates actively in it work . it grant at least mfn treatment to all it trading partner . european union relation and cooperation with barbados are carried out both on a bilateral and a regional basis . barbados is party to the cotonou agreement , through which it is linked by an economic partnership agreement with the european commission . the pact involves the caribbean forum ( cariforum ) subgroup of the african , caribbean and pacific group of state ( acp ) . cariforum is the only part of the wider acp-bloc that ha concluded the full regional trade-pact with the european union . there are also ongoing eu-community of latin american and caribbean state ( celac ) and eu-cariforum dialogue . </s> trade policy ha also sought to protect a small number of domestic activity , mostly food production , from foreign competition , while recognising that most domestic need are best met by import . </s> <section_title_start> the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty 1994 <section_title_end> </s> on 6 july 1994 , at the sherbourne conference centre , st. michael , barbados , representative of eight ( 8 ) country signed the double taxation relief ( caricom ) treaty 1994 . the country which were represented were : antigua and barbuda , belize , grenada , jamaica , st. kitts and nevis , st. lucia , st. vincent and the grenadine and trinidad and tobago . </s> on 19 august 1994 a representative of the government of guyana signed a similar treaty . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the barbados defence force ha roughly 800 member . within it , 14- to 18-year-olds make up the barbados cadet corp . the defence preparation of the island nation are closely tied to defence treaty with the united kingdom , the united state , and the people 's republic of china . </s> the royal barbados police force is the sole law enforcement agency on the island of barbados . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> barbados is administrative division into 11 parish : </s> st. george and st. thomas are in the middle of the country and are the only parish without coastline . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> barbados is the 53rd list of country by gdp ( nominal ) per caput in term of gdp ( gross domestic product ) per caput , ha a well-developed mixed economy , and a moderately high standard of living . according to the world bank , barbados is classified a being in it 66 top high income economy of the world . despite this , a 2012 self-study in conjunction with the caribbean development bank revealed 20 % of barbadian live in poverty , and nearly 10 % can not meet their basic daily food need . </s> historically , the economy of barbados had been dependent on sugarcane cultivation and related activity , but since the late 1970s and early 1980s it ha diversified into the manufacturing and tourism sector . offshore finance and information service have become important foreign exchange earner , and there is a healthy light manufacturing sector . since the 1990s the barbados government ha been seen a business-friendly and economically sound . the island saw a construction boom , with the development and redevelopment of hotel , office complex , and home , partly due to the staging of the 2007 cricket world cup . this slowed during the 2008 to 2012 world economic crisis and the recession . </s> there wa a strong economy between 1999 and 2000 but the economy went into recession in 2001 and 2002 due to slowdown in tourism , consumer spending and the impact of the 11 september 2001 attack in the united state and the 7 july 2005 london bombing in the united kingdom . the economy rebounded in 2003 and ha shown growth since 2004 which continued right through to 2008 . the economy went into recession again from 2008 to 2013 before showing growth from 2014 to 2017 . then it declined to another recession from 2017 to 2019 during the world economic crisis . there were 23 downgrade by both standard & poor 's and moody 's in 2016 , 2017 and 2018 . the economy showed sign of recovery with 3 upgrade from standard and poor 's and moody 's in 2019 . from 1 january to 31 march 2020 the economy had started to grow , but then it experienced another decline due to the covid-19 recession covid-19 economic recession . </s> traditional trading partner include canada , the caribbean community ( especially trinidad and tobago ) , the united kingdom and the united state . recent government administration have continued effort to reduce unemployment , encourage foreign direct investment , and privatise remaining state-owned enterprise . unemployment wa reduced to 10.7 % in 2003 . however , it ha since increased to 11.9 % in second quarter , 2015. </s> the european union is assisting barbados with a program of modernisation of the country 's international business and financial service sector . </s> barbados maintains the third largest barbados stock exchange in the caribbean region . , official at the stock exchange were investigating the possibility of augmenting the local exchange with an international security market ( ism ) venture . </s> <section_title_start> sovereign default and restructuring <section_title_end> </s> by may 2018 , barbados ' outstanding debt climbed to , more than 1.7 time the country 's gdp . in june 2018 the government defaulted on it sovereign debt when it failed to make a coupon on eurobond ( international ) s maturing in 2035 . outstanding bond debt of barbados reached . </s> in october 2019 , barbados concluded restructuring negotiation with a creditor group including investment fund eaton vance , greylock capital management , teacher advisor and guyana bank for trade and industry . creditor will exchange existing bond for a new debt series maturing in 2029 . the new bond involve a principal `` haircut `` of approximately 26 % and include a clause allowing for deferment of principal and capitalization of interest in the event of a natural disaster . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> barbados ha many health center . however , the main hospital on the island is the queen elizabeth hospital . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the barbados list of country by literacy rate is ranked close to 100 % . the mainstream public education system of barbados is fashioned after the british model . the government of barbados spends 6.7 % of it gdp on education ( 2008 ) . </s> all young people in the country must attend school until age 16 . barbados ha over 70 primary school and over 20 secondary school throughout the island . there is a number of private school , including montessori education and the international baccalaureate . student enrolment at these school represents le than 5 % of the total enrolment of the public school . </s> certificate- , diploma- and degree-level education in the country is provided by the barbados community college , the samuel jackman prescod institute of technology , codrington college , and the university of the west indie , cave hill campus and open campus of the university of the west indie . barbados is also home to several overseas medical school , such a ross university school of medicine and the american university of integrative science american university of integrative science , school of medicine . </s> <section_title_start> educational testing <section_title_end> </s> barbados secondary school entrance examination : child who are 11 year old but under 12 year old on 1 september in the year of the examination are required to write the examination a a mean of allocation to secondary school . </s> caribbean secondary education certificate ( csec ) examination are usually taken by student after five year of secondary school and mark the end of standard secondary education . the csec examination are equivalent to the ordinary level ( o-levels ) examination and are targeted toward student 16 and older . </s> caribbean advanced proficiency examination ( cape ) are taken by student who have completed their secondary education and wish to continue their study . student who sit for the cape usually posse csec or an equivalent certification . the cape is equivalent to the british advanced level ( a-levels ) , voluntary qualification that are intended for university entrance . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> barbados is a blend of west african , portuguese , creole , indian and british culture . citizen are officially called barbadian . the term `` bajan `` ( pronounced bay-jun ) may have come from a localised pronunciation of the word barbadian , which at time can sound more like `` bar-bajan `` ; or , more likely , from english bay ( `` bayling `` ) , portuguese wikt : baiano . </s> the largest carnival-like cultural event that take place on the island is the crop over festival , which wa established in 1974 . a in many other caribbean and latin american country , crop over is an important event for many people on the island , a well a the thousand of tourist that flock to there to participate in the annual event . the festival includes musical competition and other traditional activity , and feature the majority of the island 's homegrown calypso music and soca music for the year . the male and female barbadian who harvested the most sugarcane are crowned a the king and queen of the crop . crop over get under way at the beginning of july and end with the costumed parade on kadooment day , held on the first monday of august . new calypso/soca music is usually released and played more frequently from the beginning of may to coincide with the start of the festival . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> bajan cuisine is a mixture of cuisine of africa , indian cuisine , ireland , creole people and british cuisine influence . a typical meal consists of a main dish of meat or fish , normally marinated with a mixture of herb and spice , hot side dish , and one or more salad . a common bajan side dish could be pickled cucumber , fish cake , bake , etc . the meal is usually served with one or more sauce . the national dish of barbados is cou-cou & flying fish with spicy gravy . another traditional meal is `` pudding and souse `` a dish of pickled pork with spiced sweet potato . a wide variety of seafood and meat are also available . </s> the mount gay rum ] visitor centre in barbados claim to be the world 's oldest remaining rum company , with earliest confirmed deed from 1703 . [ [ cockspur rum and malibu ( rum ) are also from the island . barbados is home to the bank barbados brewery , which brew bank beer , a pale lager , a well a bank amber ale . bank also brew tiger malt , a non-alcoholic malta . 10 saint beer is brewed in speightstown , st. peter in barbados and aged for 90 day in mount gay 'special reserve ' rum cask . it wa first brewed in 2009 and is available in certain caricom nation . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> public holiday <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> a in other caribbean country of british colonial heritage , cricket is very popular on the island . the west indie cricket team usually includes several barbadian player . in addition to several warm-up match and six `` super eight `` match , the country hosted the final of the 2007 cricket world cup . barbados ha produced many great cricketer including sir garfield sobers , sir frank worrell , sir clyde walcott , sir everton weekes , gordon greenidge , wes hall , charlie griffith , joel garner , desmond haynes and malcolm marshall . </s> rugby union is also popular in barbados . </s> horse racing take place at the garrison savannah racetrack close to bridgetown . spectator can pay for admission to the stand , or else can watch race from the public `` rail `` , which encompasses the track . </s> basketball is an increasingly popular sport , played at school or college . barbados national basketball team barbados 's national team ha shown some unexpected result a in the past it beat many much larger country . </s> polo is very popular amongst the rich elite on the island and the `` high-goal `` ape hill team is based at the st james 's club . it is also played at the private holder festival ground . </s> in golf , the barbados open , played at royal westmoreland golf club , wa an annual stop on the european senior tour from 2000 to 2009 . in december 2006 the wgc-world cup took place at the country 's sandy lane ( resort ) resort on the country club course , an 18-hole course designed by tom fazio . the barbados golf club is another course on the island . it ha hosted the barbados open on several occasion . </s> volleyball is also popular and is mainly played indoors . </s> tennis is gaining popularity and barbados is home to darian king , currently ranked 270th in the world and is the 2nd highest ranked player in the caribbean . </s> motorsports also play a role , with rally barbados occurring each summer and being listed on the fia nacam calendar . also , the bushy park , barbados hosted the race of champion and global rallycross championship in 2014. </s> the presence of the trade wind along with favourable swell make the southern tip of the island an ideal location for wave sailing ( an extreme form of the sport of windsurfing ) . </s> barbados also host several international surfing competition . </s> netball is also popular with woman in barbados . </s> barbadian team the flyin ' fish , are the 2009 segway polo world champion . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> although barbados is about across at it widest point , a car journey from six cross road in st. philip ( south-east ) to north point in st. lucy ( north-central ) can take one and a half hour or longer due to traffic . barbados ha half a many registered car a citizen . in barbados , driver drive on the left side of the road . </s> barbados is known for it many roundabout . one famous roundabout is a roundabout located east of bridgetown , where you will see an emancipation statue of a slave named bussa . </s> transport on the island is relatively convenient with `` share taxi `` called `` zr `` ( pronounced `` zed-rs `` ) travelling to most point on the island . these small bus can at time be crowded , a passenger are generally never turned down regardless of the number . they will usually take the more scenic route to destination . they generally depart from the capital bridgetown or from speightstown , barbados in the northern part of the island . </s> including the zr , there are three bus system running seven day a week ( though le frequently on sunday ) . there are zr , the yellow minibus and the blue barbados transport board . a ride on any of them cost . the smaller bus from the two privately owned system ( `` zr `` and `` minibus `` ) can give change ; the larger blue bus from the government-operated barbados transport board system can not , but do give receipt . the barbados transport board bus travel in regular bus route and scheduled timetable across barbados . schoolchildren in school uniform including some secondary school ride for free on the government bus and for on the zr . most route require a connection in bridgetown . barbados transport board 's headquarters are located at kay 's house , roebuck street , st. michael , and the bus depot and terminal are located in the fairchild street bus terminal in fairchild street and the princess alice bus terminal ( which wa formerly the lower green bus terminal in jubilee garden , bridgetown , st. michael ) in princess alice highway , bridgetown , st. michael ; the speightstown bus terminal in speightstown , st. peter ; the oistins bus depot in oistins , christ church ; and the mangrove bus depot in mangrove , st. philip . in july 2020 , the barbados transport board received 33 byd auto electric bus which were obtained not only to add to the aging fleet of diesel bus but also to assist the government in their goal of eliminating the use of fossil fuel by the year 2030. </s> some hotel also provide visitor with shuttle to point of interest on the island from outside the hotel lobby . there are several locally owned and operated vehicle rental agency in barbados but there are no multi-national company . </s> the island 's lone airport is the grantley adam international airport . it receives daily flight by several major airline from point around the globe , a well a several smaller regional commercial airline and charter . the airport serf a the main air-transportation hub for the eastern caribbean . in the first decade of the 21st century it underwent a upgrade and expansion in february 2003 until completion in august 2005. </s> there wa also a helicopter shuttle service , which offered air taxi service to a number of site around the island , mainly on the west coast tourist belt . air and maritime traffic wa regulated by the barbados port authority . </s> <section_title_start> notable people
