the caribbean </s> category:1966 establishment in north america </s> category : monarchy of north america </s> category : country in north america </s> category : island country <article_end> <article_start> </s> djibouti , officially the republic of djibouti , is a country located in the horn of africa . it is bordered by somaliland in the south , ethiopia in the southwest , eritrea in the north , and the red sea and the gulf of aden in the east . across the gulf of aden is yemen . the country ha a total area of . the republic of djibouti is predominantly inhabited by two ethnic group , the somali and the afar people people , with the former comprising the majority of the population . </s> in antiquity , the territory together with ethiopia , eritrea and somalia wa part of the land of punt . nearby zeila , now in somalia , wa the seat of the medieval adal sultanate and ifat sultanate sultanate . in the late 19th century , the colony of french somaliland wa established following treaty signed by the ruling dir ( clan ) somali people sultan with the french and it imperial ethiopian railway to dire dawa ( and later addis ababa ) allowed it to quickly supersede zeila a the port for southern ethiopia and the ogaden . it wa subsequently renamed to the french territory of the afars and the issas in 1967 . a decade later , the djiboutian people voted for independence . this officially marked the establishment of the republic of djibouti , named after it djibouti ( city ) . the new state joined the united nation the same year , on 20 september 1977 . in the early 1990s , tension over government representation led to djiboutian civil war , which ended in a power-sharing agreement in 2000 between the ruling party and the opposition . </s> djibouti is a multi-ethnic nation with a population of over 921,804 inhabitant ( list of sovereign state and dependent territory in africa in mainland africa ) . somali and arabic are the country 's two official language . about 94 % of resident adhere to islam , which is the official religion and ha been predominant in the region for more than a thousand year . the somali and afar people make up the two largest ethnic group . both speak the cushitic language branch of the afroasiatic language . </s> djibouti is strategically located near some of the world 's busiest shipping lane , controlling access to the red sea and indian ocean . it serf a a key refuelling and transshipment center , and is the principal maritime port for import from and export to neighboring ethiopia . a burgeoning commercial hub , the nation is the site of various foreign military base , including camp lemonnier . the intergovernmental authority on development ( igad ) regional body also ha it headquarters in djibouti city . </s> <section_title_start> name and etymology <section_title_end> </s> djibouti is officially known a the republic of djibouti . in local language it is known a yibuuti ( in afar language ) and jabuuti ( in somali language ) . </s> the country is named for it capital , the djibouti ( city ) . the etymology of the name is disputed . several theory and legend exist regarding it origin , varying based on ethnicity . one theory derives it from the afar language word , meaning `` plate `` , possibly referring to the geographical feature of the area . another connects it to gabood , meaning `` upland/plateau `` . djibouti could also mean `` land of tehuti `` or `` land of thoth ( egyptian language : djehuti/ djehuty ) `` , after the ancient egyptian religion moon god . </s> from 1862 until 1894 , the land to the north of the gulf of tadjoura wa called `` obock region `` . under french administration , from 1883 to 1967 the area wa known a french somaliland ( french : cte franaise de somali ) , and from 1967 to 1977 a the french territory of the afars and the issas ( french : territoire franais de afars et de issas ) . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistory <section_title_end> </s> the bab-el-mandeb region ha often been considered a primary crossing point for early hominins following a southern coastal route from east africa to south asia and southeast asia . </s> the djibouti area ha been inhabited since the neolithic . according to linguist , the first afroasiatic languages-speaking population arrived in the region during this period from the family 's proposed afroasiatic urheimat ( `` original homeland `` ) in the nile valley , or the near east . other scholar propose that the afroasiatic family developed in situ in the horn , with it speaker subsequently dispersing from there . </s> cut stone dated about 3 million year old have been collected in the area of lake abbe . in the gobaad plain ( between dikhil and lake abbe ) , the remains of a palaeoloxodon recki were also discovered , visibly butchered using basalt tool found nearby . these remains would date from 1.4 million year bce . subsequently , other similar site were identified a probably the work of homo ergaster . an acheulean site ( from 800,000 to 400,000 year bce ) , where stone wa cut , wa excavated in the 1990s , in gombourta , between damerdjog and loyada , 15 km south of djibouti city . finally , in gobaad , a homo erectus jaw wa found , dating from 100,000 bce . on ghoubbet-el-kharab devil 's island , tool dating back 6,000 year have been found , which were used to open shell . in the area at the bottom of ghoubbet-el-kharab ( dankallo , not far from devil 's island ) , circular stone structure and fragment of painted pottery have also been discovered . previous investigator have also reported a fragmentary maxilla , attributed to an older form of homo sapiens and dated to ~250 ka , from the valley of the dagadl wadi . </s> pottery predating the mid-2nd millennium ha been found at asa koma , an inland lake area on the gobaad plain . the site 's ware is characterized by punctate and incision geometric design , which bear a similarity to the sabir culture phase 1 ceramic from ma'layba in southern arabia . long-horned humpless cattle bone have likewise been discovered at asa koma , suggesting that domesticated cattle were present by around 3,500 year ago . rock art of what appear to be antelope and a giraffe are also found at dorra and balho . handoga , dated to the fourth millennium bce , ha in turn yielded obsidian microliths and plain ceramic used by early nomadic pastoralists with domesticated cattle . </s> the site of wakrita is a small neolithic establishment located on a wadi in the tectonic depression of gobaad in djibouti in the horn of africa . the 2005 excavation yielded abundant ceramic that enabled u to define one neolithic cultural facies of this region , which wa also identified at the nearby site of asa koma . the faunal remains confirm the importance of fishing in neolithic settlement close to lake abbe , but also the importance of bovine husbandry and , for the first time in this area , evidence for caprine herding practice . radiocarbon dating place this occupation at the beginning of the 2nd millennium bce , similar in range to asa koma . these two site represent the oldest evidence of herding in the region , and they provide a better understanding of the development of neolithic society in this region . </s> up to 4000 year bce , the region benefited from a climate very different from the one it know today and probably close to the mediterranean climate . the water resource were numerous with lake in gobaad , lake assal and abb larger and resembling real body of water . the human therefore lived by gathering , fishing and hunting . the region wa populated by a very rich fauna : felidae , african buffalo , elephant , rhino , etc . , a evidenced , for example , by the bestiary of cave painting at balho . in the 3rd and 2nd millennium bce , few nomad settled around the lake and practiced fishing and cattle ] ] breeding . the burial of an 18-year-old woman , dating from this period , a well a the bone of hunted animal , bone tool and small gemstone have been unearthed . by about 1500 bce , the climate wa already beginning to change , with source of fresh water becoming more scarce . engraving show dromedary ( animal of arid zone ) , some of which are ridden by armed warrior . the sedentary people now returned to a nomadic life . stone tumuli of various shape and sheltering graf dating from this period have been unearthed all over the territory . </s> <section_title_start> punt ( 2,500 bce ) <section_title_end> </s> together with northern ethiopia , northern somalia ] , eritrea and the red sea coast of sudan , djibouti is considered the most likely location of the territory known to the ancient egyptian a land of punt ( or ta netjeru , meaning `` god 's land `` ) . the first mention of the land of punt date to the 25th century bc . the puntites were a nation of people who had close relation with ancient egypt during the reign of the 5th dynasty pharaoh sahure and the 18th dynasty queen hatshepsut . according to the temple mural at deir el-bahari , the land of punt wa ruled at that time by king parahu and queen ati . </s> <section_title_start> macrobians ( 247 bce ) <section_title_end> </s> the macrobians ( ) were a legendary people and kingdom positioned in the horn of africa mentioned by herodotus . later author ( so pliny the elder on the authority of ctesias ' indica ( ctesias ) ) place them in india ( herodotus ) instead . it is one of the legendary people postulated at the extremity of the ecumene ( from the perspective of the greek ) , in this case in the extreme south , contrasting with the hyperborean in the extreme east . their name is due to their legendary longevity , an average person supposedly living to the age of 120 . they were said to be the `` tallest and handsomest of all men `` . according to herodotus ' account , the persian emperor cambyses ii upon his history of achaemenid egypt ( 525 bc ) sent ambassador to macrobia , bringing luxury gift for the macrobian king to entice his submission . the macrobian ruler , who wa elected based at least in part on stature , replied instead with a challenge for his persian counterpart in the form of an unstrung bow : if the persian could manage to string it , they would have the right to invade his country ; but until then , they should thank the god that the macrobians never decided to invade their empire . </s> <section_title_start> kingdom of adal ( 9001285 ) <section_title_end> </s> the kingdom of adal ( also awdal , adl , or adel ) wa centered around zeila , it capital . it wa established by the local somali tribe in the early 9th century . zeila attracted merchant from around the world , contributing to the wealth of the city . zeila is an ancient city and it wa one of the earliest city in the world to embrace islam , shortly after the hijra ( islam ) . zeila 's two-mihrab masjid al-qiblatayn ( somalia ) masjid al-qiblatayn date to the 7th century , and is the oldest mosque . </s> in the late 9th century , al-yaqubi , an armenian muslim scholar and traveler , wrote that the kingdom of adal wa a small wealthy kingdom and that zeila served a the headquarters for the kingdom , which dated back to the beginning of the century . </s> <section_title_start> ifat sultanate ( 12851415 ) <section_title_end> </s> through close contact with the adjacent arabian peninsula for more than 1,000 year , the somali and afar ethnic group in the region became among the first population on the continent to embrace islam . the ifat sultanate wa a muslim medieval kingdom in the horn of africa . founded in 1285 by the walashma dynasty , it wa centered in zeila . ifat established base in djibouti and northern somalia , and from there expanded southward to the ahmar mountain . it sultan umar walashma ( or his son ali , according to another source ) is recorded a having conquered the sultanate of showa in 1285 . taddesse tamrat explains sultan umar 's military expedition a an effort to consolidate the muslim territory in the horn , in much the same way a emperor yekuno amlak wa attempting to unite the christian territory in the highland during the same period . these two state inevitably came into conflict over shewa and territory further south . a lengthy war ensued , but the muslim sultanate of the time were not strongly unified . ifat wa finally defeated by emperor amda seyon i of ethiopia in 1332 , and withdrew from shewa . </s> <section_title_start> adal sultanate ( 14151577 ) <section_title_end> </s> according to the 16th-century explorer leo africanus , the adal sultanate 's realm encompassed the geographical area between the bab el mandeb and cape guardafui . it wa therefore flanked to the south by the ajuran empire ( kingdom of ajuuran ) and to the west by the abyssinian empire ( abassin empire ) . adal is mentioned by name in the 14th century in the context of the battle between the muslim of the somali and afar seaboard and the abyssinian king amda seyon i 's christian troop . adal originally had it capital in the port city of zeila , situated in the northwestern awdal region . the polity at the time wa an emirate in the larger sultanate of ifat ruled by the walashma dynasty . </s> according to i.m . lewis , the polity wa governed by local dynasty consisting of afarized arab or arabized somali , who also ruled over the similarly-established sultanate of mogadishu in the benadir region to the south . adal 's history from this founding period forth would be characterized by a succession of battle with neighbouring ethiopian empire . at it height , the adal kingdom controlled large part of modern-day djibouti , somalia , eritrea and ethiopia . between djibouti city and loyada are a number of anthropomorphic and phallic stele . the structure are associated with graf of rectangular shape flanked by vertical slab , a also found in tiya , central ethiopia . the djibouti-loyada stele are of uncertain age , and some of them are adorned with a t-shaped symbol . additionally , archaeological excavation at tiya have yielded tomb . a of 1997 , 118 stele were reported in the area . along with the stele in the hadiya zone , the structure are identified by local resident a yegragn dingay or `` gran 's stone `` , in reference to imam ahmad ibn ibrahim al-ghazi ( ahmad `` gurey `` or `` gran `` ) , ruler of the adal sultanate . </s> <section_title_start> ottoman eyalet ( 15771867 ) <section_title_end> </s> although nominally part of the ottoman empire since 1577 , between 1821 and 1841 , muhammad ali of egypt , pasha of egypt , came to control yemen , harar , gulf of tadjoura with zeila and berbera included . the governor abou baker ordered the egyptian garrison at sagallo to retire to zeila . the cruiser seignelay reached sagallo shortly after the egyptian had departed . french troop occupied the fort despite protest from the british agent in aden , major frederick mercer hunter , who dispatched troop to safeguard british and egyptian interest in zeila and prevent further extension of french influence in that direction . </s> on 14 april 1884 the commander of the patrol sloop l'inferent reported on the egyptian occupation in the gulf of tadjoura . the commander of the patrol sloop le vaudreuil reported that the egyptian were occupying the interior between obock and tadjoura . emperor yohannes iv of ethiopia signed an accord with great britain to cease fighting the egyptian and to allow the evacuation of egyptian force from ethiopia and the somalia littoral . the egyptian garrison wa withdrawn from tadjoura . lonce lagarde deployed a patrol sloop to tadjoura the following night . </s> <section_title_start> french somaliland ( 18831977 ) <section_title_end> </s> the boundary of the present-day djibouti state were established a the first french establishment in the horn of africa during the scramble for africa . the march 11 , 1862 , agreement the afar people sultan , raieta dini ahmet , signed in paris wa a treaty where the afars sold land surrounding in obock . the french were interested in having a coaling station for steamship , which would become especially important upon the opening of the suez canal in 1869 . ( up to that time french ship had to buy coal at the british port of aden across the gulf , an unwise dependency in case of war . ) later on , that treaty wa used by the captain of the fleuriot de langle to colonize the south of the gulf of tadjoura . on march 26 , 1885 the french signed another treaty with the issas where the latter would become a protectorate under the french , no monetary exchange occurred and issa clan did not sign away any of their right to the land , the agreement wa to protect their land from outsider with the help of the french . it wa established between 1883 and 1887 , after the ruling somali people and afar people sultan each signed a treaty with the french third republic . an attempt by nikolay ivanovitch achinov , a russian empire adventurer , to establish a settlement at sagallo in 1889 wa promptly thwarted by french force after just one month . in 1894 , lonce lagarde established a permanent french administration in the city of djibouti and named the region french somaliland . a is shown in `` morin `` ( 2005 ) , this name ha been proposed by mohamed haji dide of the mahad 'ase branch of the gadabuursi . it lasted from 1896 until 1967 , when it wa renamed the territoire franais de afars et de issas ( tfai ) ( `` french territory of the afars and the issas `` ) , after france , the colonial power , ha empowered the issas clan at the expense of the gadabuursi . </s> the construction of the imperial ethiopian railway west into ethiopia turned the djibouti ( city ) into a boomtown of 15,000 at a time when harar wa the only city in ethiopia to exceed that . </s> although the population fell after the completion of the railwayline to dire dawa and the original company failed and required a government bail-out , the rail link allowed the territory to quickly supersede the caravan-based trade carried on at zeila ( then in the united kingdom of great britain and ireland area of british somaliland ) and become the premier port for harari coffee and other good leaving southern ethiopia and the ogaden through harar . </s> after the italian second italo-abyssinian war in the mid-1930s , constant border skirmish occurred between french force in french somaliland and italian force in italian east africa . in june 1940 , during the early stage of world war ii , fall of france and the colony wa then ruled by the pro-axis power vichy france vichy ( french ) government . </s> british and commonwealth force fought the neighboring italian during the east african campaign ( world war ii ) . in 1941 , the italian were defeated and the vichy force in french somaliland were isolated . the vichy french administration continued to hold out in the colony for over a year after the italian collapse . in response , the british blockaded the port of djibouti city but it could not prevent local french from providing information on the passing ship convoy . in 1942 , about 4,000 british troop occupied the city . a local battalion from french somaliland participated in the liberation of paris in 1944. </s> in 1958 , on the eve of neighboring somalia 's independence in 1960 , a french somaliland overseas territory referendum , 1958 wa held in djibouti to decide whether to remain with france or to be an independent country . the referendum turned out in favour of a continued association with france , partly due to a combined yes vote by the sizable afar ethnic group and resident french . there were also allegation of widespread vote rigging . the majority of those who had voted no were somali who were strongly in favour of joining a united somalia a had been proposed by mahmoud harbi , vice president of the government council . harbi wa killed in a plane crash two year later under suspicious circumstance . </s> in 1966 , france rejected the united nation ' recommendation that it should grant french somaliland independence . in august of the same year , an official visit to the territory by then french president , general charles de gaulle , wa also met with demonstration and rioting . in response to the protest , de gaulle ordered another referendum . </s> in 1967 , a french somaliland independence referendum , 1967 wa held to determine the fate of the territory . initial result supported a continued but looser relationship with france . voting wa also divided along ethnic line , with the resident somali generally voting for independence , with the goal of eventual union with somalia , and the afars largely opting to remain associated with france . the referendum wa again marred by report of vote rigging on the part of the french authority . shortly after the plebiscite wa held , the former cte franaise de somali ( french somaliland ) wa renamed to territoire franais de afars et de issas . announcement of the plebiscite result sparked civil unrest , including several death . france also increased it military force along the frontier . </s> djibouti is partitioned into six administrative region , with djibouti ( city ) representing one of the official region . it is further subdivided into twenty district of djibouti . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> location and habitat <section_title_end> </s> djibouti is situated in the horn of africa on the gulf of aden and the bab-el-mandeb , at the southern entrance to the red sea . it lie between latitude 11 and 14n and longitude 41 and 44e , at the northernmost point of the great rift valley . it is here in djibouti that the rift between the african plate and the somali plate meet the arabian plate , forming a geologic tripoint . the tectonic interaction at this tripoint ha created the extreme point of africa at lake assal ( djibouti ) , and indeed , the second lowest depression on dry land found anywhere on earth ( surpassed only by the depression along the border of jordan and israel ) . </s> the country 's coastline stretch , with terrain consisting mainly of plateau , plain and highland . djibouti ha a total area of . it border extend , of which are shared with eritrea , with ethiopia , and with somaliland . djibouti is the southernmost arabian plate country . </s> djibouti ha eight mountain range with peak of over . the mousa ali range is considered the country 's highest mountain range , with the tallest peak on the border with ethiopia and eritrea . it ha an elevation of . the grand bara desert cover part of southern djibouti in the arta , ali sabieh and dikhil region . the majority of it sits at a relatively low elevation , below . </s> extreme geographic point include : to the north , ra doumera and the point at which the border with eritrea enters the red sea in the obock region ; to the east , a section of the red sea coast north of ra bir ; to the south , a location on the border with ethiopia west of the town of a ela ; and to the west , a location on the frontier with ethiopia immediately east of the ethiopian town of afambo ( woreda ) . </s> most of djibouti is part of the ethiopian xeric grassland and shrublands ecoregion . the exception is an eastern strip located along the red sea coast , which is part of the eritrean coastal desert . </s> file : djib 003.jpg lake assal ( djibouti ) </s> file : traditional house on the mabla mountains.jpg traditional house on the mabla mountain </s> file : lac abbe-02.jpg lake abbe </s> file : the mountain near dasbiyo.png the mountain near dasbiyo </s> file : south djibouti beach.png thumb beach south of djibouti city , overlooking the gulf of aden </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> djibouti 's climate is significantly warmer and ha significantly le seasonal variation than the world average . the mean daily maximum temperature range from 32 to 41 ; c ( 90 to 106 ; f ) , except at high elevation . in djibouti city , for instance , average afternoon high range from 28 to 34 ; c ( 82 to 93 ; f ) in april . but at airolaf , which range from 1,535 to 1,600 m ( 5,036 to 5,249 ; ft ) , maximum temperature is 30 ; c ( 86 ; f ) in summer and minimum 9 ; c ( 48 ; f ) in winter . in the wikt : upland range from 500 to 800 m ( 1,640 to 2,624 ; ft ) , are comparable and cooler to those on the coast in the hottest month of june until august . december and january is the coolest month with average low temperature falling a low a 15 ; c ( 59 ; f ) . djibouti ha either a [ semi-arid climate ] ( bsh ) or a [ desert climate ] ( bwh ) , although temperature are much moderated at the highest elevation . </s> djibouti 's climate range from arid in the northeastern coastal region to semiarid semi-arid in the central , northern , western and southern part of the country . on the eastern seaboard , annual rainfall is le than 5 inch ( 131 ; mm ) ; in the central highland , precipitation is about 8 to 16 inch ( 200 to 400 ; mm ) . the hinterland is significantly le [ than the coastal region . </s> <section_title_start> wildlife <section_title_end> </s> the country 's flora and fauna live in a harsh landscape with forest accounting for le than one percent of the total area of the country . wildlife is spread over three main region , namely from the northern mountain region of the country to the volcanic plateau in it southern and central part and culminating in the coastal region . </s> most specie of wildlife are found in the northern part of the country , in the ecosystem of the day forest national park . at an average altitude of , the area includes the goda massif , with a peak of . it cover an area of of juniperus procera forest , with many of the tree rising to height . this forest area is the main habitat of the endangered and endemic djibouti francolin ( a bird ) , and another recently noted vertebrate , platyceps afarensis ( a colubrine snake ) . it also contains many specie of woody and herbaceous plant , including boxwood and olive tree , which account for 60 % of the total identified specie in the country . </s> according to the country profile related to biodiversity of wildlife in djibouti , the nation contains more than 820 specie of plant , 493 specie of invertebrate , 455 specie of fish , 40 specie of reptile , three specie of amphibian , 360 specie of bird and 66 specie of mammal . wildlife of djibouti is also listed a part of horn of africa biodiversity hotspot and the red sea and gulf of aden coral reef hotspot . mammal include several specie of antelope , such a soemmerring 's gazelle and pelzeln 's gazelle . a a result of the hunting ban imposed since early 1970 these specie are well conserved now . other characteristic mammal are grevy 's zebra , [ baboon ] and hunter 's antelope . the warthog , a vulnerable specie , is also found in the day national park . the coastal water have dugong and abyssinian genet ; the latter need confirmation by further study . green turtle and [ turtle ] s are in the coastal water where nestling also take place . the northeast african cheetah acinonyx jubatus soemmeringii is thought to be extinct in djibouti . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> djibouti 's economy is largely concentrated in the service sector . commercial activity revolve around the country 's free trade policy and strategic location a a red sea transit point . due to limited rainfall , vegetable and fruit are the principal production crop , and other food item require importation . the gdp ( purchasing power parity ) in 2013 wa estimated at $ 2.505 ; billion , with a real growth rate of 5 % annually . per caput income is around $ 2,874 ( ppp ) . the service sector constituted around 79.7 % of the gdp , followed by industry at 17.3 % , and agriculture at 3 % . </s> , the container terminal at the port of djibouti handle the bulk of the nation 's trade . about 70 % of the seaport 's activity consists of import to and export from neighboring ethiopia , which depends on the harbour a it main maritime outlet . a of 2018 , 95 % of ethiopian transit cargo wa handled by the port of djibouti . the port also serf a an international refueling center and transshipment hub . in 2012 , the djiboutian government in collaboration with dp world started construction of the doraleh container terminal , a third major seaport intended to further develop the national transit capacity . a $ 396 ; million project , it ha the capacity to accommodate 1.5 ; million twenty foot container unit annually . </s> djibouti wa ranked the 177th safest investment destination in the world in the march 2011 euromoney country risk ranking . to improve the environment for direct foreign investment , the djibouti authority in conjunction with various non-profit organization have launched a number of development project aimed at highlighting the country 's commercial potential . the government ha also introduced new private sector policy targeting high interest and inflation rate , including relaxing the tax burden on enterprise and allowing exemption on consumption tax . </s> additionally , effort have been made to lower the estimated 60 % urban unemployment rate by creating more job opportunity through investment in diversified sector . fund have especially gone toward building telecommunication infrastructure and increasing disposable income by supporting small business . owing to it growth potential , the fishing and agro-processing sector , which represents around 15 % of gdp , ha also enjoyed rising investment since 2008. </s> to expand the modest industrial sector , a 56 megawatt geothermal power plant slated to be completed by 2018 is being constructed with the help of opec , the world bank and the global environmental facility . the facility is expected to solve the recurring electricity shortage , decrease the nation 's reliance on ethiopia for energy , reduce costly oil import for diesel-generated electricity , and thereby buttress the gdp and lower debt . </s> the djibouti firm salt investment ( si ) began a large-scale operation to industrialize the plentiful salt in djibouti 's lake assal ( djibouti ) region . operating at an annual capacity of 4 million ton , the desalination project ha lifted export revenue , created more job opportunity , and provided more fresh water for the area 's resident . in 2012 , the djibouti government also enlisted the service of the china harbor engineering company ltd for the construction of an ore terminal . worth $ 64 ; million , the project enabled djibouti to export a further 5,000 ton of salt per year to market in southeast asia . </s> djibouti 's gross domestic product expanded by an average of more than 6 percent per year , from u $ 341 ; million in 1985 to u $ 1.5 ; billion in 2015 . the djiboutian franc is the currency of djibouti . it is issued by the central bank of djibouti , the country 's monetary authority . since the djiboutian franc is pegged to the u.s. dollar , it is generally stable and inflation is not a problem . this ha contributed to the growing interest in investment in the country . </s> , 10 conventional and islamic bank operate in djibouti . most arrived within the past few year , including the somali money transfer company dahabshiil and bdcd , a subsidiary of swiss financial investment . the banking system had previously been monopolized by two institution : the indo-suez bank and the commercial and industrial bank ( bcimr ) . to assure a robust credit and deposit sector , the government requires commercial bank to maintain 30 % of share in the financial institution ; a minimum of 300 million djiboutian franc in up-front capital is mandatory for international bank . lending ha likewise been encouraged by the creation of a guarantee fund , which allows bank to issue loan to eligible small- and medium-sized business without first requiring a large deposit or other collateral . </s> saudi investor are also reportedly exploring the possibility of linking the horn of africa with the arabian peninsula via a oversea bridge through djibouti , referred to a the bridge of the horn . the investor tarek bin laden ha been linked to the project . however , it wa announced in june 2010 that phase i of the project had been delayed . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> the djiboutiambouli international airport in djibouti city , the country 's only international airport , serf many intercontinental route with scheduled and chartered flight . air djibouti is the flag carrier of djibouti and is the country 's largest airline . </s> the new and electrified standard gauge addis ababa-djibouti railway started operation in january 2018 . it main purpose is to facilitate freight service between the ethiopian hinterland and the djiboutian port of doraleh . </s> car ferry pas the gulf of tadjoura from djibouti city to tadjoura . there is the port of doraleh west of djibouti city , which is the main port of djibouti . the port of doraleh is the terminal of the new addis ababadjibouti railway . in addition to the port of doraleh , which handle general cargo and oil import , djibouti ( 2018 ) ha three other major port for the import and export of bulk good and livestock , the tadjoura ( potash ) , the damerjog ( livestock ) and the port of goubet ( salt ) . almost 95 % of ethiopia 's import and export move through djiboutian port . </s> the djiboutian highway system is named according to the road classification . road that are considered primary road are those that are fully asphalted ( throughout their entire length ) and in general they carry traffic between all the major town in djibouti . </s> djibouti is part of the 21st century maritime silk road that run from the chinese coast to the upper adriatic region with it connection to central and eastern europe . </s> <section_title_start> media and telecommunications <section_title_end> </s> telecommunication in djibouti fall under the authority of the ministry of communication . </s> djibouti telecom is the sole provider of telecommunication service . it mostly utilizes a microwave radio relay network . a fiber-optic cable is installed in the capital , whereas rural area are connected via wireless local loop radio system . mobile cellular coverage is primarily limited to the area in and around djibouti city . , 23,000 telephone main line and 312,000 mobile/cellular line were in use . the sea-me-we 3 ( cable system ) sea-me-we 3 submarine communication cable operates to jeddah , suez , sicily , marseille , colombo , singapore and beyond . telephone satellite earth station include 1 intelsat ( indian ocean ) and 1 arabsat . medarabtel is the regional microwave radio relay telephone network . </s> radio television of djibouti is the state-owned national broadcaster . it operates the sole terrestrial tv station , a well a the two domestic radio network on am broadcasting 1 , fm broadcasting 2 , and shortwave 0 . licensing and operation of broadcast medium is regulated by the government . movie theater include the odeon cinema in the capital . </s> , there were 215 local internet service provider . internet user comprised around 99,000 individual ( 2015 ) . the internet country top-level domain is .dj . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism in djibouti is one of the growing economic sector of the country and is an industry that generates le than 80,000 arrival per year , mostly the family and friend of the soldier stationed in the country 's major naval base . although the number are on the rise , there are talk of the visa on arrival being stopped , which could limit tourism growth . </s> infrastructure make it difficult for tourist to travel independently and cost of private tour are high . since the re-opening of the train line from addis ababa to djibouti in january 2018 , travel by land ha also resumed . djibouti 's two main geological marvel , lake abbe and lake assal , are the country 's top tourist destination . the two site draw hundred of tourist every year looking for remote place that are not visited by many . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> djibouti ha an installed electrical power generating capacity of 126 mw from fuel oil and diesel plant . in 2002 electrical power output wa put at 232 gwh , with consumption at 216 gwh . at 2015 , per caput annual electricity consumption is about 330 kilowatt-hours ( kwh ) ; moreover , about 45 % of the population doe not have access to electricity , and the level of unmet demand in the country 's power sector is significant . increased [ import from ethiopia ] , which satisfies 65 % of djibouti 's demand , will play a significant role in boosting the country 's renewable energy supply . the geothermal potential ha generated particular interest in japan , with 13 potential site ; they have already started the construction on one site near lake assal . the construction of the photovoltaic power station ( solar farm ) in grand bara will generate 50 mw capacity . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> djibouti ha a population of about 921,804 inhabitant . it is a [ [ multiethnic country . the local population grew rapidly during the latter half of the 20th century , increasing from about 69,589 in 1955 to around 869,099 by 2015 . the two largest ethnic group native to djibouti are the somali ( 60 % ) and the afar people ( 35 % ) . the somali clan component is mainly composed of the issa ( clan ) dir ( clan ) , followed by a sizable group of gadabuursi dir ( clan ) and a smaller population of isaaq , mainly the subclan sacad muuse . the remaining 5 % of djibouti 's population primarily consists of yemeni , people of ethiopia and european ( french people and italian ) . approximately 76 % of local resident are urban dweller ; the remainder are pastoralism . djibouti also host a number of immigrant and refugee from neighboring state , with djibouti city nicknamed the `` french hong kong in the red sea `` due to it cosmopolitan urbanism . djibouti 's location on the eastern coast of africa make it a hub of regional human migration , with somali , yemeni , and ethiopian traveling through the country en route to the arab state of the persian gulf and north africa . djibouti ha received a massive influx of migrant from yemen . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> djibouti is a multilingual nation . the majority of local resident speak somali language ( 524,000 speaker ) and afar language ( 306,000 speaker ) a first language . these idiom are the mother tongue of the somali and afar ethnic group , respectively . both language belong to the larger afroasiatic language cushitic family . there are two official language in djibouti : arabic language and french language . </s> arabic is of religious importance . in formal setting , it consists of modern standard arabic . colloquially , about 59,000 local resident speak the ta'izzi-adeni arabic dialect , also known a djibouti arabic . french serf a a statutory national language . it wa inherited from the colonial period , and is the primary language of instruction . around 17,000 djiboutian speak it a a first language . immigrant language include omani arabic ( 38,900 speaker ) , amharic ( 1,400 speaker ) , and greek language ( 1,000 speaker ) . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> djibouti 's population is predominantly muslim . islam is observed by around 94 % of the nation 's population ( approximately 740,000 ) , whereas the remaining 6 % of resident are christian adherent . </s> islam entered the region very early on , a a group of persecuted muslim had sought refuge across the red sea in the horn of africa at the urging of the islamic prophet muhammad . in 1900 , during the early part of the colonial era , there were virtually no christian in the territory , with only about 100300 follower coming from the school and orphanage of the few catholic mission in the french somaliland . the constitution of djibouti name islam a the sole state religion , and also provides for the equality of citizen of all faith ( article 1 ) and freedom of religious practice ( article 11 ) . most local muslim adhere to the sunni islam denomination , following the shafi ' i school . the non-denominational muslim largely belong to sufism order of varying school . according to the international religious freedom report 2008 , while muslim djiboutian have the legal right to convert to or marry someone from another faith , convert may encounter negative reaction from their family and clan or from society at large , and they often face pressure to go back to islam . </s> the roman catholic diocese of djibouti serf the small local catholicism population , which it estimate numbered around 7,000 individual in 2006. </s> <section_title_start> largest city <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> the life expectancy at birth is around 64.7 for both male and female . fertility is at 2.35 child per woman . in djibouti there are about 18 doctor per 100,000 person . </s> the 2010 maternal mortality rate per 100,000 birth for djibouti is 300 . this is compared with 461.6 in 2008 and 606.5 in 1990 . the under 5 mortality rate , per 1,000 birth is 95 and the neonatal mortality a a percentage of under 5 's mortality are 37 . in djibouti the number of midwife per 1,000 live birth is 6 and the lifetime risk of death for pregnant woman 1 in 93. </s> about 93.1 % of djibouti 's woman and girl have undergone female genital mutilation ( female circumcision ) , a pre-marital custom mainly endemic to northeast africa and part of the near east . although legally proscribed in 1994 , the procedure is still widely practiced , a it is deeply ingrained in the local culture . encouraged and performed by woman in the community , circumcision is primarily intended to deter promiscuity and to offer protection from assault . </s> about 94 % of djibouti 's male population have also reportedly undergone circumcision , a figure in line with adherence to islam , which requires this . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> education is a priority for the government of djibouti . , it allocates 20.5 % of it annual budget to scholastic instruction . </s> the djiboutian educational system wa initially formulated to cater to a limited pupil base . a such , the schooling framework wa largely elitist and drew considerably from the french colonial paradigm , which wa ill-suited to local circumstance and need . </s> in the late 1990s , the djiboutian authority revised the national educational strategy and launched a broad-based consultative process involving administrative official , teacher , parent , national assembly member and ngo . the initiative identified area in need of attention and produced concrete recommendation on how to go about improving them . the government subsequently prepared a comprehensive reform plan aimed at modernizing the educational sector over the 200010 period . in august 2000 , it passed an official education planning act and drafted a medium-term development plan for the next five year . the fundamental academic system wa significantly restructured and made compulsory ; it now consists of five year of primary school and four year of middle school . secondary school also require a certificate of fundamental education for admission . in addition , the new law introduced secondary-level vocational instruction and established university facility in the country . </s> a a result of the education planning act and the medium-term action strategy , substantial progress ha been registered throughout the educational sector . in particular , school enrollment , attendance , and retention rate have all steadily increased , with some regional variation . from 2004 to 2005 to 200708 , net enrollment of girl in primary school rose by 18.6 % ; for boy , it increased 8.0 % . net enrollment in middle school over the same period rose by 72.4 % for girl and 52.2 % for boy . at the secondary level , the rate of increase in net enrollment wa 49.8 % for girl and 56.1 % for boy . </s> the djiboutian government ha especially focused on developing and improving institutional infrastructure and teaching material , including constructing new classroom and supplying textbook . at the post-secondary level , emphasis ha also been placed on producing qualified instructor and encouraging out-of-school youngster to pursue vocational training . , the literacy rate in djibouti wa estimated at 70 % . </s> institution of higher learning in the country include the university of djibouti . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> djiboutian attire reflects the region 's hot and arid climate . when not dressed in western clothing such a jean and t-shirt , men typically wear the , which is a traditional sarong-like garment worn around the waist . many nomadic people wear a loosely wrapped white cotton robe called a tobe that go down to about the knee , with the end thrown over the shoulder ( much like a roman toga ) . </s> woman typically wear the dirac , which is a long , light , diaphanous voile dress made of cotton or polyester that is worn over a full-length slip ( clothing ) half-slip and a bra . married woman tend to sport head-scarves referred to a shash and often cover their upper body with a shawl known a garbasaar . unmarried or young woman , however , do not always cover their head . traditional arabian garb such a the male jellabiya ( jellabiyaad in somali ) and the female jilbb is also commonly worn . for some occasion such a festival , woman may adorn themselves with specialized jewelry and head-dresses similar to those worn by the berber people tribe of the maghreb . </s> a lot of djibouti 's original art is passed on and preserved orally , mainly through song . many example of islamic , ottoman , and french influence can also be noted in the local building , which contain plasterwork , carefully constructed motif ( visual art ) , and calligraphy . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> somali have a rich musical heritage centered on traditional somali folklore . most somali song are pentatonic scale . that is , they only use five pitch ( music ) per octave in contrast to a heptatonic scale ( seven note ) scale such a the major scale . at first listen , somali music might be mistaken for the sound of nearby region such a ethiopia , sudan or the arabian peninsula , but it is ultimately recognizable by it own unique tune and style . somali song are usually the product of collaboration between lyricist ( ) , songwriter ( ) and singer ( or `` voice `` ) . balwo is a somali musical style centered on love theme that is popular in djibouti . </s> traditional afar music resembles the folk music of other part of the horn of africa such a music of ethiopia ; it also contains element of arabic music . the history of djibouti is recorded in the poetry and song of it nomadic people , and go back thousand of year to a time when the people of djibouti traded hide and skin for the perfume and spice of ancient egypt , india and china . afar oral literature is also quite musical . it come in many variety , including song for wedding , war , praise and boasting . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> djibouti ha a long tradition of poetry . several well-developed somali form of verse include the , , , , , , and . the ( epic poem ) ha the most complex length and meter , often exceeding 100 line . it is considered the mark of poetic attainment when a young poet is able to compose such verse , and is regarded a the height of poetry . group of memorizer and reciter ( ) traditionally propagated the well-developed art form . poem revolve around several main theme , including ( elegy ) , ( praise ) , ( romance ) , ( diatribe ) , ( gloating ) and ( guidance ) . the baroorodiiq is composed to commemorate the death of a prominent poet or figure . the afar are familiar with the , a kind of warrior-poet and diviner , and have a rich oral tradition of folk story . they also have an extensive repertoire of battle song . </s> additionally , djibouti ha a long tradition of islamic literature . among the most prominent historical work is the medieval futuh al-habash by shihb al-dn , which chronicle the adal sultanate army 's ethiopian-adal war during the 16th century . in recent year , a number of politician and intellectual have also penned memoir or reflection on the country . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> football is the most popular sport amongst djiboutian . the country became a member of fifa in 1994 , but ha only taken part in the qualifying round for the african cup of nation a well a the fifa world cup in the mid-2000s . in november 2007 , the djibouti national football team beat somalia national football team somalia 's national squad 10 in the qualification round for the 2010 fifa world cup , marking it first ever world cup-related win . </s> recently , the world archery federation ha helped to implement the djibouti archery federation , and an international archery training center is being created in arta , djibouti to support archery development in east africa and red sea area . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> djiboutian cuisine is a mixture of somali cuisine , afar people , yemeni cuisine , and french cuisine , with some additional south asian cuisine ( especially indian cuisine ) culinary influence . local dish are commonly prepared using a lot of middle eastern spice , ranging from saffron to cinnamon . grilled yemeni fish , opened in half and often cooked in tandoori style oven , are a local delicacy . spicy dish come in many variation , from the traditional fah-fah or `` soupe djiboutienne `` ( spicy boiled beef soup ) , to the ( spicy mixed vegetable stew ) . ( pronounced `` halwo `` ) or [ is a popular confection eaten during festive occasion , such a eid ul-fitr eid ] celebration or wedding reception . halva is made from sugar , [ [ corn starch , cardamom powder , nutmeg powder and ghee . peanut are sometimes added to enhance texture and flavor . after meal , home are traditionally perfumed using incense ( ) or frankincense ( ) , which is prepared inside an incense burner referred to a a dabqaad . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of djibouti-related article </s> * outline of djibouti </s> <section_title_start> notes <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> references <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> online source <section_title_end> </s> * </s> <section_title_start>
