: member state of the united nation </s> category : miocene africa </s> category : miocene volcanism </s> category : volcano of mauritius </s> category : small island developing state </s> category : state and territory established in 1968 </s> category:1968 establishment in mauritius </s> category:1968 establishment in africa </s> category : populated place established in 1638 </s> category : populated place established by the dutch east india company </s> category:1638 establishment in the dutch empire </s> category : country in africa <article_end> <article_start> </s> kuwait ( ; , or ) , officially the state of kuwait ( ) , is a country in western asia . situated in the northern edge of eastern arabia at the tip of the persian gulf , it border iraq to iraqkuwait border and saudi arabia to kuwaitsaudi arabia border . , kuwait ha a population of 4.5 ; million people : 1.3 million are kuwaiti and 3.2 million are expatriate . expatriate in kuwait account for approximately 70 % of the population . </s> oil reserve were discovered in commercial quantity in 1938 . in 1946 , crude oil wa exported for the first time . from 1946 to 1982 , the country underwent large-scale modernization . in the 1980s , kuwait experienced a period of geopolitical instability and an economic crisis following the souk al-manakh stock market crash . in 1990 , kuwait wa invasion of kuwait , and later kuwait governorate , by ba'athist iraq saddam 's iraq . the iraqi occupation of kuwait came to an end in 1991 after gulf war by a military coalition led by the united state . kuwait is a non-nato ally of the united state . </s> kuwait is a constitutional sovereign state with a semi-democracy semi-democratic political system . kuwait ha a world bank high-income economy backed by the world 's list of country by proven oil reserve # country . the kuwaiti dinar is the highest valued currency in the world . according to the world bank , the country ha the nineteenth list of country by gdp ( ppp ) per caput . the constitution of kuwait wa promulgation in 1962 . kuwait is home to the largest sheikh jaber al-ahmad cultural centre in the middle east . the kuwait national cultural district is a member of the global cultural district network . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> antiquity <section_title_end> </s> during the ubaid period ( 6500 bc ) , northern kuwait wa the central site of interaction between the people of mesopotamia and neolithic eastern arabia , mainly centered in bahra 1 as-subiya in northern kuwait . the earliest evidence of human habitation in kuwait date back 8000 b.c . where mesolithic tool were found in burgan . </s> mesopotamians first settled in the kuwaiti island of failaka island in 2000 b.c . trader from the sumerian city of ur inhabited failaka and ran a mercantile business . the island had many mesopotamian-style building typical of those found in iraq dating from around 2000 b.c . the neolithic inhabitant of kuwait were among the world 's earliest maritime trader . one of the world 's earliest reed-boats wa discovered in northern kuwait dating back to the ubaid period . </s> in 4000 bc until 2000 bc , the bay of kuwait wa home to the dilmun civilization . dilmun 's control of the bay of kuwait included kuwait city 's shuwaikh port ( formerly akkaz island ) , umm an namil island and failaka island . at it peak in 2000 bc , the dilmun empire controlled the trade route from mesopotamia to india and the indus valley civilization . dilmun 's commercial power began to decline after 1800 bc . piracy flourished throughout the region during dilmun 's decline . after 600 bc , the babylonian added dilmun to their empire . </s> during the dilmun era ( from ca . 3000 bc ) , failaka wa known a `` agarum `` , the land of enzak , a great god in the dilmun civilization according to sumerian cuneiform text found on the island . a part of dilmun , failaka became a hub for the civilization from the end of the 3rd to the middle of the 1st millennium bc . failaka wa settled following 2000 bc after a drop in sea level . after the dilmun civilization , failaka wa inhabited by the kassite of mesopotamia , and wa formally under the control of the kassite # kassite dynasty of babylon . study indicate trace of human settlement can be found on failaka dating back to a early a the end of the 3rd millennium bc , and extending until the 20th century ad . many of the artifact found in falaika are linked to mesopotamian civilization and seem to show that failaka wa gradually drawn toward the civilization based in antioch . under nebuchadnezzar ii , failaka wa under babylonian control . cuneiform document found in failaka indicate the presence of babylonian in the island 's population . list of king of babylon were present in failaka during the neo-babylonian empire period , nabonidus had a governor in failaka and nebuchadnezzar ii had a palace and temple in falaika . failaka also contained temple dedicated to the worship of shamash , the mesopotamian sun god in the babylonian pantheon . </s> in 4th century bc , the ancient greek colonized the bay of kuwait under alexander the great , the ancient greek named mainland kuwait larissa and failaka wa named ikaros ( failaka island ) . according to strabo and arrian , alexander the great named failaka ikaros because it resembled the aegean island of that name in size and shape . some element of greek mythology were mixed with the local cult in failaka . `` ikaros `` wa also the name of a prominent city situated in failaka . remains of greek colonization include a large hellenistic town of ancient greece # military settlement and greek temple . </s> in 127 bc , the kingdom of characene wa established around the bay of kuwait . characene wa centered in the region encompassing southern mesopotamia , including failaka island . a busy parthian commercial station existed on failaka island . </s> the earliest recorded mention of kuwait wa in 150 ad in the geographical treatise geography ( ptolemy ) by greek scholar ptolemy . ptolemy mentioned the bay of kuwait a hieros kolpos ( sacer sinus in the latin version ) . </s> in 224 ad , kuwait became part of the sassanid empire . at the time of the sassanid empire , kuwait wa known a meshan , which wa an alternative name of the kingdom of characene . akkaz wa a parthian empire-sassanian site ; the zoroastrianism 's tower of silence wa discovered in northern akkaz . </s> in addition to parthian empire-sasanian settlement , akkaz also contained christian settlement . christian nestorian settlement flourished in akkaz and failaka from the 5th century until the 9th century . excavation have revealed several farm , village and two large church dating from the 5th and 6th century . archaeologist are currently excavating nearby site to understand the extent of the settlement that flourished in the eighth and ninth century a.d. an old island tradition is that a community grew up around a christian mystic and hermit . the small farm and village were eventually abandoned . remains of byzantine era nestorian church were found at al-qusur in failaka . pottery at the site can be dated from a early a the first half of the 7th century through the 9th century . </s> in 636 ad , the battle of chain between the sassanid empire and rashidun caliphate wa fought in kuwait near the town of kazma . at the time , kuwait wa under the control of the sassanid empire . the battle of chain wa the first battle of the rashidun caliphate in which the muslim army sought to extend it frontier . </s> a a result of rashidun victory in 636 ad , the bay of kuwait wa home to the city of kazma ( also known a `` kadhima `` or `` kzimah `` ) in the early islamic era . medieval arabic source contain multiple reference to the bay of kuwait in the early islamic period . the city functioned a a port city and resting place for pilgrim on their way from iraq to hejaz . the city wa controlled by the kingdom of al-hirah in iraq . in the early islamic period , the bay of kuwait wa known for being a fertile area . </s> the kazma wa a stop for caravan coming from persia and mesopotamia en route to the arabian peninsula . the poet al-farazdaq wa born in the kuwaiti city of kazma . al-farazdaq is recognized a one of the greatest classical literature of the arab . </s> <section_title_start> 1521 - 1918 : founding <section_title_end> </s> in 1521 , kuwait wa under portugal control . in the late 16th century , the portuguese built a defensive settlement in kuwait . in 1613 , kuwait city wa founded a a fishing village predominantly populated by fisherman . administratively , it wa a sheikhdom , ruled by local sheikh from ban khalid clan . in 1682 or 1716 , the ban utbah settled in kuwait city , which at this time wa still inhabited by fisherman and primarily functioned a a fishing village under ban khalid control . sometime after the death of the ban khalid 's leader barrak bin urair and the fall of the ban khalid emirate , the utub were able to wrest control of kuwait a a result of successive marriage of state . </s> in the early eighteenth century , kuwait prospered a a maritime port city and rapidly became the principal commercial center for the transit of good between baghdad , india , muscat , and arabian peninsula . by the mid 1700s , kuwait had established itself a the major trading route from the persian gulf to aleppo . during the ottomanpersian war ( 17751776 ) persian siege of basra in 177579 , iraqi merchant took refuge in kuwait and were partly instrumental in the expansion of kuwait 's boat-building and trading activity . a a result , kuwait 's maritime commerce boomed , a the indian trade route with baghdad , aleppo , smyrna and constantinople were diverted to kuwait during this time . the east india company wa diverted to kuwait in 1792 . the east india company secured the sea route between kuwait , india and the east coast of africa . after the persian withdrew from basra in 1779 , kuwait continued to attract trade away from basra . the flight of many of basra 's leading merchant to kuwait continued to play a significant role in basra 's commercial stagnation well into the 1850s . </s> instability in basra helped foster economic prosperity in kuwait . in the late 18th century , kuwait wa a haven for basra merchant fleeing ottoman government persecution . kuwait wa the center of boat building in the persian gulf , it ship renowned throughout the indian ocean . kuwaiti also developed a reputation a the best sailor in the persian gulf . in the 19th century , kuwait became significant in the [ trading horse trade ] , with regular shipment in sailing vessel . in the mid 19th century , it wa estimated that kuwait exported an average of 800 horse to india annually . </s> in the 1890s , threatened by the ottoman empire , ruler sheikh mubarak al-sabah signed an agreement with the presidency and province of british india ( subsequently known a the anglo-kuwaiti agreement of 1899 ) making kuwait a british protectorate . this gave britain exclusive access and trade with kuwait , while denying ottoman province to the north a port on the persian gulf . the sheikhdom of kuwait remained a british protectorate until 1961. </s> during the mubarak al-sabah , kuwait wa dubbed the `` marseille of the persian gulf `` because it economic vitality attracted a large variety of people . the population wa cosmopolitan and ethnically diverse , including arab , persian , african , history of the jew in kuwait and armenian in kuwait # history . kuwait wa known for it religious tolerance . </s> in the first decade of the twentieth century , kuwait had a well-established elite : wealthy trading family linked by marriage and shared economic interest , long-settled and urban , most claiming descent from the original 30 ban utubi family . the wealthiest were merchant who acquired their wealth from long-distance commerce , shipbuilding and pearling . they were a cosmopolitan elite who traveled extensively to india , africa and europe , and educated their son abroad more than other gulf arab elite . western visitor noted the kuwaiti elite used european office system , typewriter , and followed european culture with curiosity . the richest were involved in general trade . the kuwaiti merchant family of al-ghanim and al-hamad were estimated to be worth millionaire before the 1940s . </s> <section_title_start> 1919 - 1939 : after world war i <section_title_end> </s> in 1919 , sheikh salim al-mubarak al-sabah intended to build a commercial city in the south of kuwait . this caused a diplomatic crisis with najd , but britain intervened , discouraging sheikh salim . in 1920 , an attempt by the ikhwan to build a stronghold in southern kuwait led to the battle of hamdh . the battle of hamdh involved 2,000 ikhwan fighter against 100 kuwaiti cavalryman and 200 kuwaiti infantryman . the battle lasted for six day and resulted in heavy but unknown casualty on both side resulting in the victory of the ikhwan force and leading to the battle of jahra around the kuwait red fort . the battle of jahra happened a the result of the battle of hamdh . a force of three to four thousand ikhwan , led by faisal al-dawish , attacked the kuwait red fort at al-jahra , defended by fifteen hundred men . the fort wa besieged and the kuwaiti position precarious ; had the fort fallen , kuwait would likely have been incorporated into ibn saud 's empire . the ikhwan attack repulsed for the while , negotiation began between salim and al-dawish ; the latter threatened another attack if the kuwaiti force did not surrender . the local merchant class convinced salim to call in help from british troop , who showed up with airplane and three warship , ending the attack . after the battle of jahra , ibn saud 's warrior , the ikhwan , demanded that kuwait follows five rule : evict all the shia , adopt the wahhabism , label the turk `` [ abolish smoking , munkar ( disambiguation ) munkar ] and prostitution , and destroy the american missionary hospital . </s> the [ [ kuwaitnajd war of 191920 erupted in the aftermath of world war i . the war occurred because ibn saud of najd wanted to annex kuwait . the sharpened conflict between kuwait and najd led to the death of hundred of kuwaiti . the war resulted in sporadic border clash throughout 19191920 . following the kuwaitnajd war in 191920 , ibn saud imposed a trade blockade against kuwait from the year 1923 until 1937 . the goal of the saudi economic and military attack on kuwait wa to annex a much of kuwait 's territory a possible . at the uqair protocol of 1922 in 1922 , the boundary of kuwait and najd were set ; a a result of british interference , kuwait had no representative at the uqair protocol of 1922 . after the uqair conference , kuwait wa still subjected to a saudi economic blockade and intermittent saudi raid ( military ) . </s> the great depression harmed kuwait 's economy , starting in the late 1920s . international trading wa one of kuwait 's main source of income before oil . kuwaiti merchant were mostly intermediary merchant . a a result of the decline of european demand for good from india and africa , kuwait 's economy suffered . the decline in international trade resulted in an increase in gold smuggling by kuwaiti ship to india . some kuwaiti merchant family became rich from this smuggling . kuwait 's pearl industry also collapsed a a result of the worldwide economic depression . at it height , kuwait 's pearl industry had led the world 's luxury market , regularly sending out between 750 and 800 ship to meet the european elite 's desire for pearl . during the economic depression , luxury like pearl were in little demand . the japanese invention of cultured pearl also contributed to the collapse of kuwait 's pearl industry . </s> in 1937 , freya stark wrote about the extent of poverty in kuwait at the time : </s> some merchant family left kuwait in the early 1930s due to the prevalence of economic hardship caused by saudi arabia 's economic blockade against kuwait . at the time of the discovery of oil in 19361937 , most of kuwait 's inhabitant were impoverished . </s> throughout the 1930s , kuwaiti people opposed the british imposed separation of kuwait from iraq . in 1938 , the `` free kuwaiti movement `` wa established by kuwaiti youth who opposed british rule and submitted a petition demanding the iraqi government reunifies kuwait and iraq . due to fear of armed uprising in kuwait , the al sabah agreed to the establishment of a legislative council to represent the `` free kuwaiti movement `` demanding the reunification of iraq and kuwait . in 1938 , the council 's first meeting resulted in unanimous resolution demanding the reunification of kuwait and iraq . </s> in march 1939 , a popular armed uprising erupted within kuwait to reunify with iraq . the al sabah family , along with british military support , violently put down the uprising , and killed and imprisoned it participant . king ghazi of iraq publicly demanded the release of the kuwaiti prisoner and warned the al sabah family to end the repression of the `` free kuwaiti movement `` . </s> <section_title_start> 1946 - 1982 : golden era of kuwait <section_title_end> </s> between 19461982 , kuwait experienced a period of prosperity driven by oil and it liberal atmosphere . in popular discourse , the year between 1946 and 1982 are referred to a the `` golden era of kuwait `` . in 1950 , a major public-work programme began to enable kuwaiti to enjoy a modern standard of living . by 1952 , the country became the largest oil exporter in the persian gulf region . this massive growth attracted many foreign worker , especially from palestine , india , and egypt with the latter being particularly political within the context of the arab cold war . in june 1961 , kuwait became independent with the end of the sheikhdom of kuwait # history a a protected state of britain and the sheikh abdullah al-salim al-sabah became emir of kuwait . kuwait 's public holiday in kuwait , however , is celebrated on 25 february , the anniversary of the coronation of sheikh abdullah ( it wa originally celebrated on 19 june , the date of independence , but concern over the summer heat caused the government to move it ) . under the term of the newly drafted constitution of kuwait , kuwait held it first kuwaiti parliamentary election , 1963 . kuwait wa the first of the arab state of the persian gulf to establish a constitution and parliament . </s> in the 1960s and 1970s , kuwait wa considered the most developed country in the region . kuwait wa the pioneer in the middle east in diversifying it earnings away from oil export . the kuwait investment authority is the world 's first sovereign wealth fund . from the 1970s onward , kuwait scored highest of all arab country on the human development index . kuwait university wa established in 1966 . kuwait 's # theatre wa well known throughout the arab world . </s> in the 1960s and 1970s , kuwait 's press wa described a one of the freedom of the press . kuwait wa the pioneer in the literary renaissance in the arab region . in 1958 , al-arabi ( magazine ) al-arabi magazine wa first published . the magazine went on to become the most popular magazine in the arab world . many arab writer moved to kuwait because they enjoyed greater freedom of expression than elsewhere in the arab world . the iraqi poet ahmed matar left iraq in the 1970s to take refuge in the more liberal environment of kuwait . </s> kuwaiti society embraced liberal and non-traditional attitude throughout the 1960s and 1970s . for example , most kuwaiti woman did not wear the [ in the 1960s and 70 . </s> <section_title_start> 1982 - present <section_title_end> </s> in the early 1980s , kuwait experienced a major economic crisis ] after the [ [ souk al-manakh stock market crash and 1980s oil glut . </s> during the iraniraq war , kuwait supported iraq . throughout the 1980s , there were several terrorism in kuwait in kuwait , including the 1983 kuwait bombing , hijacking of 1983 kuwait bombing # aircraft hijacking ( 19841988 ) and the attempted assassination of jaber al-ahmad al-sabah in 1985 . kuwait wa a regional hub of science and technology in the 1960s and 1970s up until the early 1980s ; the scientific research sector significantly suffered due to the terror attack . </s> after the iraniraq war ended , kuwait declined an iraqi request to forgive it u $ 65 ; billion debt . an economic rivalry between the two country ensued after kuwait increased it oil production by 40 percent . tension between the two country increased further in july 1990 , after iraq complained to opec claiming that kuwait wa stealing it oil from a field near the border by slant drilling of the rumaila field . </s> in august 1990 , iraqi force invasion of kuwait kuwait . after a series of failed diplomatic negotiation , the united state led a coalition to remove the iraqi force from kuwait , in what became known a the gulf war . on 26 february 1991 , the coalition succeeded in driving out the iraqi force . a they retreated , iraqi force carried out a kuwaiti oil fire policy by setting oil well on fire . during the iraqi occupation , more than 1,000 kuwaiti civilian were killed . in addition , more than 600 kuwaiti went missing people during iraq 's occupation ; remains of approximately 375 were found in mass graf in iraq . </s> in march 2003 , kuwait became the springboard for the us-led invasion of iraq . upon the death of the emir jaber in january 2006 , saad al-sabah succeeded him but wa removed nine day later by the kuwaiti parliament due to his ailing health . sabah al-sabah wa sworn in a emir . </s> from 2001 to 2009 , kuwait had the highest human development index ranking in the arab world . in 2005 , woman won the right to vote and run in election . in 2014 and 2015 , kuwait wa ranked first among arab country in the global gender gap report . sabah al ahmad sea city wa inaugurated in mid-2015 . </s> the amiri diwan of kuwait is currently developing the new kuwait national cultural district ( kncd ) , which comprises sheikh abdullah al salem cultural centre , sheikh jaber al ahmad cultural centre , al shaheed park , and al salam palace ( kuwait ) . with a capital cost of more than u $ 1 ; billion , the project is one of the largest cultural investment in the world . in november 2016 , the sheikh jaber al ahmad cultural centre opened . it is the largest cultural centre in the middle east . the kuwait national cultural district is a member of the global cultural district network . in 2016 kuwait commenced a new national development plan , kuwait vision 2035 , including plan to diversify the economy and become le dependent on oil . </s> on 30 september 2020 , kuwait 's crown prince sheikh nawaf al-ahmad al-jaber al-sabah became the 16th emir of kuwait and the successor to emir sheikh sabah al-ahmad al-jaber al-sabah , who died at the age of 91 . on 7 october 2020 , mishal al-ahmad al-jaber al-sabah wa nominated to be the crown prince by emir sheikh nawaf . on 8 october , kuwait 's national assembly approved sheikh mishal a the crown prince , where he took the oath of office , and pledged commitment to democracy and peace . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> located in the north-east corner of the arabian peninsula , kuwait is one of the smallest country in the world in term of land area . kuwait lie between latitude 28th parallel north 28 and 31st parallel north 31 n , and longitude 46th meridian east 46 and 49th meridian east 49 e. the flat , sandy arabian desert cover most of kuwait . kuwait is generally low-lying , with the highest point being above sea level . </s> kuwait ha list of island of kuwait , all of which , with the exception of failaka island , are uninhabited . with an area of , the bubiyan island is the largest island in kuwait and is connected to the rest of the country by a bridge . 0.6 % of kuwaiti land area is considered arable with sparse vegetation found along it coastline . kuwait city is located on kuwait bay , a natural deep-water harbor . </s> kuwait 's burgan field ha a total capacity of approximately of proven oil reserve . during the 1991 kuwaiti oil fire , more than 500 oil lake were created covering a combined surface area of about . the resulting soil contamination due to oil and soot accumulation had made eastern and south-eastern part of kuwait uninhabitable . sand and oil residue had reduced large part of the kuwaiti desert to semi-asphalt surface . the oil spill during the gulf war also drastically affected kuwait 's marine resource . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the spring season in march is warm with occasional thunderstorm . the frequent wind from the northwest are cold in winter and hot in summer . southeasterly damp wind spring up between july and october . hot and dry south wind prevail in spring and early summer . the shamal , a northwesterly wind common during june and july , cause dramatic sandstorm . summer in kuwait are some of the hottest on earth . the highest recorded temperature wa at mitribah on 21 july 2016 , which is the highest temperature recorded in asia . </s> in 2014 kuwait wa the fourth highest country in the world in term of list of country by carbon dioxide emission per caput after qatar , curaao and trinidad and tobago according to the world bank . on average , every single inhabitant released 25.2 metric ton of co2 in the atmosphere that year . in comparison , the world average wa 5.0 ton per caput the same year . </s> access to biocapacity in kuwait is lower than world average . in 2016 , kuwait had 0.59 global hectare of biocapacity per person within it territory , much le than the world average of 1.6 global hectare per person . in 2016 kuwait used 8.6 global hectare of biocapacity per person - their ecological footprint of consumption . this mean they use about 14.5 time a much biocapacity a kuwait contains . a a result , kuwait is running a biocapacity deficit . </s> <section_title_start> national park <section_title_end> </s> at present , there are five protected area in kuwait recognized by the iucn . in response to kuwait becoming the list of party to the ramsar convention of the ramsar convention , bubiyan island 's mubarak al-kabeer reserve wa designated a the country 's first wetland of international importance . the 50,948 ; ha reserve consists of small lagoon and shallow saltmarsh and is important a a stop-over for migrating bird on two migration route . the reserve is home to the world 's largest breeding colony of crab-plover . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> more than 363 specie of bird were recorded in kuwait , 18 specie of which breed in the country . kuwait is situated at the crossroad of several major bird migration route and between two and three million bird pas each year . the marsh in northern kuwait and jahra have become increasingly important a a refuge for passage migrant . kuwaiti island are important breeding area for four specie of tern and the socotra cormorant . </s> kuwait 's marine and littoral ecosystem contain the bulk of the country 's biodiversity heritage . twenty eight specie of mammal are found in kuwait ; animal such a gerboa , desert rabbit and [ are common in the desert . large carnivore , such a the wolf ] , [ [ caracal and jackal , are not found . among the endangered mammalian specie are the red fox and wild cat . cause for wildlife extinction are habitat destruction and extensive unregulated hunting . forty reptile specie have been recorded although none are endemic to kuwait . </s> <section_title_start> water and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> kuwait doe not have any permanent river . it doe have some wadi , the most notable of which is wadi al-batin which form the border between kuwait and iraq . </s> kuwait relies on water desalination a a primary source of fresh water for drinking and domestic purpose . there are currently more than six desalination plant . kuwait wa the first country in the world to use desalination to supply water for large-scale domestic use . the history of desalination in kuwait date back to 1951 when the first distillation plant wa commissioned . </s> in 1965 , the kuwaiti government commissioned the swedish engineering company of vbb ( sweco ) to develop and implement a plan for a modern water-supply system for kuwait city . the company built kuwait water tower , thirty-one tower total , designed by it chief architect sune lindstrm , called `` the mushroom tower `` . for a sixth site , the emir of kuwait , sheikh jaber al-ahmad al-jaber al-sabah jaber al-ahmed , wanted a more spectacular design . this last group , known a kuwait tower , consists of three tower , two of which also serve a water tower . water from the desalination facility is pumped up to the tower . the thirty-three tower have a standard capacity of 102,000 cubic meter of water . `` the water tower `` ( kuwait tower and the kuwait water tower ) were awarded the aga khan award for architecture ( 1980 cycle ) . </s> kuwait 's fresh water resource are limited to groundwater , desalinated seawater , and treated wastewater effluent . there are three major municipal wastewater treatment plant . most water demand is currently satisfied through seawater desalination plant . sewage disposal is handled by a national sewage network that cover 98 % of facility in the country . </s> <section_title_start> government <section_title_end> </s> kuwait is a constitutional emirate with a semi-democracy semi-democratic political system . the emir of kuwait is the head of state . the hybrid political system is divided between an national assembly ( kuwait ) and government of kuwait . </s> the constitution of kuwait wa promulgated in 1962 . kuwait is among the middle east 's freest country in civil liberty and political right . freedom house rate the country a `` partly free `` in the freedom in the world survey , while the polity data series and the economist democracy index both categorise it a an autocracy . </s> <section_title_start> political culture <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of kuwait is considered the most liberal constitution in the gulf cooperation council . it guarantee a wide range of civil liberty and right . in contrast to other state in the region , the political process largely respect constitutional provision . kuwait ha a robust public sphere and active civil society with political and social organization that are political party in all but name . professional group like the kuwait chamber of commerce and industry maintain their autonomy from the government . </s> the national assembly ( kuwait ) is the legislature and ha oversight authority . the national assembly consists of fifty elected member , who are chosen in election held every four year . since the parliament can conduct inquiry into government action and pas motion of no confidence , separation of power # check and balance are robust in kuwait . the parliament can be dissolved under a set of condition based on constitutional provision . the constitutional court and emir both have the power to dissolve the parliament , although the constitutional court can invalidate the emir 's dissolution . </s> executive ( government ) is executed by the government . the emir appoints the prime minister , who in turn chooses the minister comprising the government . according to the constitution , at least one minister ha to be an elected mp from the parliament . the parliament is often rigorous in holding the accountability , government minister are frequently interpellated and forced to resign . kuwait ha more government accountability and transparency than other gulf cooperation council country . </s> the judiciary is nominally independent of the executive and the legislature , and the constitutional court is charged with ruling on the conformity of law and decree with the constitution . the judiciary 's independence ha come under question , although the constitutional court is widely regarded a one of the most judicially independent court in the arab world . the constitutional court ha the power to dissolve the parliament and invalidate the emir 's decree , a happened in 2013 when the dissolved 2009 parliament resumed it role . </s> kuwaiti woman outnumber men in the workforce . the political participation of woman in kuwait ha been limited , although kuwaiti woman are among the most emancipated woman in the middle east . in 2014 and 2015 , kuwait wa ranked first among arab country in the global gender gap report . in 2013 , 53 % of kuwaiti woman participated in the labor force . kuwait ha higher female citizen participation in the workforce than other gcc country . </s> political group and parliamentary voting bloc exist , although most candidate run a independent . once elected , many deputy form voting bloc in the national assembly . kuwaiti law doe not recognize political party . however , numerous political group function a de facto political party in election , and there are bloc in the parliament . major de facto political party include the national democratic alliance ( kuwait ) , popular action bloc , hadas ( kuwaiti muslim brotherhood ) , national islamic alliance and the justice and peace alliance . </s> <section_title_start> legal system <section_title_end> </s> kuwait follows the `` civil law ( legal system ) `` modeled after the french legal system , kuwait 's legal system is largely secular . sharia law governs only family law for muslim resident , while non-muslims in kuwait have a secular family law . for the application of family law , there are three separate court section : sunni islam , shia islam , and dhimmi non-muslim . according to the united nation , kuwait 's legal system is a mix of english law # common law , law of france , egyptian civil code and islamic law . </s> the judiciary in kuwait is secular . unlike other arab state of the persian gulf , kuwait doe not have sharia court . section of the civil court system administer family law . kuwait ha the most secular commercial law in the gulf . the parliament criminalized alcohol consumption in 1983 . kuwait 's code of personal status ( kuwait ) wa promulgated in 1984. </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> foreign affair relation of kuwait is handled at the level of the ministry of foreign affair ( kuwait ) . the first foreign affair department bureau wa established in 1961 . kuwait became the 111th member state of the united nation in may 1963 . it is a long-standing member of the arab league and cooperation council for the arab state of the gulf . </s> before the gulf war , kuwait wa the only `` pro-soviet `` state in the persian gulf region . kuwait acted a a conduit for the soviet to the other arab state of the persian gulf , and kuwait wa used to demonstrate the benefit of a pro-soviet stance . in july 1987 , kuwait refused to allow u.s. military base in it territory . a a result of the gulf war , kuwait 's relation with the u.s. have improved ( major non-nato ally ) and it currently host thousand of united state armed force and contractor within active u.s. facility . kuwait is also a major ally of association of southeast asian nation and enjoys a good relationship with china while working to establish a model of cooperation in numerous field . according to kuwaiti official , kuwait is the largest arab investor in germany , particularly with regard to the mercedes-benz company . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the military of kuwait trace it original root to the kuwaiti cavalryman and infantryman that used to protect kuwait and it wall since the early 1900s . these cavalryman and infantryman formed the defense and security force in metropolitan area and were charged with protecting outpost outside the wall of kuwait . </s> the military of kuwait consists of several joint defense force . the governing body are the ministry of defense ( kuwait ) , the ministry of interior ( kuwait ) , the kuwait national guard and the kuwait fire service directorate . the emir of kuwait is the commander-in-chief of all defense force by default . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> kuwait is divided into governorates of kuwait : al asimah governorate ( kuwait ) ( or capital governorate ) ; hawalli governorate ; farwaniya governorate ; mubarak al-kabeer governorate ; ahmadi governorate ; and jahra governorate . the governorates are further area of kuwait . </s> <section_title_start> human rights <section_title_end> </s> human right in kuwait ha been the subject of criticism , particularly regarding migrant worker in the gulf cooperation council region foreign worker ' right . expatriate account for 70 % of kuwait 's total population . the kafala system leaf foreign worker prone to exploitation . kuwait ha the most liberal labor law in the gcc . a a result , the international labour organization ( international labour organization ) removed kuwait from the list of country violating worker right . male [ is lgbt right in kuwait illegal in kuwait ] and punishable by up to 6 year in prison . </s> a of 2009 , 20 % of the youth in juvenile centre have dyslexia , a compared to the 6 % of the general population . data from a 1993 study found that there is a higher rate of psychiatric morbidity in kuwaiti prison than in the general population . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha a [ [ petroleum-based economy , petroleum is the main export product . the kuwaiti dinar is the highest-valued unit of currency in the world . according to the world bank , kuwait is the seventh richest country in the world list of country by gdp ( ppp ) per caput # list of country and dependency . kuwait is the second richest gcc country per caput ( after qatar ) . petroleum account for half of gdp and 90 % of government income . non-petroleum industry include financial service . </s> in the past five year , there ha been a significant rise in entrepreneurship and small business start-ups in kuwait . the informal sector is also on the rise , mainly due to the popularity of instagram business . </s> kuwait is a major source of foreign economic assistance to other state through the kuwait fund for arab economic development , an autonomous state institution created in 1961 on the pattern of international development agency . in 1974 , the fund 's lending mandate wa expanded to include all developing country in the world . </s> in 2018 kuwait enacted certain measure to regulate foreign labor . citing security concern , worker from georgia ( country ) will be subject to heightened scrutiny when applying for entry visa , and an outright ban wa being imposed on the entry of domestic worker from guinea-bissau and vietnam . worker from bangladesh are also banned . in april 2019 , kuwait added ethiopia , burkina faso , bhutan , guinea and guinea-bissau to the list of banned country bringing the total to 20 . according to migrant right , the ban are put in place mainly due to the fact that these country lack embassy and labour corporation in kuwait . </s> <section_title_start> petroleum <section_title_end> </s> despite it relatively small territory , kuwait ha proven crude list of country by proven oil reserve # country of 104 ; billion barrel , estimated to be 10 % of the world 's reserve . according to the constitution , all natural resource in the country are state property . kuwait currently pump 2.9 ; million barrel per day and it full production capacity is a little over 3 million bpd . </s> <section_title_start> finance <section_title_end> </s> the kuwait investment authority ( kia ) is kuwait 's sovereign wealth fund specializing in foreign investment . the kia is the world 's oldest sovereign wealth fund . since 1953 , the kuwaiti government ha directed investment into europe , united state and asia pacific . , the holding were valued at $ 592 ; billion in asset . it is the sovereign wealth fund # largest sovereign wealth fund sovereign wealth fund in the world . </s> kuwait ha a leading position in the financial industry in the gcc ; the abyss that separate kuwait from it persian gulf neighbor in term of tourism , transport , and other measure of diversification is absent in the financial sector . the emir ha promoted the idea that kuwait should focus it energy , in term of economic development , on the financial industry . </s> the historical preeminence of kuwait ( among the persian gulf monarchy ) in finance date back to the founding of the national bank of kuwait in 1952 . the bank wa the first local publicly traded corporation in the persian gulf region . in the late 1970s and early 1980s , an alternative stock market , trading in share of persian gulf company , emerged in kuwait , the souk al-manakh stock market crash souk al-manakh . at it peak , it market capitalization wa the third highest in the world , behind only the united state and japan , and ahead of the united kingdom and france . </s> kuwait ha a large wealth-management industry that stand out in the region . kuwaiti investment company administer more asset than those of any other gcc country , save the much larger saudi arabia . the kuwait financial centre , in a rough calculation , estimated that kuwaiti firm accounted for over one-third of the total asset under management in the gcc . the relative strength of kuwait in the financial industry extends to it stock market . for many year , the total valuation of list of company of kuwait listed on the kuwait stock exchange far exceeded the value of those on any other gcc bourse , except saudi arabia . in 2011 , financial and banking company made up more than half of the market capitalization of the kuwaiti bourse ; among all the persian gulf state , the market capitalization of kuwaiti financial-sector firm wa , in total , behind only that of saudi arabia . </s> in recent year , kuwaiti investment company have invested large percentage of their asset abroad , and their foreign asset have become substantially larger than their domestic asset . </s> <section_title_start> health and research <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha a state-funded healthcare in kuwait , which provides treatment without charge to kuwaiti national . there are outpatient clinic in every residential area in kuwait . a public insurance scheme exists to provide reduced cost healthcare to expatriate . private healthcare provider also run medical facility in the country , available to member of their insurance scheme . there are 29 list of hospital in kuwait . many new hospital are under construction . the sheikh jaber al-ahmad hospital is the largest hospital in the middle east . </s> kuwait ha a growing scientific research sector . to date , kuwait ha registered 384 patent , the second highest figure in the arab world . kuwait produce the largest number of patent per caput in the arab world and oic . the government ha implemented various program to foster innovation resulting in patent right . between 2010 and 2016 , kuwait registered the highest growth in patent in the arab world . </s> <section_title_start> code in space <section_title_end> </s> to increase awareness about current opportunity and to encourage solution to challenge faced by the satellite industry , orbital space in collaboration with the space challenge program and endurosat introduced an international online student programming opportunity called `` code in space `` . this opportunity allows student from around the world to send and execute their own code in space . the code is transmitted from a satellite ground station to a cubesat ( small satellite ) orbiting earth 450 km above sea level . the code is then executed by the satellite 's onboard computer and tested under real space environment condition . the nanosatellite is called `` qmr-kwt `` ( arabic : ) which mean `` moon of kuwait `` , translated from arabic . qmr-kwt is scheduled to be launched to space in february 2021 on spacex falcon 9 block 5 rocket . it is planned to have qmr-kwt shuttled to it final destination ( sun-synchronous orbit ) via vigoride orbit transfer vehicle by space tug . qmr-kwt is kuwait 's first satellite . </s> <section_title_start> um alaish 4 <section_title_end> </s> seven year after the launch of the world 's first communication satellite , telstar 1 , kuwait inaugurated in october 1969 one of the first satellite ground station in the middle east about 70 km north of kuwait city in an area called `` um alaish `` . the um alaish satellite station complex housed several satellite ground station including um alaish 1 ( 1969 ) , um alaish 2 ( 1977 ) , um alaish 3 ( 1981 ) . it provided satellite communication service in kuwait until 1990 when it wa destroyed by the iraqi armed force during the iraqi invasion of kuwait . in 2019 , orbital space established an amateur satellite ground station to provide free access to signal from satellite in orbit passing over kuwait . the station wa named um alaish 4 to continue the legacy of `` um alaish `` satellite station . um alaish 4 is member of funcube distributed ground station network and the satellite networked open ground station project ( satnogs ) . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha the highest literacy rate in the arab world . the general education system consists of four level : kindergarten ( lasting for 2 year ) , primary education ( lasting for 5 year ) , middle school ( lasting for 4 year ) and secondary education ( lasting for 3 year ) . schooling at primary and intermediate level is compulsory for all student aged 6 14 . all the level of state education , including higher education , are free . </s> the public school system is undergoing a revamp due to a project in conjunction with the world bank . in 2013 , the government launched a pilot project in 48 school across the state called the national curriculum framework . the curriculum is set to be implemented in the next two or three year . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism account for 1.5 percent of the gdp . in 2016 , the tourism industry generated nearly $ 500 ; million in revenue . the annual `` hala febrayer `` festival attracts many tourist from neighboring gcc country , and includes a variety of event including music concert , parade , and carnival . the festival is a month-long commemoration of the liberation of kuwait , and run from 1 to 28 february . liberation day itself is celebrated on 26 february . </s> the amiri diwan of kuwait is currently developing the new kuwait national cultural district ( kncd ) , which comprises sheikh abdullah al salem cultural centre , sheikh jaber al ahmad cultural centre , al shaheed park , and al salam palace ( kuwait ) . with a capital cost of more than u $ 1 ; billion , the project is one of the largest cultural investment in the world . in november 2016 , the sheikh jaber al ahmad cultural centre opened . it is the largest cultural centre in the middle east . the kuwait national cultural district is a member of the global cultural district network . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha an extensive and modern network of highway . road in kuwait extended , of which is paved . there are more than two million passenger car , and 500,000 commercial taxi , bus , and truck in use . on major highway the maximum speed is . since there is no railway system in the country , most people travel by automobile . </s> the country 's public transportation network consists almost entirely of bus route . the state owned kuwait public transportation company wa established in 1962 . it run local bus route across kuwait a well a longer distance service to other arab state of the persian gulf . the main private bus company is citybus , which operates about 20 route across the country . another private bus company , kuwait gulf link public transport service , wa started in 2006 . it run local bus route across kuwait and longer distance service to neighbouring arab country . </s> there are two airport in kuwait . kuwait international airport serf a the principal hub for international air travel . state-owned kuwait airway is the largest airline in the country . a portion of the airport complex is designated a al mubarak air base , which contains the headquarters of the kuwait air force , a well a the kuwait air force museum . in 2004 , the first private airline of kuwait , jazeera airway , wa launched . in 2005 , the second private airline , wataniya airway wa founded . </s> kuwait ha one of the largest shipping industry in the region . the kuwait port public authority manages and operates port across kuwait . the country 's principal commercial seaport are shuwaikh and shuaiba , which handled combined cargo of 753,334 teu in 2006 . mina al-ahmadi , the largest port in the country , handle most of kuwait 's oil export . construction of another major port located in bubiyan island started in 2007 . the port is expected to handle 1.3 ; million twenty-foot equivalent unit when operation start . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> kuwait 's 2018 population wa 4.6 ; million people , of which 1.4 ; million were kuwaiti , 1.2 ; million are other arab , 1.8 ; million asian expatriate , and 47,227 african . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> expatriate in kuwait account for around 70 % of kuwait 's total population . at the end of december 2018 , 57.65 % of kuwait 's total population were arab ( including arab expat ) . indian people and egyptian are the largest expat community respectively . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> most kuwaiti citizen are muslim ; it is estimated that 60 % 65 % are sunni and 35 % 40 % are shia . most shia islam in kuwait are of 'ajam of kuwait . the country includes a christianity in kuwait # kuwaiti christian community , estimated to be composed of between 259 and 400 christian kuwaiti citizen . kuwait is the only cooperation council for the arab state of the gulf besides bahrain to have a local christian population who hold citizenship . there is also a small number of kuwaiti citizen who follow the bah faith . kuwait also ha a large community of expatriate christian , hinduism , buddhism , and sikhism . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> kuwait 's official language is modern standard arabic , but it everyday usage is limited to journalism and education . kuwaiti arabic is the variant of arabic used in everyday life . english language is widely understood and often used a a business language . besides english , french language is taught a a third language for the student of the [ at school , but for two year only . kuwaiti arabic is a variant of gulf arabic ] , sharing similarity with the dialect of neighboring coastal area in eastern arabia . due to immigration during it early history a well a trade , kuwaiti arabic borrowed a lot of word from [ [ persian language , language of india , balochi language , turkish language , english language and italian language . </s> due to historical immigration , kuwaiti persian is used among 'ajam of kuwait . the iranian language sub-dialects of larestani , khonji , bastaki and gerashi also influenced the vocabulary of kuwaiti arabic . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> kuwaiti popular culture , in the form of theatre , radio , music , and television soap opera , flourish and is even exported to neighboring state . within the gulf arab state , the culture of kuwait is the closest to the culture of bahrain and southern iraq ; this is evident in the close association between the two state in theatrical production and soap opera . </s> <section_title_start> society <section_title_end> </s> kuwaiti society is markedly more open society than other gulf arab society . kuwaiti citizen are ethnically diverse , consisting of both arab and 'ajam of kuwait persian ( 'ajam ) . kuwait stand out in the region a the most liberal in empowering woman in the public sphere . woman in kuwait outnumber men in the workforce . kuwaiti political scientist ghanim alnajjar see these quality a a manifestation of kuwaiti society a a whole , whereby in the gulf arab region it is `` the least strict about tradition `` . </s> <section_title_start> television and theatre <section_title_end> </s> kuwait 's television drama industry top other gulf arab drama industry and produce a minimum of fifteen serial annually . kuwait is the production centre of the gulf television drama and comedy scene . most gulf television drama and comedy production are filmed in kuwait . kuwaiti soap opera are the most-watched soap opera from the gulf region . soap opera are most popular during the time of ramadan , when family gather to break their fast . although usually performed in the kuwaiti arabic , they have been shown with success a far away a tunisia . kuwait is frequently dubbed the `` hollywood of the gulf `` due to the popularity of it television soap opera and theatre . </s> kuwait is known for it home-grown tradition of theatre . kuwait is the only country in the gulf arab region with a theatrical tradition . the theatrical movement in kuwait constitutes a major part of the country 's cultural life . theatrical activity in kuwait began in the 1920s when the first spoken drama were released . theatre activity are still popular today . abdulhussain abdulredha is the most prominent actor . </s> kuwait is the main centre of scenography and performing art education in the gulf region . in 1973 , the higher institute of theatrical art wa founded by the government to provide [ education ] in theatrical art . the institute ha several division . many actor have graduated from the institute , such a souad abdullah , mohammed khalifa , mansour al-mansour , along with a number of prominent critic such a ismail fahd ismail . </s> theatre in kuwait is subsidized by the government , previously by the ministry of social affair and now by the national council for culture , art , and letter ( nccal ) . every urban district ha a public theatre . the public theatre in salmiya is named after abdulhussain abdulredha . </s> <section_title_start> arts <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha the oldest modern art movement in the arabian peninsula . beginning in 1936 , kuwait wa the first gulf arab country to grant scholarship in the art . the kuwaiti artist mojeb al-dousari wa the earliest recognized visual artist in the gulf arab region . he is regarded a the founder of portrait art in the region . the sultan gallery wa the first professional arab art gallery in the gulf . </s> kuwait is home to more than art of kuwait # art gallery . in recent year , kuwait 's contemporary art scene ha boomed . khalifa al-qattan wa the first artist to hold a solo exhibition in kuwait . he founded a new art theory in the early 1960s known a `` circulism `` . other notable kuwaiti artist include sami mohammad , thuraya al-baqsami and suzan bushnaq . </s> the government organizes various art festival , including the al qurain cultural festival and formative art festival . the kuwait international biennial wa inaugurated in 1967 , more than 20 arab and foreign country have participated in the biennial . prominent participant include layla al-attar . in 2004 , the al kharafi biennial for contemporary arab art wa inaugurated . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> kuwait is the birthplace of various popular musical genre , such a sawt ( music ) . kuwaiti music ha considerably influenced the music culture in other gulf cooperation council ( gcc ) country . traditional kuwaiti music is a reflection of the country 's seafaring heritage , which is known for genre such a fijiri . kuwait pioneered khaliji ( music ) . kuwaiti were the first commercial recording artist in the gulf region . the first known kuwaiti recording were made between 1912 and 1915. </s> the sheikh jaber al-ahmad cultural centre contains the largest opera house in the middle east . kuwait is home to various music festival , including the international music festival hosted by the national council for culture , art and letter ( nccal ) . kuwait ha several academic institution specializing in university-level music education . the higher institute of musical art wa established by the government to provide bachelor 's degree in music . in addition , the college of basic education offer bachelor 's degree in music education . the institute of musical study offer degree equivalent to secondary school . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> kuwait ha , in recent year , produced several prominent contemporary writer such a ismail fahd ismail , author of over twenty novel and numerous short story collection . there is also evidence that kuwaiti literature ha long been interactive with english literature and french literature . </s> <section_title_start> museums <section_title_end> </s> the new kuwait national cultural district ( kncd ) consists of various cultural venue including sheikh abdullah al salem cultural centre , sheikh jaber al ahmad cultural centre , al shaheed park , and al salam palace ( kuwait ) . with a capital cost of more than u $ 1 ; billion , it is one of the largest cultural district in the world . the abdullah salem cultural centre is the largest museum complex in the middle east . the kuwait national cultural district is a member of the global cultural district network . </s> several kuwaiti museum are devoted to islamic art , most notably the tareq rajab museum and dar al athar al islamiyyah cultural centre . the dar al athar al islamiyyah cultural centre include education wing , conservation lab , and research library . there are several library in kuwait . khalifa al-qattan 's mirror house is the most popular art museum in kuwait . many museum in kuwait are private enterprise . in contrast to the top-down approach in other gulf state , museum development in kuwait reflects a greater sense of civic identity and demonstrates the strength of civil society in kuwait , which ha produced many independent cultural enterprise . </s> sadu house is among kuwait 's most important cultural institution . bait al-othman museum bait al-othman is the largest museum specializing in kuwait 's history . kuwait scientific center is one of the largest science museum in the middle east . the museum of modern art ( kuwait ) showcase the history of modern art in kuwait and the region . the kuwait national museum , established in 1983 , ha been described a `` underused and overlooked `` . </s> <section_title_start> media <section_title_end> </s> kuwait 's medium is annually classified a `` partly free `` in the freedom of press survey by freedom house . since 2005 , kuwait ha frequently earned the highest ranking of all arab country in the annual press freedom index by reporter without border . in 2009 , 2011 , 2013 and 2014 , kuwait surpassed israel a the country with the greatest press freedom in the middle east . kuwait is also frequently ranked a the arab country with the greatest press freedom in freedom house 's annual freedom of press survey . </s> kuwait produce more list of newspaper in kuwait per caput than it neighbor . there are limit to kuwait 's press freedom ; while criticism of the government and ruling family member is permitted , kuwait 's constitution criminalizes criticism of the emir . </s> the state-owned kuwait news agency ( kuna ) is the largest medium house in the country . the ministry of information regulates the medium industry in kuwait . </s> kuwait ha 15 satellite television channel , of which four are controlled by the ministry of information . state-owned kuwait television ( ktv ) offered first colored broadcast in 1974 and operates five television channel . government-funded radio kuwait also offer daily informative programming in several language including arabic language , farsi , urdu , and english on the am broadcasting and shortwave . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> association football is the most popular sport in kuwait . the kuwait football association ( kfa ) is the governing body of football in kuwait . the kfa organises the kuwait national football team men 's , kuwait woman 's national football team woman 's , and futsal national team . the kuwaiti premier league is the top league of kuwaiti football , featuring eighteen team . the kuwait national football team have been the champion of the 1980 afc asian cup , runner-up of the 1976 afc asian cup , and have taken third place of the 1984 afc asian cup . kuwait ha also been to one fifa world cup , in 1982 fifa world cup ; they drew 11 with czechoslovakia national football team before losing to france national football team and england national football team , failing to advance from the first round . kuwait is home to many football club including al-arabi sc ( kuwait ) al-arabi , fahaheel ( football club ) al-fahaheel , al jahra ( football club ) al-jahra , al kuwait kaifan al-kuwait , al naser sporting club al-naser , al salmiya club al-salmiya , al-shabab ( kuwait ) al-shabab , al qadsia kuwait , al yarmouk ( football club ) al-yarmouk , al kazma kuwait , khaitan , sulaibikhat , sahel ( kuwaiti football club ) , and tadamon , kuwait . the biggest football rivalry in kuwait is between al-arabi sc ( kuwait ) al-arabi and al qadsia kuwait . </s> basketball is one of the country 's most popular sport . the kuwait national basketball team is governed by the kuwait basketball association ( kba ) . kuwait made it international debut in 1959 . the national team ha been to the fiba asian championship in basketball eleven time . the kuwaiti division i basketball league is the highest professional basketball league in kuwait . kuwait national cricket team is governed by the kuwait cricket association . other growing sport include rugby union in kuwait . kuwait men 's national handball team is widely considered to be the national icon of kuwait , although football is more popular among the overall population . </s> kuwait national ice hockey team is governed by the kuwait ice hockey association . kuwait first joined the international ice hockey federation in 1985 , but wa expelled in 1992 due to a lack of ice hockey activity . kuwait wa re-admitted into the iihf in may 2009 . in 2015 , kuwait won the iihf challenge cup of asia . </s> in february 2020 kuwait held for the first time a leg of the aquabike world championship ( powerboating ) in front of marina beach city . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * outline of kuwait </s> * index of kuwait-related article
