category : member state of the united nation </s> category : middle eastern country </s> category : near eastern country </s> category : state and territory established in 1961 </s> category : western asian country </s> category : country in asia <article_end> <article_start> </s> south africa , officially the republic of south africa ( rsa ) , is the southernmost country in africa . with over demographic of south africa 59 ; million people , it is the world 's list of country by population 24th-most populous nation and cover an area of . south africa ha three capital city : executive pretoria , judicial bloemfontein and legislative cape town . the largest city is johannesburg . about 80 % of south african are of bantu people in south africa ancestry , divided among a ethnic group in south africa speaking language of south africa . the remaining population consists of africa 's largest community of white south african , asian south african , and multiracial ancestry . </s> it is bounded to the south by of coastline of southern africa stretching along the atlantic ocean and indian ocean ; to the north by the neighbouring country of namibia , botswana , and zimbabwe ; and to the east and northeast by mozambique and eswatini ( former swaziland ) ; and it surround the enclave and exclave of lesotho . it is the southernmost country on the mainland of the old world , and the most populous country located entirely south of the equator . south africa is a biodiversity hotspot , with a diversity of unique biome and plant and animal life . </s> south africa is a multiethnic society encompassing a wide culture of south africa , language of south africa , and religion in south africa . it pluralistic makeup is reflected in the constitution of south africa 's recognition of 11 official language , the fourth-highest number in the world . according to the 2011 census , the two most spoken first language are zulu language ( 22.7 % ) and xhosa language ( 16.0 % ) . the two next one are of european origin : afrikaans ( 13.5 % ) developed from dutch language and serf a the first language of most coloured and white south african south african ; south african english ( 9.6 % ) reflects the legacy of british colonialism , and is commonly used in public and commercial life . the country is one of the few in africa never to have had a coup d'tat , and election in south africa have been held for almost a century . however , the vast majority of black south african were not enfranchised until 1994. </s> during the 20th century , the black majority sought to claim more right from the dominant white minority , which played a large role in the country 's recent history of south africa and politics . the national party ( south africa ) imposed apartheid in 1948 , institutionalising previous racial segregation . after a long and sometimes violent internal resistance to apartheid by the african national congress ( anc ) and other anti-apartheid activist both inside and outside the country , the repeal of discriminatory law began in the mid-1980s . since 1994 , all ethnic and linguistic group have held political representation in the country 's liberal democracy , which comprises a parliamentary republic and province of south africa . south africa is often referred to a the `` rainbow nation `` to describe the country 's multicultural diversity , especially in the wake of apartheid . </s> south africa is a developing country and rank 113th on the human development index , the list of country by human development index seventh-highest in africa . it ha been classified by the world bank a a newly industrialised country , with the list of african country by gdp ( nominal ) second-largest economy in africa , and the list of country by gdp ( nominal ) 33rd-largest in the world . south africa also ha the most list of world heritage site in africa in africa . the country is a middle power in international affair ; it maintains significant regional power and is a member of both the commonwealth of nation and g20 . however , crime , poverty and inequality in post-apartheid south africa remain widespread , with about a quarter of the population unemployed and living on le than u $ 1.25 a day . moreover , climate change in south africa : it is a major contributor to climate change a the list of country by greenhouse gas emission a of 2018 ( in large part due to it coal in south africa ) , and is vulnerable to many of it impact , because of it water-insecure environment and vulnerable community . </s> <section_title_start> name <section_title_end> </s> the name `` south africa `` is derived from the country 's geographic location at the southern tip of africa . upon formation , the country wa named the union of south africa in english and unie van zuid-afrika in dutch language , reflecting it origin from the unification of four formerly separate british colony . since 1961 , the long formal name in english ha been the `` republic of south africa `` and republiek van suid-afrika in afrikaans . since 1994 , the country ha had an official name in each of it language of south africa . </s> mzansi , derived from the xhosa language noun umzantsi meaning `` south `` , is a colloquialism for south africa , while some pan-africanism pan-africanist political party prefer the term `` azania `` . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistoric archaeology <section_title_end> </s> south africa contains some of the oldest archaeological and [ fossil human-fossil ] site in the world . archaeologist have recovered extensive fossil remains from a series of cave in gauteng province . the area , a unesco world heritage site , ha been branded `` the cradle of humankind `` . the site include sterkfontein , one of the richest site for [ fossil in the world . other site include swartkrans ] , [ [ gondolin cave , kromdraai , cooper cave and malapa . raymond dart identified the first hominin fossil discovered in africa , the taung child ( found near taung ) in 1924 . further hominin remains have come from the site of makapansgat in limpopo province , cornelia , free state and florisbad in the free state ( south african province ) , border cave in kwazulu-natal province , klasies river mouth in eastern cape province and pinnacle point , elandsfontein cranium and die kelders cave in western cape province . </s> these find suggest that various hominid specie existed in south africa from about three million year ago , starting with australopithecus africanus . there followed specie including australopithecus sediba , homo ergaster , homo erectus , homo rhodesiensis , homo helmei , homo naledi and modern human ( homo sapiens ) . modern human have pinnacle point for at least 170,000 year . </s> various researcher have located pebble tool within the vaal river valley . </s> <section_title_start> bantu expansion <section_title_end> </s> settlement of bantu-speaking people of south africa bantu-speaking people , who were iron-using agriculturist and [ were already present south of the limpopo river ] ( now the northern border with [ [ botswana and zimbabwe ) by the 4th or 5th century current era ( see bantu expansion ) . they displaced , conquered and absorbed the original khoisan speaker , the khoikhoi and bushman people . the bantu slowly moved south . the earliest ironwork in modern-day kwazulu-natal province are believed to date from around 1050 . the southernmost group wa the xhosa people , whose language incorporates certain linguistic trait from the earlier khoisan people . the xhosa reached the great fish river , in today 's eastern cape province . a they migrated , these larger iron age population displaced or assimilated earlier people . </s> in mpumalanga province , several stone circle have been found along with the stone arrangement that ha been named adam 's calendar , and the ruin are thought to be created by the bokoni , a northern sotho language people . </s> <section_title_start> portuguese exploration <section_title_end> </s> at the time of european contact , the dominant ethnic group were bantu-speaking people who had migrated from other part of africa about one thousand year before . the two major historic group were the xhosa people and zulu people . </s> in 1487 , the portuguese explorer bartolomeu dia led the first european voyage to land in southern africa . on 4 december , he landed at walfisch bay ( now known a walvis bay in present-day namibia ) . this wa south of the furthest point reached in 1485 by his predecessor , the portuguese navigator diogo co ( cape cross , north of the bay ) . dia continued down the western coast of southern africa . after 8 january 1488 , prevented by storm from proceeding along the coast , he sailed out of sight of land and passed the southernmost point of africa without seeing it . he reached a far up the eastern coast of africa a , what he called , rio do infante , probably the present-day groot river ( eastern cape ) , in may 1488 , but on his return he saw the cape , which he first named cabo da tormentas ( cape of storm ) . his king , john ii of portugal , renamed the point cabo da boa esperana , or cape of good hope , a it led to the rich of the east indie . dia ' feat of navigation wa later immortalised in lu de cames ' portuguese epic poem , o lusadas ( 1572 ) . </s> <section_title_start> dutch colonisation <section_title_end> </s> by the early 17th century , portugal 's maritime power wa starting to decline , and english and dutch merchant competed to oust lisbon from it lucrative monopoly on the spice trade . representative of the british east india company did call sporadically at the cape in search of provision a early a 1601 , but later came to favour ascension island and st. helena a alternative port of refuge . dutch interest wa aroused after 1647 , when two employee of the dutch east india company ( verenigde oostindische compagnie ) were shipwrecked at the cape for several month . the sailor were able to survive by obtaining fresh water and meat from the native . they also sowed vegetable in the fertile soil . upon their return to holland , they reported favourably on the cape 's potential a a `` warehouse and garden `` for provision to stock passing ship for long voyage . </s> in 1652 , a century and a half after the discovery of the cape sea route , jan van riebeeck established a station at the cape of good hope , at what would become cape town , on behalf of the dutch east india company . in time , the cape became home to a large population of vrij , also known a vrijburgers ( ) , former company employee who stayed in dutch territory overseas after serving their contract . dutch trader also imported thousand of slavery to the fledgling colony from indonesia , madagascar , and part of eastern africa . some of the earliest mixed race community in the country were formed through union between vrijburgers , their slave , and various indigenous people . this led to the development of a new ethnic group , the cape coloureds , most of whom adopted the dutch language and christian faith . </s> the eastward expansion of dutch colonist ushered in a series of war with the southwesterly migrating xhosa tribe , known a the xhosa war , a both side competed for the pastureland necessary to graze their cattle near the great fish river . vrijburgers who became independent farmer on the frontier were known a boer , with some adopting semi-nomadic lifestyle being denoted a trekboers . the boer formed loose militia , which they termed commando , and forged alliance with khoisan group to repel xhosa raid . both side launched bloody but inconclusive offensive , and sporadic violence , often accompanied by livestock theft , remained common for several decade . </s> <section_title_start> british colonisation and the great trek <section_title_end> </s> great britain occupied cape town between 1795 and 1803 to prevent it from falling under the control of the french first republic , which had invaded the low country . despite briefly returning to dutch rule under the batavian republic in 1803 , the cape wa occupied again by the british in 1806 . following the end of the napoleonic war , it wa formally ceded to great britain and became an integral part of the british empire . british emigration to south africa began around 1818 , subsequently culminating in the arrival of the 1820 settler . the new colonist were induced to settle for a variety of reason , namely to increase the size of the european workforce and to bolster frontier region against xhosa incursion . </s> in the first two decade of the 19th century , the zulu people grew in power and expanded their territory under their leader , shaka . shaka 's warfare indirectly led to the mfecane ( `` crushing `` ) , in which 1,000,000 to 2,000,000 people were killed and the inland plateau wa devastated and depopulated in the early 1820s . an offshoot of the zulu , the northern ndebele people people created a larger empire that included large part of the [ under their king mzilikazi ] . </s> during the early 1800s , many dutch settler departed from the [ [ cape colony , where they had been subjected to british control , in a series of migrant group who came to be known a voortrekkers , meaning `` pathfinder `` or `` pioneer `` . they migrated to the future natal ( province ) , free state , and transvaal ( province ) region . the boer founded the boer republic : the south african republic ( now gauteng , limpopo , mpumalanga and north west province ( south africa ) province ) , the natalia republic ( kwazulu-natal ) , and the orange free state ( free state ) . </s> the discovery of diamond in 1867 and gold in 1884 in the interior started the mineral revolution and increased economic growth and immigration . this intensified british effort to gain control over the indigenous people . the struggle to control these important economic resource wa a factor in relation between european and the indigenous population and also between the boer and the british . </s> on 16 may 1876 , thomas franois burger of the south african republic ( transvaal colony ) declared war against sekhukhune and the pedi people . sekhukhune managed to defeat the transvaal army on 1 august 1876 . another attack by the lydenburg volunteer corp wa also repulsed . on 16 february 1877 , the two party signed a peace treaty at botshabelo , mpumalanga . the boer inability to subdue sekhukhune and the pedi led to the departure of burger in favour of paul kruger and the british annexation of the south african republic ( transvaal colony ) on 12 april 1877 by theophilus shepstone , secretary for native affair of colony of natal . in 1878 and 1879 three british attack were successfully repelled until garnet wolseley , 1st viscount wolseley defeated sekhukhune in november 1879 with an army of 2,000 british soldier , boer and 10,000 swazi . </s> the anglo-zulu war wa fought in 1879 between the united kingdom of great britain and ireland and the zulu kingdom . following lord carnarvon 's successful introduction of canadian confederation , it wa thought that similar political effort , coupled with military campaign , might succeed with the african kingdom , tribal area and boer republic in south africa . in 1874 , sir henry bartle frere wa sent to south africa a the british high commissioner for southern africa to bring such plan into being . among the obstacle were the presence of the independent state of the boer and the zulu kingdom and it army . the zulu nation defeated the british at the battle of isandlwana . eventually , though , the war wa lost , resulting in the termination of the zulu nation 's independence . </s> <section_title_start> boer wars <section_title_end> </s> the boer republic successfully resisted british encroachment during the first boer war ( 18801881 ) using guerrilla warfare tactic , which were well suited to local condition . the british returned with greater number , more experience , and new strategy in the second boer war ( 18991902 ) but suffered heavy casualty through attrition warfare ; nonetheless , they were ultimately successful . over 27,000 boer woman and child died in the british concentration camp . </s> <section_title_start> independence <section_title_end> </s> within the country , anti-british policy among white south african focused on independence . during the dutch and british colonial year , racial segregation wa mostly informal , though some legislation wa enacted to control the settlement and movement of native people , including the native location act of 1879 and the system of pas law . </s> eight year after the end of the second boer war and after four year of negotiation , an act of the british parliament ( south africa act 1909 ) granted nominal independence , while creating the union of south africa on 31 may 1910 . the union wa a dominion that included the former territory of the cape colony , transvaal colony and colony of natal colony , a well a the orange free state republic . </s> the native ' land act of 1913 severely restricted the ownership of land by black ; at that stage native controlled only seven percent of the country . the amount of land reserved for indigenous people wa later marginally increased . </s> in 1931 , the union wa fully sovereign from the united kingdom with the passage of the statute of westminster 1931 , which abolished the last power of the parliament of the united kingdom to legislate on the country . in 1934 , the south african party and national party ( south africa ) merged to form the united party ( south africa ) , seeking reconciliation between afrikaner and english-speaking white . in 1939 , the party split over the entry of the union into world war ii a an military history of south africa during world war ii , a move which the national party follower strongly opposed . </s> <section_title_start> beginning of apartheid <section_title_end> </s> in 1948 , the national party wa elected to power . it strengthened the racial segregation begun under dutch and british colonial rule . taking canada 's indian act a a framework , the nationalism government classified all people into three race and developed right and limitation for each . the white minority ( le than 20 % ) controlled the vastly larger black majority . the legally institutionalised segregation became known a apartheid . while white enjoyed the highest standard of living in all of africa , comparable to first world western nation , the black majority remained disadvantaged by almost every standard , including income , education , housing , and life expectancy . the freedom charter , adopted in 1955 by the congress alliance , demanded a non-racial society and an end to discrimination . </s> <section_title_start> republic <section_title_end> </s> on 31 may 1961 , the country became a republic following south african republic referendum , 1960 ( only open to white voter ) which narrowly passed ; the british-dominated natal province province largely voted against the proposal . queen elizabeth ii lost the title queen of south africa , and the last governor-general of the union of south africa governor-general , charles robberts swart , became state president of south africa . a a concession to the westminster system , the appointment of the president remained an appointment by parliament , and virtually powerless until p. w. botha 's south african constitution of 1983 , which eliminated the office of prime minister of south africa and instated a near-unique `` strong presidency `` parliamentary system . pressured by other commonwealth of nation country , south africa withdrew from the organisation in 1961 and rejoined it only in 1994. </s> despite internal resistance to apartheid both within and outside the country , the government legislated for a continuation of apartheid . the security force cracked down on internal dissent , and violence became widespread , with anti-apartheid organisation such a the african national congress ( anc ) , the azanian people 's organisation ( azapo ) , and the pan africanist congress of azania pan-africanist congress ( pac ) carrying out guerrilla warfare and urban sabotage . the three rival resistance movement also engaged in occasional inter-factional clash a they jockeyed for domestic influence . apartheid became increasingly controversial , and several country began to boycott business with the south african government because of it racial policy . these measure were later extended to international sanction and the disinvestment from south africa by foreign investor . </s> in the late 1970s , south africa south africa and weapon of mass destruction . in the following decade , it produced six deliverable nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> end of apartheid <section_title_end> </s> the mahlabatini declaration of faith , signed by mangosuthu buthelezi and harry schwarz in 1974 , enshrined the principle of peaceful transition of power and equality for all , the first of such agreement by black and white political leader in south africa . ultimately , f. w. de klerk opened bilateral discussion with nelson mandela in 1993 for a transition of policy and government . </s> in 1990 , the national party government took the first step towards dismantling discrimination when it lifted the ban on the anc and other political organisation . it released nelson mandela from prison after 27 year ' serving a sentence for sabotage . a negotiation to end apartheid in south africa followed . with approval from the white electorate in a south african apartheid referendum , 1992 , the government continued negotiation to end apartheid . south africa also destroyed it nuclear arsenal and acceded to the nuclear non-proliferation treaty . south africa held it first universal south african general election , 1994 , which the anc won by an overwhelming majority . it ha been in power ever since . the country rejoined the commonwealth of nation and became a member of the southern african development community ( sadc ) . </s> in post-apartheid south africa , unemployment remained high . while many black have risen to middle or upper class , the overall unemployment rate of black people worsened between 1994 and 2003 by official metric , but declined significantly using expanded definition . poverty among white , which wa previously rare , increased . in addition , the current government ha struggled to achieve the monetary and fiscal discipline to ensure both redistribution of wealth and economic growth . the united nation ( un ) human development index ( hdi ) of south africa fell from 1995 to 2005 , while it wa steadily rising until the mid-1990s , before recovering it 1995 peak in 2013 . this is in large part attributable to the hiv/aids in south africa south african hiv/aids pandemic which saw south african life expectancy fall from a high point of 62.25 year in 1992 to a low of 52.57 in 2005 , and the failure of the government to take step to address the pandemic in it early year . </s> in may 2008 , riot left over 60 people dead . the centre on housing right and eviction estimated that over 100,000 people were driven from their home . the target were mainly immigration to south africa and illegal immigration to south africa and refugee seeking asylum , but a third of the victim were south african citizen . in a 2006 survey , the south african migration project concluded that south african are more opposed to immigration than any other national group . the united nation high commissioner for refugee in 2008 reported over 200,000 refugee applied for asylum in south africa , almost four time a many a the year before . these people were mainly from zimbabwe , though many also come from burundi , democratic republic of the congo , rwanda , eritrea , ethiopia and somalia . competition over job , business opportunity , public service and housing ha led to tension between refugee and host community . while xenophobia in south africa is still a problem , recent violence ha not been a widespread a initially feared . nevertheless , a south africa continues to grapple with racial issue , one of the proposed solution ha been to pas legislation , such a the pending the prevention and combating of hate crime and hate speech bill , to uphold south africa 's ban on racism and commitment to equality . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> south africa is located at the southernmost region of africa , with a long coastline that stretch more than and along two ocean ( the south atlantic and the indian ) . at , according to the un demographic yearbook , south africa is the 24th-largest country in the world . it is about the same size a colombia , twice the size of france , three time a big a japan , four time the size of italy and five time the size of the united kingdom . </s> mafadi in the drakensberg at is the highest peak in south africa . excluding the prince edward island , the country lie between latitude 22nd parallel south 22 and 35th parallel south 35s , and longitude 16th meridian east 16 and 33rd meridian east 33e . </s> the interior of south africa consists of a vast , in most place almost flat , plateau with an altitude of between and , highest in the east and sloping gently downwards towards the west and north , and slightly le noticeably so to the south and south-west . this plateau is surrounded by the great escarpment , southern africa whose eastern , and highest , stretch is known a the drakensberg . </s> the south and south-western part of the plateau ( at approximately 1,1001,800m above sea level ) , and the adjoining plain below ( at approximately 700800m above sea levelsee map on the right ) is known a the karoo , which consists of sparsely populated scrubland . to the north , the great karoo fade into the even drier and more arid bushmanland , which eventually becomes the kalahari desert in the very north-west of the country . the mid-eastern , and highest part of the plateau is known a the highveld . this relatively well-watered area is home to a great proportion of the country 's commercial farmland and contains it largest conurbation ( gauteng ) . to the north of highveld , from about the 2530 's line of latitude , the plateau slope downwards into the bushveld , which ultimately give way to the limpopo lowland or veld # highveld and lowveld . </s> the coastal belt , below the great escarpment , moving clockwise from the northeast , consists of the limpopo lowveld , which merges into the mpumalanga lowveld , below the mpumalanga drakensberg ( the eastern portion of the great escarpment ) . this is hotter , drier and le intensely cultivated than the highveld above the escarpment . the kruger national park , located in the province of limpopo and mpumalanga in northeastern south africa , occupies a large portion of the lowveld covering 19,633 square kilometre ( 7,580 sq mi . ) south of the lowveld the annual rainfall increase a one enters kwazulu-natal province , which , especially near the coast , is subtropics hot and humid . the kwazulu-natallesotho international border is formed by the highest portion of the great escarpment , or drakensberg , which reach an altitude of over . the climate at the foot of this part of the drakensberg is temperate . </s> the coastal belt below the south and south-western stretch of the great escarpment contains several range of cape fold belt which run parallel to the coast , separating the great escarpment from the ocean . ( these parallel range of fold mountain are shown on the map , above left . note the course of the great escarpment to the north of these mountain range . ) the land ( at approximately 400500m above sea level ) between two of these range of fold mountain in the south ( i.e . between the outeniqua mountain and langeberg range to the south and the swartberg range to the north ) is known a the karoo , which consists of semi-desert scrubland similar to that of the great karoo , except that it northern strip along the foothill of the swartberg mountain , ha a somewhat higher rainfall and is , therefore , more cultivated than the great karoo . the little karoo is historically , and still , famous for it ostrich farming around the town of oudtshoorn . the lowland area ( 700800m above sea level ) to the north of the swartberg mountain range up to the great escarpment is the lowland part of the great karoo ( see map at top right ) , which is climatically and botanically almost indistinguishable from the karoo above the great escarpment . the narrow coastal strip between the most seaward cape fold mountain range ( i.e . , the langebergouteniqua mountain ) and the ocean ha a moderately high year-round rainfall , especially in the george , western cape-knysna-plettenberg bay region , which is known a the garden route . it is famous for the most extensive area of indigenous forest in south africa ( a generally forest-poor country ) . </s> in the south-west corner of the country , the cape peninsula form the southernmost tip of the coastal strip which border the atlantic ocean and ultimately terminates at the country 's border with namibia at the orange river . the cape peninsula ha a mediterranean climate , making it and it immediate surround the only portion of sub-saharan africa which receives most of it rainfall in winter . the greater city of cape town is situated on the cape peninsula and is home to 3.7million people according to the 2011 population census . it is the country 's legislative capital . </s> the coastal belt to the north of the cape peninsula is bounded on the west by the atlantic ocean and the first row of northsouth running cape fold mountain to the east . the cape fold mountain peter out at about the 32s line of latitude , after which the coastal plain is bounded by the great escarpment itself . the most southerly portion of this coastal belt is known a the swartland and malmesbury plain , which is an important wheat growing region , relying on winter rain . the region further north is known a namaqualand , which becomes more and more arid a one approach the orange river . the little rain that fall tends to fall in winter , which result in one of the world 's most spectacular display of flower carpeting huge stretch of veld in spring ( augustseptember ) . </s> south africa also ha one possession , the small subantarctic sub-antarctic archipelago of the prince edward island , consisting of marion island ( ) and prince edward island ( ) ( not to be confused with the prince edward island ) . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> south africa ha a generally temperate climate because it is surrounded by the atlantic and indian ocean on three side , because it is located in the climatically milder southern hemisphere , and because it average elevation rise steadily toward the north ( toward the equator ) and further inland . this varied topography and oceanic influence result in a great variety of climatic zone . the climatic zone range from the extreme desert of the southern namib desert in the farthest northwest to the lush subtropical climate in the east along the border with mozambique and the indian ocean . winter in south africa occur between june and august . </s> the extreme southwest ha a climate remarkably similar to that of the mediterranean sea with wet winter and hot , dry summer , hosting the famous fynbos biome of shrubland and albany thicket . this area also produce much of the wine in south africa . this region is also particularly known for it wind , which blow intermittently almost all year . the severity of this wind made passing around the cape of good hope particularly treacherous for sailor , causing many shipwreck . further east on the south coast , rainfall is distributed more evenly throughout the year , producing a green landscape . this area is popularly known a the garden route . </s> the free state is particularly flat because it lie centrally on the high plateau . north of the vaal river , the highveld becomes better watered and doe not experience subtropical extreme of heat . johannesburg , in the centre of the highveld , is at above sea level and receives an annual rainfall of . winter in this region are cold , although snow is rare . </s> the high drakensberg mountain , which form the south-eastern escarpment of the highveld , offer limited skiing opportunity in winter . the coldest place on mainland south africa is buffelsfontein in the eastern cape , where a temperature of wa recorded in 2013 . the prince edward island have colder average annual temperature , but buffelsfontein ha colder extreme . the deep interior of mainland south africa ha the hottest temperature : a temperature of wa recorded in 1948 in the northern cape kalahari near upington , northern cape , but this temperature is unofficial and wa not recorded with standard equipment , the official highest temperature is at vioolsdrif in january 1993. </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> south africa signed the rio convention on biological diversity on 4 june 1994 , and became a party to the convention on 2 november 1995 . it ha subsequently produced a biodiversity action plan , which wa received by the convention on 7 june 2006 . the country is ranked sixth out of the world 's seventeen megadiverse country . ecotourism in south africa ha become more prevalent in recent year , a a possible method of maintaining and improving biodiversity . </s> <section_title_start> animal <section_title_end> </s> numerous mammal are found in the bushveld including lion , african leopard , south african cheetah , southern white rhino , blue wildebeest , kudu , impala , [ hippopotamus ] e and [ [ south african giraffe . a significant extent of the bushveld exists in the north-east including kruger national park and the sabi sand game reserve , a well a in the far north in the waterberg biosphere . south africa house many endemic specie , among them the critically endangered riverine rabbit ( bunolagus monticullaris ) in the karoo . </s> <section_title_start> fungi <section_title_end> </s> up to 1945 , more than 4900 specie of fungus ( including lichen # fungi lichen-forming specie ) had been recorded . in 2006 , the number of fungi in south africa wa estimated at about 200,000 specie , but did not take into account fungi associated with insect . if correct , then the number of south african fungi dwarf that of it plant . in at least some major south african ecosystem , an exceptionally high percentage of fungi are highly specific in term of the plant with which they occur . the country 's biodiversity strategy and action plan doe not mention fungi ( including lichen-forming fungi ) . </s> <section_title_start> plant <section_title_end> </s> with more than 22,000 different [ plant ] , or about 9 % of all the known specie of plant on earth , south africa is particularly rich in plant diversity . the most prevalent biome in south africa is the grassland , particularly on the highveld , where the plant cover is dominated by different poaceae , low shrub , and acacia tree , mainly camelthorn tree camel-thorn ( vachellia erioloba ) . vegetation becomes even more sparse towards the northwest due to low precipitation ( meteorology ) . there are several specie of water-storing succulent plant , like aloe and euphorbia , in the very hot and dry namaqualand area . the grass and thorn savannah turn slowly into a bush savannah towards the north-east of the country , with denser growth . there are significant number of baobab tree in this area , near the northern end of kruger national park . </s> the fynbos biome , which make up the majority of the area and plant life in the cape floristic region , one of the six floral kingdom , is located in a small region of the western cape and contains more than 9,000 of those specie , making it among the richest region on earth in term of plant diversity . most of the plant are evergreen hard-leaf plant with fine , needle-like leaf , such a the sclerophyllous plant . another uniquely south african flowering plant group is the genus protea . there are around 130 different specie of protea in south africa . </s> while south africa ha a great wealth of flowering plant , only one percent of south africa is forest , almost exclusively in the humid kwazulu-cape coastal forest mosaic coastal plain of kwazulu-natal , where there are also area of southern africa mangrove in river mouth . there are even smaller reserve of forest that are out of the reach of fire , known a knysna-amatole montane forest . plantation of imported tree specie are predominant , particularly the non-native eucalyptus and pine . </s> <section_title_start> conservation issue <section_title_end> </s> south africa ha lost a large area of natural habitat in the last four decade , primarily due to overpopulation , sprawling development pattern and deforestation during the 19th century . the country had a 2019 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 4.94/10 , ranking it 112th globally out of 172 country . south africa is one of the worst affected country in the world when it come to invasion by alien specie with many ( e.g . , acacia mearnsii , acacia saligna , hakea , lantana and jacaranda ) posing a significant threat to the native biodiversity and the already scarce water resource . the original temperate broadleaf and mixed forest found by the first european settler wa exploited ruthlessly until only small patch remained . currently , south african [ tree like real yellowwood ] ( podocarpus latifolius ) , [ [ ocotea bullata ( ocotea bullata ) , and south african olea laurifolia ( olea laurifolia ) are under government protection . statistic from the south african department of environmental affair show a record 1,215 rhino have been killed in 2014. </s> climate change is expected to bring considerable warming and drying to much of this already semi-arid region , with greater frequency and intensity of extreme weather event such a [ wave ] s , flooding and drought . according to computer-generated climate modelling produced by the south african national biodiversity institute , part of southern africa will see an increase in temperature by about along the coast to more than in the already hot [ such a the northern cape in late spring and summertime by 2050 . the cape floral region ] , being identified a one of the global [ [ biodiversity hotspot , will be hit very hard by climate change . drought , increased intensity and frequency of fire , and climbing temperature are expected to push many rare specie towards extinction . south africa ha published two national climate change report in 2011 and 2016. </s> <section_title_start> politics and government <section_title_end> </s> south africa is a parliamentary republic , although unlike most such republic the president of south africa is both [ of state ] and [ of government ] , and depends for his tenure on the confidence and supply of parliament of south africa . the executive , legislature and judiciary are all subject to the supremacy of the constitution of south africa , and the court of south africa have the power to strike down executive action and act of parliament if they are unconstitutional . </s> the national assembly of south africa , the lower house of parliament , consists of 400 member and is elected every five year by a system of party-list proportional representation . the national council of province , the upper house , consists of ninety member , with each of the nine provincial legislature ( south africa ) electing ten member . </s> after each parliamentary election , the national assembly elect one of it member a president ; hence the president serf a term of office the same a that of the assembly , normally five year . no president may serve more than two term in office . the president appoints a deputy president of south africa and minister ( government ) , who form the cabinet of south africa which consists of departmentalization . the president and the cabinet may be removed by the national assembly by a motion of no confidence . </s> in the 2019 south african general election , held on 8 may 2019 , the anc won 57.5 % of the vote and 230 seat , while the main opposition , the democratic alliance ( south africa ) ( da ) won 20.77 % of the vote and 84 seat . the economic freedom fighter ( eff ) , founded by julius malema , former president of the anc 's youth wing ( anc youth league ) who wa later expelled from the anc , won 10.79 % of the vote and 44 seat . the anc ha been the governing political party in south africa since the end of apartheid . </s> south africa ha no legally defined capital city . the fourth chapter of the constitution of south africa , state that `` the seat of parliament is cape town , but an act of parliament enacted in accordance with section 76 ( 1 ) and ( 5 ) may determine that the seat of parliament is elsewhere . `` the country 's three branch of government are split over different city . cape town , a the seat of parliament , is the legislative capital ; pretoria , a the seat of the president and cabinet , is the administrative capital ; and bloemfontein , a the seat of the supreme court of appeal of south africa , is the judicial capital , while the constitutional court of south africa sits in johannesburg . most foreign embassy are located in pretoria . </s> since 2004 , south africa ha had many thousand of popular protest , some violent , making it , according to one academic , the `` most protest-rich country in the world `` . there have been a number of incident of political repression in post-apartheid south africa a well a threat of future repression in violation of the constitution , leading some analyst and civil society organisation to conclude that there is or could be a new climate of political repression , or a decline in political tolerance . </s> in 2008 , south africa placed fifth out of 48 sub-saharan african country on the ibrahim index of african governance . south africa scored well in the category of rule of law , transparency ( social ) and corruption , and participation ( decision making ) and human right , but wa let down by it relatively poor performance in safety and security . in november 2006 , south africa became the first african country to legalise same-sex marriage . </s> <section_title_start> law <section_title_end> </s> the constitution of south africa is the supreme rule of law in the country . the primary source of south african law are roman-dutch law roman-dutch mercantile law and personal law with english common law , a import of dutch settlement and british colonialism . the first european based law in south africa wa brought by the dutch east india company and is called roman-dutch law . it wa imported before the codification ( law ) of european law into the napoleonic code and is comparable in many way to scot law . this wa followed in the 19th century by english law , both common law and statutory law . after unification in 1910 , south africa had it own parliament which passed law specific for south africa , building on those previously passed for the individual member colony . </s> the judicial system consists of the magistrate ' court of south africa magistrate ' court , which hear lesser criminal case and smaller civil case ; the high court of south africa , which ha division that serve a the court of general jurisdiction for specific area ; the supreme court of appeal of south africa , and the constitutional court of south africa , which is the highest court . </s> from april 2017 to march 2018 , on average 57 murder were committed each day in south africa . in the year ended march 2017 , there were 20,336 murder and the murder rate wa 35.9 per 100,000 over five time higher than the global average of 6.2 per 100,000 . middle-class south african seek security in gated community . the private security industry in south africa is the largest in the world , with nearly 9,000 registered company and 400,000 registered active private security guard , more than the south african police and army combined . many emigrant from south africa also state that crime wa a major factor in their decision to leave . south african farmer murder ha continued to be a major problem . in an attempt to reduce crime rate , the police arrested over 500 undocumented foreigner in a raid in august 2019. </s> south africa ha a high rape rate , with 43,195 rape reported in 2014/15 , and an unknown number of sexual assault going unreported . a 2009 survey of 1,738 men in kwazulu-natal and the eastern cape by the medical research council found one in four men admitted to raping someone and another survey of 4,000 woman in johannesburg by ciet africa found one in three said they had been raped in the past year . rape occurs most commonly in relationship but many men and woman say that rape can not occur in relationship ; however , one in four woman reported having been abused by an intimate partner . rape are also perpetrated by child ( some a young a ten ) . the incidence of child sexual abuse is among the highest in the world , largely a a result of the virgin cleansing myth , and a number of high-profile case ( sometimes a young a eight month ) have outraged the nation . </s> between 1994 and 2018 , there were more than 500 xenophobic xenophobia in south africa in south africa . the 2019 johannesburg riot were similar in nature and origin to the xenophobia in south africa # may 2008 riot that also occurred in johannesburg . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> a the union of south africa , the country wa a founding member of the un . the then prime minister jan smut wrote the preamble to the united nation charter . south africa is one of the founding member of the african union ( au ) , and ha the list of african country by gdp ( nominal ) . it is also a founding member of the au 's new partnership for africa 's development ( nepad ) . </s> south africa ha played a key role a a mediator in african conflict over the last decade , such a in burundi , the democratic republic of congo ( drc ) , the comoros , and zimbabwe . after apartheid ended , south africa wa readmitted to the commonwealth of nation . the country is a member of the group of 77 and chaired the organisation in 2006 . south africa is also a member of the southern african development community ( sadc ) , south atlantic peace and cooperation zone , southern african custom union ( sacu ) , antarctic treaty system ( at ) , world trade organization ( wto ) , international monetary fund ( imf ) , g20 industrial nation , g8+5 , and the port management association of eastern and southern africa . </s> former south african president jacob zuma and former chinese president hu jintao upgraded bilateral tie between the two country on 24 august 2010 , when they signed the beijing agreement , which elevated south africa 's earlier `` strategic partnership `` with china to the higher level of `` comprehensive strategic partnership `` in both economic and political affair , including the strengthening of exchange between their respective ruling party and legislature . in april 2011 , south africa formally joined the brazil-russia-india-china ( brics ) grouping of country , identified by zuma a the country 's largest trading partner , and also the largest trading partner with africa a a whole . zuma asserted that brics member country would also work with each other through the un , the group of twenty ( g20 ) and the india , brazil south africa ( ibsa dialogue forum ) forum . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the south african national defence force ( sandf ) wa created in 1994 , a an volunteer military all-volunteer military composed of the former south african defence force , the force of the african nationalist group ( umkhonto we sizwe and azanian people 's liberation army ) , and the former bantustan defence force . the sandf is subdivided into four branch , the south african army , the south african air force , the south african navy , and the south african military health service . in recent year , the sandf ha become a major peacekeeping force in africa , and ha been involved in operation in lesotho , the drc , and burundi , amongst others . it ha also served in multinational un peacekeeping force such a the united nation force intervention brigade for example . </s> south africa is the only african country to have successfully developed nuclear weapon and south africa . it became the first country ( followed by ukraine ) with nuclear capability to voluntarily renounce and dismantle it programme and in the process signed the nuclear non-proliferation treaty in 1991 . south africa undertook a south african nuclear program in the 1970s according to former state president fw de klerk , the decision to build a `` nuclear deterrent `` wa taken `` a early a 1974 against a backdrop of a soviet expansionist threat . `` south africa is vela incident a nuclear test over the atlantic in 1979 , although this is officially denied . former president , fw de klerk , maintained that south africa had `` never conducted a clandestine nuclear test . `` six nuclear device were completed between 1980 and 1990 , but all were dismantled before south africa signed the nuclear non-proliferation treaty in 1991 . in 2017 , south africa signed the un treaty on the treaty on the prohibition of nuclear weapon . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> each of the nine province is governed by a unicameralism provincial legislature ( south africa ) , which is elected every five year by party-list proportional representation . the legislature elect a premier ( south africa ) a head of government , and the premier appoints an executive council ( south africa ) a a provincial cabinet . the power of provincial government are limited to topic listed in the constitution of south africa ; these topic include such field a health , education , public housing and transport . </s> the province are in turn divided into 52 district of south africa : 8 metropolitan municipality ( south africa ) and 44 district municipality ( south africa ) . the district municipality are further subdivided into 205 local municipality ( south africa ) . the metropolitan municipality , which govern the largest urban agglomeration , perform the function of both district and local municipality . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> south africa ha a mixed economy , the second largest in africa after nigeria . it also ha a relatively high gross domestic product ( gdp ) per caput compared to other country in sub-saharan africa ( u $ 11,750 at purchasing power parity a of 2012 ) . despite this , south africa is still burdened by a relatively high rate of poverty and unemployment , and is also ranked in the top ten country in the world for income inequality , measured by the gini coefficient . in 2015 , 71 percent of net wealth are held by 10 percent richest of the population , whereas 60 percent of the poorest held only 7 percent of the net wealth and the gini coefficient wa 0.63 , whereas in 1996 wa 0.61. </s> unlike most of the world 's poor country , south africa doe not have a thriving informal economy . only 15 % of south african job are in the informal sector , compared with around half in economy of brazil and economy of india and nearly three-quarters in economy of indonesia . the oecd organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) attribute this difference to south africa 's widespread welfare system . world bank research show that south africa ha one of the widest gap between per caput gdp versus it human development index ( hdi ) ranking , with only botswana showing a larger gap . </s> after 1994 , government policy brought down inflation , stabilised public finance , and some foreign capital wa attracted , however growth wa still subpar . from 2004 onward , economic growth picked up significantly ; both employment and capital formation increased . during the presidency of jacob zuma , the government increased the role of state-owned enterprise ( soes ) . some of the biggest soes are eskom , the electric power monopoly , south african airway ( saa ) , and transnet , the railroad and port monopoly . some of these soes have not been profitable , such a saa , which ha required bailouts totaling r30 ; billion ( $ billion ) over 20 year . </s> principal international trading partner of south africabesides other african countriesinclude germany , the united state , china , japan , the united kingdom and spain . </s> the agriculture in south africa contributes around 10 % of formal employment , relatively low compared to other part of africa , a well a providing work for casual labourer and contributing around 2.6 % of gdp for the nation . due to the aridity of the land , only 13.5 % can be used for crop production , and only 3 % is considered high potential land . </s> in august 2013 , south africa wa ranked a the top african country of the future by fdi magazine based on the country 's economic potential , labour environment , cost-effectiveness , infrastructure , business friendliness , and foreign direct investment strategy . </s> the financial secrecy index ( fdi ) rank south africa a the 50th safest tax haven in the world . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> south africa is a popular tourist destination , and a substantial amount of revenue come from tourism . </s> <section_title_start> labour market <section_title_end> </s> during 19952003 , the number of formal job decreased and informal job increased ; overall unemployment worsened . </s> the government 's black economic empowerment ( bee ) policy have drawn criticism from neva makgetla , lead economist for research and information at the development bank of southern africa , for focusing `` almost exclusively on promoting individual ownership by black people [ which ] doe little to address broader economic disparity , though the rich may become more diverse . `` official affirmative action policy have seen a rise in black economic wealth and an emerging black middle class . other problem include state ownership and state intervention , which impose high barrier to entry in many area . restrictive labour regulation have contributed to the unemployment malaise . </s> along with many african nation , south africa ha been experiencing a `` brain drain `` in the past 20 year . and is almost certainly detrimental for the wellbeing of those reliant on the healthcare infrastructure . the skill drain in south africa tends to demonstrate racial contour given the skill distribution legacy of south africa and ha thus resulted in large white south african community abroad . however , the statistic which purport to show a brain drain are disputed and also do not account for repatriation and expiry of foreign work contract . according to several survey , there ha been a reverse in brain drain following the global financial crisis of 20082009 and expiration of foreign work contract . in the first quarter of 2011 , confidence level for graduate professional were recorded at a level of 84 % in a professional provident society ( pps ) survey . illegal immigrant are involved in informal trading . many immigrant to south africa continue to live in poor condition , and the immigration policy ha become increasingly restrictive since the year 1994. </s> the human right watch reported on 26 august 2019 about foreign national truck driver being subjected to deadly attack carried out by south african truck driver . the organization urged the south african government to take immediate action ensuring the safety of the foreign national truck driver putting up with violence , harassment , intimidation , stoning , bombing , and shooting , by local truck driver in the country . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> several important scientific and technological development have originated in south africa . the first human-to-human heart transplantation wa performed by cardiac surgeon christiaan barnard at groote schuur hospital in december 1967 , max theiler developed a yellow fever vaccine against yellow fever , allan mcleod cormack pioneered x-ray computed tomography ( ct scan ) , and aaron klug developed crystallographic electron microscopy technique . with the exception of that of barnard , all of these advancement were recognised with nobel prize . sydney brenner won most recently , in 2002 , for his pioneering work in molecular biology . </s> mark shuttleworth founded an early internet security company thawte , that wa subsequently bought out by world-leader verisign . despite government effort to encourage entrepreneurship in biotechnology , information technology and other high technology field , no other notable groundbreaking company have been founded in south africa . it is the expressed objective of the government to transition the economy to be more reliant on high technology , based on the realisation that south africa can not compete with far eastern economy in manufacturing , nor can the republic rely on it mineral wealth in perpetuity . </s> south africa ha cultivated a burgeoning astronomy community . it host the southern african large telescope , the largest optical telescope in the southern hemisphere . south africa is currently building the karoo array telescope a a pathfinder for the 1.5 ; billion square kilometre array project . on 25 may 2012 , it wa announced that hosting of the square kilometer array telescope will be split over both the south african and the australia and new zealand site . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> two distinctive feature of the south african water sector are the policy of free basic water and the existence of water board ( south africa ) , which are bulk water supply agency that operate pipeline and sell water from reservoir to municipality . these feature have led to significant problem concerning the financial sustainability of service provider , leading to a lack of attention to maintenance . following the end of apartheid , the country had made improvement in the level of access to water a those with access increased from 66 % to 79 % from 1990 to 2010 . sanitation access increased from 71 % to 79 % during the same period . however , water supply and sanitation in south africa ha come under increasing pressure in recent year despite a commitment made by the government to improve service standard and provide investment subsidy to the water industry . </s> the eastern part of south africa suffer from periodic drought linked to the el nio weather phenomenon . in early 2018 , cape town , which ha different weather pattern to the rest of the country , faced a water crisis a the city 's water supply wa predicted to run dry before the end of june . water-saving measure were in effect that required each citizen to use le than a day . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> different method of transport in south africa include road , railway , airport , water , and pipeline for petroleum oil . the majority of people in south africa use informal share taxi a their main mode of transport . bus rapid transit ha been implemented in some south african city in an attempt to provide more formalised and safer public transport service . these system have been widely criticised due to their large capital and operating cost . a `` freeway `` is different from most country a certain thing are forbidden which include certain motorcycle , no hand signal , and motor tricycle . south africa ha many major port including cape town , durban , and port elizabeth that allow ship and other boat to pas through , some carrying passenger and some carrying oil tanker . </s> <section_title_start> demographics <section_title_end> </s> south africa is a nation of about 55 million ( 2016 ) people of diverse origin , culture , language , and religion . the last south african national census of 2011 wa held in 2011 , with a more recent intercensal national survey conducted in 2016 . south africa is home to an estimated five ; million illegal immigrant , including some three ; million zimbabwean . a series of 2008 south africa riot anti-immigrant riot occurred in south africa beginning on 11 may 2008. </s> statistic south africa asks people to describe themselves in the census in term of five race ( classification of human being ) population group . the 2011 census figure for these group were : bantu people in south africa at 79.2 % , white south african at 8.9 % , cape coloureds at 8.9 % , asian south african at 2.5 % , and other/unspecified at 0.5 % . the first census in south africa in 1911 showed that white made up 22 % of the population ; this had declined to 16 % by 1980. </s> south africa host a sizeable refugee and asylum seeker population . according to the world refugee survey 2008 , published by the u committee for refugee and immigrant , this population numbered approximately 144,700 in 2007 . group of refugee and asylum seeker numbering over 10,000 included people from zimbabwe ( 48,400 ) , the drc ( 24,800 ) , and somalia ( 12,900 ) . these population mainly lived in johannesburg , pretoria , durban , cape town , and port elizabeth . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> south africa ha 11 official language : zulu language , xhosa language , afrikaans , south african english , northern sotho , tswana language , sotho language , tsonga language , swazi language , venda language , and southern ndebele language ( in order of first language speaker ) . in this regard it is fourth only to bolivia , official language of india , and zimbabwe in number . while all the language are formally equal , some language are spoken more than others . according to the 2011 census , the three most spoken first language are zulu ( 22.7 % ) , xhosa ( 16.0 % ) , and afrikaans ( 13.5 % ) . although english is recognised a the language of commerce and science , it is only the fourth most common home language , that of only 9.6 % of south african in 2011 ; nevertheless , it ha become the de facto lingua franca of the nation . estimate based on the 1991 census suggest just under half of south african can speak english . it is the second most commonly spoken language outside of the household , after zulu . </s> the country also recognises several unofficial language , including fanagalo language , khoe language , lobedu language , nama language , northern ndebele language , phuthi language , and south african sign language . these unofficial language may be used in certain official us in limited area where it ha been determined that these language are prevalent . </s> many of the unofficial khoisan language people contain regional dialect stretching northward into namibia and botswana , and elsewhere . these people , who are a physically distinct population from other african , have their own cultural identity based on their [ society . they have been marginalised to a great extent , and the remainder of their language are in danger of becoming extinct language extinct ] . </s> white south african may also speak [ [ european language , including italian language , portuguese language ( also spoken by black angolan and mozambique ) , dutch language , german language , and greek language , while some indian south african speak language of india , such a gujarati language , hindi language , tamil language , telugu language , and urdu language . french language is spoken in south africa by migrant from francophone africa . </s> <section_title_start> urban centre <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> according to the 2001 census , christian accounted for 79.8 % of the population , with a majority of them being member of various protestant christian denomination ( broadly defined to include syncretism african initiated church ) and a minority of roman catholic and other christian . christian category includes zion christian church ( 11.1 % ) , pentecostalism ( charismatic movement ) ( 8.2 % ) , roman catholicism in south africa ( 7.1 % ) , methodist church of southern africa ( 6.8 % ) , nederduits gereformeerde kerk ( nederduits gereformeerde kerk ; 6.7 % ) , and anglican church of southern africa ( 3.8 % ) . member of remaining christian church accounted for another 36 % of the population . islam in south africa accounted for 1.5 % of the population , hinduism in south africa 1.2 % , traditional african religion 0.3 % and judaism 0.2 % . 15.1 % had no religious affiliation , 0.6 % were `` other `` and 1.4 % were `` unspecified . `` </s> african initiated church formed the largest of the christian group . it wa believed that many of the person who claimed no affiliation with any organised religion adhered to traditional african religion . there are an estimated 200,000 traditional healer of south africa in south africa , and up to 60 % of south african consult these healer , generally called sangoma or inyangas . these healer use a combination of veneration of the dead and a belief in the spiritual and medicinal property of local fauna and flora , commonly known a traditional african medicine , to facilitate healing in client . many people have syncretic religious practice combining christian and indigenous influence . </s> south african muslim comprise mainly of those who are described a coloureds and those who are described a indian south african . they have been joined by black or white south african religious conversion a well a others from other part of africa . south african muslim claim that their faith is the fastest-growing religion of conversion in the country , with the number of black muslim growing sixfold , from 12,000 in 1991 to 74,700 in 2004. </s> south africa is also home to a substantial history of the jew in south africa , descended from history of the jew in europe who arrived a a minority among other european settler . this population peaked in the 1970s at 120,000 , though only around 67,000 remain today , the rest having emigrated , mostly to israel . even so , these number make the jewish community in south africa the twelfth largest in the world . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the adult literacy rate in 2007 wa 88.7 % . south africa ha a three-tier education three-tier system of education starting with primary school , followed by high school and tertiary education in the form of ( academic ) university and university of technology . learner have twelve year of formal schooling , from grade 1 to 12 . grade r , or grade 0 , is a pre-primary foundation year . primary school span the first seven year of schooling . high school education span a further five year . the national senior certificate ( nsc ) examination take place at the end of grade 12 and is necessary for tertiary study at a list of university in south africa . </s> public university in south africa are divided into three type : traditional university , which offer theoretically oriented university degree ; university of technology ( formerly called `` technikons `` ) , which offer vocational oriented diploma and degree ; and comprehensive university , which offer both type of qualification . there are 23 public university in south africa : 11 traditional university , 6 university of technology and 6 comprehensive university . </s> under apartheid , school for black people were subject to discrimination through inadequate funding and a separate syllabus called bantu education act which wa only designed to give them sufficient skill to work a labourer . </s> in 2004 , south africa started reforming it tertiary education system , merging and incorporating small university into larger institution , and renaming all tertiary education institution `` university `` . by 2015 , 1.4 ; million student in higher education have benefited from a financial aid scheme which wa promulgated in 1999. </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> according to the south african institute of race relation , the life expectancy in 2009 wa 71 year for a white south african and 48 year for a black south african . the healthcare spending in the country is about 9 % of gdp . </s> about 84 % of the population depends on the public healthcare system , which is beset with chronic human resource shortage and limited resource . </s> about 20 % of the population us private healthcare . only 16 % of the population is covered by [ insurance medical aid scheme ] . the rest pay for private care `` out-of-pocket expense `` or through in-hospital-only plan . the three dominant hospital group , mediclinic international , life healthcare group and netcare , together control 75 % of the private hospital market . </s> <section_title_start> hiv/aids <section_title_end> </s> according to the 2015 unaids report , south africa ha an estimated seven million people living with hiv ; more than any other country in the world . in 2018 , hiv prevalencethe percentage of people living with hivamong adult ( 1549 year ) wa 20.4 % and in the same year 71000 people died from an aids-related illness . </s> a 2008 study revealed that hiv/aids infection in south africa is distinctly divided along racial line : 13.6 % of black are hiv-positive , whereas only 0.3 % of white have the disease . most death are experienced by economically active individual , resulting in many aid orphan who in many case depend on the state for care and financial support . it is estimated that there are 1,200,000 orphan in south africa . </s> the link between hiv , a virus spread primarily by sexual contact , and aid wa long aid denial by former president thabo mbeki and his health minister manto tshabalala-msimang , who insisted that the many death in the country are due to malnutrition in south africa , and hence poverty , and not hiv . in 2007 , in response to international pressure , the government made effort to fight aid . </s> after the south african general election , 2009 , former president jacob zuma appointed aaron motsoaledi a the new health minister and committed his government to increasing funding for and widening the scope of hiv treatment , and by 2015 , south africa had made significant progress , with the widespread availability of anti-retroviral drug resulted in an increase in life expectancy from 52.1 year to 62.5 year . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the south african black majority still ha a substantial number of rural inhabitant who lead largely impoverished life . it is among these people that cultural tradition survive most strongly ; a black have become increasingly urbanised and western world , aspect of traditional culture have declined . member of the middle class , who are predominantly white but whose rank include growing number of black , coloured and indian people , have lifestyle similar in many respect to that of people found in western europe , north america and australasia . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> south african art includes the oldest art object in the world , which were discovered in a south african cave , and dated from 75,000 year ago . </s> the scattered tribe of khoisan people moving into south africa from around 10,000 bc had their own fluent art style seen today in a multitude of cave painting . they were superseded by bantu peoples/nguni people with their own vocabulary of art form . new form of art evolved in the mine and township : a dynamic art using everything from plastic strip to bicycle spoke . the dutch-influenced folk art of the afrikaner trekboer and the urban white artist , earnestly following changing european tradition from the 1850s onwards , also contributed to this eclectic mix which continues to evolve today . </s> south african literature emerged from a unique social and political history . one of the first well known novel written by a black author in an african language wa sol plaatje 's mhudi , written in 1930 . during the 1950s , drum ( south african magazine ) magazine became a hotbed of political satire , fiction , and essay , giving a voice to urban black culture . </s> notable white south african author include alan paton , who published the novel cry , the beloved country in 1948 . nadine gordimer became the first south african to be awarded the nobel prize for literature , in 1991 . j. m. coetzee won the nobel prize for literature , in 2003 . when awarding the prize , the swedish academy stated that coetzee `` in innumerable guise portrays the surprising involvement of the outsider . `` </s> the play of athol fugard have been regularly premiered in fringe theatre in south africa , london ( royal court theatre ) and new york . olive schreiner 's the story of an african farm ( 1883 ) wa a revelation in victorian literature : it is heralded by many a introducing feminism into the novel form . </s> breyten breytenbach wa jailed for his involvement with the guerrilla movement against apartheid . andr brink wa the first afrikaner writer to be banned book by the government after he released the novel a dry white season ( novel ) . </s> <section_title_start> popular culture <section_title_end> </s> the medium of south africa sector is large , and south africa is one of africa 's major medium centre . while south africa 's many broadcaster and publication reflect the diversity of the population a a whole , the most commonly used language is english . however , all ten other official language are represented to some extent or another . </s> there is great diversity in music of south africa . black musician have developed a unique style called kwaito , that is said to have taken over radio , television , and magazine . of note is brenda fassie , who launched to fame with her song `` weekend special `` , which wa sung in english . more famous traditional musician include ladysmith black mambazo , while the soweto string quartet performs classic music with an african flavour . south africa ha produced world-famous jazz musician , notably hugh masekela , jonas gwangwa , abdullah ibrahim , miriam makeba , jonathan butler , chris mcgregor , and sathima bea benjamin . afrikaans music cover multiple genre , such a the contemporary music steve hofmeyr , the punk rock band fokofpolisiekar , and the singer-songwriter jeremy loop . south african popular musician that have found international success include johnny clegg , rap-rave duo die antwoord , and rock band seether . </s> although few cinema of south africa production are known outside south africa itself , many foreign film have been produced about south africa . arguably , the most high-profile film portraying south africa in recent year wa district 9 . other notable exception are the film tsotsi , which won the academy award for foreign language film at the 78th academy award in 2006 , a well a u-carmen e-khayelitsha , which won the golden bear at the 2005 berlin international film festival . in 2015 , the oliver hermanus film the endless river ( film ) became the first south african film selected for the venice film festival . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> south african cuisine is diverse ; food from many culture are enjoyed by all and especially marketed to tourist who wish to sample the large variety available . </s> south african cuisine is heavily meat-based and ha spawned the distinctively south african social gathering known a the braai , a variation of the barbecue . south africa ha also developed into a major wine producer , with some of the best vineyard lying in valley around stellenbosch , franschhoek , paarl and barrydale . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> south africa 's most popular sport are association football , rugby union and cricket . other sport with significant support are swimming , athletics , golf , boxing , tennis , ringball , and netball . although football ( soccer ) command the greatest following among the youth , other sport like basketball , surfing and skateboarding are increasingly popular . </s> association football is the most popular sport in south africa . footballer who have played for major foreign club include steven pienaar , lucas radebe and philemon masinga , benni mccarthy , aaron mokoena , and delron buckley . south africa hosted the 2010 fifa world cup , and fifa president sepp blatter awarded south africa a grade 9 out of 10 for successfully hosting the event . </s> famous boxing personality include baby jake jacob matlala , vuyani bungu , welcome ncita , dingaan thobela , gerrie coetzee and brian mitchell ( boxer ) . durban surfer jordy smith won the 2010 billabong j-bay open making him the highest ranked surfer in the world . south africa produced formula one motor racing 's 1979 world champion jody scheckter . famous current cricket player include kagiso rabada , ab de villiers , hashim amla , dale steyn , vernon philander , and faf du plessis ; most also participate in the indian premier league . </s> south africa ha also produced numerous world class rugby player , including francois pienaar , joost van der westhuizen , danie craven , frik du preez , naas botha , and bryan habana . south africa ha won the rugby world cup three time , tying new zealand for the most rugby world cup win . south africa first won the 1995 rugby world cup , which it hosted . they went on to win the tournament again in 2007 and in 2019 . it followed the 1995 rugby world cup by hosting the 1996 african cup of nation , with the national team , south africa national football team , going on to win the tournament . it also hosted the 2003 cricket world cup , the icc world twenty20 . south africa 's national cricket team , the south africa national cricket team , ha also won the inaugural edition of the 1998 icc knockout trophy by defeating west indie national cricket team in the final . south africa national blind cricket team south africa 's national blind cricket team also went on to win the inaugural edition of the blind cricket world cup in 1998. </s> in 2004 , the swimming team of roland schoeman , lyndon fern , darian townsend and ryk neethling won the gold medal at the olympic game in athens , simultaneously breaking the world record in the 4100 freestyle relay . penny heyns won olympic gold in the 1996 atlanta olympic game . in 2012 , oscar pistorius became the first double amputee sprinter to compete at the olympic game in london . in golf , gary player is generally regarded a one of the greatest golfer of all time , having won the grand slam ( golf ) , one of five golfer to have done so . other south african golfer to have won major tournament include bobby locke , ernie el , retief goosen , tim clark ( golfer ) , trevor immelman , louis oosthuizen and charl schwartzel . </s> <section_title_start> see also category : state and territory established in 1910 </s> category : hindi-speaking country and territory <article_end> <article_start> </s> hungary ( magyarorszg ) is a country in central europe . spanning in the pannonian basin , it border slovakia to the north , ukraine to the northeast , romania to the east and southeast , serbia to the south , croatia and slovenia to the southwest , and austria to the west . with about 10 ; million inhabitant , hungary is a member state of the european union medium-sized member state of the european union . the language of hungary is hungarian
