united nation </s> category : republic </s> category : state and territory established in 1000 </s> category : state and territory established in 1920 </s> category : state and territory established in the 890s </s> category : christian state <article_end> <article_start> </s> new zealand ( aotearoa ) is an island country in the southwestern pacific ocean . it consists of two main landmassesthe north island ( te ika-a-mui ) and the south island ( te waipounamu ) and more than 700 list of island of new zealand , covering a total area of . new zealand is about east of australia across the tasman sea and south of the island of new caledonia , fiji , and tonga . the country 's varied topography and sharp mountain peak , including the southern alp , owe much to tectonic uplift and volcanic eruption . new zealand 's capital of new zealand is wellington , and it most populous city is auckland . </s> owing to their remoteness , the island of new zealand were the last large habitable land to be settled by human . between about 1280 and 1350 , polynesian began to settle in the island and then developed a distinctive mori culture . in 1642 , the dutch explorer , abel tasman , became the first european to sight new zealand . in 1840 , representative of the united kingdom and mori people chief signed the treaty of waitangi , which declared british sovereignty over the island . in 1841 , new zealand colony of new zealand within the british empire , and in 1907 it dominion of new zealand ; it gained independence of new zealand in 1947 , and the british monarch remained the [ of state ] . today , the majority of new zealand 's population of 5 million is of european new zealander ; the indigenous mori are the largest minority , followed by asian new zealander and pacific islander . reflecting this , new zealand 's culture is mainly derived from mori and early british settler , with recent broadening arising from increased immigration to new zealand . the language of new zealand are english language , mori language , and new zealand sign language , with english being very dominant . </s> a developed country , new zealand rank highly in international comparison , particularly in education , protection of civil liberty , government transparency , and economic freedom . it underwent rogernomics during the 1980s , which transformed it from a protectionist to a economic liberalization free-trade economy . the service sector dominates the economy of new zealand , followed by the industrial sector , and agriculture in new zealand ; international tourism in new zealand is a significant source of revenue . nationally , legislative authority is vested in an elected , unicameral new zealand parliament , while executive political power is exercised by the cabinet of new zealand , led by the prime minister of new zealand , currently jacinda ardern . queen elizabeth ii is the monarchy of new zealand country 's monarch and is represented by a governor-general of new zealand governor-general , currently dame patsy reddy . in addition , new zealand is organised into 11 region of new zealand and 67 territorial authority of new zealand for local government purpose . the realm of new zealand also includes tokelau ( a dependent territory ) ; the cook island and niue ( self-governing state in associated state with new zealand ) ; and the ross dependency , which is new zealand 's territorial claim in antarctica . </s> new zealand is a member of the united nation , commonwealth of nation , anzus , organisation for economic co-operation and development , asean # asean plus six , asia-pacific economic cooperation , the pacific community and the pacific island forum . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the first european visitor to new zealand , dutch explorer abel tasman , named the island staten land , believing they were part of the isla de los estados that jacob le maire had sighted off the southern end of south america . hendrik brouwer proved that the south american land wa a small island in 1643 , and dutch cartographer subsequently renamed tasman 's discovery nova zeelandia , from latin , after the seventeen province of zeeland . this name wa later anglicisation to `` new zealand `` . </s> this wa written a nu tireni in the mori language . in 1834 a document written in mori and entitled `` he wakaputanga o te rangatiratanga o nu tireni `` wa translated into english and became the declaration of the independence of new zealand . it wa prepared by te w ( h ) akaminenga o nga rangatiratanga o nga hapu o nu tireni , the united tribe of new zealand , and a copy wa sent to william iv of the united kingdom who had already acknowledged the flag of the united tribe of new zealand , and who recognised the declaration in a letter from charles grant , 1st baron glenelg . </s> aotearoa ( pronounced in mori and in english ; often translated a `` land of the long white cloud `` ) is the current mori name for new zealand . it is unknown whether mori had a name for the whole country before the arrival of european , with aotearoa originally referring to just the north island . mori had several traditional name for the two main island , including te ika-a-mui ( the fish of mui ( mori mythology ) ) for the north island and te waipounamu ( the water of pounamu ) or te waka o aoraki ( the canoe of aoraki ) for the south island . early european map labelled the island north ( north island ) , middle ( south island ) and south ( stewart island / rakiura ) . in 1830 , mapmakers began to use `` north `` and `` south `` on their map to distinguish the two largest island , and by 1907 this wa the accepted norm . the new zealand geographic board discovered in 2009 that the name of the north island and south island had never been formalised , and name and alternative name were formalised in 2013 . this set the name a north island or te ika-a-mui , and south island or te waipounamu . for each island , either it english or mori name can be used , or both can be used together . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> new zealand is one of the last major landmass settled by human . radiocarbon dating , evidence of deforestation and mitochondrial dna variability within mori people population suggest that eastern polynesian first settled the new zealand archipelago between 1250 and 1300 , although newer archaeology of new zealand and genetic research point to a date no earlier than about 1280 , with at least the main settlement period between about 1320 and 1350 , consistent with evidence based on whakapapa . this represented a culmination in a long series of voyage through the pacific island . over the century that followed , the polynesian settler developed a distinct culture now known a mori . the population formed different iwi ( tribe ) and [ ( subtribes ) which would sometimes cooperate , sometimes compete and sometimes fight against each other . at some point , a group of mori migrated to rkohu , now known a the chatham island ] , where they developed their distinct [ [ moriori culture . the moriori population wa all but wiped out between 1835 and 1862 , largely because of taranaki ( iwi ) mori invasion and enslavement in the 1830s , although european disease also contributed . in 1862 only 101 survived , and the last known full-blooded moriori died in 1933. </s> in a hostile 1642 encounter , four of dutch explorer abel tasman abel tasman 's crew member were killed , and at least one mori wa hit by canister shot . european did not revisit new zealand until 1769 when british explorer james cook mapped almost the entire coastline . following cook , new zealand wa visited by numerous european and north american history of whaling , seal hunting and trading ship . they traded european food , metal tool , weapon and other good for timber , mori food , artefact and water . the introduction of the potato and the musket transformed mori agriculture and warfare . potato provided a reliable food surplus , which enabled longer and more sustained military campaign . the resulting intertribal musket war encompassed over 600 battle between 1801 and 1840 , killing 30,00040,000 mori . from the early 19th century , christian missionary began to settle new zealand , eventually religious conversion most of the mori population . the mori population declined to around 40 % of it pre-contact level during the 19th century ; introduced disease were the major factor . </s> in 1788 captain arthur phillip assumed the position of governor of new south wale of the new british colony of colony of new south wale which according to his commission included new zealand . the british government appointed james busby a british resident to new zealand in 1832 following a petition from northern mori . in 1835 , following an announcement of impending french settlement by charles de thierry , the nebulous united tribe of new zealand sent a declaration of the independence of new zealand to king william iv of the united kingdom asking for protection . ongoing unrest , the proposed settlement of new zealand by the new zealand company ( which had already sent it first ship of surveyor to buy land from mori ) and the dubious legal standing of the declaration of independence prompted the colonial office to send captain william hobson to claim sovereignty for the united kingdom of great britain and ireland and negotiate a treaty with the mori . the treaty of waitangi wa first signed in the bay of island on 6 february 1840 . in response to the new zealand company 's attempt to establish an independent settlement in wellington and french settler purchasing land in akaroa , hobson declared british sovereignty over all of new zealand on 21 may 1840 , even though copy of the treaty were still circulating throughout the country for mori to sign . with the signing of the treaty and declaration of sovereignty , the number of immigrant , particularly from the united kingdom , began to increase . </s> new zealand , still part of the colony of new south wale , became a separate crown colony colony of new zealand on 1 july 1841 . armed conflict began between the colonial government and </s> mori in 1843 with the wairau affray over land and disagreement over sovereignty . these conflict , mainly in the north island , saw thousand of imperial troop and the royal navy come to new zealand and became known a the new zealand war . following these armed conflict , large amount of new zealand land confiscation to meet settler demand . </s> the colony gained a new zealand constitution act 1852 , and the 1st new zealand parliament met in 1854 . in 1856 the colony effectively became self-governing , gaining responsibility over all domestic matter ( except indigenous people policy , which wa granted in the mid-1860s ) . following concern that the south island might form a separate colony , premier alfred domett moved a resolution to transfer the capital of new zealand from auckland to a locality near cook strait . wellington wa chosen for it central location , with parliament officially sitting there for the first time in 1865. </s> in 1891 the new zealand liberal party came to power a the first organised political party . the liberal government of new zealand , led by richard seddon for most of it period in office , passed many important social and economic measure . in 1893 new zealand wa the first nation in the world to grant all woman 's suffrage in new zealand and in 1894 pioneered the industrial conciliation and arbitration act 1894 between employer and union . </s> in 1907 , at the request of the new zealand parliament , king edward vii proclaimed new zealand a dominion of new zealand within the british empire , reflecting it self-governing status . in 1947 the country statute of westminster adoption act 1947 the statute of westminster 1931 , confirming that the british parliament could no longer legislate for new zealand without the consent of new zealand . </s> early in the 20th century , new zealand wa involved in world affair , fighting in the military history of new zealand in world war i and military history of new zealand during world war ii and suffering through the great depression . the depression led to the election of the first labour government of new zealand and the establishment of a comprehensive welfare state and a protectionist economy . new zealand experienced increasing prosperity following the second world war , and mori began to leave their traditional rural life and move to the city in search of work . a mori protest movement developed , which criticised eurocentrism and worked for greater recognition of mori culture and of the treaty of waitangi . in 1975 , a waitangi tribunal wa set up to investigate alleged breach of the treaty , and it wa enabled to investigate historic grievance in 1985 . the government ha negotiated treaty of waitangi claim and settlement with many iwi , although new zealand foreshore and seabed controversy proved controversial in the 2000s . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> new zealand is a constitutional monarchy with a parliamentary democracy , although constitution of new zealand is uncodified constitution . elizabeth ii is the queen of new zealand and thus the [ of state ] . the queen is represented by the governor-general of new zealand governor-general , whom she appoints on the advice ( constitutional ) of the prime minister of new zealand . the governor-general can exercise the crown 's prerogative power , such a reviewing case of injustice and making appointment of minister of the new zealand government , ambassador , and other key public official , and in rare situation , the reserve power ( e.g . the power to dissolve parliament or refuse the royal assent of a bill ( law ) into law ) . the power of the monarch and the governor-general are limited by constitutional constraint , and they can not normally be exercised without the advice of minister . </s> the new zealand parliament hold legislative power and consists of the queen and the new zealand house of representative . it also included an upper house , the new zealand legislative council , until this wa abolished in 1950 . the supremacy of parliament over the crown and other government institution wa established in england by the bill of right 1689 and ha been ratified a law in new zealand . the house of representative is democratically elected , and a government is formed from the party or coalition government with the majority of seat . if no majority is formed , a minority government can be formed if support from other party during confidence and supply vote is assured . the governor-general appoints minister under advice from the prime minister , who is by constitutional convention ( political custom ) the parliamentary leader of the governing party or coalition . cabinet of new zealand , formed by minister and led by the prime minister , is the highest policy-making body in government and responsible for deciding significant government action . member of cabinet make major decision collectively and are therefore cabinet collective responsibility for the consequence of these decision . </s> a election in new zealand must be called no later than three year after the previous election . almost all general election between and were held under the first-past-the-post voting system . since the , a form of proportional representation called mixed-member proportional ( mmp ) ha been used . under the mmp system , each person ha two vote ; one is for a candidate standing in the voter 's new zealand electorate , and the other is for a party . since the , there have been 71 electorate ( which include seven mori electorate in which only mori can optionally vote ) , and the remaining 49 of the 120 seat are assigned so that representation in parliament reflects the party vote , with the threshold that a party must win at least one electorate or 5 % of the total party vote before it is eligible for a seat . </s> election since the 1930s have been dominated by two political party , new zealand national party and new zealand labour party . between march 2005 and august 2006 , new zealand became the first country in the world in which all the highest office in the landhead of state , governor-general , prime minister , speaker of the new zealand house of representative , and chief justice of new zealandwere occupied simultaneously by woman . the current prime minister is jacinda ardern , who ha been in office since 26 october 2017 . she is the country 's third female prime minister . </s> judiciary of new zealand new zealand 's judiciary , headed by the chief justice , includes the supreme court of new zealand , court of appeal of new zealand , the high court of new zealand , and subordinate court . judge and judicial officer are appointed non-politically and under strict rule regarding tenure to help maintain judicial independence . this theoretically allows the judiciary to interpret the law based solely on the legislation enacted by parliament without other influence on their decision . </s> new zealand is identified a one of the world 's most stable and well-governed state . , the country wa ranked fourth in the strength of it democratic institution and first in government transparency and corruption in new zealand . a 2017 country report on human right practice by the u.s. department of state noted that the government generally human right in new zealand of individual , but voiced concern regarding the social status of the mori population . new zealand rank highly for civic participation in the political process , with 80 % voter turnout during recent election , compared to an average of 68 % . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation and military <section_title_end> </s> early colonial new zealand allowed the british government to determine external trade and be responsible for foreign policy . the 1923 and 1926 imperial conference decided that new zealand should be allowed to negotiate it own political treaty , and the first commercial treaty wa ratified in 1928 with japan . on 3 september 1939 , new zealand allied itself with britain and declaration of war on germany with prime minister michael joseph savage proclaiming , `` where she go , we go ; where she stand , we stand . `` </s> in 1951 the united kingdom became increasingly focused on it european interest , while new zealand joined australianew zealand relation and the new zealandunited state relation in the anzus security treaty . the influence of the united state on new zealand weakened following protest over the new zealand in the vietnam war , the refusal of the united state to admonish france after the sinking of the rainbow warrior , disagreement over environmental and agricultural trade issue , and new zealand nuclear-free zone new zealand 's nuclear-free policy . despite the united state ' suspension of anzus obligation , the treaty remained in effect between new zealand and australia , whose foreign policy ha followed a similar historical trend . close political contact is maintained between the two country , with closer economic relation and trans-tasman travel arrangement that allow citizen to visit , live and work in both country without restriction . there were about 650,000 new zealand citizen living in australia , which is equivalent to 15 % of the population of new zealand . </s> new zealand ha a strong presence among the pacific island country . a large proportion of new zealand 's aid go to these country , and many pacific people migrate to new zealand for employment . permanent migration is regulated under the 1970 samoan quota scheme and the 2002 pacific access category , which allow up to 1,100 samoan national and up to 750 other pacific islander respectively to become permanent new zealand resident each year . a seasonal worker scheme for temporary migration wa introduced in 2007 , and in 2009 about 8,000 pacific islander were employed under it . new zealand is involved in the pacific island forum , the pacific community , asia-pacific economic cooperation , and the association of southeast asian nation regional forum ( including the east asia summit ) . new zealand ha been described a an emerging power . the country is a member of the new zealand and the united nation , the commonwealth of nation and the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) , and participates in the five power defence arrangement . </s> new zealand 's military servicesthe defence forcecomprise the new zealand army , the royal new zealand air force , and the royal new zealand navy . new zealand 's national defence need are modest since a direct attack is unlikely . however , it military ha military history of new zealand . the country fought in both world war , with notable campaign in gallipoli campaign , battle of crete , second battle of el alamein , and battle of monte cassino . the gallipoli campaign played an important part in fostering new zealand 's national identity and strengthened the australian and new zealand army corp tradition it share with australia . </s> in addition to vietnam and the two world war , new zealand fought in the second boer war , the new zealand in the korean war , the malayan emergency , the gulf war , and the war in afghanistan ( 2001present ) . it ha contributed force to several regional and global peacekeeping mission , such a those in cyprus dispute , somali civil war , bosnian war , the suez crisis , angolan civil war , cambodianvietnamese war , the iraniraq war iraniraq border , bougainville campaign , operation astute , and the solomon island # civil war . </s> <section_title_start> local government and external territories <section_title_end> </s> the early european settler divided new zealand into province of new zealand , which had a degree of autonomy . because of financial pressure and the desire to consolidate railway , education , land sale , and other policy , government wa centralised and the province were abolished in 1876 . the province are remembered in public holiday in new zealand and sporting rivalry . </s> since 1876 , various council have administered local area under legislation determined by the central government . in 1989 , the government reorganised local government into the current two-tier structure of region of new zealand and territorial authority . the list of former territorial authority in new zealand that existed in 1975 have now been consolidated into 67 territorial authority and 11 regional council . the regional council ' role is to regulate `` the natural environment with particular emphasis on resource management act 1991 `` , while territorial authority are responsible for sewage , water , local road , building consent , and other local matter . five of the territorial council are unitary authority and also act a regional council . the territorial authority consist of 13 city council , 53 district of new zealand council , and the chatham island council . while officially the chatham island council is not a unitary authority , it undertakes many function of a regional council . </s> the realm of new zealand , one of 16 commonwealth realm , is the entire area over which the queen of new zealand is sovereign and comprises new zealand , tokelau , the ross dependency , the cook island , and niue . the cook island and niue are self-governing state in associated state with new zealand . the new zealand parliament can not pas legislation for these country , but with their consent can act on behalf of them in foreign affair and defence . tokelau is classified a a united nation list of non-self-governing territory non-self-governing territory but is administered by a council of three elder ( one from each tokelauan atoll ) . the ross dependency is new zealand 's territorial claim in antarctica , where it operates the scott base research facility . new zealand nationality law treat all part of the realm equally , so most people born in new zealand , the cook island , niue , tokelau , and the ross dependency are new zealand citizen . </s> <section_title_start> geography and environment <section_title_end> </s> new zealand is located near the centre of the water hemisphere and is made up of two main island and a number of list of island of new zealand . the two main island ( the north island , or te ika-a-mui , and the south island , or te waipounamu ) are separated by cook strait , wide at it narrowest point . besides the north and south island , the five largest inhabited island are stewart island ( across the foveaux strait ) , chatham island , great barrier island ( in the hauraki gulf ) , d'urville island ( new zealand ) d'urville island ( in the marlborough sound ) and waiheke island ( about from central auckland ) . </s> new zealand is long and narrowover along it north-north-east axis with a maximum width of with about of coastline and a total land area of . because of it far-flung outlying island and long coastline , the country ha extensive marine resource . it exclusive economic zone of new zealand is one of the largest in the world , covering more than 15 time it land area . </s> the south island is the largest landmass of new zealand . it is divided along it length by the southern alp . there are 18 peak over , the highest of which is aoraki / mount cook at . fiordland 's steep mountain and deep list of fiord of new zealand record the extensive ice age glaciation of this southwestern corner of the south island . the north island is le mountainous but is volcanology of new zealand . the highly active taupo volcanic zone ha formed a large north island volcanic plateau , punctuated by the north island 's highest mountain , mount ruapehu ( ) . the plateau also host the country 's largest lake , lake taupo , nestled in the caldera of one of the world 's most active supervolcanoes . </s> the country owes it varied topography , and perhaps even it emergence above the wave , to the dynamic boundary it straddle between the pacific plate and indo-australian plate . new zealand is part of zealandia , a microcontinent nearly half the size of australia that gradually submerged after breaking away from the gondwanan supercontinent . about 25 million year ago , a shift in plate tectonic movement began to kaikoura orogeny the region . this is now most evident in the southern alp , formed by continental collision beside the alpine fault . elsewhere the plate boundary involves the subduction of one plate under the other , producing the puysegur trench to the south , the hikurangi trench east of the north island , and the kermadec trench and tonga trench further north . </s> new zealand is part of a region known a australasia , together with australia . it also form the southwestern extremity of the geographic and ethnographic region called polynesia . the term oceania is often used to denote the wider region encompassing the australia ( continent ) , new zealand and various island in the pacific ocean that are not included in the continent seven-continent model . </s> file : nz landscape.jpg rural scene near queenstown , new zealand </s> file : twc hokitika gorge stewart nimmo mrd 16.jpg hokitika gorge , west coast , new zealand </s> file : emerald lake , new zealand.jpg the emerald lake , mt tongariro </s> file : lake gunn.jpg lake gunn </s> file : pencarrow head , wellington , new zealand from santa regina , 24 feb. 2007.jpg pencarrow head , wellington </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> new zealand 's climate is predominantly temperate oceanic climate ( kppen climate classification : cfb ) , with mean annual temperature ranging from in the south to in the north . historical maximum and minimum are in rangiora , canterbury , new zealand and in ranfurly , new zealand , otago . condition vary sharply across region from extremely wet on the west coast , new zealand of the south island to semi-arid climate semi-arid in central otago and the mackenzie basin of inland canterbury , and subtropical in northland peninsula . of the seven largest city , christchurch is the driest , receiving on average only of rain per year and wellington the wettest , receiving almost twice that amount . auckland , wellington and christchurch all receive a yearly average of more than 2,000 hour of sunshine . the southern and southwestern part of the south island have a cooler and cloudier climate , with around 1,4001,600 hour ; the northern and northeastern part of the south island are the sunniest area of the country and receive about 2,4002,500 hour . the general snow season is early june until early october , though cold snap can occur outside this season . snowfall is common in the eastern and southern part of the south island and mountain area across the country . </s> the table below list climate normal for the warmest and coldest month in new zealand 's six largest city . north island city are generally warmest in february . south island city are warmest in january . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> new zealand 's geographic isolation for 80 million year and island biogeography ha influenced evolution of the country 's specie of fauna , fungus and flora . physical isolation ha caused biological isolation , resulting in a dynamic evolutionary ecology with example of very distinctive plant and animal a well a population of widespread specie . about 82 % of new zealand 's indigenous vascular plant are endemism , covering 1,944 specie across 65 genus . the number of fungi recorded from new zealand , including lichen-forming specie , is not known , nor is the proportion of those fungi which are endemic , but one estimate suggests there are about 2,300 specie of lichen-forming fungi in new zealand and 40 % of these are endemic . the two main type of forest are those dominated by broadleaf tree with emergent podocarp , or by nothofagus in cooler climate . the remaining vegetation type consist of grassland , the majority of which are tussock grassland of new zealand . new zealand had a 2019 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 7.12/10 , ranking it 55th globally out of 172 country . </s> before the arrival of human , an estimated 80 % of the land wa covered in forest , with only tree line , wet , infertile and volcanic area without tree . massive deforestation in new zealand occurred after human arrived , with around half the forest cover lost to fire after polynesian settlement . much of the remaining forest fell after european settlement , being logged or cleared to make room for pastoral farming , leaving forest occupying only 23 % of the land . </s> the forest were dominated by bird of new zealand , and the lack of mammalian predator led to some like the kiwi ( bird ) , kakapo , weka and takah evolving flightless bird . the arrival of human , associated change to habitat , and the introduction of polynesian rat , ferret and other mammal led to the list of new zealand animal extinct in the holocene of many bird specie , including megafauna like the moa and haast 's eagle . </s> other indigenous animal are represented by reptile ( tuatara , skink and list of gecko of new zealand ) , leiopelmatidae , spider of new zealand , insect ( wt ) and snail . some , such a the tuatara , are so unique that they have been called living fossil . three specie of bat ( new zealand greater short-tailed bat since extinct ) were the only sign of native land mammal in new zealand until the 2006 discovery of bone from saint bathans mammal a unique , mouse-sized land mammal at least 16 million year old . marine mammal , however , are abundant , with almost half the world 's cetacean ( whale , dolphin , and porpoise ) and large number of fur seal reported in new zealand water . many seabird breed in new zealand , a third of them unique to the country . more list of bird of new zealand # penguin specie are found in new zealand than in any other country . </s> since human arrival , almost half of the country 's vertebrate specie have become extinct , including at least fifty-one bird , three frog , three lizard , one freshwater fish , and one bat . others are endangered or have had their range severely reduced . however , new zealand conservationist have pioneered several method to help threatened wildlife recover , including island sanctuary , pest control , wildlife translocation , fostering and ecological island restoration and other protected area of new zealand . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> new zealand ha an advanced economy market economy , ranked 14th in the human development index and third in the index of economic freedom . it is a [ economy ] with a nominal value gross domestic product ( gdp ) per caput of united state dollar u $ 36,254 . the currency is the new zealand dollar , informally known a the `` kiwi dollar `` ; it also circulates in the cook island ( see cook island dollar ) , niue , tokelau , and the pitcairn island . </s> historically , extractive industry have contributed strongly to new zealand 's economy , focussing at different time on sealing , whaling , phormium , gold , kauri gum , and native timber . the first shipment of refrigerated meat on the dunedin ( ship ) in 1882 led to the establishment of meat and dairy export to britain , a trade which provided the basis for strong economic growth in new zealand . high demand for agricultural product from the united kingdom and the united state helped new zealander achieve higher living standard than both australia and western europe in the 1950s and 1960s . in 1973 , new zealand 's export market wa reduced when the united kingdom joined the european economic community and other compounding factor , such a the 1973 oil crisis and 1979 oil crisis crisis , led to a severe depression ( economics ) . living standard in new zealand fell behind those of australia and western europe , and by 1982 new zealand had the lowest per-capita income of all the developed nation surveyed by world bank group . in the mid-1980s new zealand deregulated it agriculture in new zealand by phasing out agricultural subsidy over a three-year period . since 1984 , successive government engaged in major macroeconomic restructuring ( known first a rogernomics and then ruthanasia ) , rapidly transforming new zealand from a protectionism and highly regulated economy to a liberalised free-trade economy . </s> unemployment peaked above 10 % in 1991 and 1992 , following the black monday ( 1987 ) # new zealand , but eventually fell to a record low ( since 1986 ) of 3.7 % in 2007 ( ranking third from twenty-seven comparable oecd nation ) . however , the financial crisis of 20072008 that followed had a major impact on new zealand , with the gdp shrinking for five consecutive quarter , the longest recession in over thirty year , and unemployment rising back to 7 % in late 2009 . unemployment rate for different age group follow similar trend but are consistently higher among youth . in the december 2014 quarter , the general unemployment rate wa around 5.8 % , while the unemployment rate for youth aged 15 to 21 wa 15.6 % . new zealand ha experienced a series of `` brain drain `` since the 1970s that still continue today . nearly one-quarter of highly skilled worker live overseas , mostly in australia and britain , which is the largest proportion from any developed nation . in recent decade , however , a `` brain gain `` ha brought in educated professional from europe and le developed country . today new zealand 's economy benefit from a high level of innovation . </s> <section_title_start> trade <section_title_end> </s> new zealand is heavily dependent on international trade , particularly in agricultural product . export account for 24 % of it output , making new zealand vulnerable to international commodity price and global recession . food product made up 55 % of the value of all the country 's export in 2014 ; wood wa the second largest earner ( 7 % ) . new zealand 's main trading partner , , are china ( nz $ 27.8b ) , australia ( $ 26.2b ) , the european union ( $ 22.9b ) , the united state ( $ 17.6b ) , and japan ( $ 8.4b ) . on 7 april 2008 , new zealand and china signed the new zealandchina free trade agreement , the first such agreement china ha signed with a developed country . the service sector is the largest sector in the economy , followed by manufacturing and construction and then farming and raw material extraction . tourism in new zealand play a significant role in the economy , contributing $ 12.9 billion ( or 5.6 % ) to new zealand 's total gdp and supporting 7.5 % of the total workforce in 2016. international visitor arrival are expected to increase at a rate of 5.4 % annually up to 2022. </s> wool wa new zealand 's major agricultural export during the late 19th century . even a late a the 1960s it made up over a third of all export revenue , but since then it price ha steadily dropped relative to other commodity , and wool is no longer profitable for many farmer . in contrast , dairy farming in new zealand increased , with the number of dairy cow doubling between 1990 and 2007 , to become new zealand 's largest export earner . in the year to june 2018 , dairy product accounted for 17.7 % ( $ 14.1 billion ) of total export , and the country 's largest company , fonterra , control almost one-third of the international dairy trade . other export in 2017-18 were meat ( 8.8 % ) , wood and wood product ( 6.2 % ) , fruit ( 3.6 % ) , machinery ( 2.2 % ) and wine ( 2.1 % ) . new zealand wine new zealand 's wine industry ha followed a similar trend to dairy , the number of vineyard doubling over the same period , overtaking wool export for the first time in 2007. </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> in 2015 , renewable energy in new zealand generated 40.1 % of energy in new zealand new zealand 's gross energy supply . the majority of the country 's electricity sector in new zealand is generated from hydroelectric power in new zealand , with major scheme on the waikato river , waitaki river and clutha river river , a well a at manapouri power station . geothermal power in new zealand is also a significant generator of electricity , with several large station located across the taupo volcanic zone in the north island . the five main company in the generation and retail market are contact energy , genesis energy limited , mercury energy , meridian energy , and trustpower . state-owned transpower new zealand operates the high-voltage transmission grid in the north and south island , a well a the hvdc inter-island inter-island hvdc link connecting the two together . </s> the provision of water supply and sanitation in new zealand is generally of good quality . regional authority provide water abstraction , treatment and distribution infrastructure to most developed area . </s> transport in new zealand new zealand 's transport network comprises of road , including of motorway , and of railway line . most major city and town are linked by bus service , although the private car is the predominant mode of transport . the rail transport in new zealand were privatised in 1993 but were re-nationalised by the government in stage between 2004 and 2008 . the state-owned enterprise kiwirail now operates the railway , with the exception of commuter service in auckland and wellington , which are operated by transdev auckland and public transport in the wellington region , respectively . railway run the length of the country , although most line now carry freight rather than passenger . the road and rail network in the two main island are linked by roll-on/roll-off ferry between wellington and picton , new zealand , operated by interislander ( part of kiwirail ) and straitnz . most international visitor arrive via air , and new zealand ha list of airport in new zealand , but only the auckland airport and christchurch international airport connect directly with country other than australia or fiji . </s> the new zealand post office had a monopoly over telecommunication in new zealand until 1987 when spark new zealand wa formed , initially a a state-owned enterprise and then privatised in 1990 . chorus limited , which wa split from telecom ( now spark ) in 2011 , still owns the majority of the telecommunication infrastructure , but competition from other provider ha increased . a large-scale rollout of gigabit-capable fibre to the premise , branded a ultra-fast broadband , began in 2009 with a target of being available to 87 % of the population by 2022. , the united nation international telecommunication union rank new zealand 13th in the development of information and communication infrastructure . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> early indigenous contribution to science in new zealand wa by mori tohunga accumulating knowledge of agricultural practice and the effect of herbal remedy in the treatment of illness and disease . james cook 's voyage in the 1700s and charles darwin 's in 1835 had important scientific botanical and zoological objective . the establishment of university in the 19th century fostered scientific discovery by notable new zealander including ernest rutherford for splitting the atom , bill pickering ( rocket scientist ) for rocket science , maurice wilkins for helping discover dna , beatrice tinsley for galaxy formation , archibald mcindoe for plastic surgery , and alan macdiarmid for conducting polymer . </s> crown research institute ( cris ) were formed in 1992 from existing government-owned research organisation . their role is to research and develop new science , knowledge , product and service across the economic , environmental , social and cultural spectrum for the benefit of new zealand . the total gross expenditure on research and development ( r & d ) a a proportion of gdp rose to 1.37 % in 2018 , up from 1.23 % in 2015 . new zealand rank 21st in the oecd for it gross r & d spending a a percentage of gdp . </s> <section_title_start> demography <section_title_end> </s> the 2018 new zealand census enumerated a resident population of 4,699,755 , an increase of 10.8 % over the 2013 new zealand census figure . a of , the total population ha risen to an estimated . new zealand 's population increased at a rate of 1.9 % per year in the seven year ended june 2020 . in september 2020 statistic new zealand reported that the population had climbed above 5 million people in september 2019 , according to population estimate based on the 2018 census . </s> new zealand is a predominantly urban country , with % of the population living in urban area of new zealand , and % of the population living in the seven city with population exceeding 100,000 . auckland , with over 1 million resident , is by far the largest city . new zealand city generally rank highly on international livability measure . for instance , in 2016 , auckland wa ranked the world 's third most liveable city and wellington the twelfth by the mercer quality of living survey . </s> life expectancy for new zealander in 2012 wa 84 year for female , and 80.2 year for male . life expectancy at birth is forecast to increase from 80 year to 85 year in 2050 , and infant mortality is expected to decline . new zealand 's fertility rate of 2.1 is relatively high for a developed country , and natural birth account for a significant proportion of replacement fertility rate . consequently , the country ha a young population compared to most industrialised nation , with 20 % of new zealander being 14 year old or younger . in 2018 the median age of the new zealand population wa 38.1 year . by 2050 the median age is projected to rise to 43 year and the percentage of people 60 year of age and older to rise from 18 % to 29 % . in 2008 the leading cause of premature death wa cancer , at 29.8 % , followed by ischaemic heart disease , 19.7 % , and then cerebrovascular disease , 9.2 % . , total expenditure on [ care in new zealand health care ] ( including private sector spending ) is 9.2 % of gdp . </s> <section_title_start> ethnicity and immigration <section_title_end> </s> in the 2018 new zealand census , 71.8 % of new zealand resident identified ethnically a european or pkeh , and 16.5 % a native mori people . other major ethnic group include asian new zealander ( 15.3 % ) and pacific people ( 9.0 % ) , two-thirds of whom live in the auckland region . the population ha become more diverse in recent decade : in 1961 , the census reported that the population of new zealand wa 92 % european and 7 % mori , with asian and pacific minority sharing the remaining 1 % . </s> while the demonym for a new zealand citizen is new zealander , the informal `` kiwi ( people ) `` is commonly used both internationally and by local . the mori loanword pkeh ha been used to refer to european new zealander , although some reject this name . the word pkeh today is increasingly used to refer to all non-polynesian new zealander . </s> the mori were the first people to reach new zealand , followed by the early pkeh settler . following colonisation , immigrant were predominantly from britain , ireland and australia because of restrictive policy similar to the white australia policy . there wa also significant dutch , dalmatian , german , and italian immigration , together with indirect european immigration through australia , north america , south america and south africa . net migration increased after the second world war ; in the 1970s and 1980s policy were relaxed , and immigration from asia wa promoted . in 200910 , an annual target of 45,00050,000 permanent residence approval wa set by the new zealand immigration servicemore than one new migrant for every 100 new zealand resident . in the 2018 census , 27.4 % of people counted were not born in new zealand , up from 25.2 % in the 2013 new zealand census . over half ( 52.4 % ) of new zealand 's overseas-born population life in the auckland region . the united kingdom remains the largest source of new zealand 's immigrant population , with around a quarter of all overseas-born new zealander born there ; other major source of new zealand 's overseas-born population are china , india , australia , south africa , fiji and samoa . the number of fee-paying international student increased sharply in the late 1990s , with more than 20,000 studying in public tertiary education in 2002. </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> english is the predominant language in new zealand , spoken by 95.4 % of the population . new zealand english is similar to australian english , and many speaker from the northern hemisphere are unable to tell the accent ( sociolinguistics ) apart . the most prominent difference between the new zealand english dialect and other english dialect are the shift in the short front vowel : the short- `` i `` sound ( a in `` kit `` ) ha centralised towards the schwa sound ( the `` a `` in `` comma `` and `` about `` ) ; the short- `` e `` sound ( a in `` dress `` ) ha moved towards the short- `` i `` sound ; and the short- `` a `` sound ( a in `` trap `` ) ha moved to the short- `` e `` sound . </s> after the second world war , mori were discouraged from speaking their own language ( te reo mori ) in school and workplace , and it existed a a community language only in a few remote area . it ha recently undergone a process of revitalisation , being declared one of new zealand 's official language in 1987 , and is spoken by 4.0 % of the population . there are now mori language immersion school and two television channel that broadcast predominantly in mori . list of dual place name in new zealand have both their mori and english name officially recognised . </s> a recorded in the 2018 census , samoan language is the most widely spoken non-official language ( 2.2 % ) , followed by `` northern chinese `` ( including mandarin chinese , 2.0 % ) , hindi ( 1.5 % ) , and french ( 1.2 % ) . 22,986 people ( 0.5 % ) reported the ability to use new zealand sign language , which became one of new zealand 's official language in 2006. </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> christianity in new zealand is the predominant religion in new zealand , although it society is among the most secular in the world . in the 2018 census , 44.7 % of respondent identified with one or more religion , including 37.0 % identifying a christian . another 48.5 % indicated that they had no religion . of those who affiliate with a particular christian denomination , the main response are anglican church in aotearoa , new zealand and polynesia ( 6.7 % ) , catholic church in new zealand ( 6.3 % ) , and presbyterian church of aotearoa new zealand ( 4.7 % ) . the mori-based ringat and rtana religion ( 1.2 % ) are also christian in origin . immigration and demographic change in recent decade have contributed to the growth of minority religion , such a hinduism in new zealand ( 2.6 % ) , islam in new zealand ( 1.3 % ) , buddhism in new zealand ( 1.1 % ) , and sikhism in new zealand ( 0.9 % ) . the auckland region exhibited the greatest religious diversity . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> primary and secondary schooling is compulsory for child aged 6 to 16 , with the majority attending from the age of 5 . there are 13 school year and attending state school state ( public ) school is free to new zealand citizen and permanent resident from a person 's 5th birthday to the end of the calendar year following their 19th birthday . new zealand ha an adult literacy rate of 99 % , and over half of the population aged 15 to 29 hold a tertiary qualification . there are five type of government-owned tertiary institution : university , college of education , institute of technology # new zealand , specialist college , and wnanga , in addition to private training establishment . in the adult population , 14.2 % have a bachelor 's degree or higher , 30.4 % have some form of secondary qualification a their highest qualification , and 22.4 % have no formal qualification . the oecd 's programme for international student assessment rank new zealand 's education system a the seventh-best in the world , with student performing exceptionally well in reading , mathematics and science . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> early mori adapted the tropically based east polynesian culture in line with the challenge associated with a larger and more diverse environment , eventually developing their own distinctive culture . social organisation wa largely communal with family ( whnau ) , subtribes ( hap ) and tribe ( iwi ) ruled by a chief ( rangatira ) , whose position wa subject to the community 's approval . the british and irish immigrant brought aspect of their own culture to new zealand and also influenced mori culture , particularly with the introduction of christianity . however , mori still regard their allegiance to tribal group a a vital part of cultural identity , and mori kinship role resemble hawaiian kinship . more recently , culture of the united state , culture of australia , culture of asia and other culture of europe have exerted influence on new zealand . non-mori polynesian culture are also apparent , with pasifika festival , the world 's largest polynesian festival , now an annual event in auckland . </s> the largely rural life in early new zealand led to the image of new zealander being rugged , industrious problem solver . modesty wa expected and enforced through the `` tall poppy syndrome `` , where high achiever received harsh criticism . at the time , new zealand wa not known a an intellectual country . from the early 20th century until the late 1960s , mori culture wa suppressed by the attempted forced assimilation of mori into british new zealander . in the 1960s , a tertiary education became more available , and urbanization urban culture began to dominate . however , rural imagery and theme are common in new zealand 's art , literature and medium . </s> national symbol of new zealand new zealand 's national symbol are influenced by natural , historical , and mori source . the silver fern is an emblem appearing on army insignia and sporting team uniform . certain item of popular culture thought to be unique to new zealand are called `` kiwiana `` . </s> <section_title_start> art <section_title_end> </s> a part of the resurgence of mori culture , the traditional craft of carving and weaving are now more widely practised , and mori artist are increasing in number and influence . most mori carving feature human figure , generally with three finger and either a natural-looking , detailed head or a grotesque head . surface pattern consisting of spiral , ridge , notch and fish scale decorate most carving . the pre-eminent mori architecture consisted of carved meeting house ( wharenui ) decorated with symbolic carving and illustration . these building were originally designed to be constantly rebuilt , changing and adapting to different whim or need . </s> mori decorated the white wood of building , canoe and cenotaph using red ( a mixture of red ochre and shark fat ) and black ( made from soot ) paint and painted picture of bird , reptile and other design on cave wall . mori tattoo ( t moko ) consisting of coloured soot mixed with gum were cut into the flesh with a bone chisel . since european arrival painting and photograph have been dominated by landscape , originally not a work of art but a factual portrayal of new zealand . portrait of mori were also common , with early painter often portraying them a an ideal race untainted by civilisation . the country 's isolation delayed the influence of european artistic trend allowing local artist to develop their own distinctive style of regionalism ( art ) . during the 1960s and 1970s , many artist combined traditional mori and western technique , creating unique art form . new zealand art and craft ha gradually achieved an international audience , with exhibition in the venice biennale in 2001 and the `` paradise now `` exhibition in new york in 2004. </s> mori cloak are made of fine flax fibre and patterned with black , red and white triangle , diamond and other geometric shape . pounamu wa fashioned into earring and necklace , with the most well-known design being the [ a distorted human figure sitting cross-legged with it head tilted to the side . european brought english fashion etiquette to new zealand , and until the 1950s most people dressed up for social occasion . standard have since relaxed and new zealand fashion ha received a reputation for being casual , practical and lacklustre . however , the local fashion industry ha grown significantly since 2000 , doubling export and increasing from a handful to about 50 established label , with some label gaining international recognition . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> mori quickly adopted writing a a mean of sharing idea , and many of their oral story and poem were converted to the written form . most early english literature wa obtained from britain , and it wa not until the 1950s when local publishing outlet increased that new zealand literature started to become widely known . although still largely influenced by global trend ( literary modernism modernism ] ) and event ( the great depression ) , writer in the 1930s began to develop story increasingly focused on their experience in new zealand . during this period , literature changed from a [ [ journalism activity to a more academic pursuit . participation in the world war gave some new zealand writer a new perspective on new zealand culture and with the post-war expansion of university local literature flourished . dunedin is a unesco city of literature . </s> <section_title_start> media and entertainment <section_title_end> </s> new zealand music ha been influenced by blue , jazz , country music , rock and roll and [ hop music hip hop ] , with many of these genre given a unique new zealand interpretation . mori developed traditional chant and song from their ancient southeast asian origin , and after century of isolation created a unique `` monotonous `` and `` wikt : doleful `` sound . flute and trumpet were used a musical instrument or a signalling device during war or special occasion . early settler brought over their ethnic music , with brass band and choir being popular , and musician began touring new zealand in the 1860s . pipe band became widespread during the early 20th century . the new zealand recording industry began to develop from 1940 onwards , and many new zealand musician have obtained success in britain and the united state . some artist release mori language song , and the mori tradition-based art of kapa haka ( song and dance ) ha made a resurgence . the new zealand music award are held annually by recorded music nz ; the award were first held in 1965 by reckitt & colman a the loxene golden disc award . recorded music nz also publishes the country 's official new zealand music chart . </s> public radio in new zealand wa introduced in new zealand in 1922 . a state-owned television in new zealand began in 1960 . deregulation in the 1980s saw a sudden increase in the number of radio and television station . new zealand television primarily broadcast american and british programming , along with many australian and local show . the number of list of new zealand film significantly increased during the 1970s . in 1978 the new zealand film commission started assisting local film-makers , and many film attained a world audience , some receiving international acknowledgement . the highest-grossing new zealand film are hunt for the wilderpeople , boy ( 2010 film ) , the world 's fastest indian , whale rider , once were warrior ( film ) and the piano . the country 's diverse scenery and compact size , plus government incentive , have encouraged some film producer to shoot big-budget production in new zealand , including the lord of the ring ( film series ) and the hobbit ( film series ) film trilogy , avatar ( 2009 film ) , the chronicle of narnia ( film series ) , king kong ( 2005 film ) , x-men origin : wolverine and the last samurai . the new zealand medium industry is dominated by a small number of company , most of which are foreign-owned , although the crown entity of some television and radio station . since 1994 , freedom house ha consistently ranked new zealand 's press freedom in the top twenty , with the 19th freest medium . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> most of the major sporting code played in new zealand have british origin . rugby union is considered the national sport and attracts the most spectator . golf , netball , tennis and cricket have the highest rate of adult participation , while netball , rugby union and association football football ( soccer ) are particularly popular among young people . around 54 % of new zealand adolescent participate in sport for their school . victorious rugby tour to australia and the united kingdom in the 188889 new zealand native football team and the the original all black played an early role in instilling a national identity . horseracing in new zealand wa also a popular spectator sport and became part of the `` rugby , racing and beer `` culture during the 1960s . mori participation in european sport wa particularly evident in rugby , and the country 's team performs a haka ( sport ) , a traditional mori challenge , before international match . new zealand is known for it extreme sport , adventure travel and strong mountaineering tradition , a seen in the success of notable new zealander edmund hillary . other outdoor pursuit such a cycling in new zealand , fishing , swimming , running , tramping in new zealand , canoeing , hunting , snowsports , surfing and sailing are also popular . new zealand ha seen regular sailing success in the america 's cup regatta since 1995 . the polynesian sport of waka ama racing ha experienced a resurgence of interest in new zealand since the 1980s . </s> new zealand ha competitive international team in new zealand national rugby union team , new zealand national rugby league team , new zealand national netball team , new zealand national cricket team , new zealand men 's national softball team , and team new zealand . new zealand participated at the summer olympics in 1908 and 1912 a australasia at the olympics , before first participating new zealand at the olympics in 1920 . the country ha ranked highly on a medals-to-population ratio at recent game . the `` all black `` , the national rugby union team , are the most successful in the history of international rugby and have won the rugby world cup three time . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> the national cuisine ha been described a pacific rim , incorporating the native mori cuisine and diverse culinary tradition introduced by settler and immigrant from europe , polynesia , and asia . new zealand yield produce from land and seamost crop and livestock , such a maize , potato and pig , were gradually introduced by the early european settler . distinctive ingredient or dish include lamb and mutton , salmon , kura ( crayfish ) , bluff oyster , whitebait , pua ( abalone ) , mussel , scallop , paphies australis and tuatua ( both are type of new zealand shellfish ) , kmara ( sweet potato ) , kiwifruit , tamarillo and pavlova ( food ) ( considered a national dish ) . a [ is a traditional mori method of cooking food using heated rock buried in a pit oven ; still used for large group on special occasion , such a tangihanga ] . </s> <section_title_start> see
