and the rest by the state . in 2010 , spending on healthcare accounted for 4.66 % of the country 's gdp . in 2009 , there were 16.04 physician and 33.80 nurse per 10,000 inhabitant . </s> a a result of modernisation effort over the year , egypt 's healthcare system ha made great stride forward . access to healthcare in both urban and rural area greatly improved and immunisation program are now able to cover 98 % of the population . life expectancy increased from 44.8 year during the 1960s to 72.12 year in 2009 . there wa a noticeable decline of the infant mortality rate ( during the 1970s to the 1980s the infant mortality rate wa 101-132/1000 live birth , in 2000 the rate wa 50-60/1000 , and in 2008 it wa 28-30/1000 ) . </s> according to the world health organization in 2008 , an estimated 91.1 % of egypt 's girl and woman aged 15 to 49 have been subjected to female genital mutilation , despite being illegal in the country . in 2016 the law wa amended to impose tougher penalty on those convicted of performing the procedure , pegging the highest jail term at 15 year . those who escort victim to the procedure can also face jail term up to 3 year . </s> the total number of egyptian with [ insurance ] reached 37 million in 2009 , of which 11 million are minor , providing an insurance coverage of approximately 52 percent of egypt 's population . </s> <section_title_start> </s> category:1922 establishment in egypt </s> category:1922 establishment in africa </s> category:1922 establishment in asia </s> category : country in africa </s> category : country in asia </s> category : transcontinental country <article_end> <article_start> </s> greece ( , ellada , ) , also known a hellas , and officially the hellenic republic , is a country located in southeast europe . it population is approximately 10.7 million a of 2018 ; athens is it largest and capital city , followed by thessaloniki . situated on the southern tip of the balkan , greece is located at the crossroad of europe , asia , and africa . it share land border with albania to the northwest , north macedonia and bulgaria to the north , and turkey to the northeast . the aegean sea lie to the east of the geography of greece , the ionian sea to the west , the sea of crete and the mediterranean sea to the south . greece ha the longest coastline on the mediterranean basin and the list of country by length of coastline at in length , featuring many list of island of greece , of which 227 are inhabited . eighty percent of greece is mountainous , with mount olympus being the highest peak at . the country consists of nine geographic region of greece : macedonia ( greece ) , central greece , the peloponnese , thessaly , epirus ( region ) , the aegean island ( including the dodecanese and cyclades ) , western thrace , crete , and the ionian island . </s> greece is considered the cradle of western culture , being the birthplace of athenian democracy , western philosophy , western literature , [ political science ] , major [ [ history of science in classical antiquity and greek mathematics principle , drama and the olympic game . from the eighth century bc , the greek were organised into various independent city-state , known a poleis ( singular polis ) , which spanned the mediterranean basin and the black sea . philip ii of macedon united most of present-day greece in the fourth century bc , with his son alexander the great rapidly conquering much of the ancient world , from the eastern mediterranean to india . the subsequent hellenistic period saw the height of greek culture and influence in antiquity . greece wa annexed by roman republic in the second century bc , becoming an integral part of the roman empire and it continuation , the byzantine empire , which wa predominately culturally and linguistically greek . the greek orthodox church , which emerged in the first century ad , helped shape modern greek identity and transmitted greek tradition to the wider eastern orthodox church . after falling under ottoman empire dominion in the mid-15th century , greece emerged a a modern nation state in 1830 following a greek war of independence . the country 's rich historical legacy is reflected in part by it 18 list of world heritage site in greece . </s> greece is a unitary parliamentary republic , and a developed country , with an advanced world bank high-income economy high-income economy , and a high quality of life , ranking simultaneously very high in the list of country by human development index . it economy is the list of sovereign state in europe by gdp ( nominal ) in the balkan , where it is an important regional investor . a founding member of the united nation , greece wa the tenth member to join the european community ( precursor to the european union ) and ha been part of the eurozone since 2001 . it is also a member of numerous other international institution , including the council of europe , the nato ( nato ) , the oecd organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) , the world trade organization ( wto ) , the organization for security and co-operation in europe ( osce ) , and the organisation internationale de la francophonie ( oif ) . greece 's unique cultural heritage , large tourism in greece , greek shipping and geostrategic importance classify it a a middle power . </s> <section_title_start> name <section_title_end> </s> the native name of the country in modern greek is ( , pronounced ) . the corresponding form in ancient greek and conservative formal modern greek ( katharevousa ) is ( hellas , classical : , modern : ) . this is the source of the english alternate name hellas , which is mostly found in archaic or poetic context today . the greek adjectival form ( ellinikos , ) is sometimes also translated a hellenic and is often rendered in this way in the formal name of greek institution , a in the official name of the greek state , the hellenic republic ( , ) . </s> the english name greece and greek are derived , via the latin graecia and graecus , from the name of the graecians ( , graiko ; singular , graiks ) , who were among the first list of ancient greek tribe to settle magna graecia in southern italy . the term is ultimately derived from the proto-indo-european language proto-indo-european root wikt : reconstruction : proto-indo-european/erh- , `` to grow old `` . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistory and early history <section_title_end> </s> the earliest evidence of the presence of human ancestor in the southern balkan , dated to 270,000bc , is to be found in the petralona cave , in the greek province of macedonia . the apidima cave in mani peninsula , in southern greece , contains the oldest remains of early modern human outside of africa , dated to 210,000 year ago . all three stage of the stone age ( paleolithic , mesolithic , and neolithic ) are represented in greece , for example in the franchthi cave . neolithic settlement in greece , dating from the 7th millennium bc , are the oldest in europe by several century , a greece lie on the route via which farming spread from the near east to europe . </s> greece is home to the first advanced civilization in europe and is considered the birthplace of western civilisation , beginning with the cycladic civilization on the island of the aegean sea at around 3200 bc , the minoan civilization in crete ( 27001500 bc ) , and then the mycenaean greece civilization on the mainland ( 16001100 bc ) . these civilization possessed writing , the minoan using an undeciphered writing system known a linear a , and the mycenaeans writing the earliest attested language form of greek language in linear b . the mycenaeans gradually absorbed the minoan , but collapsed violently around 1200 bc , along with other civilization , during the regional event known a the late bronze age collapse . this ushered in a period known a the greek dark age , from which written record are absent . though the unearthed linear b text are too fragmentary for the reconstruction of the political landscape and ca n't support the existence of a larger state , contemporary hittite and egyptian record suggest the presence of a single state under a `` great king `` based in mainland greece . </s> <section_title_start> archaic and classical period <section_title_end> </s> the end of the dark age is traditionally dated to 776 bc , the year of the first ancient olympic game . the iliad and the odyssey , the foundational text of western literature , are believed to have been composed by homer in the 7th or 8th century bc . with the end of the dark age , there emerged various kingdom and city-state across the greek peninsula , which spread to the shore of the black sea , magna grecia ( `` magna graecia `` ) and anatolia . these state and their colony reached great level of prosperity that resulted in an unprecedented cultural boom , that of classical greece , expressed in architecture of ancient greece , theatre of ancient greece , ancient greek science , greek mathematics and ancient greek philosophy . in 508 bc , cleisthenes instituted the world 's first athenian democracy system of government in athens . </s> by 500 bc , the achaemenid empire controlled the greek city state in asia minor and macedonia . attempt by some of the greek city-state of asia minor to overthrow persian rule ionian revolt , and persia first persian invasion of greece in 492 bc , but wa forced to withdraw after a defeat at the battle of marathon in 490 bc . in response , the greek city-state formed the hellenic league in 481 bc , led by sparta , which wa the first historically recorded union of greek state since the mythical union of the trojan war . a second persian invasion of greece by the persian followed in 480 bc . following decisive greek victory in 480 and 479 bc at battle of salami , battle of plataea , and battle of mycale , the persian were forced to withdraw for a second time , marking their eventual withdrawal from all of their european territory . led by athens and sparta , the greek victory in the greco-persian war are considered a pivotal moment in world history , a the 50 year of peace that followed are known a the fifth-century athens , the seminal period of ancient greek development that laid many of the foundation of western civilization . </s> lack of political unity within greece resulted in frequent conflict between greek state . the most devastating intra-greek war wa the peloponnesian war ( 431404 bc ) , won by sparta and marking the demise of the athenian empire a the leading power in ancient greece . both athens and sparta were later overshadowed by ancient thebe ( boeotia ) and eventually macedon , with the latter uniting most of the city-state of the greek hinterland in the league of corinth ( also known a the hellenic league or greek league ) under the control of phillip ii of macedon . despite this development , the greek world remained largely fragmented and would not be united under a single power until the roman year . sparta did not join the league and actively fought against it , raising an army led by agis iii to secure the city-state of crete for persia . </s> following the assassination of phillip ii , his son alexander iii of macedon ( `` the great `` ) assumed the leadership of the league of corinth and launched an invasion of the persian empire with the combined force of the league in 334 bc . undefeated in battle , alexander had conquered the persian empire in it entirety by 330 bc . by the time of his death in 323 bc , he had created one of the largest empire in history , stretching from greece to india . upon his death , his empire split into several kingdom , the most famous of which were the seleucid empire , ptolemaic egypt , the greco-bactrian kingdom , and the indo-greeks indo-greek kingdom . many greek migrated to alexandria , antioch , seleucia , and the many other new hellenistic city in asia and africa . although the political unity of alexander 's empire could not be maintained , it resulted in the hellenistic civilization and spread the greek language and greek culture in the territory conquered by alexander . greek science , technology , and mathematics are generally considered to have reached their peak during the hellenistic period . </s> <section_title_start> hellenistic and roman period ( 323 bc 4th century ad ) <section_title_end> </s> after a war of the diadochi following alexander 's death , the antigonid dynasty , descended from one of alexander 's general , established it control over macedon and most of the greek city-state by 276 bc . from about 200 bc the ancient rome became increasingly involved in greek affair and engaged in a macedonian war . macedon 's defeat at the battle of pydna in 168 bc signalled the end of antigonid power in greece . in 146 bc , macedonia wa annexed a a province by rome , and the rest of greece became a roman protectorate . </s> the process wa completed in 27 bc when the roman emperor augustus annexed the rest of greece and constituted it a the senatorial province of achaea ( roman province ) . despite their military superiority , the roman admired and became greco-roman world by the achievement of greek culture , hence horace 's famous statement : graecia capta ferum victorem cepit ( `` greece , although captured , took it wild conqueror captive `` ) . the epic of homer inspired the aeneid of virgil , and author such a seneca the younger wrote using greek style . roman hero such a scipio africanus , tended to study philosophy and regarded greek culture and science a an example to be followed . similarly , most roman emperor maintained an admiration for thing greek in nature . the roman emperor nero visited greece in ad 66 , and performed at the ancient olympic game , despite the rule against non-greek participation . hadrian wa also particularly fond of the greek . before becoming emperor , he served a an eponymous archon of athens . </s> greek-speaking community of the hellenised east were instrumental in the spread of early christianity in the 2nd and 3rd century , and christianity 's early leader and writer ( notably st paul st. paul ) were mostly greek-speaking , though generally not from greece itself . the new testament wa written in greek , and some of it section ( first epistle to the corinthian , first epistle to the thessalonian , epistle to the philippian , book of revelation of st. john of patmos ) attest to the importance of church in greece in early christianity . nevertheless , much of greece clung tenaciously to paganism , and ancient greek religious practice were still in vogue in the late 4th century ad , when they were outlawed by the roman emperor theodosius i in 391392 . the last recorded olympic game were held in 393 , and many temple were destroyed or damaged in the century that followed . in athens and rural area , paganism is attested well into the sixth century ad and even later . the closure of the neoplatonism academy of athens by the emperor justinian in 529 is considered by many to mark the end of antiquity , although there is evidence that the academy continued it activity for some time after that . some remote area such a the southeastern peloponnese remained pagan until well into the 10th century ad . </s> <section_title_start> medieval period ( 4th 15th century ) <section_title_end> </s> the roman empire in the east , following the decline of the roman empire in the 5th century , is conventionally known a the byzantine empire ( but wa simply called `` kingdom of the roman `` in it own time ) and lasted until 1453 . with it capital in constantinople , it language and culture were greek and it religion wa predominantly eastern orthodox church . </s> from the 4th century , the empire 's balkan territory , including greece , suffered from the dislocation of migration period . the raid and devastation of the goth and hun in the 4th and 5th century and the south slav invasion of greece in the 7th century resulted in a dramatic collapse in imperial authority in the greek peninsula . following the slavic invasion , the imperial government retained formal control of only the island and coastal area , particularly the densely populated walled city such a athens , corinth and thessalonica , while some mountainous area in the interior held out on their own and continued to recognise imperial authority . outside of these area , a limited amount of slavic settlement is generally thought to have occurred , although on a much smaller scale than previously thought . however , the view that greece in late antiquity underwent a crisis of decline , fragmentation and depopulation is now considered outdated , a greek city show a high degree of institutional continuity and prosperity between the 4th and 6th century ad ( and possibly later a well ) . in the early 6th century , greece had approximately 80 city according to the synecdemus chronicle , and the period from the 4th to the 7th century ad is considered one of high prosperity not just in greece but in the entire eastern mediterranean . </s> until the 8th century almost all of modern greece wa under the jurisdiction of the holy see of rome according to the system of pentarchy . byzantine emperor leo iii moved the border of the patriarchate of constantinople westward and northward in the 8th century . </s> the byzantine recovery of lost province began toward the end of the 8th century and most of the greek peninsula came under imperial control again , in stage , during the 9th century . this process wa facilitated by a large influx of greek from sicily and asia minor to the greek peninsula , while at the same time many slav were captured and re-settled in asia minor and the few that remained were assimilated . during the 11th and 12th century the return of stability resulted in the greek peninsula benefiting from strong economic growth ; much stronger than that of the anatolian territory of the empire . during that time , the greek orthodox church wa also instrumental in the spread of greek idea to the wider orthodoxy . </s> following the fourth crusade and the fall of constantinople to the `` latin empire `` in 1204 mainland greece wa split between the greek despotate of epirus # foundation ( a byzantine successor state ) and kingdom of france rule ( known a the frankokratia ) , while some island came under republic of venice rule . the re-establishment of the byzantine imperial capital in constantinople in 1261 wa accompanied by the empire 's recovery of much of the greek peninsula , although the frankish principality of achaea in the peloponnese and the rival greek despotate of epirus in the north both remained important regional power into the 14th century , while the island remained largely under genoese and venetian control . during the byzantine empire under the palaiologos dynasty ( 12611453 ) a new era of greek patriotism emerged accompanied by a turning back to ancient greece . </s> a such prominent personality at the time also proposed changing the imperial title to `` emperor of the hellene `` , and , in late fourteenth century , the emperor wa frequently referred to a the `` emperor of the hellene `` . similarly , in several international treaty of that time the byzantine emperor is styled a `` imperator graecorum `` . </s> in the 14th century , much of the greek peninsula wa lost by the byzantine empire at first to the serb and then to the ottoman . by the beginning of the 15th century , the ottoman advance meant that byzantine territory in greece wa limited mainly to it then-largest city , thessaloniki , and the peloponnese ( despotate of the morea ) . after the fall of constantinople to the ottoman in 1453 , the morea wa one of the last remnant of the byzantine empire to hold out against the ottoman . however , this , too , fell to the ottoman in 1460 , completing the ottoman conquest of mainland greece . with the turkish conquest , many byzantine greek scholar , who up until then were largely responsible for preserving classical greece knowledge , fled to the west , taking with them a large body of literature and thereby significantly greek scholar in the renaissance . </s> <section_title_start> venetian possession and ottoman rule ( 15th century 1821 ) <section_title_end> </s> while most of mainland greece and the aegean island wa under ottoman control by the end of the 15th century , cyprus and crete remained republic of venice territory and did not fall to the ottoman until 1571 and 1670 respectively . the only part of the greek-speaking world that escaped long-term ottoman rule wa the ionian island , which remained venetian until their capture by the first french republic in 1797 , then passed to the united kingdom of great britain and ireland in 1809 until their unification with greece in 1864. </s> while some greek in the ionian island and constantinople lived in prosperity , and greek of constantinople ( phanariotes ) achieved position of power within the ottoman administration , much of the population of mainland greece suffered the economic consequence of the ottoman conquest . heavy tax were enforced , and in later year the ottoman empire enacted a policy of creation of hereditary estate , effectively turning the rural greek population into serfdom . </s> the greek orthodox church and the ecumenical patriarchate of constantinople were considered by the ottoman government a the ruling authority of the entire eastern orthodox church population of the ottoman empire , whether ethnically greek or not . although the ottoman state did not force non-muslims to convert to islam , christian faced several type of discrimination intended to highlight their inferior status in the ottoman empire . discrimination against christian , particularly when combined with harsh treatment by local ottoman authority , led to conversion to islam , if only superficially . in the 19th century , many `` crypto-christians `` returned to their old religious allegiance . </s> the nature of ottoman administration of greece varied , though it wa invariably arbitrary and often harsh . some city had governor appointed by the ottoman sultan , while others ( like athens ) were self-governed municipality . mountainous region in the interior and many island remained effectively autonomous from the central ottoman state for many century . </s> when military conflict broke out between the ottoman empire and other state , greek usually took up arm against the ottoman , with few exception . prior to the greek revolution of 1821 , there had been a number of war which saw greek fight against the ottoman , such a the greek participation in the battle of lepanto in 1571 , the epirus peasant ' revolt of 16001601 ( led by the orthodox bishop dionysios skylosophos ) , the morean war of 16841699 , and the russian empire-instigated orlov revolt in 1770 , which aimed at breaking up the ottoman empire in favour of russian interest . these uprising were put down by the ottoman with great bloodshed . on the other side , many greek were conscripted a ottoman citizen to serve in the ottoman army ( and especially the ottoman navy ) , while also the ecumenical patriarchate of constantinople , responsible for the orthodox , remained in general loyal to the empire . </s> the 16th and 17th century are regarded a something of a `` dark age `` in greek history , with the prospect of overthrowing ottoman rule appearing remote with only the ionian island remaining free of turkish domination . corfu withstood three major siege in siege of corfu ( 1537 ) , 1571 and siege of corfu ( 1716 ) # the siege of corfu all of which resulted in the repulsion of the ottoman . however , in the 18th century , due to their mastery of shipping and commerce , a wealthy and dispersed greek merchant class arose . these merchant came to dominate trade within the ottoman empire , establishing community throughout the mediterranean , the balkan , and western europe . though the ottoman conquest had cut greece off from significant european intellectual movement such a the reformation and the age of enlightenment , these idea together with the ideal of the french revolution and romantic nationalism began to penetrate the greek world via the mercantile diaspora . in the late 18th century , riga feraios , the first revolutionary to envision an independent greek state , published a series of document relating to greek independence , including but not limited to a national anthem and the first detailed map of greece , in vienna . feraios wa murdered by ottoman agent in 1798. </s> <section_title_start> modern period <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> greek war of independence ( 18211832 ) <section_title_end> </s> in the late eighteenth century , an increase in secular learning during the modern greek enlightenment led to the revival among greek of the diaspora of the greek nationalism tracing it existence to ancient greece , distinct from the other orthodox people , and having a right to political autonomy . one of the organization formed in this intellectual milieu wa the filiki eteria , a secret organization formed by merchant in odessa in 1814 . appropriating a long-standing tradition of eastern orthodox church messianic prophecy aspiring to the resurrection of the eastern roman empire and creating the impression they had the backing of russian empire , they managed amidst a crisis of ottoman trade , from 1815 onwards , to engage traditional stratum of the greek orthodox world in their liberal nationalist cause . the filiki eteria planned to launch revolution in the peloponnese , the danubian principality and constantinople . the first of these revolt began on 6 march 1821 in the danubian principality under the leadership of alexander ypsilantis ( 17921828 ) , but it wa soon put down by the ottoman . the event in the north spurred the greek of the peloponnese into action and on 17 march 1821 the maniots declared war on the ottoman . </s> by the end of the month , the peloponnese wa in open revolt against the ottoman and by october 1821 the greek under theodoros kolokotronis had captured tripoli , greece . the peloponnesian revolt wa quickly followed by revolt in crete , macedonia ( greece ) and central greece , which would soon be suppressed . meanwhile , the makeshift greek navy wa achieving success against the ottoman navy in the aegean sea and prevented ottoman reinforcement from arriving by sea . in 1822 and 1824 the turk and egyptian ravaged the island , including chios massacre and destruction of psara , committing wholesale massacre during the greek revolution of the population . approximately three-quarters of the chios ' greek population of 120,000 were chios massacre killed , enslaved or died of disease . this had the effect of galvanizing public opinion in western europe in favour of the greek rebel . </s> tension soon developed among different greek faction , leading to two consecutive civil war . meanwhile , the ottoman sultan negotiated with mehmet ali of egypt , who agreed to send his son ibrahim pasha of egypt to greece with an army to suppress the revolt in return for territorial gain . ibrahim landed in the peloponnese in february 1825 and had immediate success : by the end of 1825 , most of the peloponnese wa under egyptian control , and the city of missolonghiput under siege by the turk since april 1825fell in april 1826 . although ibrahim wa defeated in mani peninsula , he had succeeded in suppressing most of the revolt in the peloponnese and athens had been retaken . </s> after year of negotiation , three great power , bourbon restoration , russian empire , and the united kingdom , decided to intervene in the conflict and each nation sent a navy to greece . following news that combined ottomanegyptian fleet were going to attack the greek island of hydra , saronic island , the allied fleet intercepted the ottomanegyptian fleet at pylos . a week-long standoff ended with the battle of navarino ( 20 october 1827 ) which resulted in the destruction of the ottomanegyptian fleet . a morea expedition wa dispatched to supervise the evacuation of the egyptian army from the peloponnese , while the greek proceeded to the captured part of central greece by 1828 . a a result of year of negotiation , the first hellenic republic wa finally recognised under the london protocol ( 1830 ) in 1830. </s> <section_title_start> kingdom of greece <section_title_end> </s> in 1827 , ioannis kapodistrias , from corfu , wa chosen by the third national assembly at troezen a the first governor of the first hellenic republic . kapodistrias established a series of state , economic and military institution . soon tension appeared between him and local interest . following his assassination in 1831 and the subsequent london conference of 1832 a year later , the great power of britain , france and russia installed bavarian prince otto of greece a kingdom of greece ( wittelsbach ) . otto 's reign wa despotism , and in it first 11 year of independence greece wa ruled by a bavarian oligarchy led by joseph ludwig von armansperg a prime minister of greece and , later , by otto himself , who held the title of both king and premier . throughout this period greece remained under the influence of it three protecting great power , july monarchy , russian empire , and the united kingdom , a well a kingdom of bavaria . in 1843 an uprising forced the king to grant a constitution and a representative assembly . </s> despite the absolute monarchy of otto 's reign , the early year proved instrumental in creating institution which are still the bedrock of greek administration and education . important step were taken in the creation of the education system , maritime and postal communication , effective civil administration and , most importantly , the legal code . historical revisionism took the form of de-byzantine empire and de-ottoman empire , in favour of promoting the country 's ancient greece heritage . in this spirit , the national capital wa moved from nafplio , where it had been since 1829 , to athens , which wa at the time a village . religious reform also took place , and the church of greece wa established a greece 's national church , although otto remained a catholic church . 25 march , the day of annunciation , wa chosen a the anniversary of the greek war of independence in order to reinforce the link between greek identity and orthodoxy . pavlos karolidis called the bavarian effort to create a modern state in greece a `` not only appropriate for the people ' need , but also based on excellent administrative principle of the era `` . </s> otto wa deposed in the 23 october 1862 revolution . multiple cause led to his deposition and exile , including the bavarian-dominated government , heavy taxation , and a failed attempt to annex crete from the ottoman empire . the catalyst for the revolt wa otto 's dismissal of konstantinos kanaris from the premiership . a year later , he wa replaced by prince wilhelm ( william ) of denmark , who took the name george i of greece and brought with him the ionian island a a coronation gift from britain . a greek constitution of 1864 changed greece 's form of government from constitutional monarchy to the more democratic crowned republic . in 1875 the concept of parliamentary majority a a requirement for the formation of a government wa introduced by charilaos trikoupis , curbing the power of the monarchy to appoint minority government of it preference . </s> corruption , coupled with trikoupis ' increased spending to fund infrastructure project like the corinth canal , overtaxed the weak greek economy and forced the declaration of sovereign default in 1893 . greece also accepted the imposition of an international financial control authority to pay off the country 's debtor . another political issue in 19th-century greece wa uniquely greek : the language question . the greek people spoke a form of greek called modern greek . many of the educated elite saw this a a peasant dialect and were determined to restore the glory of ancient greek . </s> government document and newspaper were consequently published in katharevousa ( purified ) greek , a form which few ordinary greek could read . liberal favoured recognising demotic a the national language , but conservative and the orthodox church resisted all such effort , to the extent that , when the new testament wa translated into demotic in 1901 , riot erupted in athens and the government fell ( the evangeliaka ) . this issue would continue to plague greek politics until the 1970s . </s> all greek were united , however , in their determination to liberate the region of ancient greece under ottoman rule . especially in crete , a cretan revolt ( 18661869 ) prolonged revolt in 18661869 had raised nationalist fervour . when war broke out between russo-turkish war ( 18771878 ) , greek popular sentiment rallied to russia 's side , but greece wa too poor and too concerned about british intervention , to officially enter the war . nevertheless , in 1881 , thessaly and small part of epirus ( region ) were ceded to greece a part of the treaty of berlin , 1878 , while frustrating greek hope of receiving crete . </s> greek in crete continued to stage regular revolt , and in 1897 , the greek government under theodoros deligiannis , bowing to popular pressure , declared war on the ottoman . in the ensuing greco-turkish war ( 1897 ) greco-turkish war of 1897 , the badly trained and equipped greek army wa defeated by the ottoman . through the intervention of the great power , however , greece lost only a little territory along the border to turkey , while crete wa established a an cretan state under prince george of greece . with state coffer empty , fiscal policy came under international financial control . alarmed by the abortive ilinden uprising of the autonomism ( political doctrine ) internal macedonian revolutionary organization ( imro ) in 1903 , the greek government , aiming to quell komitadjis ( imro band ) and detach the slavic speaker in ottoman macedonia from bulgarian macedonian influence , sponsored a guerrilla warfare campaign in ottoman-ruled macedonia ( region ) , led by greek officer and known a the macedonian struggle , which ended with the young turk revolution in 1908. </s> <section_title_start> expansion , disaster , and reconstruction <section_title_end> </s> amidst general dissatisfaction with the seeming inertia and unattainability of megali idea under the premiership of the cautious reformist georgios theotokis , a group of military officer organised a goudi coup in august 1909 and shortly thereafter called to athens cretan state politician eleftherios venizelos , who conveyed a vision of national regeneration . after winning greek legislative election , august 1910 greek legislative election , november 1910 and becoming prime minister in 1910 , venizelos initiated wide-ranging fiscal , social , and greek constitution of 1911 , reorganised the military , made greece a member of the balkan league , and led the country through the balkan war . by 1913 , greece 's territory and population had almost doubled , annexing crete , epirus ( region ) , and macedonia ( greece ) . in the following year , the struggle between constantine i of greece and charismatic venizelos over the country 's foreign policy on the eve of first world war dominated the country 's political scene and divided the country into national schism . during part of the ww1 , greece had two government : a royalist central power pro-german one in athens and a venizelism pro-triple entente one in thessaloniki . the two government were united in 1917 , when greece officially entered the war on the side of the entente . </s> in the aftermath of world war i , greece attempted further expansion into asia minor , a region with a large native greek population at the time , but wa defeated in the greco-turkish war ( 191922 ) greco-turkish war of 19191922 , contributing to a massive flight of ottoman greek . these event overlapped , with both happening during the greek genocide ( 19141922 ) , a period during which , according to various source , ottoman and turkish official contributed to the death of several hundred thousand asia minor greek , along with similar number of assyrian genocide and a rather larger number of armenian genocide . the resultant greek exodus from asia minor wa made permanent , and expanded , in an official population exchange between greece and turkey . the exchange wa part of the term of the treaty of lausanne which ended the war . </s> the following era wa marked by instability , a over 1.5 million propertyless greek refugee from turkey had to be integrated into greek society . cappadocian greek , pontian greek , and antiochian greek non-greek follower of greek orthodoxy were all subject to the exchange a well . some of the refugee could not speak the language and were from what had been unfamiliar environment to mainland greek , such a in the case of the cappadocians and non-greeks . the refugee also made a dramatic post-war population boost , a the number of refugee wa more than a quarter of greece 's prior population . </s> following the catastrophic event in asia minor , the monarchy wa abolished greek republic referendum , 1924 in 1924 and the second hellenic republic wa declared . in 1935 , a royalist general-turned-politician georgios kondylis took power after a coup d'tat and abolished the republic , holding greek monarchy referendum , 1935 , after which george ii of greece returned to greece and wa restored to the throne . </s> <section_title_start> dictatorship , world war ii , and reconstruction <section_title_end> </s> an agreement between prime minister ioannis metaxas and the head of state george ii of greece followed in 1936 , which installed metaxas a the head of a dictatorial regime known a the 4th of august regime , inaugurating a period of authoritarian rule that would last , with short break , until 1974 . although a dictatorship , greece remained on good term with britain and wa not allied with the axis power . </s> on 28 october 1940 , kingdom of italy demanded the surrender of greece , but the greek administration refused , and , in the following greco-italian war , greece repelled italian force into albania , giving the ally of world war ii their first victory over axis force on land . the greek struggle and victory against the italian received exuberant praise at the time . most prominent is the quote attributed to winston churchill : `` hence we will not say that greek fight like hero , but we will say that hero fight like greek . `` french general charles de gaulle wa among those who praised the fierceness of the greek resistance . in an official notice released to coincide with the greek national celebration of the day of independence , de gaulle expressed his admiration for the greek resistance : in the name of the captured yet still alive french people , france want to send her greeting to the greek people who are fighting for their freedom . the 25 march 1941 find greece in the peak of their heroic struggle and in the top of their glory . since the battle of salami , greece had not achieved the greatness and the glory which today hold . the country would eventually fall to urgently dispatched nazi germany force during the battle of greece , despite the fierce greek resistance , particularly in the battle of the metaxas line . adolf hitler himself recognised the bravery and the courage of the greek army , stating in his address to the reichstag on 11 december 1941 , that : `` historical justice obliges me to state that of the enemy who took up position against u , the greek soldier particularly fought with the highest courage . he capitulated only when further resistance had become impossible and useless . `` </s> the nazi proceeded to administer athens and thessaloniki , while other region of the country were given to nazi germany 's partner , fascist italy and bulgaria . the occupation brought about terrible hardship for the greek civilian population . over 100,000 civilian died of starvation during the winter of 19411942 , ten of thousand more died because of reprisal by nazi and collaboration with the axis power during world war ii # greece , the country 's economy wa ruined , and the great majority of history of the jew in greece ( ten of thousand ) were deported and murdered in nazi concentration camp . the greek resistance , one of the most effective resistance movement in europe , fought vehemently against the nazi and their collaborator . the german occupier committed german war crime # greece numerous atrocity , mass execution , and wholesale slaughter of civilian and destruction of town and village in reprisal . in the course of the concerted anti-guerrilla campaign , hundred of village were systematically torched and almost 1 million greek left homeless . in total , the german executed some 21,000 greek , the bulgarian 40,000 , and the italian 9,000. </s> following liberation and the allied victory over the axis , greece annexed the dodecanese island from italy and regained western thrace from bulgaria . the country almost immediately descended into greek civil war between communism force and the anti-communist greek government , which lasted until 1949 with the latter 's victory . the conflict , considered one of the earliest struggle of the cold war , resulted in further economic devastation , mass population displacement and severe political polarisation for the next thirty year . </s> although the post-war decade were characterised by social strife and widespread marginalisation of the left in political and social sphere , greece nonetheless experienced greek economic miracle and recovery , propelled in part by the u.s.-administered marshall plan . in 1952 , greece joined nato , reinforcing it membership in the western bloc of the cold war . </s> <section_title_start> military regime ( 196774 ) <section_title_end> </s> king constantine ii of greece 's apostasia of 1965 of george papandreou ( senior ) 's centrist government in july 1965 prompted a prolonged period of political turbulence , which culminated in a coup d'tat on 21 april 1967 by the greek military junta of 19671974 . under the junta , civil right were suspended , political repression wa intensified , and human right abuse , including state-sanctioned torture , were rampant . economic growth remained rapid before plateauing in 1972 . the brutal suppression of the athens polytechnic uprising on 17 november 1973 set in motion the event that caused the fall of the papadopoulos regime , resulting in a counter-coup which overthrew georgios papadopoulos and established brigadier dimitrios ioannidis a the new junta strongman . on 20 july 1974 , turkish invasion of cyprus in response to a greek-backed cypriot coup , triggering a political crisis in greece that led to the regime 's collapse and the restoration of democracy through metapolitefsi . </s> <section_title_start> third hellenic republic <section_title_end> </s> the former prime minister konstantinos karamanlis wa invited back from paris where he had lived in self-exile since 1963 , marking the beginning of the metapolitefsi era . the greek legislative election , 1974 since 1964 were held on the first anniversary of the polytechnic uprising . a democratic and republican constitution of greece wa promulgated on 11 june 1975 following a greek republic referendum , 1974 which chose to not restore the monarchy . </s> meanwhile , andreas papandreou , george papandreou 's son , founded the panhellenic socialist movement ( pasok ) in response to karamanlis 's conservative new democracy ( greece ) party , with the two political formation dominating in government over the next four decade . greece rejoined nato in 1980 . greece became the tenth member of the european community ( subsequently subsumed by the european union ) on 1 january 1981 , ushering in a period of sustained growth . widespread investment in industrial enterprise and heavy infrastructure , a well a fund from the european union and growing revenue from tourism , shipping , and a fast-growing service sector raised the country 's standard of living to unprecedented level . traditionally strained greekturkish relation greekturkish earthquake diplomacy , leading to the lifting of the greek veto against accession of turkey to the european union turkey 's bid for eu membership . </s> the country adopted the euro in 2001 and successfully hosted the 2004 summer olympics in athens . more recently , greece ha suffered greatly from the late-2000s recession and ha been central to the related european sovereign debt crisis . due to the adoption of the euro , when greece experienced financial crisis , it could no longer devaluation it currency to regain competitiveness . youth unemployment wa especially high during the 2000s . the greek government-debt crisis , and subsequent austerity policy , have resulted in protest and social strife . </s> <section_title_start> geography and climate <section_title_end> </s> located in southern europe and southeast europe , greece consists of a mountainous , peninsular mainland jutting out into the sea at the southern end of the balkan , ending at the peloponnese peninsula ( separated from the mainland by the corinth canal of the isthmus of corinth ) and strategically located at the crossroad of europe , asia , and africa . due to it highly indented coastline and numerous island , greece ha the list of country by length of coastline in the world with ; it land boundary is . the country lie approximately between latitude 35th parallel north 34 and 42nd parallel north 42 n , and longitude 19th meridian east 19 and 30th meridian east 30 e , with the extreme point being : </s> * north : ormenio village </s> * south : gavdos island </s> * east : strongyli megistis ( kastelorizo , megisti ) island </s> * west : othonoi island </s> eighty percent of greece consists of mountain or hill , making the country one of the most mountainous in europe . mount olympus , the mythical abode of the twelve olympian , culminates at mytikas peak , the highest in the country . western greece contains a number of lake and wetland and is dominated by the pindus mountain range . the pindus , a continuation of the dinaric alp , reach a maximum elevation of at smolikas mt . smolikas ( the second-highest in greece ) and historically ha been a significant barrier to eastwest travel . </s> the pindus range continues through the central peloponnese , cross the island of kythera and antikythera and find it way into southwestern aegean , in the island of crete where it eventually end . the island of the aegean are peak of underwater mountain that once constituted an extension of the mainland . pindus is characterised by it high , steep peak , often dissected by numerous canyon and a variety of other karstic landscape . the spectacular vikos gorge , part of the vikos-aoos national park in the pindus range , is listed by the guinness book of world record a the deepest gorge in the world . another notable formation are the meteora rock pillar , atop which have been built medieval greek orthodox monastery . </s> northeastern greece feature another high-altitude mountain range , the rhodope mountain range , spreading across the region of east macedonia and thrace ; this area is covered with vast , thick , ancient forest , including the famous dadia forest in the evros ( regional unit ) , in the far northeast of the country . </s> extensive plain are primarily located in the region of thessaly , central macedonia and western thrace . they constitute key economic region a they are among the few arable place in the country . rare marine specie such a the pinniped seal and the loggerhead sea turtle live in the sea surrounding mainland greece , while it dense forest are home to the endangered brown bear , the eurasian lynx , the roe deer and the wild goat . </s> <section_title_start> island <section_title_end> </s> greece feature a list of island of greece - between 1,200 and 6,000 , depending on the definition , 227 of which are inhabited - and is considered a list of transcontinental country # non-contiguous non-contiguous transcontinental country . crete is the largest and most populous island ; euboea , separated from the mainland by the 60 ; m-wide euripus strait , is the second largest , followed by lesbos and rhodes . </s> the greek island are traditionally grouped into the following cluster : the argo-saronic island in the saronic gulf near athens , the cyclades , a large but dense collection occupying the central part of the aegean sea , the north aegean island , a loose grouping off the west coast of turkey , the dodecanese , another loose collection in the southeast between crete and turkey , the sporades , a small tight group off the coast of northeast euboea , and the ionian island , located to the west of the mainland in the ionian sea . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the climate of greece is primarily mediterranean climate , featuring mild , wet winter and hot , dry summer . this climate occurs at all coastal location , including athens , the cyclades , the dodecanese , crete , the peloponnese , the ionian island and part of the central continental greece region . the pindus mountain range strongly affect the climate of the country , a area to the west of the range are considerably wetter on average ( due to greater exposure to south-westerly system bringing in moisture ) than the area lying to the east of the range ( due to a rain shadow effect ) . </s> the mountainous area of northwestern greece ( part of epirus ( region ) , central greece , thessaly , western macedonia ) a well a in the mountainous central part of peloponnese ; including part of the regional unit of achaea , arcadia ( regional unit ) and laconia ; feature an alpine climate with heavy snowfall . the inland part of northern greece , in central macedonia and east macedonia and thrace feature a temperate climate with cold , damp winter and hot , dry summer with frequent thunderstorm . snowfall occur every year in the mountain and northern area , and brief snowfall are not unknown even in low-lying southern area , such a athens . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> phytogeography , greece belongs to the boreal kingdom and is shared between the east mediterranean province of the mediterranean region and the illyrian province of the circumboreal region . according to the world wide fund for nature and the european environment agency , the territory of greece can be subdivided into six ecoregions : the illyrian deciduous forest , pindus mountain mixed forest , balkan mixed forest , rhodope montane mixed forest , aegean and western turkey sclerophyllous and mixed forest , and crete mediterranean forest . it had a 2018 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 6.6/10 , ranking it 70th globally out of 172 country . </s> <section_title_start> politics <section_title_end> </s> greece is a unitary state parliamentary republic . the current constitution of greece wa drawn up and adopted by the fifth revisionary parliament of the hellene and entered into force in 1975 after the fall of the greek military junta of 19671974 military junta of 19671974 . it ha been revised three time since , in greek constitutional amendment of 1986 , greek constitutional amendment of 2001 and greek constitutional amendment of 2008 . the constitution , which consists of 120 article , provides for a separation of power into executive branch , legislative branch , and judicial branch , and grant extensive specific guarantee ( further reinforced in 2001 ) of civil liberty and social right . woman 's suffrage wa guaranteed with an amendment to the 1952 constitution . </s> the nominal [ of state ] is the president of greece , who is elected by the hellenic parliament for a five-year term . according to the constitution , executive power is exercised by the president and the cabinet of greece . however , the greek constitutional amendment of 1986 curtailed the president 's duty and power to a significant extent , rendering the position largely ceremonial ; most political power is thus vested in the prime minister , greece 's [ of government ] . the position is filled by the list of prime minister of greece of the list of political party in greece that can obtain a vote of confidence by the parliament . the president of the republic formally appoints the prime minister and , on his recommendation , appoints and dismisses the other member of the cabinet . </s> legislative power are exercised by a 300-member elective unicameralism . statute passed by the parliament are promulgated by the president of the republic . election in greece # election of the legislature are held every four year , but the president of the republic is obliged to dissolve the parliament earlier on the proposal of the cabinet , in view of dealing with a national issue of exceptional importance . the president is also obliged to dissolve the parliament earlier , if the opposition manages to pas a motion of no confidence . the voting age is 17. </s> according to a 2016 report by the oecd , greek display a moderate level of civic participation compared to most other developed country ; voter turnout wa 64 percent during recent election , lower than the oecd average of 69 percent . </s> <section_title_start> political party <section_title_end> </s> since the restoration of democracy , the greek party system wa dominated by the liberal-conservative new democracy ( greece ) ( nd ) and the social-democratic pasok ( pasok ) . other party represented in the hellenic parliament include the syriza ( syriza ) , the communist party of greece ( kke ) , greek solution and mera25 . </s> pasok and new democracy largely alternated in power until the outbreak of the greek government-debt crisis government-debt crisis in 2009 . from that time , the two major party , new democracy and pasok , experienced a sharp decline in popularity . in november 2011 , the two major party joined the smaller popular orthodox rally in a grand coalition , pledging their parliamentary support for a government of national unity headed by former european central bank vice-president lucas papademos . panos kammenos voted against this government and he split off from nd forming the right-wing populism right-wing populist independent greek . </s> the coalition government led the country to the greek legislative election , may 2012 . the power of the traditional greek political party , pasok and new democracy ( greece ) , declined from 43 % to 13 % and from 33 % to 18 % , respectively . the left-wing party of syriza became the second major party , with an increase from 4 % to 16 % . no party could form a sustainable government , which led to the greek legislative election , june 2012 . the result of the second election wa the formation of a coalition government composed of new democracy ( greece ) ( 29 % ) , pasok ( 12 % ) and democratic left ( greece ) ( 6 % ) party . </s> syriza ha since overtaken pasok a the main party of the centre-left . alexis tsipras led syriza to victory in the greek legislative election , january 2015 held on 25 january 2015 , falling short of an outright majority in parliament by just two seat . the following morning , tsipras reached an agreement with independent greek party to form a coalition , and he wa sworn in a prime minister of greece . tsipras called snap election in august 2015 , resigning from his post , which led to a month-long caretaker administration headed by judge vassiliki thanou-christophilou , greece 's first female prime minister . in the greek legislative election , september 2015 , alexis tsipras led syriza to another victory , winning 145 out of 300 seat and re-forming the coalition with the independent greek . however , he wa defeated in the 2019 greek legislative election by kyriakos mitsotakis who lead new democracy . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> greece 's foreign policy is conducted through the ministry of foreign affair ( greece ) and it head , the minister for foreign affair ( greece ) , currently nikos dendias . officially , the main aim of the ministry are to represent greece before other state and international organization ; safeguard the interest of the greek state and of it citizen abroad ; promote greek culture ; foster closer relation with the greek diaspora ; and encourage international cooperation . the ministry identifies two issue of particular importance to the greek state : greekturkish relation in the aegean sea and corresponding airspace and the cyprus dispute involving the turkish military force in northern cyprus of northern cyprus . </s> there is a long-standing aegean dispute over natural resource in the eastern mediterranean . turkey doe n't recognize a legal continental shelf and exclusive economic zone around the greek island . </s> additionally , due to it political and geographical proximity to europe , asia , the middle east and africa , greece is a country of significant geostrategic importance , which it ha leveraged to develop a regional policy to help promote peace and stability in the balkan , the mediterranean , and the middle east . this ha accorded the country middle power status in global affair . </s> greece is a member of numerous international organization , including the council of europe , the european union , the union for the mediterranean , the north atlantic treaty organization , the organisation internationale de la francophonie and the united nation , of which it is a founding member . </s> <section_title_start> law and justice <section_title_end> </s> the judicial system of greece is independent of the executive and the legislature and comprises three supreme court : the court of cassation ( greece ) ( ) , the council of state ( greece ) ( ) and the chamber of account ( greece ) ( ) . the judiciary system is also composed of civil court , which judge civil and penal case and administrative court , which judge dispute between the citizen and the greek administrative authority . </s> the hellenic police ( ) is the national police force of greece . it is a very large agency with it responsibility ranging from road traffic control to counter-terrorism . it wa established in 1984 under law 1481/1-10-1984 ( government gazette 152 a ) a the result of the fusion of the hellenic gendarmerie ( , chorofylaki ) and the city police ( , astynomia poleon ) force . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the hellenic armed force are overseen by the hellenic national defense general staff ( greek : ; ) , with civilian authority vested in the ministry of national defence ( greece ) . it consists of three branch : </s> * hellenic army ( ellinikos stratos , e ) </s> * hellenic navy ( elliniko polemiko navtiko , epn ) </s> * hellenic air force ( elliniki polemiki aeroporia , epa ) </s> moreover , greece maintains the hellenic coast guard for law enforcement at sea , search and rescue , and port operation . though it can support the navy during wartime , it resides under the authority of the ministry of shipping ( greece ) . </s> greek military personnel total 367,450 , of whom 142,950 are active and 220,500 are reserve . greece list of country by number of military and paramilitary personnel in the number of citizen serving in the armed force . conscription in greece is nine month for the army and one year for the navy and air force . additionally , greek male between the age of 18 and 60 who live in strategically sensitive area may be required to serve part-time in the national guard . </s> a a member of nato , the greek military participates in exercise and deployment under the auspex of the alliance , although it involvement in nato mission is minimal . greece spends over u $ 7 billion annually on it military , or 2.3 percent of gdp , the list of country by military expenditure 24th-highest in the world in absolute term , the list of country by military expenditure per caput seventh-highest on a per caput basis , and the second-highest in nato after the united state . moreover , greece is one of only five nato country to meet or surpass the minimum defence spending target of 2 percent of gdp . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> since the kallikratis programme reform entered into effect on 1 january 2011 , greece ha consisted of thirteen modern region of greece subdivided into a total of 325 municipality of greece . the 54 old prefecture of greece prefecture and prefecture-level administration have been largely retained a regional unit of greece sub-units of the region . seven decentralized administration of greece group one to three region for administrative purpose on a regional basis . there is also one autonomous area , mount athos ( agio oros , `` holy mountain `` ) , which border the region of central macedonia . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> introduction <section_title_end> </s> according to world bank statistic for the year 2013 , the economy of greece is the list of country by gdp ( nominal ) largest by nominal gdp gross domestic product at $ 242 billion and list of country by gdp ( ppp ) largest by purchasing power parity ( ppp ) at $ 284 billion . additionally , greece is the 15th largest economy in the 27-member european union . in term of per caput income , greece is ranked list of country by gdp ( nominal ) per caput or list of country by gdp ( ppp ) per caput in the world at $ 18,168 and $ 29,045 for nominal gdp and ppp respectively . the greek economy is classified a advanced and [ income economy high-income ] . </s> greece is a developed country with a high standard of living and a high ranking in the human development index . it economy mainly comprises the service sector ( 85.0 % ) and industrial sector ( 12.0 % ) , while agriculture make up 3.0 % of the national economic output . important greek industry include tourism in greece ( with 14.9 million international tourist in 2009 , it is ranked a the 7th most visited country in the european union and 16th in the world by the united nation world tourism organization ) and greek merchant navy ( at 16.2 % of the world 's total capacity , the greek merchant marine is the largest in the world ) , while the country is also a considerable agricultural producer ( including fishery ) within the union . </s> greek unemployment stood at 21.7 % in april 2017 . the youth unemployment rate ( 42.3 % in march 2018 ) is extremely high compared to eu standard . </s> with an economy larger than all the other balkan economy combined , greece is the largest economy in the balkan , and an important regional investor . greece is the number-two foreign investor of capital in albania , the number-three foreign investor in bulgaria , at the top-three of foreign investor in romania and serbia and the most important trading partner and largest foreign investor of north macedonia . greek bank open a new branch somewhere in the balkan on an almost weekly basis . the greek telecommunication company ote ha become a strong investor in yugoslavia and other balkan country . </s> greece wa a founding member of the organisation for economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) and the organization of the black sea economic cooperation ( bsec ) . in 1979 the accession of the country in the european community and the internal market ( european union ) wa signed , and the process wa completed in 1982 . greece wa accepted into the economic and monetary union of the european union on 19 june 2000 , and in january 2001 adopted the euro a it currency , replacing the greek drachma at an exchange rate of 340.75 drachma to the euro . greece is also a member of the international monetary fund and the world trade organization , and is ranked 24th on the kof globalization index for 2013. </s> <section_title_start> debt crisis ( 20102018 ) <section_title_end> </s> the greek economy had fared well for much of the 20th century , with high growth rate and low public debt ) . even until the eve of the financial crisis of 20072008 , it featured high rate of growth , which , however , were coupled with high structural deficit , thus maintaining a ( roughly unchanged throughout this period ) public debt to gdp ratio of just over 100 % . the greek crisis wa triggered by the turmoil of the 20072009 great recession , which led the budget deficit of several western nation to reach or exceed 10 % of gdp . in greece 's case , the high budget deficit ( which , after several correction and revision , wa revealed that it had been allowed to reach 10.2 % and 15.1 % of gdp in 2008 and 2009 , respectively ) wa coupled with a high public debt to gdp ratio ( relatively stable , at just over 100 % until 2007 - a calculated after all correction ) . thus , the country appeared to lose control of it public debt to gdp ratio , which already reached 127 % of gdp in 2009 . in addition , being a member of the eurozone , the country had essentially no autonomous economic and monetary union of the european union # monetary policy inflexibility . </s> finally , there wa an effect of controversy about greek statistic ( due to the aforementioned drastic budget deficit revision which led to an increase in the calculated value of the greek public debt by greek financial audit , 200910 about 10 % , i.e . , a public debt to gdp of about 100 % until 2007 ) , while there have been argument about a possible effect of greek government-debt crisis # criticism of the role of news medium and stereotyping . consequently , greece wa `` punished `` by the market which increased borrowing rate , making it impossible for the country to finance it debt since early 2010. </s> the above revision were largely connected with the fact that in the year before the crisis goldman sachs , jpmorgan chase , and numerous other bank had developed financial product which enabled the government of greece , italy , and many other european country to hide their borrowing . dozen of similar agreement were concluded across europe whereby bank supplied cash in advance in exchange for future payment by the government involved ; in turn , the liability of the involved country were `` kept off the book `` . these condition had enabled greece a well a other european government to spend beyond their mean , while meeting the deficit target set out in the maastricht treaty . </s> in may 2010 , the greece 's deficit wa again revised and estimated to be 13.6 % which wa the second highest in the world relative to gdp , with iceland in first place at 15.7 % and the united kingdom in third with 12.6 % . public debt wa forecast , according to some estimate , to hit 120 % of gdp in the same year , causing a crisis of confidence in greece 's ability pay back loan . </s> to avert a sovereign default , greece , the other eurozone member , and the international monetary fund agreed on a rescue package which involved giving greece an immediate in loan , with additional fund to follow , totaling . to secure the funding , greece wa required to adopt harsh austerity to bring it deficit under control . a second bail-out amounting to ( $ ) wa agreed in 2012 , subject to strict condition , including financial reform and further austerity measure . a debt relief wa also agreed a part of the deal . greece achieved a primary government balanced budget in 2013 , while in april 2014 , it returned to the global bond market . greece returned to growth after six year of economic decline in the second quarter of 2014 , and wa the eurozone 's fastest-growing economy in the third quarter . a third bailout wa agreed in july 2015 , after a confrontation with the newly elected government of alexis tsipras . </s> there wa a 25 % drop in greece 's gdp , connected with the bailout programme . this had a critical effect : the debt-to-gdp ratio , the key factor defining the severity of the crisis , would jump from it 2009 level of 127 % to about 170 % , solely due to the shrinking economy . in a 2013 report , the imf admitted that it had underestimated the effect of so extensive tax hike and budget cut on the country 's gdp and issued an informal apology . the greek programme imposed a very rapid improvement in structural primary balance ( at least two time faster than for other eurozone bailed-out country ) . the policy have been blamed for worsening the crisis , while greece 's president , prokopis pavlopoulos , stressed the creditor ' share in responsibility for the depth of the crisis . greek prime minister , alexis tsipras , asserted that error in the design of the first two programme which led to a loss of 25 % of the greek economy due to the harsh imposition of excessive austerity . </s> between 2009 and 2017 the greek government debt rose from 300 bn to 318 bn , i.e . by only about 6 % ( thanks , in part , to the 2012 debt restructuring ) ; however , during the same period , the critical debt-to-gdp ratio shot up from 127 % to 179 % basically due to the severe gdp drop greek government-debt crisis # effect of applied programme on the debt crisis . </s> greece 's bailouts successfully ended ( a declared ) on 20 august 2018. </s> <section_title_start> agriculture <section_title_end> </s> in 2010 , greece wa the european union 's largest producer of cotton ( 183,800 ton ) and pistachio ( 8,000 ton ) and ranked second in the production of rice ( 229,500 ton ) and olive ( 147,500 ton ) , third in the production of common fig ( 11,000 ton ) , almond ( 44,000 ton ) , tomato ( 1,400,000 ton ) , and watermelon ( 578,400 ton ) and fourth in the production of tobacco ( 22,000 ton ) . agriculture contributes 3.8 % of the country 's gdp and employ 12.4 % of the country 's labor force . </s> greece is a major beneficiary of the common agricultural policy of the european union . a a result of the country 's entry to the european community , much of it agricultural infrastructure ha been upgraded and agricultural output increased . between 2000 and 2007 , organic farming in greece increased by 885 % , the highest change percentage in the eu . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> electricity production in greece is dominated by the state-owned public power corporation of greece ( known mostly by it acronym , transliterated a dei ) . in 2009 dei supplied for 85.6 % of all electric energy demand in greece , while the number fell to 77.3 % in 2010 . almost half ( 48 % ) of dei 's power output is generated using lignite , a drop from the 51.6 % in 2009. </s> twelve percent of greece 's electricity come from hydroelectric power plant and another 20 % from natural gas . between 2009 and 2010 , independent company ' energy production increased by 56 % , from 2,709 kilowatt hour in 2009 to 4,232 gwh in 2010. </s> in 2012 , renewable energy accounted for 13.8 % of the country 's total energy consumption , a rise from the 10.6 % it accounted for in 2011 , a figure almost equal to the eu average of 14.1 % in 2012 . 10 % of the country 's renewable energy come from solar power , while most come from biomass and waste recycling . in line with the european commission 's directive on renewable energy , greece aim to get 18 % of it energy from renewable source by 2020. </s> in 2013 , according to the independent power transmission operator in greece ( ) more than 20 % of the electricity in greece ha been produced from renewable energy source and hydroelectric powerplants . this percentage in april reached 42 % . greece currently doe not have any nuclear power plant in operation ; however , in 2009 the academy of athens ( modern ) suggested that research in the possibility of greek nuclear power plant begin . </s> <section_title_start> maritime industry <section_title_end> </s> the shipping industry ha been a key element of greek economic activity since ancient time . shipping remains one of the country 's most important industry , accounting for 4.5 percent of gdp , employing about 160,000 people ( 4 percent of the workforce ) , and representing a third of the trade deficit . </s> according to a 2011 report by the united nation conference on trade and development , the greek merchant navy is the largest in the world at 16.2 percent of total global capacity , up from 15.96 percent in 2010 but below the peak of 18.2 percent in 2006 . the country 's merchant fleet rank first in total tonnage ( 202 million deadweight tonnage ) , fourth in total number of ship ( at 3,150 ) , first in both tanker ( ship ) and dry bulk carrier , fourth in the number of container ship , and fifth in other ship . however , today 's fleet roster is smaller than an all-time high of 5,000 ship in the late 1970s . additionally , the total number of ship flying a greek flag ( includes non-greek fleet ) is 1,517 , or 5.3 percent of the world 's dwt ( ranked fifth globally ) . </s> during the 1960s , the size of the greek fleet nearly doubled , primarily through the investment undertaken by the shipping magnate , aristotle onassis and stavros niarchos . the basis of the modern greek maritime industry wa formed after world war ii when greek shipping businessmen were able to amass surplus ship sold to them by the u.s. government through the ship sale act of the 1940s . </s> greece ha a significant shipbuilding and ship maintenance industry . the six shipyard around the port of piraeus are among the largest in europe . in recent year , greece ha also become a leader in the construction and maintenance of luxury yacht . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism ha been a key element of the economic activity in the country and one of the country 's most important sector , contributing 20.6 % of the gross domestic product a of 2018 . greece welcomed over 28 million visitor in 2016 , which is an increase from the 26.5 million tourist it welcomed in 2015 and the 19.5 million in 2009 , and the 17.7 million tourist in 2007 , making greece one of the world tourism ranking # europe in europe in the recent year . </s> the vast majority of visitor in greece in 2007 came from the european continent , numbering 12.7 million , while the most visitor from a single nationality were those from the united kingdom , ( 2.6 million ) , followed closely by those from germany ( 2.3 million ) . in 2010 , the most visited modern region of greece of greece wa that of central macedonia , with 18 % of the country 's total tourist flow ( amounting to 3.6 million tourist ) , followed by attica with 2.6 million and the peloponnese with 1.8 million . northern greece is the country 's most-visited geographical region , with 6.5 million tourist , while central greece is second with 6.3 million . </s> in 2010 , lonely planet ranked greece 's northern and second-largest city of thessaloniki a the world 's fifth-best party town worldwide , comparable to other city such a dubai and montreal . in 2011 , santorini wa voted a `` the world 's best island `` in travel + leisure . it neighboring island mykonos , came in fifth in the european category . there are 18 unesco world heritage site in greece , and greece is ranked 16th in the world in term of total site . 14 further site are on the tentative list , awaiting nomination . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> since the 1980s , the road and rail network of greece ha been significantly modernised . important work include the egnatia odo ( modern road ) a2 ( egnatia odo ) motorway , that connects northwestern greece ( igoumenitsa ) with northern greece ( thessaloniki ) and northeastern greece ( kipoi , evros ) ; the rioantirrio bridge , the longest suspension cable bridge in europe ( long ) , connecting the peloponnese ( rio , greece , from patras ) with aetolia-akarnania ( antirrio ) in western greece . </s> also completed are the ionia odo a5 ( ionia odo ) motorway that connects northwestern greece ( ioannina ) with western greece ( antirrio ) ; the last section of the motorway 1 ( greece ) , connecting athens to thessaloniki and evzonoi in northern greece ; a well a the motorway 8 ( greece ) ( part of the olympia odo ) in peloponnese , connecting athens to patras . the remaining section of olympia odo , connecting patras with pyrgos , ilium , is under planning . </s> other important project that are currently underway , include the construction of the thessaloniki metro . </s> the athens metropolitan area in particular is served by some of the most modern and efficient transport infrastructure in europe , such a the athens international airport , the privately run attiki odo a6 ( attiki odo ) motorway network and the expanded athens metro system . </s> most of the greek island and many main city of greece are connected by air mainly from the two major greek airline , olympic air and aegean airline . maritime connection have been improved with modern high-speed craft , including [ and catamaran ] . </s> railway connection play a somewhat lesser role in greece than in many other european country , but they too have also been expanded , with new suburban/ [ [ commuter rail connection , serviced by proastiakos around athens , towards it airport , kiato and chalcis ; around thessaloniki , towards the city of larissa and edessa , greece ; and around patras . a modern intercity rail connection between athens and thessaloniki ha also been established , while an upgrade to double line in many part of the network is underway ; along with a p.a.th.e./p . new double track , standard gauge railway between athens and patras ( replacing the old metre-gauge railway metre-gauge piraeuspatras railway ) which is currently under construction and opening in stage . international railway line connect greek city with the rest of europe , the balkan and turkey . </s> <section_title_start> telecommunication <section_title_end> </s> modern digital information and communication network reach all area . there are over of fiber optic and an extensive open-wire network . broadband internet availability is widespread in greece : there were a total of 2,252,653 broadband connection , translating to 20 % broadband penetration . according to 2017 data , around 82 % of the general population used the internet regularly . </s> internet cafs that provide net access , office application and multiplayer gaming are also a common sight in the country , while mobile internet on 3g and 4g- lte ( telecommunication ) cellphone network and wi-fi connection can be found almost everywhere . 3g/4g mobile internet usage ha been on a sharp increase in recent year . based on 2016 data 70 % of greek internet user have access via 3g/4g mobile . the united nation international telecommunication union rank greece among the top 30 country with a highly developed information and communication infrastructure . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> the general secretariat for research and technology of the ministry of development and competitiveness is responsible for designing , implementing and supervising national research and technological policy . in 2017 , spending on research and development ( r & d ) reached an all-time high of 2 billion , equal to 1.14 percent of gdp . </s> although lower than the eu average of 1.93 percent , between 1990 and 1998 , total r & d expenditure in greece enjoyed the third-highest increase in europe , after finland and ireland . because of it strategic location ,
