qualified workforce , and political and economic stability , many multinational company such a ericsson , siemens ag , motorola , coca-cola , and tesla , inc. have their regional r & d headquarters in greece . </s> greece ha several major technology park with incubator facility and ha been a member of the european space agency ( esa ) since 2005 . cooperation between esa and the hellenic national space committee began in 1994 with the signing of the first cooperation agreement . after applying for full membership in 2003 , greece became the esa 's sixteenth member on 16 march 2005 . the country participates in the esa 's telecommunication and technology activity and the global monitoring for environment and security initiative . </s> the national centre of scientific research `` demokritos `` wa founded in 1959 . the original objective of the center wa the advancement of nuclear power . today , it activity cover several field of science and engineering . </s> greece ha one of the highest rate of tertiary enrollment in the world , while greek are well represented in academia worldwide ; numerous leading western university employ a disproportionately high number of greek faculty . greek scientific publication have grown significantly in term of research impact , surpassing both the eu and global average from 2012 to 2016. </s> notable greek scientist of modern time include georgios papanikolaou ( inventor of the pap test ) , mathematician constantin carathodory ( known for the carathodory theorem ( disambiguation ) and carathodory conjecture ) , astronomer e. m. antoniadi , archaeologist ioannis svoronos , valerios stais , spyridon marinatos , manolis andronikos ( discovered the tomb of philip ii of macedon in vergina ) , indologist dimitrios galanos , botanist theodoros g. orphanides , such a michael dertouzos , nicholas negroponte , john argyris , john iliopoulos ( 2007 dirac prize for his contribution on the physic of the charm quark , a major contribution to the birth of the standard model , the modern theory of elementary particle ) , joseph sifakis ( 2007 turing award , the `` nobel prize `` of computer science ) , christos papadimitriou ( 2002 knuth prize , 2012 gdel prize ) , mihalis yannakakis ( 2005 knuth prize ) and physicist dimitri nanopoulos . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> according to the official statistical body of greece , the hellenic statistical authority ( elstat ) , the country 's total population in 2011 wa 10,816,286 . eurostat place the current population at 10.7 million in 2018. </s> greek society ha changed rapidly over the last several decade , coinciding with the aging of europe of declining fertility and rapid aging . the birth rate in 2003 stood at 9.5 per 1,000 inhabitant , significantly lower than the rate of 14.5 per 1,000 in 1981 . at the same time , the mortality rate increased slightly from 8.9 per 1,000 inhabitant in 1981 to 9.6 per 1,000 inhabitant in 2003 . estimate from 2016 show the birth rate decreasing further still to 8.5 per 1,000 and mortality climbing to 11.2 per 1,000. </s> the fertility rate of 1.41 child per woman is well below the replacement fertility rate replacement rate of 2.1 , and is one of the lowest in the world , considerably below the high of 5.47 child born per woman in 1900 . subsequently , greece 's median age is 44.2 year , the seventh-highest in the world . in 2001 , 16.71 percent of the population were 65 year old and older , 68.12 percent between the age of 15 and 64 year old , and 15.18 percent were 14 year old and younger . by 2016 , the proportion of the population age 65 and older had risen to 20.68 percent , while the proportion of those aged 14 and younger declined to slightly below 14 percent . </s> marriage rate began declining from almost 71 per 1,000 inhabitant in 1981 until 2002 , only to increase slightly in 2003 to 61 per 1,000 and then fall again to 51 in 2004 . moreover , divorce rate have seen an increase from 191.2 per 1,000 marriage in 1991 to 239.5 per 1,000 marriage in 2004. </s> a a result of these trend , the average greek household is smaller and older than in previous generation . the economic crisis ha exacerbated this development , with 350,000-450,000 greek , predominantly young adult , emigrating since 2010. </s> <section_title_start> city <section_title_end> </s> almost two-thirds of the greek people live in urban area . greece 's largest and most influential metropolitan centre are those of athens and thessalonikithat latter commonly referred to a the ( wikt : , ) with metropolitan population of approximately 4 million and 1 million inhabitant respectively . other prominent city with urban population above 100,000 inhabitant include patras , heraklion , larissa , volos , rhodes ( city ) , ioannina , agrinio , chania , and chalcis . </s> the table below list the largest city in greece , by population contained in their respective contiguous built up urban area , which are either made up of many municipality , evident in the case of athens and thessaloniki , or are contained within a larger single municipality , case evident in most of the smaller city of the country . the result come from the preliminary figure of the population census that took place in greece in may 2011. </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the greek constitution recognises eastern orthodox church a the 'prevailing ' faith of the country , while guaranteeing freedom of religious belief for all . the greek government doe not keep statistic on religious group and census do not ask for religious affiliation . according to the u.s. state department , an estimated 97 % of greek citizen identify themselves a eastern orthodox church , belonging to the greek orthodox church , which us the byzantine rite and the greek language , the original language of the new testament . the administration of the greek territory is shared between the church of greece and the patriarchate of constantinople . </s> in a 2010 eurostateurobarometer poll , 79 % of greek citizen responded that they `` believe there is a god `` . according to other source , 15.8 % of greek describe themselves a `` very religious `` , which is the highest among all european country . the survey also found that just 3.5 % never attend a church , compared to 4.9 % in poland and 59.1 % in the czech republic . </s> estimate of the recognised muslim minority of greece , which is mostly located in thrace , range around 100,000 , ( about 1 % of the population ) . some of the albanian immigrant to greece come from a nominally muslim background , although most are secular in orientation . following the greco-turkish war ( 19191922 ) 19191922 greco-turkish war and the 1923 treaty of lausanne , greece and turkey agreed to a population exchange between greece and turkey . about 500,000 muslim from greece , predominantly those defined a turkish people , but also greek muslim like the vallahades of western macedonia , were exchanged with approximately 1.5 million greek from turkey . however , many refugee who settled in former ottoman muslim village in central macedonia , and were defined a christian orthodox caucasus greek , arrived from the former russian transcaucasus province of kars oblast , after it had been retroceded to turkey prior to the official population exchange . </s> judaism ha history of the jew in greece in greece for more than 2,000 year . </s> the ancient community of greek jew are called romaniote jew , while the sephardi jew were once a prominent community in the city of thessaloniki , numbering some 80,000 , or more than half of the population , by 1900 . however , after the german occupation of greece and the holocaust during world war ii , is estimated to number around 5,500 people . </s> the catholic church community is estimated to be around 250,000 of which 50,000 are greek citizen . catholic church in greece is nominally separate from the smaller greek byzantine catholic church , which recognises the primacy of the pope but maintains the liturgy of the byzantine rite . greek old calendarists account for 500,000 follower . protestant , including the greek evangelical church and free evangelical church , stand at about 30,000 . other christian minority , such a assembly of god , international church of the foursquare gospel and various pentecostalism church of the greek synod of apostolic church total about 12,000 member . the independent free apostolic church of pentecost is the biggest protestant denomination in greece with 120 church . there are no official statistic about free apostolic church of pentecost , but the orthodox church estimate the follower a 20,000 . the jehovah 's witness report having 28,874 active member . </s> since 2017 , hellenism ( religion ) , or helenism ha been legally recognised a an actively practiced religion in greece , with estimate of 2,000 active practitioner and an additional 100,000 `` sympathiser `` . hellenism refers to various religious movement that continue , revive , or reconstruct ancient greek religion . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> the first textual evidence of the greek language date back to 15th century bc and the linear b script which is associated with the mycenaean greece . greek wa a widely spoken lingua franca in the mediterranean world and beyond during classical antiquity , and would eventually become the official parlance of the byzantine empire . </s> during the 19th and 20th century there wa a major dispute known a the greek language question , on whether the official language of greece should be the archaic katharevousa , created in the 19th century and used a the state and scholarly language , or the dimotiki , the form of the greek language which evolved naturally from byzantine greek language and wa the language of the people . the dispute wa finally resolved in 1976 , when dimotiki wa made the only official variation of the greek language , and katharevousa fell to disuse . </s> greece is today relatively homogeneous in linguistic term , with a large majority of the native population using greek a their first or only language . among the greek-speaking population , speaker of the distinctive pontic greek dialect came to greece from asia minor after the greek genocide and constitute a sizable group . the cappadocian greek dialect came to greece due to the genocide a well , but is endangered and is barely spoken now . indigenous greek dialect include the archaic greek spoken by the sarakatsani , traditionally transhument mountain shepherd of greek macedonia and other part of northern greece . the tsakonian language , a distinct greek language deriving from doric greek instead of koine greek , is still spoken in some village in the southeastern peloponnese . </s> the muslim minority of greece in thrace , which amount to approximately 0.95 % of the total population , consists of speaker of turkish language , bulgarian language ( pomaks ) and romani language . romani is also spoken by christian romani people in other part of the country . further minority language have traditionally been spoken by regional population group in various part of the country . their use ha decreased radically in the course of the 20th century through assimilation with the greek-speaking majority . </s> today they are only maintained by the older generation and are on the verge of extinction . this go for the arvanites , an albanian language-speaking group mostly located in the rural area around the capital athens , and for the aromanians and megleno-romanians , also known a `` vlachs `` , whose language is closely related to romanian language and who used to live scattered across several area of mountainous central greece . member of these group usually identify ethnically a greek and are today all at least bilingual in greek . </s> near the northern greek border there are also some slavic speaker of greek macedonia slavicspeaking group , locally known a slavomacedonian-speaking , most of whose member identify ethnically a greek . it is estimated that after the population exchange of 1923 , macedonia ( greece ) had 200,000 to 400,000 slavic language speaker . the jewish community in greece traditionally spoke ladino language ( judeo-spanish ) , today maintained only by a few thousand speaker . other notable minority language include armenian language , georgian language , and the greco-turkic dialect spoken by the urums , a community of caucasus greek from the tsalka region of central georgia and ethnic greek from southeastern greek in ukraine who arrived in mainly northern greece a economic migrant in the 1990s . </s> <section_title_start> migration <section_title_end> </s> throughout the 20th century , million of greek migrated to the greek american , greek in the united kingdom , greek australian , greek canadian , and greek in germany , creating a large greek diaspora . net migration started to show positive number from the 1970s , but until the beginning of the 1990s , the main influx wa that of returning greek migrant or of pontic greek and others from greek in russia , greek in georgia , greek in turkey the greek in the czech republic , and elsewhere in the former soviet bloc . </s> a study from the mediterranean migration observatory maintains that the 2001 census recorded 762,191 person residing in greece without greek citizenship , constituting around 7 % of the total population . of the non-citizen resident , 48,560 were eu or european free trade association national and 17,426 were cypriot with privileged status . the majority come from eastern european country : albania ( 56 % ) , bulgaria ( 5 % ) and romania ( 3 % ) , while migrant from the former soviet union ( georgia , russia , ukraine , moldova , etc . ) comprise 10 % of the total . some of the immigrant from albania are from the greek in albania centred on the region of northern epirus . in addition , the total albanian national population which includes temporary migrant and undocumented person is around 600,000. </s> the greek census 2011 recorded 9,903,268 greek citizen ( 91,56 % ) , 480,824 albanian citizen ( 4,44 % ) , 75,915 bulgarian citizen ( 0,7 % ) , 46,523 romanian citizenship ( 0,43 % ) , 34,177 pakistani citizen ( 0,32 % ) , 27,400 georgia ( country ) citizen ( 0,25 % ) and 247,090 people had other or unidentified citizenship ( 2,3 % ) . 189,000 people of the total population of albanian citizen were reported in 2008 a ethnic greek from southern albania , in the historical region of northern epirus . </s> the greatest cluster of non-eu immigrant population are the larger urban center , especially the municipality of athens , with 132,000 immigrant comprising 17 % of the local population , and then thessaloniki , with 27,000 immigrant reaching 7 % of the local population . there is also a considerable number of co-ethnics that came from the greek community of albania and the former soviet union . </s> greece , together with italy and spain , is a major entry point for european migrant crisis . illegal immigrant entering greece mostly do so from the border with turkey at the evros river and the island of the eastern aegean across from turkey ( mainly lesbos , chios , ko , and samos ) . in 2012 , the majority of illegal immigrant entering greece came from afghanistan , followed by pakistani and bangladeshi . in 2015 , arrival of refugee by sea had increased dramatically mainly due to the ongoing syrian civil war . there were 856,723 arrival by sea in greece , an almost fivefold increase to the same period of 2014 , of which the syrian represent almost 45 % . the majority of refugee and migrant use greece a a transit country , while their intended destination are northern european nation such a austria , germany and sweden . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> greek have a long tradition of valuing and investing in paideia ( education ) , which wa upheld a one of the highest societal value in the greek and hellenistic world . the first european institution described a a university wa founded in fifth-century constantinople and continued operating in various incarnation until the fall of constantinople city 's fall to the ottoman in 1453 . the university of constantinople wa christian europe 's first secular institution of higher learning , and by some measure wa the world 's first university . </s> compulsory education in greece comprises primary school ( , dimotik scholeio ) and gymnasium ( school ) ( ) . nursery school ( , paidiks stathms ) are popular but not compulsory . kindergarten ( , nipiagogeo ) are now compulsory for any child above four year of age . child start primary school aged six and remain there for six year . attendance at gymnasium start at age 12 and last for three year . </s> greece 's post-compulsory secondary education consists of two school type : unified upper secondary school ( , genik lykei ) and technical schoolvocational school educational school ( , `` tee `` ) . post-compulsory secondary education also includes vocational training institute ( , `` iek `` ) which provide a formal but unclassified level of education . a they can accept both gymnasio ( lower secondary school ) and lykeio ( upper secondary school ) graduate , these institute are not classified a offering a particular level of education . </s> according to the framework law ( 3549/2007 ) , public higher education `` highest educational institution `` ( , antata ekpaideytik idrmata , `` `` ) consists of two parallel sector : the university sector ( university , polytechnic , fine art school , the open university ) and the technological sector ( technological education institution ( tei ) and the school of pedagogic and technological education ) . there are also state non-university tertiary institute offering vocationally oriented course of shorter duration ( 2 to 3 year ) which operate under the authority of other ministry . student are admitted to these institute according to their performance at national level examination taking place after completion of the third grade of lykeio . additionally , student over twenty-two year old may be admitted to the hellenic open university through a form of lottery . the national and capodistrian university of athens is the oldest university in the eastern mediterranean . </s> the greek education system also provides special kindergarten , primary , and secondary school for people with special need or difficulty in learning . there are also specialist gymnasium and high school offering musical , theological , and physical education . </s> seventy-two percent of greek adult aged 2564 have completed upper secondary education , which is slightly le than the oecd average of 74 percent . the average greek pupil scored 458 in reading literacy , math and science in the oecd 's 2015 programme for international student assessment ( pisa ) . this score is lower than the oecd average of 486 . on average , girl outperformed boy by 15 point , much more than the average oecd gap of two point . </s> <section_title_start> healthcare system <section_title_end> </s> greece ha universal health care . the system is mixed , combining a national health service with social health insurance ( shi ) . 2000 world health organization report , it [ care system ] ranked 14th in overall performance of 191 country surveyed . in a 2013 save the child report , greece wa ranked the 19th out of 176 country for the state of mother and newborn baby . in 2010 , there were 138 hospital with 31,000 bed , but in 2011 , the ministry for health and social solidarity ( greece ) announced plan to decrease the number to 77 hospital with 36,035 bed to reduce expense and further enhance healthcare standard . however , a of 2014 , there were 124 public hospital , of which 106 were general hospital and 18 specialised hospital , with a total capacity of about 30,000 bed . </s> greece 's healthcare expenditure a a percentage of gdp were 9.6 % in 2007 , just above the oecd average of 9.5 % . by 2015 , spending declined to 8.4 % of gdp ( compared with the eu average of 9.5 % ) , a decline of one-fifth since 2010 . nevertheless , the country maintains the highest doctor-to-population ratio of any oecd country and the highest doctor-to-patient ratio in the eu . </s> life expectancy in greece is among the highest in the world ; a 2011 oecd report placed it at 80.3 year , above the oecd average of 79.5 , while a more recent 2017 study found life expectancy in 2015 to be 81.1 year , slightly above the eu average of 80.6 . the island of icaria ha the highest percentage of nonagenarian in the world ; approximately 33 % of islander are 90 or older . icaria is subsequently classified a a `` blue zone `` , a region where people allegedly live longer than average and have lower rate of cancer , heart disease , or other chronic illness . </s> the 2011 oecd report showed that greece had the largest percentage of adult daily smoker of any of the 34 oecd member . the country 's obesity rate is 18.1 % , which is above the oecd average of 15.1 % , but considerably lower than the united state rate of 27.7 % . in 2008 , greece had the highest rate of perceived good health in the oecd , at 98.5 % . infant mortality , with a rate of 3.6 death per 1,000 live birth , wa below the 2007 oecd average of 4.9. </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the culture of greece ha evolved over thousand of year , beginning in mycenaean greece and continuing most notably into classical greece , through the influence of the roman empire and it greek eastern continuation , the eastern roman or byzantine empire . other culture and nation , such a the frankokratia , the ottoman empire , the venetian republic , the genoese republic , and the british empire have also left their influence on modern greek culture , although historian credit the greek war of independence with revitalising greece and giving birth to a single , cohesive entity of it multi-faceted culture . </s> in ancient time , greece wa the birthplace of western culture . modern democracy owe a debt to greek belief in government by the people , trial by jury , and equality under the law . the ancient greek pioneered in many field that rely on systematic thought , including biology , geometry , history , philosophy , physic and mathematics . they introduced such important literary form a epic and lyric poetry , history , tragedy , and comedy . in their pursuit of order and proportion , the greek created an ideal of beauty that strongly influenced western art history . `` greece , ancient . `` world book advanced . world book , 2012 . web . 8 july 2012. </s> <section_title_start> visual art <section_title_end> </s> artistic production in greece began in the prehistoric pre-greek cycladic civilization and the minoan civilization civilization , both of which were influenced by local tradition and the art of ancient egypt . </s> there were several interconnected tradition of painting in ancient greece . due to their technical difference , they underwent somewhat differentiated development . not all painting technique are equally well represented in the archaeological record . the most respected form of art , according to author like pliny the elder or pausanias ( geographer ) , were individual , mobile painting on wooden board , technically described a panel painting . also , the tradition of wall painting in greece go back at least to the minoan civilization and mycenaean greece bronze age , with the lavish fresco decoration of site like knossos , tiryns and mycenae . much of the figural or architectural sculpture of ancient greece wa painted colourfully . this aspect of greek stonework is described a polychrome . </s> ancient greek sculpture wa composed almost entirely of marble or bronze ; with cast bronze becoming the favoured medium for major work by the early 5th century . both marble and bronze are easy to form and very durable . chryselephantine sculpture , used for temple cult image and luxury work , used gold , most often in gold leaf and ivory for all or part ( face and hand ) of the figure , and probably gem and other material , but were much le common , and only fragment have survived . by the early 19th century , the systematic excavation of ancient greek site had brought forth a plethora of sculpture with trace of notably multicolored surface . it wa not until published finding by german archaeologist vinzenz brinkmann in the late 20th century , that the painting of ancient greek sculpture became an established fact . </s> the art production continued also during the byzantine era . the most salient feature of this new aesthetic wa it `` abstract `` , or anti-naturalistic character . if classical art wa marked by the attempt to create representation that mimicked reality a closely a possible , byzantine art seems to have abandoned this attempt in favour of a more symbolic approach . the byzantine painting concentrated mainly on icon and [ the macedonian art ( byzantine ) ] wa the artistic expression of [ [ macedonian renaissance , a label sometimes used to describe the period of the macedonian dynasty of the byzantine empire ( 8671056 ) , especially the 10th century , which some scholar have seen a a time of increased interest in classical scholarship and the assimilation of classical motif into christian artwork . </s> post byzantine art school include the cretan school and heptanese school ( painting ) . the first artistic movement in the greek kingdom can be considered the greek academic art of the 19th century ( munich school ) . notable modern greek painter include nikolaos gyzis , georgios jakobides , theodoros vryzakis , nikiforos lytras , konstantinos volanakis , nikos engonopoulos and yannis tsarouchis , while some notable sculptor are pavlos prosalentis , ioannis kossos , leonidas drosis , georgios bonanos and yannoulis chalepas . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> the architecture of ancient greece wa produced by the ancient greek ( hellene ) , whose ancient greece flourished on the greek mainland , the aegean island and their colony in antiquity , for a period from about 900 bc until the 1st century ad , with the earliest remaining architectural work dating from around 600 bc . the formal vocabulary of ancient greek architecture , in particular the division of architectural style into three defined order : the doric order , the ionic order and the corinthian order , wa to have profound effect on history of architecture of later period . </s> byzantine architecture is the architecture promoted by the byzantine empire , also known a the eastern roman empire , which dominated greece and the greek speaking world during the middle age . the empire endured for more than a millennium , dramatically influencing medieval architecture throughout europe and the near east , and becoming the primary progenitor of the renaissance architecture and ottoman architecture tradition that followed it collapse . </s> after the greek war of independence , the modern greek architect tried to combine traditional greek and byzantine element and motif with the western european movement and style . patras wa the first city of the modern greek state to develop a city plan . in january 1829 , stamatis voulgaris , a greek engineer of the french army , presented the plan of the new city to the governor ioannis kapodistrias , who approved it . voulgaris applied the orthogonal rule in the urban complex of patras . </s> two special genre can be considered the cycladic architecture , featuring white-coloured house , in the cyclades and the epirotic architecture in the region of epirus . important is also the influence of the venetian gothic architecture in the ionian island and the `` mediterranean style `` of florestano di fausto ( during the year of the fascist regime ) in the dodecanese . </s> after the establishment of the greek kingdom , the architecture of athens and other city wa mostly influenced by the neoclassical architecture . for athens , the first king of greece , otto of greece , commissioned the architect stamatios kleanthis and eduard schaubert to design a modern city plan fit for the capital of a state . a for thessaloniki , after the great thessaloniki fire of 1917 , the government ordered for a new city plan under the supervision of ernest hbrard . other modern greek architect include anastasios metaxas , lysandros kaftanzoglou , panagis kalkos , ernst ziller , xenophon paionidis , dimitris pikionis and george candilis . </s> <section_title_start> theatre <section_title_end> </s> theatre in it western form wa born in greece . the polis city-state of classical athens , which became a significant cultural , political , and military power during this period , wa it centre , where it wa institutionalised a part of a festival called the dionysia , which honoured the god dionysus . greek tragedy ( late 6th century bc ) , ancient greek comedy ( 486 bc ) , and the satyr play were the three dramatic genre to emerge there . </s> during the byzantine period , the theatrical art wa heavily declined . according to marios ploritis , the only form survived wa the folk theatre ( mimos and pantomimos ) , despite the hostility of the official state . later , during the ottoman period , the main theatrical folk art wa the karagiozis . the renaissance which led to the modern greek theatre , took place in the venetian crete . significal dramatist include vitsentzos kornaros and georgios chortatzis . </s> the modern greek theatre wa born after the greek war of independence , in the early 19th century , and initially wa influenced by the heptanesean theatre and melodrama , such a the italian opera . the nobile teatro di san giacomo di corf wa the first theatre and opera house of modern greece and the place where the first greek opera , spyridon xyndas ' the parliamentary candidate ( based on an exclusively greek libretto ) wa performed . during the late 19th and early 20th century , the athenian theatre scene wa dominated by revue , musical theatre , operetta and nocturne and notable playwright included spyridon samara , dionysios lavrangas , theophrastos sakellaridis and others . </s> the national theatre of greece wa opened in 1900 a royal theatre . notable playwright of the modern greek theatre include gregorios xenopoulos , nikos kazantzakis , pantelis horn , alekos sakellarios and iakovos kambanelis , while notable actor include cybele andrianou , marika kotopouli , aimilios veakis , orestis makris , katina paxinou , manos katrakis and dimitris horn . significant director include dimitris rontiris , alexis minotis and karolos koun . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> greek literature can be divided into three main category : ancient , byzantine and modern greek literature . </s> athens is considered the birthplace of western literature . at the beginning of greek literature stand the two monumental work of homer : the iliad and the odyssey . though date of composition vary , these work were fixed around 800 ; bc or after . in the classical period many of the genre of western literature became more prominent . lyrical poetry , ode , pastoral , elegy , epigram ; dramatic presentation of comedy and tragedy ; [ rhetorical ] treatise , philosophical dialectic , and philosophical treatise all arose in this period . the two major lyrical poet were [ [ sappho and pindar . the classical era also saw the dawn of drama . </s> of the hundred of tragedy written and performed during the classical age , only a limited number of play by three author have survived : those of aeschylus , sophocles , and euripides . the surviving play by aristophanes are also a treasure trove of comic presentation , while herodotus and thucydides are two of the most influential historian in this period . the greatest prose achievement of the 4th century wa in philosophy with the work of the three great philosopher . </s> byzantine literature refers to literature of the byzantine empire written in attic greek , medieval and early modern greek , and it is the expression of the intellectual life of the byzantine greek during the christian middle age . although popular byzantine literature and early modern greek literature both began in the 11th century , the two are indistinguishable . </s> modern greek literature refers to literature written in common modern greek , emerging from late byzantine time in the 11th century . the cretan renaissance poem erotokritos is undoubtedly the masterpiece of this period of greek literature . it is a verse romance ( heroic literature ) written around 1600 by vitsentzos kornaros ( 15531613 ) . later , during the period of greek enlightenment ( diafotismos ) , writer such a adamantios korais and riga feraios prepared with their work the greek war of independence ( 18211830 ) . </s> leading figure of modern greek literature include dionysios solomos , andreas kalvos , angelos sikelianos , emmanuel rhoides , demetrius vikelas , kostis palamas , penelope delta , yannis ritsos , alexandros papadiamantis , nikos kazantzakis , andreas embeirikos , kostas karyotakis , gregorios xenopoulos , constantine p. cavafy , nikos kavvadias , kostas varnalis and kiki dimoula . two greek author have been awarded the nobel prize in literature : george seferis in 1963 and odysseas elytis in 1979. </s> <section_title_start> philosophy <section_title_end> </s> most western philosophical tradition began in ancient greece in the 6th century bc . the first philosopher are called `` presocratics , `` which designates that they came before socrates , whose contribution mark a turning point in western thought . the presocratics were from the western or the eastern colony of greece and only fragment of their original writing survive , in some case merely a single sentence . </s> a new period of philosophy started with socrates . like the sophist , he rejected entirely the physical speculation in which his predecessor had indulged , and made the thought and opinion of people his starting-point . aspect of socrates were first united from plato , who also combined with them many of the principle established by earlier philosopher , and developed the whole of this material into the unity of a comprehensive system . </s> aristotle of stagira , the most important disciple of plato , shared with his teacher the title of the greatest philosopher of antiquity . but while plato had sought to elucidate and explain thing from the supra-sensual standpoint of the form , his pupil preferred to start from the fact given u by experience . except from these three most significant greek philosopher other known school of greek philosophy from other founder during ancient time were stoicism , epicureanism , skepticism and neoplatonism . </s> byzantine philosophy refers to the distinctive philosophical idea of the philosopher and scholar of the byzantine empire , especially between the 8th and 15th century . it wa characterised by a christianity world-view , but one which could draw idea directly from the greek text of plato , aristotle , and the neoplatonist . </s> on the eve of the fall of constantinople , gemistus pletho tried to restore the use of the term `` hellene `` and advocated the return to the olympian god of the ancient world . after 1453 a number of greek scholar in the renaissance who fled to western europe contributed to the renaissance . </s> in modern period , modern greek enlightenment ( greek : , `` enlightenment `` , `` illumination `` ) wa the greek expression of the age of enlightenment and it philosophical and political idea . some notable representative were adamantios korais , riga feraios and theophilos kairis . </s> other modern era greek philosopher or political scientist include cornelius castoriadis , nicos poulantzas and christos yannaras . </s> <section_title_start> music and dance <section_title_end> </s> greek vocal music extends far back into ancient time where mixed-gender chorus performed for entertainment , celebration and spiritual reason . instrument during that period included the double-reed aulos and the plucked string instrument , the lyre , especially the special kind called a kithara . music played an important role in the education system during ancient time . boy were taught music from the age of six . later influence from the roman empire , middle east , and the byzantine empire also had effect on greek music . </s> while the new technique of polyphony wa developing in the west , the eastern orthodox church resisted any type of change . therefore , byzantine music remained monophonic and without any form of instrumental accompaniment . a a result , and despite certain attempt by certain greek chanter ( such a manouel gazis , ioannis plousiadinos or the cypriot ieronimos o tragoudistis ) , byzantine music wa deprived of element of which in the west encouraged an unimpeded development of art . however , this method which kept music away from polyphony , along with century of continuous culture , enabled monophonic music to develop to the greatest height of perfection . byzantium presented the monophonic byzantine chant ; a melodic treasury of inestimable value for it rhythmical variety and expressive power . </s> along with the byzantine ( church ) chant and music , the greek people also cultivated the greek folk music ( demotiko ) which is divided into two cycle , the acritic song and klephtic song . the akritic wa created between the 9th and 10th century and expressed the life and struggle of the akrites ( frontier guard ) of the byzantine empire , the most well known being the story associated with digenis acritas . the klephtic cycle came into being between the late byzantine period and the start of the greek war of independence . the klephtic cycle , together with historical song , paraloghes ( narrative song or ballad ) , love song , mantinada , wedding song , song of exile and dirge express the life of the greek . there is a unity between the greek people 's struggle for freedom , their joy and sorrow and attitude towards love and death . </s> the heptanesean greek folk music # ionian island ( 'serenades ' ; sing . : ) became the forerunner of the greek modern urban popular song , influencing it development to a considerable degree . for the first part of the next century , several greek composer continued to borrow element from the heptanesean style . the most successful song during the period 18701930 were the so-called athenian serenade , and the song performed on stage ( 'theatrical revue song ' ) in revue , operetta and nocturne that were dominating athens ' theater scene . </s> rebetiko , initially a music associated with the lower class , later ( and especially after the population exchange between greece and turkey ) reached greater general acceptance a the rough edge of it overt subcultural character were softened and polished , sometimes to the point of unrecognizability . it wa the base of the later lak ( song of the people ) . the leading performer of the genre include vassilis tsitsanis , grigoris bithikotsis , stelios kazantzidis , george dalaras , haris alexiou and glykeria . </s> regarding the classical music , it wa through the ionian island ( which were under western rule and influence ) that all the major advance of the western european classical music were introduced to mainland greek . the region is notable for the birth of the first school of modern greek classical music ( ionian school ( music ) , greek : ) , established in 1815 . prominent representative of this genre include nikolaos mantzaros , spyridon xyndas , spyridon samara and pavlos carrer . manolis kalomiris is considered the founder of the greek national school of music . </s> in the 20th century , greek composer have had a significant impact on the development of avant garde and modern classical music , with figure such a iannis xenakis , nikos skalkottas , and dimitri mitropoulos achieving international prominence . at the same time , composer and musician such a mikis theodorakis , manos hatzidakis , eleni karaindrou , vangelis and demis roussos garnered an international following for their music , which include famous film score such a zorba the greek , serpico , never on sunday , america america , eternity and a day , chariot of fire , blade runner ( soundtrack ) , among others . greek american composer known for their film score include also yanni and basil poledouris . notable greek opera singer and classical musician of the 20th and 21st century include maria calla , nana mouskouri , mario frangoulis , leonidas kavakos , dimitris sgouros and others . </s> during the greek military junta of 196774 , the music of mikis theodorakis wa banned by the junta and the composer wa jailed , internally exiled , and put in a concentration camp , before finally being allowed to leave greece due to international reaction to his detention . released during the junta year , anthrope agapa , ti fotia stamata ( make love , stop the gunfire ) , by the pop music group poll ( band ) is considered the first anti-war protest song in the history of greek rock . the song wa echoing the hippie slogan make love , not war and wa inspired directly by the vietnam war , becoming a `` smash hit `` in greece . </s> greece participated in the eurovision song contest 35 time after it debut at the eurovision song contest 1974 . in eurovision song contest 2005 , greece won with the song `` my number one `` , performed by greek-swedish singer elena paparizou . the song received 230 point with 10 set of 12 point from belgium , bulgaria , hungary , the united kingdom , turkey , albania , cyprus , serbia & montenegro , sweden and germany and also became a smash hit in different country and especially in greece . the eurovision song contest 2006 wa held in athens at the olympic indoor hall of the athens olympic sport complex in maroussi , with hosted by maria menounos and saki rouvas . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> greek cuisine is characteristic of the healthy mediterranean diet , which is epitomised by dish of cretan diet . greek cuisine incorporates fresh ingredient into a variety of local dish such a moussaka , pastitsio , classic greek salad , fasolada , spanakopita and souvlaki . some dish can be traced back to ancient greece like skordalia ( a thick pure of walnut , almond , crushed garlic and olive oil ) , lentil soup , retsina ( white or ro wine sealed with pine resin ) and sesame seed candy ( candy bar with sesame seed baked with honey ) . throughout greece people often enjoy eating from small dish such a meze with various dip such a tzatziki , grilled octopus and small fish , feta cheese , dolmades ( rice , currant and pine kernel wrapped in vine leaf ) , various pulse , olive and cheese . olive oil is added to almost every dish . </s> some sweet dessert include melomakarona , diples and galaktoboureko , and drink such a ouzo , metaxa and a variety of wine including retsina . greek cuisine differs widely from different part of the mainland and from island to island . it us some flavoring more often than other mediterranean cuisine : oregano , mentha , garlic , onion , dill and bay laurel leaf . other common herb and spice include basil , thyme and fennel seed . many greek recipe , especially in the northern part of the country , use `` sweet `` spice in combination with meat , for example cinnamon and clove in stew . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> cinema first appeared in greece in 1896 , but the first actual cine-theatre wa opened in 1907 in athens . in 1914 the asty film company wa founded and the production of long film began . golfo ( ) , a well known traditional love story , is considered the first greek feature film , although there were several minor production such a newscast before this . in 1931 orestis laskos directed daphnis and chloe ( ) , containing one of the first nude scene in the history of european cinema ; it wa also the first greek movie which wa played abroad . in 1944 katina paxinou wa honoured with the academy award for best supporting actress academy award for for whom the bell toll ( film ) . </s> the 1950s and early 1960s are considered by many to be a `` golden age `` of greek cinema . director and actor of this era were recognised a important figure in greece and some gained international acclaim : george tzavellas , irene papa , melina mercouri , mihalis kakogiannis , alekos sakellarios , nikos tsiforos , iakovos kambanelis , katina paxinou , nikos koundouros , ellie lambeti and others . more than sixty film per year were made , with the majority having film noir element . some notable film include the drunkard ( 1950 film ) ( 1950 , directed by george tzavellas ) , the counterfeit coin ( 1955 , by giorgos tzavellas ) , ( 1951 , by grigoris grigoriou ) , o drakos ( 1956 , by nikos koundouros ) , stella ( 1955 film ) ( 1955 , directed by cacoyannis and written by kampanellis ) , woe to the young ( 1961 , by alekos sakellarios ) , glory sky ( 1962 , by takis kanellopoulos ) and the red lantern ( 1963 , by vasilis georgiadis ) </s> cacoyannis also directed zorba the greek with anthony quinn which received best director , best adapted screenplay and best film nomination . finos film also contributed in this period with movie such a , , madalena ( film ) , i theia ap ' to chicago , and many more . </s> during the 1970s and 1980s , theo angelopoulos directed a series of notable and appreciated movie . his film eternity and a day won the palme d'or and the prize of the ecumenical jury at the 1998 cannes film festival . </s> there are also internationally renowned filmmaker in the greek diaspora , such a the greek-french costa-gavras and the greek-americans elia kazan , john cassavetes and alexander payne . </s> more recently yorgos lanthimos ( film and stage director , producer , and screenwriter ) ha received four academy award nomination for his work , including academy award for best foreign language film for dogtooth ( film ) ( 2009 ) , academy award for best original screenplay for the lobster ( 2015 ) , and academy award for best picture and academy award for best director for the favourite ( 2018 ) . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> greece is the birthplace of the ancient olympic game , first recorded in 776 bc in olympia , greece , and hosted the modern olympic game twice , the inaugural 1896 summer olympics and the 2004 summer olympics . during the parade of nation greece is always called first , a the founding nation of the ancient precursor of modern olympics . the nation ha competed at every summer olympic game , one of only four country to have done so . having won a total of 110 medal ( 30 gold , 42 silver and 38 bronze ) , greece is ranked 32nd by gold medal in the all-time olympic game medal table all-time summer olympic medal count . their best ever performance wa in the 1896 summer olympics , when greece finished second in the 1896 summer olympics medal table with 10 gold medal . </s> the greece national football team , ranking 12th in the fifa world ranking in 2014 ( and having reached a high of 8th in the world in 2008 and 2011 ) , were crowned uefa european championship # team reaching the final in uefa euro 2004 in one of the biggest upset in the history of the sport . the superleague greece is the highest professional football league in the country , comprising sixteen team . the most successful are olympiacos f.c . , panathinaikos f.c . , and aek athens f.c .. </s> the greece national basketball team ha a decades-long tradition of excellence in the sport , being considered among the world 's top basketball power . , it ranked 4th in the fiba world ranking and 2nd in fiba europe . they have won the eurobasket twice in eurobasket 1987 and eurobasket 2005 , and have reached the final four in two of the last four fiba world championship , taking the second place in the world in 2006 fiba world championship , after a 10195 win against united state men 's national basketball team in the tournament 's semifinal . the domestic top basketball league , a1 ethniki , is composed of fourteen team . the most successful greek team are panathinaikos bc , olympiacos b.c . , aris b.c . , aek athens b.c . and p.a.o.k . b.c . p.a.o.k . greek basketball team are the euroleague # final in euroleague # title , having won 9 euroleague basketball since the establishment of the modern era euroleague final four format in 1988 , while no other nation ha won more than 4 euroleague championship in this period . besides the 9 euroleagues , greek basketball team ( panathinaikos , olympiacos , aris thessaloniki , aek athens , p.a.o.k , maroussi b.c . ) have won 3 triple crown in basketball , 5 fiba saporta cup , 2 fiba kora cup and 1 fiba eurocup challenge . after the fiba eurobasket 2005 triumph of the greek national basketball team , greece became the reigning european champion in both football and basketball . </s> the greece woman 's national water polo team have emerged a one of the leading power in the world , becoming water polo at the world aquatic championship # woman 's tournament after their gold medal win against the host china woman 's national water polo team at the water polo at the 2011 world aquatic championship ; woman 's tournament . they also won the silver medal at the water polo at the 2004 summer olympics , the gold medal at the 2005 fina woman 's water polo world league and the silver medal at the 2010 woman 's european water polo championship and 2012 woman 's european water polo championship . the greece men 's national water polo team became the third best water polo team in the world in 2005 , after their win against croatia men 's national water polo team in the bronze medal game at the 2005 world aquatic championship in canada . the domestic top water polo league , a1 ethniki water polo greek men 's water polo league and a1 ethniki woman 's water polo greek woman 's water polo league are considered amongst the top national league in european water polo , a it club have made significant success in european competition . in men 's european competition , olympiacos water polo club ha won the len champion league , the european super cup and the triple crown ( water polo ) in 2002 becoming the first club in water polo history to win every title in which it ha competed within a single year ( a1 greek water polo , greek water polo cup , champion league and european super cup ) , while nc vouliagmeni ha won the len cup winner ' cup in 1997 . in woman 's european competition , greek water polo team ( nc vouliagmeni , ano glyfada , olympiacos woman 's water polo team , ethnikos piraeus water polo club ) are amongst the most successful in european water pol , having won 4 len woman 's champion ' cup , 3 woman 's len trophy and 2 european supercups . </s> the greece men 's national volleyball team greek men 's national volleyball team ha won two bronze medal , one in the men 's european volleyball championship and another one in the men 's european volleyball league , a 5th place in the volleyball at the summer olympics and a 6th place in the fivb volleyball men 's world championship . the greek league , the a1 ethniki volleyball , is considered one of the top volleyball league in europe and the greek club have had significant success in european competition . olympiacos s.c. is the most successful volleyball club in the country having won the most domestic title and being the only greek club to have won european title ; they have won two cev top team cup , they have been cev champion league runner-up twice and they have played in 12 final four in the european competition , making them one of the most traditional volleyball club in europe . iraklis thessaloniki v.c . have also seen significant success in european competition , having been three time runner-up of the cev champion league . </s> in handball , ac diomidis argous is the only greek club to have won a ehf challenge cup . </s> apart from these , cricket is relatively popular in corfu . </s> <section_title_start> mythology <section_title_end> </s> the numerous god of the ancient greek religion a well a the mythical hero and event of the ancient greek epic ( genre ) ( the odyssey and the iliad ) and other piece of art and literature from the time make up what is nowadays colloquially referred to a greek mythology . apart from serving a religious function , the mythology of the ancient greek world also served a cosmological role a it wa meant to try to explain how the world wa formed and operated . </s> the principal god of the ancient greek religion were the dodekatheon , or the twelve god , who lived on the top of mount olympus . the most important of all ancient greek god wa zeus , the king of the god , who wa married to his sister , hera . the other greek god that made up the twelve olympian were are , poseidon , athena , demeter , dionysus , apollo , artemis , aphrodite , hephaestus , and hermes . apart from these twelve god , greek also had a variety of other mystical belief , such a nymph and other magical creature . </s> <section_title_start> public holiday and festival <section_title_end> </s> according to greek law , every sunday of the year is a public holiday . since the late '70s , saturday also is a non-school and not working day . in addition , there are four mandatory official public holiday : 25 march ( greek independence day ) , easter monday , 15 august ( dormition of the mother of god ) , and 25 december ( christmas ) . 1 may ( labour day ) and 28 october ( ohi day ) are regulated by law a being optional but it is customary for employee to be given the day off . there are , however , more public holiday celebrated in greece than are announced by the ministry of labour each year a either obligatory or optional . the list of these non-fixed national holiday rarely change and ha not changed in recent decade , giving a total of eleven national holiday each year . </s> in addition to the national holiday , there are public holiday that are not celebrated nationwide , but only by a specific professional group or a local community . for example , many municipality have a `` patron saint `` parallel to `` name day in greece `` , or a `` liberation day `` . on such day it is customary for school to take the day off . </s> notable festival , beyond the religious fests , include patras carnival , athens festival and various local wine festival . the city of thessaloniki is also home of a number of festival and event . the international thessaloniki film festival is one of the most important film festival in southern europe . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * outline of greece </s> * * outline of ancient greece </s> * index of greece-related article </s> <section_title_start> note <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> reference <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> citation state of nato </s> category : member state of the council of europe </s> category : member state of the european union </s> category : member state of the organisation internationale de la
