category : christian state </s> category : transcontinental country <article_end> <article_start> </s> dominica ( or ; kalinago language : wai tu kubuli ; dominique ; dominican creole french : dominik ) , officially the commonwealth of dominica , is an island country in the caribbean . the capital , roseau , is located on the western side of the island . it is geographically situated a part of the windward island chain in the lesser antilles archipelago in the caribbean sea . the island is located near guadeloupe to the northwest and martinique to the south-southeast . it area is , and the highest point is morne diablotins , at in elevation . the population wa 71,293 at the 2011 census . </s> the island wa settled by the arawak arriving from south america in the 5th century . the kalinago displaced the arawak by the 15th century . christopher columbus is said to have passed the island on sunday , 3 november , 1493 . it wa later colonised by european , predominantly by the french from the 1690s to 1763 . the french imported enslaved people from west africa to dominica to work on coffee plantation . kingdom of great britain took possession in 1763 after the seven year ' war , and it gradually established english a it official language . the island gained independence a a republic in 1978. </s> dominica ha been nicknamed the `` nature isle of the caribbean `` for it natural environment . it is the youngest island in the lesser antilles , and in fact it is still being formed by geothermal ( geology ) -volcano activity , a evidenced by the world 's second-largest [ spring ] , called boiling lake . the island ha lush mountainous rainforest , and it is the home of many rare plant , animal , and bird specie . there are xeric area in some of the western coastal region , but heavy rainfall occurs inland . the imperial amazon , also known a the imperial amazon and found only on dominica , is the island 's national bird and featured on the flag of dominica , which is one of only two national flag containing the colour purple ( the other being nicaragua ) . the country is a member of the commonwealth of nation , the united nation , the organization of american state and the non-aligned movement . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's name is locally pronounced with emphasis on the third syllable , related to it french name of dominique ( given name ) and the spanish pronunciation of it name . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> geologic history <section_title_end> </s> dominica first emerged from the sea during the oligocene era approximately 26 million year ago , making it one of the last caribbean island to be formed by volcanism . </s> <section_title_start> pre-colonial period and early european contact <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's precolonial indigenous inhabitant were the island carib people , who are thought to have driven out the previous arawak population . the carib called the island wai tu kubuli , which mean `` tall is her body . `` </s> christopher columbus , sailing for spain , named the island a dominica , after the latin language term dy dominica for sunday , the day on which the spanish first saw it in november 1493 . some spanish coloniser settled here . but , a european explorer and settler entered the region , indigenous refugee from surrounding island settled dominica and pushed out the spanish settler . the spanish instead settled other area that were easier to control and had more natural resource . </s> <section_title_start> french colony <section_title_end> </s> spain had little success in colonising dominica . in 1632 , the french compagnie de le de l'amrique claimed it and other `` petite antilles `` for kingdom of france , but no physical occupation took place . between 1642 and 1650 , french missionary raymond breton became the first regular european visitor to the island . </s> in 1660 , the french and english agreed that dominica and saint vincent ( island ) st. vincent should not be settled , but instead left to the carib a neutral territory . but it natural resource attracted expedition of english and french forester , who began harvesting timber . in 1690 , the french established their first permanent settlement . french woodcutter from martinique and guadeloupe began to set up timber camp to supply the french island with wood , and they gradually became permanent settler . they brought the first enslaved african from west africa to dominique , a they called it in french . </s> in 1715 , a revolt of `` poor white `` smallholder in the north of martinique , known a la gaoul , caused settler to migrate to southern dominique , where they set up smallholding . meanwhile , french family and others from guadeloupe settled in the north . in 1727 , the first french commander , m. le grand , took charge of the island with a basic french government . dominique formally became a colony of france , and the island wa divided into district or `` quarter `` . the french had already developed plantation agriculture on martinique and guadeloupe , where they cultivated sugarcane with enslaved african worker . in dominique they gradually developed coffee plantation . they imported so many african slave to fill the labour demand that the population became predominantly african in ethnicity . </s> in 1761 , during the seven year ' war in europe , a british expedition against dominica led by andrew rollo , 5th lord rollo conquered the island , along with several other caribbean island . in 1763 , france had lost the war and ceded the island to great britain under the treaty of paris ( 1763 ) . the same year , the british established a legislative assembly , with only european colonist represented . french remained the official language , but antillean creole , which had developed from it , wa spoken by most of the population . </s> in 1778 the french , with the active co-operation of the population , began the invasion of dominica ( 1778 ) re-capture of dominica . this wa ended by the treaty of paris ( 1783 ) , which returned the island to british control . but the island population , especially the class of gen de couleur , resisted british restriction . the british retained control through french invasion in 1795 and 1805 , the first taking place during the period of the haitian revolution , which gained the independence of haiti ( formerly saint-domingue , france 's richest caribbean colony ) . </s> <section_title_start> british colony <section_title_end> </s> great britain established a small colony in 1805 . it used dominica a part of the triangular trade , by which slave were imported and sold a labour in the island a part of a trade that included producing and shipping sugar and coffee a commodity crop to europe . the best documented slave plantation on the island is hillsborough estate , which had 71 male and 68 female slave . the quarry bank mill family were notable : thomas hodgson , a brother-in-law , owned a slave ship , and thomas greg and his son john greg were part-owner of sugar plantation on dominica . in january 1814 , 20 slave absconded from hillsborough . they were recorded a recaptured and punished with 100 lash applied to the male and 50 for the female . the slave reportedly said that one of their people had died in the plantation hospital , and they believed he had been poisoned . </s> in 1831 , reflecting a liberalisation of official british racial attitude , the brown privilege bill conferred political and social right on free black ( mostly free people of colour , who generally were of mixed race , with african and european ancestry ) . with the slavery abolition act 1833 , britain ended the institution of slavery throughout british empire , except in india . </s> with freedom came enfranchisement . in 1835 , the first three men of african descent were elected to the legislative assembly of dominica . many slave from the neighbouring french colonial island of guadeloupe and martinique fled to dominica . in 1838 , dominica became the first colony of the british west indie to have an elected legislature controlled by an ethnic african majority . most of these legislator had been free people of colour and smallholder or merchant before the abolition of slavery . their economic and social view were different from the interest of the small , wealthy english plantation class . reacting to a perceived threat to their power , the planter lobbied for more direct british rule . </s> in 1865 , after much agitation and tension , the colonial office replaced the elective assembly with one made up of one-half member who were elected and one-half who were appointed . planter , who were allied with colonial administrator , outmanoeuvred the elected legislator on many occasion . in 1871 , dominica became part of the british leeward island . the political power of the ethnic african population progressively eroded . crown colony government wa re-established in 1896 . all political right were curtailed for people of colour and black , who were the overwhelming majority of the population . development aid , offered a compensation for disfranchisement , resulted in negligible improvement in condition for most ethnic african . </s> <section_title_start> early 20th century <section_title_end> </s> in world war i , many dominican , mainly the son of small farmer , volunteered to fight in europe for the british empire . after the war , an upsurge of political consciousness throughout the caribbean led to the formation of the list of historical autonomist and secessionist movement # british west indie . marshaling public frustration with the lack of a voice in governing dominica , this group won one-third of the popularly elected seat of the legislative assembly in 1924 , and one-half in 1936 . in 1940 , administration of dominica wa transferred from the british leeward island to the british windward island . during world war ii , some dominican volunteered in british and caribbean force . thousand of free french refugee from martinique and guadeloupe escaped to dominica from the vichy france-controlled french island , staying in roseau and other village . </s> until 1958 , dominica wa governed a part of the british windward island . caribbean island sought independence from 1958 to 1962 , and dominica became a province of the short-lived west indie federation in 1958 . after the federation dissolved in 1962 , dominica became an associated state of the united kingdom in 1967 , and formally took responsibility for it internal affair . on 3 november 1978 , the commonwealth of dominica wa granted independence a a republic , led by prime minister patrick john . </s> <section_title_start> post-independence <section_title_end> </s> in mid-1979 , political discontent with founding prime minister patrick john 's administration climaxed in a civilian coup and ended in the passage of a motion of no confidence in the house of assembly , dominica 's legislature , against john , collapsing the john administration . a new , so-called `` interim government `` wa formed under dominica 's second prime minister oliver seraphin ; seraphin 's main task wa to prepare the country for fresh general election constitutionally due in 1980 , hence the unofficial title `` interim `` prime minister . seraphin organized and led a splinter of the dominica labour party called the democratic labour party into the 1980 general election and lost mainly because his nearly thirteen month-long premiership wa dominated by the fallout from category five hurricane david , which caused 56 death and untold damage across the island . hurricane allen the following year caused further damage . after the 1980 dominican general election , seraphin 's government wa replaced by one led by the dominica freedom party ( dfp ) under prime minister eugenia charles ; she wa the caribbean 's first female prime minister . </s> in 1981 , charles 's government wa threatened with two attempted coup . the first wa led by frederick newton , commander of the military of dominica , who organised an attack on the police headquarters in roseau which resulted in the death of a police officer . newton and five other soldier were found guilty in the attack and sentenced to death in 1983 ; the sentence of the five accomplice were later commuted to life in prison , but newton wa executed in 1986 . a second occurred later in the year when the country wa threatened with a takeover by mercenary in operation red dog , led by mike perdue and wolfgang droege . they tried to overthrow charles a prime minister and reinstall ex-prime minister john in exchange for control over the country 's development . the federal bureau of investigation wa tipped off , and the ship hired to transport the mercenary never left dock . the mercenary lacked formal military experience or training , and most of the crew had been misled into joining by the ringleader mike perdue . white supremacy don black ( white nationalist ) wa also jailed for his part in the attempted coup , which violated u neutrality act of 1794 law . </s> the charles government supported the 1983 american invasion of grenada , earning dominica praise from the reagan administration and an increase in financial aid . </s> by the middle of the 1980s , the economy had begun to recover , before weakening again due to a decrease in banana price . eugenia charles won the 1985 dominican general election general election , becoming only the first incumbent dominica prime minister to be popularly re-elected . the continuing downturn in the economy and the tight grip by eugenia charles on dominica politics gave rise to a self-titled `` third force `` political formation in 1988 , which disrupted the traditional two-party arrangement of governing dfp and opposition dlp . `` third force `` soon formalized a united worker party and selected a it leader edison james , the former general manager of the dominica banana marketing company . this wa a strategic selection given james 's prestige among banana farmer and his originating from the east or atlantic coast that had begun to feel alienated by the west or caribbean sea coast elite in roseau , dominica 's capital . eugenia charles again won the 1990 dominican general election general election , the first incumbent dominica prime minister to win three consecutive general election . however , eugenia charles 's dfp had been pushed to within one seat of losing it majority in parliament by the emergence of the uwp . it wa , therefore , no great surprise when eugenia charles gave up political leadership of the dominica freedom party in 1993 and did not contest the 1995 general election in any capacity . no longer benefiting from the veteran charismatic leadership of prime minister eugenia charles , the dominica freedom party lost the 1995 dominican general election to the united worker ' party ( dominica ) united worker ' party ( uwp ) , whose leader edison james became prime minister . james , former general manager of the dominica banana marketing company attempted to diversify the dominican economy away from over-reliance on banana . the crop wa largely destroyed by hurricane luis in 1995 . further james wa unable to restore banana to it former selling price and prestige . moreover , the james administration became embroiled in opposition charge of official corruption . </s> in the 2000 dominican general election 31 january , 2000 general election , the uwp were defeated by a coalition of the dlp , led by left-leaning rosie douglas roosevelt b . `` rosie `` douglas and the dominica freedom party led by former trade union leader , charles savarin . douglas became prime minister . one uwp member of the house of assembly crossed the floor , joining the dlp-dfp coalition government . however , douglas died on 1 october , 2000 after only a few month . prime minister douglas wa replaced by pierre charles ( dominican politician ) , who also died in office on 6 january , 2004 . roosevelt skerrit , also of the dlp , replaced pierre charles a prime minister , becoming the world 's youngest head of government at thirty-one . under skerrit 's leadership , the dlp won 2005 dominican general election that gave the party 12 seat in the 21-seat parliament , to the uwp 's 8 seat . an independent candidate affiliated with the dlp won a seat a well . later , the independent candidate joined the government . with his 2005 election win , skerrit became only the second incumbent prime minister of seven to be popularly re-elected . </s> in the 2009 dominican general election , the dlp won 18 of 21 seat . the uwp claimed campaign impropriety and embarked on a wide range of protest action , including boycott of parliament . uwp 's boycott lasted at least three unauthorized absence from parliament for two of their three elected representative in parliament in violation of parliamentary procedure , leading to their two seat being declared vacant and by-election being called to fill them ; by-election were conducted for those two vacant seat in july 2010 , and the uwp again won both seat . the dlp under skerrit went on to win the 2014 dominican general election . </s> on 17 september , 2012 eliud williams wa sworn in a president ( a largely ceremonial role ) , replacing nicholas liverpool dr. nicholas liverpool who wa reportedly removed from office due to ill health . on 30 september , 2013 former trade union leader and former dominica freedom party leader charles savarin wa elected president having only day before resigned a a minister of government . </s> tropical storm erika devastated the island in august 2015 , killing 30 and causing severe environmental and economic damage dominica wa again struck on 18 september , 2017 , suffering a direct landfall from category 5 hurricane maria . early estimate of damage suggested 90 % of the building on the island had been destroyed , with infrastructure left in ruin . the uk , france and the netherlands set up shipping and air lift to take aid to the island ; the scale of destruction having left most people homeless . </s> in december 2019 , incumbent prime minister roosevelt skerrit won his fourth consecutive general election eighteen seat to three , becoming the first dominica prime minister ever to do so . </s> <section_title_start> geography and climate <section_title_end> </s> dominica is an island nation in the caribbean sea , the northernmost of the windward island ( though it is sometimes considered the southernmost of the leeward island ) . the size of the country is about and it is about 29 mile ( 47 ; km ) long and 16 mile ( 26 ; km ) wide . </s> known a `` the nature island of the caribbean `` due to it lush scenery and varied flora and fauna , dominica is largely covered by rainforest and is home to the world 's second-largest [ spring ] , boiling lake . within it border lie two ecoregions : windward island moist forest and windward island xeric scrub . the most mountainous of the lesser antilles , it volcanic peak are cone of lava crater , the largest of these being ( north-to-south ) morne aux diables , morne diablotins ( the highest on the island at 1,447 m ) , morne trois piton and morne anglais . morne trois piton national park is a tropical forest blended with volcanic feature ; it wa recognised a a world heritage site on 4 april , 1995 , a distinction it share with four other caribbean island . the calibishie area in the country 's northeast ha sandy beach . some plant and animal thought to be extinct on surrounding island can still be found in dominica 's forest . the island ha several protected area , including list of national park of dominica , a well a 365 river . for a few year the government sought to encourage the island a an ecotourism destination , although the hurricane of 2017 ha since changed these plan . the country had a 2018 forest landscape integrity index mean score of 1.06/10 , ranking it 166th globally out of 172 country . </s> there are two primary population centre : the capital roseau ( with 14,725 inhabitant in 2011 ) and portsmouth , dominica ( with 4,167 inhabitant in 2011 ) . the main centre tend to be located around the coast , with the mountainous interior sparsely populated . </s> dominica is especially vulnerable to [ a the island is located in what is referred to a the hurricane region . in 1979 , hurricane david ] struck the island a a category ; 4 hurricane , causing widespread and extreme damage . on 17 august , 2007 , [ [ hurricane dean , a category ; 1 hurricane at the time , hit the island . a mother and her seven-year-old son died when a landslide caused by the heavy rain crushed their house . in another incident two people were injured when a tree fell on their house . prime minister of dominica roosevelt skerrit estimated that 100 to 125 home were damaged , and that the agricultural sector wa extensively damaged , in particular the banana crop . in august 2015 , tropical storm erika caused extensive flooding and landslide across the island . multiple community were evacuated and upwards of 30 people were killed . according to a rapid damage and impact assessment prepared for dominica by the world bank , the total damage and loss from the storm were u $ 484.82 million or 90 % of dominica 's yearly gdp . category 5 hurricane maria struck the island in 2017 and caused loss of approximately u $ 930 million or 226 % of gdp . </s> <section_title_start> fauna <section_title_end> </s> the imperial amazon ( amazona imperialis ) is dominica 's national bird and is endemism to it mountain forest . a related specie , the jaco or red-necked parrot ( a. arausiaca ) , is also a dominican endemic . both bird are rare and protected , though some forest is still threatened by logging in addition to the long-standing threat of hurricane . </s> dominica is home to 195 specie of bird , because of the isolated location of dominica this is a lesser number compared to trinidad which is located closer to mainland south-america with 472 bird specie . </s> the caribbean sea offshore of the island of dominica is home to many cetacean . most notably a group of sperm whale live in this area year-round . other cetacean commonly seen in the area include spinner dolphin , pantropical spotted dolphin and bottlenose dolphin . le commonly seen animal include killer whale , false killer whale , pygmy sperm whale , dwarf sperm whale , risso 's dolphin , common dolphin , atlantic spotted dolphin , [ whale ] and bryde 's whale . this make dominica a destination for tourist interested in whale-watching . </s> <section_title_start> territorial disputes <section_title_end> </s> the commonwealth of dominica is engaged in a long-running dispute with venezuela over venezuela 's territorial claim to the sea surrounding isla aves ( literally bird island , but in fact called 'bird rock ' by dominican authority ) , a tiny islet located west of the island of dominica . </s> <section_title_start> government <section_title_end> </s> dominica is a parliamentary democracy within the commonwealth of nation . the capital is roseau . the commonwealth of dominica is one of the caribbean 's few republic . the president is the [ of state ] , while executive power rest with the cabinet ( government ) , headed by the prime minister . the unicameral parliament consists of the 30-member house of assembly of dominica , which consists of 21 directly elected member and nine senator , who may either be appointed by the president or elected by the other member of the house of assembly . </s> unlike other former british colony in the region , dominica wa never a commonwealth realm , instead becoming a republic on independence . dominica is a full and participating member of the caribbean community caribbean community ( caricom ) and the organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) . </s> dominica is also a member of the international criminal court , with a bilateral immunity agreement of protection with the u military , a covered under rome statute of the international criminal court . in january 2008 , dominica joined the bolivarian alternative for the america . </s> <section_title_start> human right <section_title_end> </s> both male and female lgbt right in dominica same-sex sexual activity is illegal in dominica . </s> <section_title_start> administrative divisions <section_title_end> </s> dominica is divided into 10 parish of dominica , given below with their 2011 census population : </s> * saint andrew parish , dominica ( 9,471 ) </s> * saint david parish , dominica ( 6,043 ) </s> * saint george parish , dominica ( 21,241 ) </s> * saint john parish , dominica ( 6,561 ) </s> * saint joseph parish , dominica ( 5,637 ) </s> * saint luke parish , dominica ( 1,668 ) </s> * saint mark parish , dominica ( 1,834 ) </s> * saint patrick parish , dominica ( 7,622 ) </s> * saint paul parish , dominica ( 9,786 ) </s> * saint peter parish , dominica ( 1,430 ) </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's currency is the east caribbean dollar . in 2008 , dominica had one of the lowest per caput gross domestic product ( gdp ) rate of eastern caribbean state . the country nearly had a financial crisis in 2003 and 2004 , but dominica 's economy grew by 3.5 % in 2005 and 4.0 % in 2006 , following a decade of poor performance . growth in 2006 wa attributed to gain in tourism , construction , offshore and other service , and some sub-sectors of the banana industry . around this time the international monetary fund ( imf ) praised the government of dominica for it successful macroeconomic reform , but also pointed out remaining challenge , including the need for further reduction in public debt , increased financial sector regulation , and market diversification . </s> agriculture and especially banana once dominated dominica 's economy , and nearly one-third of the labour force worked in agriculture in the early 2000s . this sector , however , is highly vulnerable to weather condition and to external event affecting commodity price . in 2007 , hurricane dean caused significant damage to the agricultural sector a well a the country 's infrastructure , especially road . in response to reduced european union ( eu ) trade preference for banana from the former european colony after the 2009 wto decision , the government ha diversified the agricultural sector by promoting the production of coffee , patchouli , aloe vera , cut flower , and exotic fruit such a mango , guava and papaya , while the economy ha become increasingly dependent on tourism . </s> the expected increase of dominica 's immigrant investor program ( cbi ) fee ha been suspended with no implementation date in sight , a announced by prime minister roosevelt skerrit , in the 2016 budget speech . </s> <section_title_start> international trade <section_title_end> </s> dominica is a beneficiary of the caribbean basin initiative ( cbi ) that grant duty-free entry into the united state for many good . dominica also belongs to the predominantly english-speaking caribbean community ( caricom ) , the caricom single market and economy ( csme ) , and the organisation of eastern caribbean state ( oecs ) . </s> <section_title_start> financial service industry <section_title_end> </s> the commonwealth of dominica is becoming in recent year a major international financial centre . the largest sector are `` offshore banking , payment processing company , and general corporate activity `` . regulation and supervision of the financial service industry is the responsibility of the financial service unit of the commonwealth of dominica ( fsu ) under the supervision of the ministry of finance . there are a number of service provider . these include global financial institution including scotiabank , royal bank of canada , cathedral investment bank , first caribbean international bank , and the interoceanic bank of the caribbean . </s> starting in the mid-late 1990s , offshore financial centre , such a the commonwealth of dominica , came under increasing pressure from the oecd for their allegedly harmful tax regime , where the oecd wished to prevent low-tax regime from having an advantage in the global marketplace . the oecd threatened to place the commonwealth of dominica and other financial centre on a `` black list `` and impose sanction against them . however , the commonwealth of dominica successfully avoided being placed on the oecd black list by committing to regulatory reform to improve transparency and begin information exchange with oecd member country about their citizen . </s> dominica supposedly offer tax-free status to company relocating from abroad . it is not known how many company benefit from the tax-free status because of the strict confidentiality the government enforces , although it is known many internet business and [ fund ] s utilise dominica for this reason . however , on 12 july , 2012 dominica signed an agreement with poland to exchange tax information . </s> <section_title_start> economic immigrant <section_title_end> </s> the commonwealth of dominica offer an official and legally mandated economic citizenship to those seeking a valid second citizenship . the nationality law of dominica authorises the government to waive the normal requirement of seven year of legal residence to acquire citizenship in exchange for an investment into their country 's economy . the required contribution for a main applicant start at u $ 100,000 through the economic diversification fund . alternatively , since 2014 , applicant can make a u $ 200,000 minimum investment in pre-approved real estate from island exclusive resort or global brand like marriott , kempinski or hilton . according to official , the citizenship by investment ( cbi ) programme wa an economic and fiscal `` lifeline `` in the aftermath of tropical storm erika in 2015 and hurricane maria in 2017 , and it new investment option had become the main source of foreign direct investment into dominica by early 2016 . dominican citizen can travel without a visa , or obtain a visa upon entry , to nearly 140 country and territory , including the united kingdom and the schengen zone . applying for dominica citizenship requires interacting with official government approved economic citizenship agent a the first step in the application process . this program is currently valued at 16 % of the government 's total revenue . </s> the government 's management of the economic citizenship programme and an initial perceived lack of transparency in the use of the revenue generated are a frequent topic of heated domestic political controversy . referring to the opposition , prime minister skerrit in 2016 stated that `` if they can discredit the citizenship by investment program and make dominica an unattractive place to obtain citizenship , then revenue would fall and the government would not be able to rebuild the country . or , the government would then have to increase tax on the people ; making itself unpopular in their sight . `` since then , the government of dominica ha improved transparency of cbi fund . according to prime minister skerrit 's 2018-2019 budget address , the island 's cbi programme ha helped develop a national health insurance pilot that provides dominican child in critical medical condition with overseas treatment . because many resident were displaced by hurricane maria 's impact on the small caribbean island , the government pledged to build 5,000 hurricane-proof home , of which the first batch of 125 house were scheduled for occupancy in february 2019 . the cbi programme ha also significantly helped to develop and create job in the island 's ecotourism sector . furthermore , the skerrit administration set aside ec $ 5m every month for the construction of a new airport . </s> the financial time ' professional wealth management publication ranked dominica a the world 's best citizenship by investment programme in it annual cbi index . according to the report , investor choose dominica 's citizenship because it ha the most affordable investment threshold , the application process is straightforward and streamlined , while the security check each applicant is subjected to remain very strict . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> dominica is mostly volcanic and ha few beach ; therefore , tourism in dominica ha developed more slowly than on neighbouring island . nevertheless , dominica 's mountain , rainforest , freshwater lake , hot spring , waterfall , and diving spot make it an attractive ecotourism destination . cruise ship stopover have increased following the development of modern docking and waterfront facility in roseau , the capital . out of 22 caribbean island tracked , dominica had the fewest visitor in 2008 ( 55,800 or 0.3 % of the total ) . this wa about half a many a visited haiti . the volcanic nature of the island ha attracted scuba diving . </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> air <section_title_end> </s> there are two regional airport on the island , but no international airport . therefore , flying to dominica requires travelling through san juan , puerto rico or other nearby island in the caribbean such a martinique , guadeloupe , or barbados . the primary airport , douglas-charles airport ( dom ) , is on the northeast coast and is about a 45-minute drive from portsmouth ( 1 hour from roseau ) . the second is canefield airport ( dcf ) , about 15 minute from roseau on the southwest coast . douglas-charles airport is suitable for limited use of commercial jet because of runway length . douglas-charles currently ha regular service by air sunshine , winair and seaborne airline using twin turboprop aircraft like the atr ( aircraft manufacturer ) and saab 340 , a well a conviasa and amerijet , which , using boeing 727 , is the only airline with jet service to the republic . a runway extension and service upgrade project began at douglas-charles airport around 2006 and wa finished in 2010 . in march 2013 , airline american eagle halted flight to the island citing high labour cost . </s> <section_title_start> road <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's road network run primarily along the coastline and along river valley . major road are two-lane highway which connect the capital , roseau , with portsmouth ( edward oliver leblanc ) and the douglas charles airport ( dr. nicholas liverpool highway ) . it take about 45 minute to drive from portsmouth to roseau . private minibus form the major public transport system . these major road were reconstructed from the early 2010s to 2015 with assistance from the people 's republic of china and the european union . </s> due to tropical storm erika # effect in dominica several road surface and bridge were damaged by flooding and landslide , including on the just completed e.o . leblanc highway ( roseau to portsmouth ) and nicholas liverpool dr. nicholas liverpool highway ( pont ca to douglas charles airport ) . to alleviate this , the government announced that it intended to install emergency bridge in roseau valley near the trafalgar fall to wotten waven and in emshall . hurricane maria # dominica also damaged the road network . </s> <section_title_start> green energy <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's electricity sector includes power from hydroelectricity , solar energy , and geothermal energy . following on from the devastation caused by hurricane maria in september 2017 , the dominican government claimed it would invest in geothermal energy . in early march 2018 dominica signed an international solar alliance framework agreement , in an attempt to exploit solar energy to power the country with a source of renewable energy . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> the vast majority of dominican are of african descent . there is a growing mixed population along with a small european origin minority ( descendant of french and british colonist along with some people of irish descent from indentured servant ) and there are small number of lebanese , syrian and asian . dominica is also the only eastern caribbean island that still ha a population of pre-columbian native kalinago ( previously called carib ) , who were exterminated or driven from neighbouring island . there are more than 3,000 kalinago remaining . they live in eight village on the east coast of dominica . this special carib territory ( now kalinago territory ) wa granted by the british crown in 1903. </s> the population growth rate of dominica is very low , due primarily to emigration to other country . in the early 21st century , emigrant number for the most popular country are a follows : the united state ( 8,560 ) , the united kingdom ( 6,739 ) , canada ( 605 ) , and france ( 394 ) . </s> dominica had a relatively large number of centenarian . in march 2007 there were 22 centenarian out of the island 's 70,000 inhabitant three time the average incidence of centenarianism in developed country . the reason for this were once the subject of a study that formerly had been undertaken at ross university school of medicine . </s> dominica wa partially integrated into the federal colony of the leeward island in 1832 . later , in 1871 , it became a full part of the federation of the leeward island . from the start it wa a peculiar relationship for previously dominica had played no part in the political or cultural tradition of the other more anglophone island of the federation . now , a a leeward island , this much larger territory , with thousand of acre of forested unclaimed land , wa open to the people of montserrat and antigua . at the beginning of the 20th century , the rose 's company , which produced rose 's lime juice , saw demand for it product outgrow it ability to supply the product from montserrat . their response to the situation wa to buy land on dominica and encourage montserrat farm labourer to relocate . a a result , there came to be two linguistic community in dominica , wesley , dominica and marigot , dominica . </s> in 1902 , on 8 may , the mount pele volcano on martinique erupted destroying the city of saint-pierre , martinique saint-pierre . refugee from martinique arrived in boat to the southern village of dominica and some remained permanently on the island . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> english language is the official language of dominica and is universally spoken and understood . in addition , dominican creole , an antillean creole based on french language , is widely spoken . this is due to french migration to the island starting in 1690 , a majority french creole speaking population that resided on the island , and it location between the two french-speaking department of martinique and guadeloupe . since 1979 , dominica ha been a member of la francophonie . dominican creole is particularly used among the older generation , which also speaks a patois language . because of a decline in the use of creole by the younger generation , initiative have been set up in an effort to increase usage and promote this unique part of the nation 's history and culture . </s> along with creole , a dialect known a kokoy ( or cockoy ) is spoken . it is a type of list of english-based pidgin which is a mix of leeward island english creole and dominican creole , and is mainly spoken in the north-eastern village of marigot and wesley , by the descendant of immigrant from montserrat and antigua . over time there ha been much intermarrying , but there are still trace of difference in origin . a a result of this mixture of language and heritage , dominica is a member of both the french-speaking francophonie and the english-speaking commonwealth of nation . </s> island carib language , also known a igneri ( ieri , igeri , inyeri ) , wa an arawakan language historically spoken by the island carib of the lesser antilles in the caribbean . the island carib lived throughout the southern lesser antilles such a dominica , saint vincent and the grenadine and trinidad and tobago , supposedly having conquered them from their previous inhabitant , the igneri . island carib became extinct about 1920 , but an offshoot survives a garifuna language , primarily in central america . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> 61.4 % of the population is roman catholic , though in recent year a number of protestant church have been established . about 1012 % of the population belongs to one of the seventh-day adventist theology seventh-day ( saturday ) denomination , which includes yahweh congregation , church of god ( seventh-day ) , and the seventh-day adventist church . </s> according to the association of religion data archive , in 2010 the world christian database reported that the largest non-christian religious group included : spiritualism followed by 2.6 % of the population ; bah faith followed by 1.7 % ; agnosticism followed by 0.5 % ; buddhism , hinduism , and islam , each followed by 0.1 % ; and chinese folk religion , neoreligions , and atheism each followed by non-negligible proportion ( i.e . , < 0.1 % ) of the population . the nation 's first mosque wa built near ross university . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> school in dominica is mandatory up to secondary school . after pre-school , pupil attend primary school for six or seven year , and are admitted into secondary school on the basis of a common entrance exam . after five year the student take the general certificate of education ( gce ) , widely replaced by the current caribbean secondary education certificate administered by the caribbean examination council ( a 15-member confederation of the caribbean community ( caricom ) . the more advanced version of this examination , cape , can be taken upon completion of two year of community college . the island ha it own dominica state college , formerly named clifton dupigny community college . some dominican attend university in cuba on scholarship offered by it government ; others go to the university of the west indie or to university in the united kingdom , the united state , or other country . </s> archbold tropical research and education center , a biological field station owned by clemson university , is located at springfield estate between canefield and pont ca . in 2006 all saint university school of medicine opened in temporary facility in loubire , it wa later located in roseau , dominica . a marine biology institute in mahaut , dominica , the institute for tropical marine ecology , closed in 2009. </s> ross university school of medicine wa located at portsmouth , dominica . ross had been operating in dominica since the 1980s . there used to be a thousand medical student arriving annually from the united state and canada who studied at ross university , but the campus wa permanently relocated to barbados at the beginning of the 2019 spring semester due to extensive hurricane damage suffered at the dominican campus . </s> the dominica library and information service serf an integral role in the education of the citizen of the country . the creation of a public library in dominica did not come easily though the impetus wa a noble one that would help `` the coloured people ... [ improve ] their lot a they moved along the path to complete freedom ... ( borom , 203 ) . the dominican library began a a reading room that would evolve into a free and public library that wa n't fully free : patron were required to pay a subscription fee . surviving religious and political discord , the great depression , and two world war , the library finally came under the care of the government where fund were set aside for it upkeep . ironically , the early stage of the library 's history were dedicated to remove the `` uncouth `` , and `` barbarous patois `` , which today is being preserved . however , it did achieve it goal of `` diminishing the island s very high percentage of illiteracy `` ( pg . 225 ) . however , the historical library wa demolished in the wake on hurricane maria in 2018 , and slated to be rebuilt with a more modern outlook . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> dominica is home to a wide range of people . although it wa historically occupied by several native tribe , the arawak people ( tainos ) and carib ( kalinago ) tribe occupied it at the time european settler reached the island . `` massacre river ( dominica ) `` is a name of a river dedicated to the kalinago genocide of 1626 by english settler on st. kitts -the survivor were forced into exile on dominica . both the french and british tried to claim the island and imported slave from africa for labour . the remaining carib now live on a territory on the east coast of the island . they elect their own chief . this mix of culture ha produced the current culture . </s> music and dance are important facet of dominica 's culture . the annual independence celebration display a variety of traditional song and dance . since 1997 , there have also been week of creole festival , such a `` creole in the park `` and the `` world creole music festival `` . </s> dominica gained prominence on the international music stage when in 1973 , gordon henderson ( musician ) founded the group exile one and an original musical genre , which he coined `` cadence-lypso `` . this paved the way for modern creole music . other musical genre include `` jing ping `` and `` cadence rampa `` . jing ping feature the accordion and is native to the island . dominica 's music is a mlange of haitian , afro-cuban , african and european tradition . popular artist over the year include chubby and the midnight groover , bell combo , the gaylords , windward caribbean kulture , and triple kay . </s> the 11th annual world creole music festival wa held in 2007 , part of the island 's celebration of independence from great britain on 3 november . a year-long reunion celebration began in january 2008 , marking 30 year of independence . </s> dominica is often seen a a society that is migrating from collectivism to that of individualism . the economy is a developing one that previously depended on agriculture . sign of collectivism are evident in the small town and village which are spread across the island . </s> the novelist jean rhys wa born and raised in dominica . the island is obliquely depicted in her best-known book , wide sargasso sea . rhys 's friend , the political activist and writer phyllis shand allfrey , set her 1954 novel , the orchid house ( novel ) , in dominica . </s> much of the walt disney picture film pirate of the caribbean : dead man 's chest ( the second in the series , released in 2006 ) , wa shot on location on dominica ( though in the film it wa known a `` pelegosto `` , a fictional island ) , along with some shooting for the third film in the series , pirate of the caribbean : at world 's end at world 's end ( 2007 ) . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> dominica 's cuisine is similar to that of other caribbean island , particularly jamaica , saint lucia and trinidad and tobago . like other commonwealth caribbean island , dominican have developed a distinct twist to their cuisine . breakfast is an important daily meal , typically including saltfish , dried and salted codfish , and `` bakes `` ( fried dough ) . saltfish and bakes are combined for a fast food snack that can be eaten throughout the day ; vendor on dominica 's street sell these snack to passersby , together with fried chicken , fish and fruit and yogurt `` smoothy `` . other breakfast meal include cornmeal porridge , which is made with fine cornmeal or polenta , milk or condensed milk , and sugar to sweeten . traditional british-influenced dish , such a egg , bacon and toast , are also popular , a are fried fish and plantain ( cooking ) . </s> common vegetable include plantain ( cooking ) , tanias ( a root vegetable ) , sweet potato , potato , rice and pea . meat and poultry typically eaten include chicken , beef and fish . these are often prepared in stew with onion , carrot , garlic , ginger and herb . the vegetable and meat are browned to create a rich dark sauce . popular meal include rice and pea , brown stew chicken , stew beef , fried and stewed fish , and many different type of hearty fish broth and soup . these are filled with dumpling , carrot and ground provision . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> cricket is a popular sport on the island , and dominica competes in test cricket a part of the west indie cricket team . in west indie domestic first-class cricket , dominica participates a part of the windward island cricket team , although they are often considered a part of the leeward island geographically . this is due to being part of the british windward island colony from 1940 until independence ; it cricket federation remains a part of the windward island cricket board of control . </s> on 24 october , 2007 , the 8,000-seat windsor park ( dominica ) wa completed with a donation of ec $ 33 ; million ( u $ 17 ; million , euro 12 ; million ) from the government of the people 's republic of china . </s> netball , basketball , rugby football , tennis and association football are gaining popularity a well . </s> during the 2014 winter olympics , a husband and wife team of gary di silvestri and angela morrone di silvestri spent u $ 175,000 to register a dominican citizen and enter the 15 ; km men 's and 10 ; km woman 's cross-country skiing at the 2014 winter olympics cross-country skiing event , respectively . angela did not start her race , and gary pulled out several hundred meter into his race . to date , they are dominica 's only winter olympic athlete . </s> athlete jrme romain won the bronze medal at the 1995 world championship in athletics 1995 world championship in athletics men 's triple jump . he also qualified for the final at the athletics at the 1996 summer olympics men 's triple jump ; even though he had to pull out due to injury , his 12th position is the best performance of a dominican ever at the olympic game . </s> <section_title_start> medium <section_title_end> </s> dominica ha two major newspaper , the sun and the chronicle ( dominica ) . there are two national television station and a few radio station , including station include : zbc-am 590 , the first private local radio station is called radio en ba mango 93.5/96.9fm in the village of berricoa grand bay and is owned by urban dangleben , zgbc-am 740 , zgbc-fm 90.7 ( portsmouth ) , zgbc-fm 102.1 ( roseau ) and zgbc-fm 106.1 ( marigot ) , q95 fm , the dominica broadcasting corporation , and kairi fm . before 2004 , there were two telecommunication company cable and wireless ( caribbean ) and marpin tv founded by dominican , ronald bernard maroni abraham . in 2005 , digicel and a uk-based company orange sa started to offer service to the island . there are a number of mobile network operating on the island ; lime and digicel compete for most of dominica 's wireless customer . orange shut down in 2010 and is no longer operating on the island of dominica . </s> historical newspaper include the dominican , the dominica guardian , and the dominica colonist , available for free in the digital library of the caribbean . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * index of dominica-related article </s> * list of people from dominica </s> * outline of dominica </s> <section_title_start> reference <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> external link <section_title_end> </s> * of the government of the commonwealth of dominica . </s> *
