state </s> category:1690 establishment in the french colonial empire </s> category:1690s establishment in the caribbean </s> category:1690 establishment in north america </s> category:1805 establishment in the british empire </s> category:1800s establishment in the caribbean </s> category:1805 establishment in north america </s> category : state and territory established in 1978 </s> category:1970s establishment in the caribbean </s> category:1978 establishment in north america </s> category : country in north america <article_end> <article_start> </s> the philippine ( ; pilipinas or filipinas ) , officially the republic of the philippine ( republika ng pilipinas ) , is an archipelagic state in southeast asia . situated in the western pacific ocean , it consists of about 7,641 island that are broadly categorized under three main geographical division from north to south : luzon , visayas , and mindanao . the capital city of the philippine is manila and the most populous city is quezon city , both within the single urban area of metro manila . bounded by the south china sea to the west , the philippine sea to the east , and the celebes sea to the southwest , the philippine share maritime border with taiwan to the north , japan to the northeast , palau to the east , indonesia to the south , malaysia and brunei to the southwest , vietnam to the west , and china to the northwest . </s> the philippine ' position a an list of island country on the pacific ring of fire and close to the equator make the country prone to earthquake in the philippine and typhoon in the philippine . the country ha a variety of natural resource and a globally significant megadiverse country . the philippine ha an area of around with a population of around 109 ; million people . , it is the list of asian country by population 8th-most populated country in asia and the list of country and dependency by population 13th-most populated country in the world . multiple ethnic group in the philippine and culture are found throughout the island . </s> negritos , some of the archipelago 's earliest inhabitant , were followed by model of migration to the philippine of austronesian people . the arrival of ferdinand magellan , a portuguese empire explorer leading a fleet for spain , marked the beginning of spanish colonization . in 1543 , spanish explorer ruy lpez de villalobos named the archipelago : e : filipinas in honor of philip ii of spain . spanish settlement , beginning in 1565 , led to the philippine becoming part of the spanish empire for more than 300 year . during this time , catholicism became the dominant religion , and manila became the western hub of spanish treasure fleet trans-pacific trade . in 1896 , the philippine revolution began , which then became entwined with the 1898 spanishamerican war . spain ceded the territory to the united state , while hong kong junta declared the first philippine republic . the ensuing philippineamerican war ended with the united state establishing control over the territory , which they maintained until the philippine campaign ( 19411942 ) of the island during world war ii . following philippine campaign ( 19441945 ) , the philippine became independent in 1946 . since then , the unitary state sovereign state ha often had a tumultuous experience with democracy , which included the overthrow of a dictatorship by the people power revolution . </s> the philippine is a founding member of the united nation , world trade organization , association of southeast asian nation , the asia-pacific economic cooperation forum , and the east asia summit . the philippine is considered to be an emerging market and a newly industrialized country , which ha an economy transitioning from being based on agriculture to being based more on service and manufacturing . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> spanish explorer ruy lpez de villalobos , during his expedition in 1542 , named the island of leyte and samar `` felipinas `` after philip ii of spain philip ; ii of spain , then the prince of asturias . eventually the name `` la islas filipinas `` would be used to cover the archipelago 's spanish possession . before spanish rule wa established , other name such a islas del poniente ( island of the west ) and magellan 's name for the island , san lzaro , were also used by the spanish to refer to island in the region . </s> during the philippine revolution , the revolutionary government of the philippine proclaimed the establishment of the repblica filipina or the first philippine republic . from the period of the spanishamerican war ( 1898 ) and the philippineamerican war ( 18991902 ) until the commonwealth of the philippine period ( 19351946 ) , american colonial authority referred to the country a the philippine island , a translation of the spanish name . the full title of the republic of the philippine wa included in the 1935 constitution a the name of the future independent state . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> prehistory ( pre900 ) <section_title_end> </s> there is evidence of early [ living in what is now the philippine a early a 709,000 year ago . a small number of bone from callao cave ] potentially represent an otherwise unknown specie , [ [ homo luzonensis , that lived around 50,000 to 67,000 year ago . the oldest modern human remains found on the island are from the tabon cave of palawan , uraniumthorium dating u/th-dated to 47,000 1110,000 year ago . the tabon man is presumably a negrito , who were among the archipelago 's earliest inhabitant , descendant of the first human migration out of africa via the coastal route along southern asia to the now sunken landmass of sundaland and sahul ( continent ) . </s> the first austronesian reached the philippine at around 2200 bc , settling the batanes island and northern luzon from taiwan . from there , they rapidly spread downwards to the rest of the island of the philippine and southeast asia . this population assimilated with the existing negritos resulting in the modern filipino ethnic group which display various ratio of genetic admixture between austronesian and negrito group . philippine jade artifact have been found dated to 2000 ; bc , with the lingling-o jade item crafted in luzon made using raw material originating from taiwan . by 1000 ; bc , the inhabitant of the archipelago had developed into four kind of social group : hunter-gatherer tribe , warrior society , highland plutocracy , and port principality . </s> <section_title_start> early state ( 9001565 ) <section_title_end> </s> the earliest known surviving written record found in the philippine is the laguna copperplate inscription . by the 1300s , a number of the large coastal settlement had emerged a trading center , and became the focal point of societal change . some polity had exchange with other state across asia . trade with china is believed to have begun during the tang dynasty , but grew more extensive during the song dynasty . by the 2nd millennium ce , some philippine polity were known to have sent trade delegation which participated in the tributary system enforced by the chinese imperial court , trading but without direct political or military control . indian cultural trait , such a linguistic term and religious practice , began to spread within the philippine during the 10th century , likely via the hindu majapahit empire . by the 15th ; century , islam wa established in the sulu archipelago and spread from there . </s> polity founded in the philippine from the 10th16th century include rajahnate of maynila , tondo ( historical polity ) , namayan , caboloan , rajahnate of cebu , rajahnate of butuan , sultanate of maguindanao , confederation of sultanate in lanao , sultanate of sulu , and ma-i . the early polity were typically made up of three-tier social structure : a nobility class , a class of `` freeman `` , and a class of dependent debtor-bondsmen . among the nobility were leader called `` datus , `` responsible for ruling autonomous group called `` barangay ( pre-colonial ) `` or `` dulohan `` . when these barangays banded together , either to form a larger settlement or a geographically looser alliance group , the more esteemed among them would be recognized a a `` paramount datu `` , rajah , or sultan which headed the community state . there is little evidence of large-scale violence in the archipelago prior to the 2nd millennium ad , and throughout these period population density is thought to have been low . </s> in 1521 , portuguese explorer ferdinand magellan arrived in the area , claimed the island for spain , and wa then killed at the battle of mactan . </s> <section_title_start> colonial rule ( 15651946 ) <section_title_end> </s> colonization began when spanish explorer miguel lpez de legazpi arrived from mexico in 1565 . in 1571 , intramuros became the capital of the spanish east indie , which also encompassed spanish territory in asia and the pacific . the spanish considered their war with the muslim in southeast asia an extension of the reconquista . the spanish successfully invaded the different local state by employing the principle of divide and rule . </s> spanish rule brought most of what is now the philippine into a single unified administration . from 1565 to 1821 , the philippine wa governed a part of the mexico-based new spain , later administered from madrid following the mexican war of independence . manila galleon were constructed in bicol region and cavite . manila wa the western hub of the spanish treasure fleet trans-pacific trade . </s> under spanish rule , disparate barangays were deliberately reduction , where friar in spanish philippine were more easily able to convert the inhabitant to christianity . a national education in the philippine during spanish rule wa introduced in 1863. </s> during it rule , spain quelled philippine revolt against spain , a well a defending against external military challenge . the philippine wa expensive . battle of la naval de manila from the west , in the 17th century , together with conflict with the muslim in the south nearly bankrupted the colonial treasury . spanish force included soldier from elsewhere in new spain , many of whom deserted and intermingled with the wider population . immigration blurred the racial caste system spain maintained in town and city . administration of the philippine island were considered a drain on the economy of spain , and there were debate about abandoning it or trading it for some other territory . however , this wa opposed for a number of reason , including economic potential , security , and the desire to continue religious conversion in the island and the surrounding region . </s> the philippine survived on an annual subsidy provided by the spanish crown , which averaged 250,000 peso and wa usually paid through the provision of 75 ton of silver bullion being sent from the america . financial constraint meant the 200-year-old fortification in manila did not see significant change after being first built by the early spanish colonizer . british occupation of manila from 1762 to 1764 during the seven year ' war , however they were unable to extend their conquest outside of manila a the filipino stayed loyal to the remaining spanish community outside manila . spanish rule wa restored through the treaty of paris ( 1763 ) . the spanishmoro conflict lasted for several hundred year . in the last quarter of the 19th century , spain conquered portion of mindanao and jolo , sulu , and the moro people muslim in the sultanate of sulu formally recognized spanish sovereignty . </s> in the 19th century , philippine port opened to world trade and shift started occurring within filipino society . the latin american war of independence and renewed immigration led to shift in social identity , with the term filipino shifting from referring to peninsulares and criollo people to a term encompassing all people in the archipelago . this identity shift wa driven by wealthy mestizo , for which it developed into a national identity . this wa compounded by a mexican of filipino descent , isidoro monte de oca , becoming captain-general to the revolutionary leader vicente guerrero during the mexican war of independence . </s> revolutionary sentiment were stoked in 1872 after gomburza were executed on weak pretence . this would inspire a propaganda movement in spain , organized by marcelo h. del pilar , jos rizal , and mariano ponce , lobbying for political reform in the philippine . rizal wa eventually executed on december 30 , 1896 , on charge of rebellion . this radicalized many who had previously been loyal to spain . a attempt at reform met with resistance , andrs bonifacio in 1892 established the militant secret society called the katipunan , who sought independence from spain through armed revolt . </s> the katipunan cry of pugad lawin the philippine revolution in 1896 . katipunan chapter in cavite province , primarily the magdiwang ( katipunan faction ) and the magdalo ( katipunan faction ) had an internal dispute that led to the tejeros convention and an election in which bonifacio lost his position and emilio aguinaldo wa elected a the new leader of the revolution . in 1897 , the pact of biak-na-bato brought about the hong kong junta . in 1898 , the spanishamerican war began and reached philippine . aguinaldo returned , resumed the revolution , and philippine declaration of independence from spain on june 12 , 1898 . the first philippine republic wa established on january 21 , 1899. </s> the island had been treaty of paris ( 1898 ) by spain to the united state alongside puerto rico and guam a a result of the latter 's victory in the spanishamerican war . a it became increasingly clear the united state would not recognize the first philippine republic , the philippineamerican war broke out . war resulted in the death of 250,000 to 1 ; million civilian , mostly due to famine and disease . after the defeat of the first philippine republic , an insular government of the philippine island wa philippine organic act ( 1902 ) . american force continued to secure and extend their control over the island , suppressing an attempted tagalog republic # sakay , kiram-bates treaty , and establishing control over interior mountainous area that had resisted spanish conquest . </s> cultural development strengthened the continuing development of a national identity , and tagalog began to take precedence over other local language . in 1935 , the philippine wa granted commonwealth of the philippine status with manuel quezon a president and sergio osmea a vice president . quezon 's priority were defence , social justice , inequality and economic diversification , and national character . tagalog wa designated the filipino language , 1937 philippine woman 's suffrage plebiscite woman 's suffrage wa introduced , and land reform mooted . </s> tydingsmcduffie act over the next decade were interrupted by world war ii when the empire of japan philippine campaign ( 19411942 ) and the second philippine republic , under jose p. laurel , wa established a a puppet state . from mid-1942 through mid-1944 , the japanese occupation of the philippine wa philippine resistance against japan by large-scale japanese occupation of the philippine # resistance . the largest naval battle in history , according to gross tonnage sunk , the battle of leyte gulf , occurred when allied force began liberating the philippine from the japanese empire . atrocity and japanese war crime were committed during the war , including the bataan death march and the manila massacre . allied troop philippine campaign ( 194445 ) in 1945 . by the end of the war it is estimated that over a million filipino had died . on october 11 , 1945 , the philippine became one of the member state of the united nation of the united nation . on july 4 , 1946 , the philippine wa officially recognized by the united state a an independent nation through the treaty of manila ( 1946 ) , during the presidency of manuel roxas . </s> <section_title_start> postcolonial period ( 1946present ) <section_title_end> </s> effort to end the hukbalahap rebellion began during elpidio quirino 's term , however , it wa only during ramon magsaysay 's presidency wa the movement suppressed . magsaysay 's successor , carlos p. garcia , initiated the filipino first policy , which wa continued by diosdado macapagal , with celebration of independence day moved from july 4 to june 12 , the date of emilio aguinaldo 's declaration , and pursuit of north borneo dispute on the eastern part of north borneo . </s> in 1965 , macapagal lost the presidential election to ferdinand marcos . early in his presidency , marcos initiated numerous infrastructure project but , together with his wife imelda marcos , wa accused of corruption and embezzling billion of dollar in public fund . nearing the end of his term , marcos declared martial law in the philippine on september 21 , 1972 . this period of his rule wa characterized by political repression , censorship , and human right violation . </s> on august 21 , 1983 , marcos ' chief rival , opposition leader benigno aquino jr. , wa assassination of benigno aquino jr. on the tarmac at manila international airport . marcos called a snap 1986 philippine presidential election . marcos wa proclaimed the winner , but the result were widely regarded a fraudulent . the resulting protest led to the people power revolution , which forced marcos and his ally to flee to hawaii , and aquino 's widow , corazon aquino , wa installed a president . </s> the return of democracy and government reform beginning in 1986 were hampered by national debt , government corruption , 198690 philippine coup attempt , a persistent cpp-npa-ndf rebellion , and a military conflict with moro conflict . the administration also faced a series of disaster , including the sinking of the mv doa paz in december 1987 and the eruption of mount pinatubo in june 1991 . aquino wa succeeded by fidel v. ramos , whose economic performance , at 3.6 % growth rate , wa overshadowed by the onset of the 1997 asian financial crisis . </s> ramos ' successor , joseph estrada , wa overthrown by the 2001 edsa revolution and succeeded by his vice president of the philippine , gloria macapagal-arroyo , on january 20 , 2001 . arroyo 's 9-year administration wa marked by economic growth , but wa tainted by graft and political scandal . on november 23 , 2009 , 34 journalist and several civilian were maguindanao massacre . </s> economic growth continued during benigno aquino iii 's administration , which pushed for good governance and transparency . in 2015 , a mamasapano clash which took place in mamasapano , maguindanao killed 44 member of the philippine national police-special action force , resulting in effort to pas the bangsamoro basic law reaching an impasse . former davao city mayor rodrigo duterte won the 2016 philippine presidential election , becoming the first president from mindanao . duterte launched philippine drug war an anti-drug campaign and build ! build ! build ! infrastructure plan . the implementation of the bangsamoro organic law led to the creation of the autonomous bangsamoro region in mindanao . in early 2020 , the covid-19 pandemic in the philippine covid-19 pandemic reached the country causing the economy to contract by 9.5 % in term of gross domestic product since record began in 1947. </s> <section_title_start> geography and environment <section_title_end> </s> the philippine is an archipelago composed of about 7,641 list of island of the philippine with a total land area , including inland body of water , of around , with cadastral survey data suggesting it may be larger . the of coastline make it the country with the fifth list of country by length of coastline in the world . the exclusive economic zone of the philippine cover . it is located between 116 ; 40 ' , and 126 ; 34 ' e longitude and 4 ; 40 ' and 21 ; 10 ' n latitude and is bordered by the philippine sea to the east , the south china sea ] to the west , and the [ [ celebes sea to the south . the island of borneo is located a few hundred kilometer southwest and taiwan is located directly to the north . the maluku island and sulawesi are located to the south-southwest and palau is located to the east of the island . </s> the highest list of mountain in the philippine is mount apo . it measure up to above sea level and is located on the island of mindanao . the galathea depth of the philippine trench in the philippine sea is the deepest point in the country and the list of submarine topographical feature # list of oceanic trench . the longest list of river of the philippine is the cagayan river in northern luzon , measuring about . manila bay , upon the shore of which the capital city of manila lie , is connected to laguna de bay , the largest list of lake of the philippine in the philippine , by the pasig river . the puerto princesa subterranean river , which run underground through a karst landscape before reaching the ocean , is a unesco world heritage site . </s> situated on the western fringe of the pacific ring of fire , the philippine experience frequent seismic and volcanic activity . the benham plateau to the east in the philippine sea is an undersea region active in plate tectonics subduction . around 20 list of earthquake in the philippines are registered daily , though most are too weak to be felt . the last major earthquake wa the 1990 luzon earthquake . there are list of active volcano in the philippine such a the mayon volcano , mount pinatubo , and taal volcano . the 1991 eruption of mount pinatubo produced the list of large volcanic eruption of the 20th century of the 20th ; century . the philippine is the world 's second-biggest geothermal power in the philippine producer behind the united state , with 18 % of energy in the philippine the country 's electricity need being met by geothermal power . </s> the country ha valuable mineral deposit a a result of the it complex geologic structure and high level of seismic activity . the philippine are thought to have the second-largest gold deposit after south africa , along with a large amount of copper deposit , and the world 's largest deposit of palladium . other mineral include chromite , nickel , and zinc . despite this , a lack of law enforcement , poor management , opposition due to the presence of indigenous community , and past instance of environmental damage and disaster , have resulted in these mineral resource remaining largely untapped . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> the philippine is a megadiverse country . eight major type of forest are distributed throughout the philippine ; dipterocarp , beach forest , pine forest , vitex parviflora forest , montane ecosystem , upper montane or mossy forest , mangrove , and ultrabasic forest . around 1,100 land vertebrate specie can be found in the philippine including over 100 mammal specie and 170 bird specie not thought to exist elsewhere . the philippine ha among the highest rate of discovery in the world with sixteen new specie of mammal discovered in the last ten year . because of this , the rate of list of ecoregions with high endemism for the philippine ha risen and likely will continue to rise . part of it marine water contain the highest diversity of shorefish specie in the world . </s> large reptile include the philippine crocodile and saltwater crocodile . the largest crocodile in captivity , known locally a lolong , wa captured in the southern island of mindanao , and died on february 10 , 2013 from pneumonia and cardiac arrest . the national bird , known a the philippine eagle , ha the longest body of any eagle ; it generally measure 86 to 102 ; cm ( 2.82 to 3.35 ; ft ) in length and weighs 4.7 to 8.0 ; kg ( 10.4 to 17.6 ; lb ) . the philippine eagle is part of the family accipitridae and is endemic to the rainforest of luzon , samar , leyte and mindanao . </s> philippine territorial water encompass a much a producing unique and diverse marine life , an important part of the coral triangle , a territory shared with other country . the total number of coral and marine fish specie wa estimated at 500 and 2,400 respectively . new record and specie discovery continue . the tubbataha reef in the sulu sea wa declared a world heritage site in 1993 . philippine water also sustain the cultivation of fish , crustacean , oyster , and seaweed . one specie of oyster , pinctada maximum , produce pearl that are naturally golden in color . pearl have been declared a `` national gem `` . </s> with an estimated 13,500 plant specie in the country , 3,200 of which are unique to the island , philippine rainforest boast an array of flora , including many rare type of list of the orchid of the philippine and rafflesia . deforestation , often the result of illegal logging , is deforestation in the philippine . forest cover declined from 70 % of the philippine 's total land area in 1900 to about 18.3 % in 1999 . many specie are endangered and scientist say that southeast asia , which the philippine is part of , face a catastrophic extinction rate of 20 % by the end of the 21st century . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> the philippine ha a tropical maritime climate that is usually hot and humid . there are three season : a hot dry season or summer from march to may ; a rainy season from june to november ; and a cool dry season from december to february . the southwest monsoon last from from may to october , and the northeast monsoon from november to april . temperature usually range from to . the coolest month is january ; the warmest is may . </s> the average yearly temperature is around . in considering temperature , location in term of latitude and longitude is not a significant factor , and temperature at sea level tend to be in the same range . altitude usually ha more of an impact . the average annual temperature of baguio at an elevation of above sea level is , making it a popular destination during hot summer . annual rainfall measure a much a in the mountainous east coast section but le than in some of the sheltered valley . </s> sitting astride the typhoon in the philippine , the island experience 1520 typhoon annually from july to october , with around nineteen typhoon entering the philippine area of responsibility in a typical year and eight or nine making landfall . historically typhoon were sometimes referred to a baguios . the wettest recorded typhoon to hit the philippine dropped in baguio from july 14 to 18 , 1911 . the philippine is highly climate change in the philippine and is among the world 's ten country that are most climate change vulnerability risk . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> the commission on population estimated the country 's population to be 107,190,081 a of december 31 , 2018 , based on the latest population census of 2015 conducted by the philippine statistic authority . the population increased from 1990 to 2008 by approximately 28 ; million , a 45 % growth in that time frame . the first philippine census in the philippine wa carried out in 1877 and recorded a population of 5,567,685. </s> a third of the population resides in metro manila and it immediately neighboring region . the 2.34 % average annual population growth rate between 1990 and 2000 decreased to an estimated 1.90 % for the 20002010 period . government attempt to reduce population growth have been a reproductive health bill ( philippine ) . the population 's median age is 22.7 year with 60.9 % aged from 15 to 64 year old . life expectancy at birth is 69.4 year , 73.1 year for female and 65.9 year for male . poverty incidence dropped to 21.6 % in 2015 from 25.2 % in 2012. </s> metro manila is the most populous of the list of metropolitan area in the philippine in the philippine and the list of metropolitan area by population in the world . census data from 2015 showed it had a population of 12,877,253 constituting almost 13 % of the national population . including suburb in the adjacent province ( bulacan , cavite , laguna ( province ) , and rizal ) of greater manila area , the population is around 23,088,000 . across the country , the philippine ha a total urbanization rate of 51.2 percent . metro manila 's gross regional product wa estimated to be philippine peso 468.4 ; billion ( at constant 1985 price ) and account for 33 % of the nation 's gdp . in 2011 manila ranked a the list of city by gdp in the world and the 2nd in southeast asia . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group <section_title_end> </s> there is substantial ethnic diversity with the philippine , a product of the sea and mountain range dividing the archipelago along with significant foreign influence . according to the 2010 census , 24.4 % of filipino are tagalog , 11.4 % visayans/bisaya , 9.9 % cebuano , 8.8 % ilocano , 8.4 % hiligaynon , 6.8 % bikol , 4 % waray , and 26.2 % are `` others `` , which can be broken down further to yield more distinct non-tribal group like the moro people , the kapampangan people , the pangasinan people , the ibanag people , and the ivatan people . there are also indigenous people of the philippine like the igorot , the lumad , the mangyan , the bajau , and the people of palawan . </s> negritos are considered among the earliest inhabitant of the island . these minority aboriginal settler are an australoid group and are a left-over from the first human migration out of africa to australia , and were likely displaced by later wave of migration . at least some negritos in the philippine have denisovan admixture in their genome . ethnic filipino generally belong to several southeast asian ethnic group classified linguistically a part of the austronesian people or malayo-polynesian language malayo-polynesian speaking people . there is some uncertainty over the origin of this austronesian speaking population , with it being likely that ancestor related to taiwanese aborigine brought their language and mixed with existing population in the area . european dna is present in many filipino today . a craniometry study reveals that sample taken from graveyard across the philippine show a mean ratio of european descent of circa 6 % . under spanish rule there wa also immigration from elsewhere in the empire , especially latin american asian . </s> chinese filipino are mostly the descendant of immigrant from fujian in china after 1898 , numbering around 2 ; million , although there are an estimated 20 percent of filipino who have partial chinese ancestry , stemming from precolonial and colonial chinese migrant . while a distinct minority , chinese filipino are well-integrated into filipino society . a of 2015 , there were 220,000 to 600,000 american citizen living in the country . there are also up to 250,000 amerasians scattered across the city of angeles , philippine , manila , new clark city and olongapo . other important non-indigenous minority include indian filipino and arab filipino . there are also japanese people , which include escaped christian ( kirishitan ) who martyr of japan which the spanish empire in the philippine had offered asylum from . the descendant of mixed-race couple are known a filipino mestizo . </s> <section_title_start> language <section_title_end> </s> ethnologue list 186 individual language in the philippine , 182 of which are living language , while 4 no longer have any known speaker . most native language are part of the philippine language branch of the malayo-polynesian language , which is itself a branch of the austronesian language . in addition , various spanish-based creole variety collectively called chavacano exist . there are also many philippine negrito language # unique vocabulary that have unique vocabulary that survived austronesian acculturation . </s> filipino language and philippine english are the official language of the country . filipino is a standardized version of tagalog language , spoken mainly in metro manila . both filipino and english are used in government , education , print , broadcast medium , and business , with third local language often being used at the same time . the philippine constitution provides for the promotion of spanish language in the philippine and arabic on a voluntary and optional basis . spanish , which wa widely used a a lingua franca in the late nineteenth century , ha since declined greatly in use , although spanish loanword are still present today in philippine language , while arabic is mainly taught in islamic school in mindanao . </s> nineteen regional language act a auxiliary official language used a medium of instruction : aklan language , bikol language , cebuano language , chavacano , hiligaynon language , ibanag language , ilocano language , ivatan language , kapampangan language , kinaray-a language kinaray-a , maguindanao language , maranao language , pangasinan language , sambal language , surigaonon language , tagalog , tausug language , waray language , and yakan language . other indigenous language such a , cuyonon language , ifugao language , itbayat language , kalinga language , kamayo language , kankanaey language , masbateo language , romblomanon language , manobo language , and several visayan language are prevalent in their respective province . article 3 of republic act no . 11106 declared the filipino sign language a the national sign language of the philippine , specifying that it shall be recognized , supported and promoted a the medium of official communication in all transaction involving the deaf , and a the language of instruction of deaf education . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> the philippine is a secular state which protects freedom of religion in the philippine . christianity in the philippine is the dominant faith , shared by over 92 % of the population . , the country had the catholic church by country world 's third largest roman catholic population , and wa the christianity in asia . census data from 2015 found that about % of the population professed catholic church in the philippine . around 37 % of the population regularly attend catholic mass . 29 % of self-identified catholic consider themselves very religious . an independent catholic church church , the philippine independent church , ha around 66,959 adherent . protestantism in the philippine were 10.8 % of the population in 2010 . % of the population are member of iglesia ni cristo . the combined following of the philippine council of evangelical church come to % of the total population . </s> islam in the philippine is the second largest religion . the muslim population of the philippine wa reported a % of the total population according to census return in 2015 . conversely , a 2012 report by the national commission of muslim filipino ( ncmf ) stated that about 10,700,000 or 11 % of filipino are muslim . the majority of muslim live in mindanao and nearby island . most practice sunni islam under the shafi ' i school . </s> the percentage of combined positive atheism and agnostic people in the philippine wa measured to be about 3 % of the population a of 2008 . the 2015 philippine census reported the religion of about % of the population a `` none `` . a 2014 survey by gallup international association reported that 21 % of it respondent identify a `` not a religious person `` . around % of the population practice indigenous philippine folk religion , whose practice and folk belief are often syncretized with christianity and islam . buddhism in the philippine is practiced by around % of the population , concentrated among filipino of chinese descent . </s> <section_title_start> health <section_title_end> </s> in 2016 , % of healthcare came from private expenditure while % wa from the government ( 12.4 % from the national government , 7.1 % from the local government , and 17.4 % from social health insurance ) . total health expenditure share in gdp for the year 2016 wa 4.5 % . per caput health expenditure rate in 2015 wa , which wa one of the lowest in southeast asia . the budget allocation for healthcare in 2019 wa 98.6 ; billion and had an increase in budget in 2014 with a record high in the collection of tax from the house bill 5727 ( commonly known a sin tax bill ) . </s> there were 101,688 hospital bed in the country in 2016 , with government hospital bed accounting for 47 % and private hospital bed for 53 % . </s> in 2009 , there were an estimated 90,370 physician or 1 per every 833 people , 480,910 nurse and 43,220 dentist . retention of skilled practitioner is a problem . seventy percent of nursing graduate go overseas to work . , the philippine wa the largest supplier of nurse for export . the philippine suffers a triple burden of high level of communicable disease , high level of non-communicable disease , and high exposure to natural disaster . </s> in 2018 , there were 1,258 [ licensed by the department of health ( philippine ) department of health ] , of which were government-run and private . a total of 20,065 barangay health station ( bh ) and 2,590 rural health unit ( rhus ) provide primary care service throughout the country a of 2016 . [ [ cardiovascular disease account for more than 35 % of all death . 9,264 case of [ immunodeficiency virus ] ( hiv ) were reported for the year 2016 , with 8,151 being asymptomatic case . at the time the country wa considered a low-hiv-prevalence country , with le than 0.1 % of the adult population estimated to be hiv-positive . hiv/aids case increased from 12,000 in 2005 to 39,622 a of 2016 , with 35,957 being asymptomatic case . </s> there is improvement in patient access to medicine due to filipino ' growing acceptance of generic drug , with 6 out of 10 filipino already using generic . while the country 's universal healthcare implementation is underway a spearheaded by the state-owned philippine health insurance corporation , most healthcare-related expense are either borne out of pocket or through health maintenance organization ( hmo ) -provided health plan . a of april 2020 , there are only about 7 ; million individual covered by these plan . </s> <section_title_start> education <section_title_end> </s> the philippine had a simple literacy rate of 98.3 % a of 2015 , and a functional illiteracy rate of 90.3 % a of 2013 . education take up a significant proportion of the national budget . in the 2020 budget , education wa allocated php17.1 ; billion from the php4.1 ; trillion budget . </s> the commission on higher education ( philippine ) ( ched ) list 2,180 higher education institution , among which 607 are public and 1,573 are private . class start in june and end in march . the majority of college and university follow a semester calendar from june to october and november to march , while some have adopted an increasingly common semester calendar from august to december and january to may . primary and secondary schooling is divided between a 6-year elementary period , a 4-year junior high school period , and a 2-year senior high school period . </s> the department of education ( philippine ) ( deped ) cover elementary , secondary , and non-formal education . the technical education and skill development authority ( tesda ) administers middle-level education training and development . the commission on higher education ( ched ) wa created in 1994 to , among other function , formulate and recommend development plan , policy , </s> priority , and program on higher education in the philippine and research . </s> in 2004 , madrasa were mainstreamed in 16 region nationwide , mainly in muslim area in mindanao under the auspex and program of the department of education . public university are all non-sectarian entity , and are further classified a state university and college ( suc ) or local college and university ( lcu ) . the university of the philippine , a system of eight ( 8 ) constituent university , is the national university system of the philippine . the country 's top ranked university are a follows : university of the philippine , ateneo de manila university , de la salle university , and university of santo tomas . the university of santo tomas , established in 1611 , ha the oldest extant literature university charter in the philippine and asia . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> the philippine ha a democracy government in the form of a constitutional republic with a presidential system . the president of the philippine function a both [ of state ] and [ of government ] and is the commander-in-chief of the armed force of the philippine . the president is elected by popular vote for a single six-year term , during which he or she appoints and presides over the cabinet ( government ) . rodrigo duterte wa elected to a six-year term a president in 2016 . the bicameral congress of the philippine is composed of the senate of the philippine , serving a the upper house , with member elected to a six-year term , and the house of representative of the philippine , serving a the lower house , with member elected to a three-year term . philippine politics tends to be dominated by those with well-known name , such a member of list of political family in the philippine or celebrity . </s> senator are elected at large while the representative are elected from both legislative district of the philippine and through sectoral representation . the judiciary power is vested in the supreme court of the philippine , composed of a chief justice of the supreme court of the philippine a it presiding officer and fourteen associate justice of the supreme court of the philippine , all of whom are appointed by the president from nomination submitted by the judicial and bar council . the capital city of the philippine is manila and the most populous city is quezon city , both within the single urban area of metro manila . </s> there have been constitutional reform in the philippine the government to a federal government , unicameral , or parliamentary government since the ramos administration . there is a significant amount of corruption in the philippine , which some historian attribute to the system of governance put in place during the spanish colonial period . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> a a philippine and the united nation of the united nation , the country list of member of the united nation security council to the united nation security council . carlos p. romulo wa a former president of the united nation general assembly . the country is an active participant in peacekeeping mission , particularly in united nation transitional administration in east timor . over 10 ; million filipino live and work overseas . </s> the philippine is a founding and active member of asean ( association of southeast asian nation ) . it ha hosted several asean summit and is an active contributor to the direction and policy of the bloc . it is also a member of the east asia summit ( ea ) , the asia-pacific economic cooperation ( apec ) , the group of 24 , and the non-aligned movement . the country is also seeking to obtain observer status in the organisation of islamic cooperation . </s> the philippine ha a long philippinesunited state relation , covering economics , security , and people-to-people relation . a mutual defense treaty ( u.s.philippines ) wa signed in 1951 , and supplemented later with the philippinesunited state visiting force agreement and the 2016 enhanced defense cooperation agreement . the philippine supported american policy during the cold war and participated in the korean war and vietnam war war . in 2003 the philippine wa designated a major non-nato ally . </s> under president duterte tie with the united state have weakened with military purchase instead coming from china and russia , while duterte state that the philippine will no longer participate in any us-led war . in 2021 , it wa revealed the united state would defend the philippine including the south china sea . </s> the philippine attache great importance in it chinaphilippines relation , and ha established significant cooperation with the country . japan is the biggest bilateral contributor of official development assistance to the country . although historical tension exist due to the event of world war ii , much of the animosity ha faded . </s> historical and cultural tie continue to affect relation with spain . relation with middle eastern country are shaped by the high number of filipino working in these country , and by issue relating the muslim minority in the philippine . concern have been raised regarding issue such a domestic abuse and war affecting the around 2.5 ; million overseas filipino worker in the region . </s> the philippine spratly island dispute in the spratly island which overlap with claim by china , malaysia , taiwan , and vietnam . the largest of it controlled island in thitu island , which contains the philippine 's smallest village . the scarborough shoal scarborough shoal standoff , where china took control of the shoal from the philippine , led to an philippine v. china and ha made the shoal a prominent symbol in the wider dispute . </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> the armed force of the philippine ( afp ) consist of three branch : the philippine air force , the philippine army , and the philippine navy . the armed force of the philippine are a volunteer military . civilian security is handled by the philippine national police under the department of the interior and local government ( dilg ) . </s> in bangsamoro , the largest separatist organization , the moro national liberation front and the moro islamic liberation front were engaging the government politically . other more militant group like the abu sayyaf have kidnapped foreigner for ransom , particularly in the sulu archipelago . their presence decreased due to successful security provided by the philippine government . the communist party of the philippine and it military wing , the new people 's army , have been waging communist rebellion in the philippine against the government since the 1970s , reaching it apex in 1986 when communist guerrilla gained control of a fifth of the country 's territory , before significantly dwindling militarily and politically after the return of democracy in 1986. , $ 2.843 ; billion , or 1.1 percent of gdp is spent on military force . </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> the philippine is governed a a unitary state , with the exception of the bangsamoro autonomous region in muslim mindanao ( barmm ) , although there ha been several step towards decentralization within the unitary framework . a 1991 law devolved some power to local government in the philippine . the country is divided into 17 region of the philippine , 81 province of the philippine , 146 city of the philippine , 1,488 municipality of the philippine , and 42,036 barangays . region other than bangsamoro serve primarily to organize the province of the country for administrative convenience . , calabarzon wa the most populated region while the metro manila ( ncr ) the most densely populated . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> the philippine economy ha produced an estimated gross domestic product ( nominal ) of $ 356.8 ; billion . primary export include semiconductor and electronic product , transport equipment , garment , copper product , petroleum product , coconut oil , and fruit . major trading partner include the united state , japan , china , singapore , south korea , the netherlands , hong kong , germany , taiwan , and thailand . it unit of currency is the philippine peso ( or php ) . </s> a newly industrialized country , the philippine economy ha been transitioning from one based upon agriculture to an economy with more emphasis upon service and manufacturing . of the country 's 2018 labor force of around 43.46 ; million , the agriculture in the philippine employed 24.3 % , and accounted for 8.1 % of 2018 gdp . the industrial sector employed around 19 % of the workforce and accounted for 34.1 % of gdp , while 57 % of the worker involved in the service sector were responsible for 57.8 % of gdp . </s> the unemployment rate , stand at 4.5 % . meanwhile , due to lower charge in basic necessity , the inflation rate eased to 1.7 % in august 2019 . gross international reserve a of october 2013 are $ 83.201 ; billion . the debt-to-gdp ratio continues to decline to 37.6 % a of the second quarter of 2019 from a record high of 78 % in 2004 . the country is a net importer but it is also a creditor nation . manila host the headquarters of the asian development bank . </s> the 1997 asian financial crisis affected the economy , resulting in a lingering decline of the value of the peso and fall in the stock market . the extent it wa affected initially wa not a severe a that of some of it asian neighbor . this wa largely due to the fiscal conservatism of the government , partly a a result of decade of monitoring and fiscal supervision from the international monetary fund ( imf ) , in comparison to the massive spending of it neighbor on the rapid acceleration of economic growth . there have been sign of progress since . in 2004 , the economy experienced 6.4 % gdp growth and 7.1 % in 2007 , it fastest pace of growth in three decade . average annual gdp growth per caput for the period 19662007 still stand at 1.45 % in comparison to an average of 5.96 % for the east asia and the pacific region a a whole . the daily income for 45 % of the population of the philippine remains le than $ 2 . </s> remittance from overseas filipino contribute significantly to the philippine economy . remittance peaked in 2006 at 10.4 % of the national gdp , and were 8.6 % and 8.5 % in 2012 and in 2014 respectively . in 2014 the total worth of foreign exchange remittance wa u $ 28 ; billion . regional development is uneven , with luzon metro manila in particular gaining most of the new economic growth at the expense of the other region . service industry such a tourism in the philippine and business process outsourcing in the philippine have been identified a area with some of the best opportunity for growth for the country . the outsourcing # business process outsourcing ( bpo ) industry is composed of eight sub-sectors , namely , knowledge process outsourcing and back office , animation , call center industry in the philippine , software development , game development , engineering design , and medical transcription . , the philippine wa reported a having eclipsed india a the main center of bpo service in the world . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> the department of science and technology ( philippine ) is the governing agency responsible for the development of coordination of science and technology in the philippine science and technology-related project in the philippine . research organization in the country include the international rice research institute , which focus on the development of new rice variety and rice crop management technique . </s> the philippine bought it first satellite in 1996 . in 2016 , space program of the philippine the philippine first micro-satellite , diwata-1 wa launched aboard the u cygnus ( spacecraft ) spacecraft . the philippine ha a high concentration of cellular phone user . text messaging is a popular form of communication and , in 2007 , the nation sent an average of one billion short message service message per day . the country ha a high level of mobile financial service utilization . the philippine long distance telephone company , commonly known a pldt , is a formerly nationalized telecommunication provider . it is also the largest company in the country . the national telecommunication commission ( philippine ) is the agency responsible for the supervision , adjudication and control over all telecommunication in the philippine . there are approximately 417 am and 1079 fm radio station and 438 television and 1,551 cable television station . on march 29 , 1994 , the country wa internet in the philippine via a 64 kbit/s connection from a router serviced by pldt to a sprint router in california . estimate for internet penetration in the philippine vary widely ranging from a low of 2.5 ; million to a high of 24 ; million people . social networking in the philippine and watching video are among the most frequent internet activity . the philippine population is the world 's top internet user . </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> the travel and tourism sector contributed 10.6 % of the country 's gdp in 2015 and providing 1,226,500 job in 2013 . 8,260,913 international visitor arrived from january to december 2019 , up by 15.24 % for the same period in 2018. of these came from east asia , came from north america , and came from other asean country . the island of boracay , popular for it beach , wa named a the best island in the world by travel + leisure in 2012 . the philippine is also a popular retirement destination for foreigner due to it climate and low cost of living . </s> <section_title_start> infrastructure <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> transportation <section_title_end> </s> transportation in the philippine is facilitated by road , air , rail and waterway . a of december 2018 , there are of road in the philippine , with only of road paved . the strong republic nautical highway ( srnh ) , an integrated set of highway segment and ferry route covering 17 city wa established in 2003 . the pan-philippine highway connects the island of luzon , samar , leyte , and mindanao , forming the backbone of land-based transportation in the country . road are the dominant form of transport , carrying 98 % of people and 58 % of cargo . a philippine expressway network extends from the capital to other area of luzon . the cebucordova link expressway in cebu will be finished by 2021 . traffic is a significant issue facing the country , especially within manila and on arterial road connecting to the capital . </s> public transport in the country include bus , jeepneys , uv express , tnvs , filcab , taxi , and tricycle . jeepneys are a popular and iconic public utility vehicle . jeepneys and other public utility vehicle which are older than 15 year are public utility vehicle modernization program in favor of a more efficient and environmentally friendly euro 4 compliant vehicle . </s> despite wider historical use , rail transport in the philippine is extremely limited , being confined to transporting passenger within metro manila and neighboring laguna ( province ) , with a separate short track in the bicol region . there are plan to revive freight transport to reduce road congestion . , the country had a railway footprint of only 79 kilometer , which it had plan to expand up to 244 kilometer . metro manila is served by three rapid transit line : lrt line 1 ( metro manila ) , lrt line 2 ( metro manila ) and mrt line 3 ( metro manila ) . the pnr metro commuter line transport passenger between metro manila and laguna . railway line that are under-construction include the line 2 east extension project ( 2020 ) , the mrt line 7 ( metro manila ) ( 2020 ) , the metro manila subway ( 2025 ) , and the pnr north-south commuter railway which is divided into several phase , with partial operation to begin in 2022 . the civil airline industry is regulated by the civil aviation authority of the philippine . philippine airline is asia 's oldest commercial airline still operating under it original name . cebu pacific is the country leading low-cost carrier . </s> a an archipelago , inter-island travel using watercraft is often necessary . boat have always been important to society in the philippine . most boat are outrigger boat double-outrigger vessel , which can reach up to in length , known a banca/bangka , parao , prahu , or balanghay . a variety of boat type are used throughout the island , such a dugout canoe ( baloto ) and house-boats like the lepa-lepa . term such a bangka and baroto are also used a general name for a variety of boat type . modern ship use plywood in place of log and motor engine in place of sail . these ship are used both for fishing and for inter-island travel . the principal seaport of port of manila , batangas international port , port of subic , port of cebu , port of iloilo , port of davao , cagayan de oro , general santos , and port of zamboanga form part of the asean transport network . the pasig river ferry serf the city of manila , makati , mandaluyong , pasig and marikina in metro manila . </s> <section_title_start> water supply and sanitation <section_title_end> </s> in 2015 , it wa reported by the joint monitoring programme for water supply and sanitation that 74 % of the population had access to improved sanitation , and that `` good progress `` had been made between 1990 and 2015 . a of 2016 , 96 % of filipino household have an improved source of drinking water , and 92 % of household had sanitary toilet facility , although connection of these toilet facility to appropriate sewerage system remain largely insufficient especially in rural and urban poor community . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> one of the most visible spanish influence on filipino culture is the prevalence of catlogo alfabtico de apellidos among filipino ; a spanish name and surname , however , doe not necessarily denote spanish ancestry . this peculiarity , unique among the people of asia , came a a result of a colonial edict by governor-general narciso clavera y zalda , 1st count of manila , which ordered the systematic distribution of family name and implementation of spanish naming custom on the population . the name of many location are also spanish , or stem from spanish root and origin . </s> there is a substantial american influence on modern filipino culture . the common use of the english language is an example of the american impact on philippine society . it ha contributed to the influence of american pop cultural trend . this affinity is seen in filipino ' consumption of fast food and american film and music . american global fast-food chain stalwart have entered the market , but local fast-food chain like goldilocks bakeshop and most notably jollibee , the leading fast-food chain in the country , have emerged and compete successfully against foreign chain . </s> the ati-atihan festival ati-atihan , moriones festival and sinulog list of festival in the philippine are among the most well-known . </s> the culture within mindanao and the sulu archipelago developed separately to that of the rest of the country , due to very limited degree of spanish influence and greater influence from nearby islamic region . </s> <section_title_start> literature <section_title_end> </s> philippine mythology ha been handed down primarily through the traditional philippine folk literature of the filipino people . some popular figure from philippine mythology are maria makiling , biag ni lam-ang lam-ang , and the sarimanok . </s> philippine literature comprises work usually written in filipino , spanish , or english . some of the most known were created from the 17th to 19th ; century . ibong adarna , for example , is a famous epic about an eponymous magical bird allegedly written by jos de la cruz or `` huseng sisiw `` . francisco balagtas , the poet and playwright who wrote florante at laura , is recognized a a preeminent writer in the tagalog ( filipino ) language . jos rizal wrote the novel noli me tngere ( novel ) ( touch me not ) and el filibusterismo ( the filibustering , also known a the reign of greed ) . </s> <section_title_start> architecture <section_title_end> </s> spanish architecture ha left an imprint in the philippine in the way many town were designed around a poblacion or plaza mayor , but many of the building bearing it influence were demolished during world war ii . four philippine baroque church are included in the list of unesco world heritage site : the san agustin church , manila in manila , paoay church in ilocos norte , santa maria church ( santa mara ) church in ilocos sur , and miagao church in iloilo . vigan in ilocos sur is also known for the many hispanic-style house and building preserved there . </s> american rule introduced new architectural style . this led to the construction of government building and art deco theater . during the american period , some semblance of city planning using the architectural design and master plan by daniel burnham wa done on the portion of the city of manila . part of the burnham plan wa the construction of government building that resembled greek architecture or neoclassical architecture . in iloilo city , structure from both the spanish and american period can still be seen , especially in calle real , iloilo . certain area of the country like batanes have slight difference a both spanish and filipino way of architecture assimilated differently due to the climate . limestone were used a a building material , with house being built to withstand typhoon . </s> <section_title_start> music <section_title_end> </s> during the spanish era rondalya music , where traditional string orchestra mandolin type instrument were used , wa widespread . kundiman developed in the 1920s and 30 's , and had a renaissance in the postwar period . the american colonial period exposed many filipino to u culture and popular form of music . rock music wa introduced to filipino in the 1960s , and developed into filipino rock , or `` pinoy rock `` , a term encompassing diverse style such a pop rock , alternative rock , [ metal music heavy metal ] , punk rock , new wave music , ska , and reggae . martial law in the 1970s produced several philippine folk music band and artist who were at the forefront of political demonstration . the 1970s also saw the birth of manila sound and original pilipino music ( opm ) . filipino hip-hop trace it origin back to 1979 , entering the mainstream in 1990 . recently k-pop ha become popular . karaoke is a popular activity in the country . </s> <section_title_start> dance <section_title_end> </s> in general , there are two type of philippine traditional folk dance . the first one reflects the influence under the spanish occupation and the other , the country 's profuseness of tribe that offer their own tribal dance . the music that incorporates the former are mostly bandurria-based band that utilizes 14th string guitar . one example of such type is the cariosa . a hispanic filipino dance , unofficially considered a the `` national dance of the philippine `` . another example is the tinikling . </s> in the modern and post-modern time period , dance may vary from the delicate ballet up to the more street-oriented style of breakdancing . </s> <section_title_start> value <section_title_end> </s> a a general description , the distinct value system of filipino is rooted primarily in personal alliance system , especially those based in kinship , obligation , friendship , religion ( particularly christianity ) , and commercial relationship . </s> filipino value are , for the most part , centered around maintaining social harmony , motivated primarily by the desire to be accepted within a group . the main sanction against diverging from these value are the concept of `` hiya `` , roughly translated a ' a sense of shame ' , and `` amor propio `` or 'self-esteem ' . social approval , acceptance by a group , and belonging to a group are major concern . caring about what others will think , say or do , are strong influence on social behavior among filipino . </s> other element of the filipino value system are optimism about the future , pessimism about present situation and event , concern and care for other people , the existence of friendship and friendliness , the habit of being hospitable , religious nature , respectfulness to self and others , respect for the female member of society , the fear of god , and abhorrence of act of cheating and thievery . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> regional variation exist throughout the island , for example rice is a standard starch in luzon while cassava is more common in mindanao . filipino taste bud tend to favor robust flavor , but the cuisine is not a spicy a those of it neighbor . </s> unlike many asian , most filipino do not eat with chopstick ; they use western cutlery . however , possibly due to rice being the primary staple food and the popularity of a large number of stew and main dish with broth in filipino cuisine , the main pairing of utensil seen at the filipino dining table is that of spoon and fork , not knife and fork . </s> the traditional way of eating with the hand known a kamayan ( using the hand for bringing food to the mouth ) wa previously more often seen in the le urbanized area . however , due to the various filipino restaurant that introduced filipino food to people of other nationality , a well a to filipino urbanites , kamayan fast became popular . this recent trend also sometimes incorporates the `` boodle fight `` concept ( a popularized and coined by the philippine army ) , wherein banana leaf are used a giant plate on top of which rice portion and filipino viand are placed all together for a filial , friendly or communal kamayan feasting . </s> <section_title_start> mass medium <section_title_end> </s> medium in the philippine us mainly filipino and english , though broadcasting ha shifted to filipino . there are large number of both list of radio station in the philippine and list of newspaper in the philippine . the top three newspaper by nationwide readership a well a credibility are the philippine daily inquirer , manila bulletin , and the philippine star . while freedom of the press is protected by the constitution , the country is very dangerous for journalist . the dominant television in the philippine network were abs-cbn and gma network , both being free to air . abs-cbn , at the time the largest network wa shut down following a cease and desist order issued by the national telecommunication commission ( philippine ) on may 5 , 2020 , a day after the abs-cbn franchise renewal controversy expiration of the network 's franchise . prior to this move , duterte accused abs-cbn of being biased against his administration and vowed to block the renewal of their franchise . however , critic of the duterte administration , human right group , and medium union said the shutdown of abs-cbn wa an attack on press freedom . on july 10 , 2020 , the house of representative declined a renewal of abs-cbn 's tv and radio franchise , voted 7011 . </s> tv , the internet , and social medium , particularly facebook , remain the top source of news and information for majority of filipino a newspaper readership continues to decline . english broadsheet are popular among executive , professional and student . cheaper tagalog tabloid , which feature crime , sex , gossip and gore , saw a rise in the 1990s , and tend to be popular among the mass , particularly in manila . </s> <section_title_start> cinema <section_title_end> </s> philippine cinema began at the end of the 19th century , and made up around 20 % of the domestic market during the second half of the 20th century . during the 21st century however , the industry ha struggled to compete with larger budget foreign film . critically acclaimed philippine film include himala ( miracle ) . moving picture were first shown in the philippine on january 1 , 1897 . all film were all in spanish since philippine cinema wa first introduced during the final year of the spanish era of the country . antonio ramos wa the first known movie producer . meanwhile , jose nepomuceno wa dubbed a the `` father of philippine movie `` . his work marked the start of the local production of movie . production company remained small during the era of silent film , but 1933 saw the emergence of sound film and the arrival of the first significant production company . the postwar 1940s and the 1950s are regarded a a high point for philippine cinema . </s> the growing dominance of hollywood film and the cost of production ha severely reduced local filmmaking . nonetheless , some local film continue to find success . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> basketball in the philippine is played at both amateur and professional level and is considered to be the most popular sport in the philippine . in 2010 , manny pacquiao wa named edward j. neil trophy # 2000s `` fighter of the decade `` for the 2000s by the boxing writer association of america . the national filipino martial art and sport of the country is arnis de mano . sabong or cockfighting is another popular entertainment especially among filipino men , and wa documented by magellan 's voyage a a pastime in the kingdom of taytay . </s> beginning in philippine at the 1924 summer olympics , the philippine ha competed in every summer olympic game , except when they participated in the american-led boycott of the 1980 summer olympics . the philippine is also the first tropical nation at the winter olympics to compete at the winter olympic game philippine at the 1972 winter olympics edition . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * outline of the philippine </s> <section_title_start> note <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> reference
