english-speaking country and territory </s> category : former colony in asia </s> category : former spanish colony </s> category : island country </s> category : maritime southeast asia </s> category : member state of asean </s> category : member state of the united nation </s> category : newly industrializing country </s> category : republic </s> category : southeast asian country </s> category : spanish east indie </s> category : state and territory established in 1565 </s> category : state and territory established in 1898 </s> category : state and territory established in 1946 </s> category : volcanic arc island </s> category : country in asia </s> category : former japanese colony <article_end> <article_start> </s> indonesia ( ) , officially the republic of indonesia ( republik indonesia links=yes ) , is a country in southeast asia and oceania , between the indian ocean and pacific ocean ocean . it consists of more than list of island of indonesia , including sumatra , java , sulawesi , and part of borneo ( kalimantan ) and new guinea ( western new guinea ) . indonesia is the world 's largest island country and the list of country and dependency by area 14th-largest country by land area , at . with more than 270.2 million people , indonesia is the world 's list of country and dependency by population fourth-most populous country a well a the most populous islam by country muslim-majority country . java , the world 's list of island by population , is home to more than half of the country 's population . </s> the sovereign state is a president of indonesia , republic with an elected people 's consultative assembly . it ha province of indonesia , of which five have autonomous administrative division . the country 's capital , jakarta , is the list of largest city second-most populous urban area in the world . the country share template : border of indonesia with papua new guinea , east timor , and the east malaysia of malaysia . other neighbouring country include singapore , vietnam , the philippine , australia , palau , and india 's andaman and nicobar island . despite it large population and densely populated region , indonesia ha vast area of wilderness that support one of the megadiverse country world 's highest level of biodiversity . </s> the indonesian archipelago ha been a valuable region for trade since at least the 7th century when srivijaya and later majapahit traded with entity from mainland china and the indian subcontinent . local ruler gradually absorbed foreign influence from the early century and hinduism in indonesia and buddhism in indonesia kingdom flourished . sunni islam trader and sufism scholar brought islam in indonesia , while european introduced christianity in indonesia through european colonisation of southeast asia . although sometimes interrupted by the portuguese colonialism in the east indie , french and british interregnum in the dutch east indie , the dutch east indie # history were the foremost dutch empire for much of their 350-year presence in the archipelago . the concept of `` indonesia `` a a nation-state indonesian national awakening in the early 20th century and the country proclamation of indonesian independence in 1945 . however , it wa not until 1949 that the dutch recognised united state of indonesia indonesia 's sovereignty following an indonesian national revolution between the two . </s> indonesia consists of hundred of distinct native ethnic group in indonesia and language of indonesia group , with the largest one being the javanese people . a shared identity ha developed with the motto `` bhinneka tunggal ika `` ( `` unity in diversity `` literally , `` many , yet one `` ) , defined by a national language , ethnic diversity , religious pluralism within a muslim-majority population , and a history of colonialism and rebellion against it . the economy of indonesia is the world 's list of country by gdp ( nominal ) largest by nominal gdp and list of country by gdp ( ppp ) by gdp at purchasing power parity . indonesia is the only regional power in southeast asia and is considered a middle power in global affair . the country is a member of several multilateral organisation , including the united nation , world trade organization , g20 , and a founding member of non-aligned movement , asean ( asean ) , east asia summit , and the organisation of islamic cooperation . </s> <section_title_start> etymology <section_title_end> </s> the name indonesia derives from ancient greek word of wikt : indo- ( ) and nesos ( ) , meaning `` indian island `` . the name date to the 18th century , far predating the formation of independent indonesia . in 1850 , george windsor earl , an english ethnology , proposed the term indunesiansand , his preference , malayunesiansfor the inhabitant of the `` indian archipelago or malay archipelago `` . in the same publication , one of his student , james richardson logan , used indonesia a a synonym for indian archipelago . however , dutch academic writing in east indie publication were reluctant to use indonesia ; they preferred malay archipelago ( maleische archipel ) ; the dutch east indie ( nederlandsch oost indi ) , popularly indi ; the east ( de oost ) ; and insulinde . </s> after 1900 , indonesia became more common in academic circle outside the netherlands , and native nationalist group adopted it for political expression . adolf bastian , of the university of berlin , popularized the name through his book indonesien oder die inseln de malayischen archipels , 18841894 italic=yes . the first native scholar to use the name wa ki hajar dewantara when in 1913 he established a press bureau in the netherlands , indonesisch pers-bureau . </s> <section_title_start> history <section_title_end> </s> <section_title_start> early history <section_title_end> </s> fossilised remains of homo erectus , popularly known a the `` java man `` , suggest the indonesian archipelago wa inhabited two million to 500,000 year ago . homo sapiens reached the region around 43,000 bce . austronesian people , who form the majority of the modern population , migrated to southeast asia from what is now taiwan . they arrived in the archipelago around 2,000 bce and confined the native melanesians to the far eastern region a they spread east . ideal agricultural condition and the mastering of paddy field wet-field rice cultivation a early a the eighth century bce allowed village , town , and small kingdom to flourish by the first century ce . the archipelago 's strategic sea-lane position fostered inter-island and international trade , including with indian kingdom and chinese dynasty , from several century bce . trade ha since fundamentally shaped indonesian history . </s> from the seventh century ce , the srivijaya naval kingdom flourished a a result of trade and the influence of hinduism and buddhism . between the eighth and tenth century ce , the agricultural buddhist sailendra and hindu mataram kingdom dynasty thrived and declined in inland java , leaving grand religious monument such a sailendra 's borobudur and mataram 's prambanan . the hindu majapahit kingdom wa founded in eastern java in the late 13th century , and under gajah mada , it influence stretched over much of present-day indonesia . this period is often referred to a a `` golden age `` in indonesian history . </s> spread of islam in indonesia in the archipelago date to the 13th century in northern sumatra . other part of the archipelago gradually adopted islam , and it wa the dominant religion in java and sumatra by the end of the 16th century . for the most part , islam overlaid and mixed with existing cultural and religious influence , which shaped the predominant form of islam in indonesia , particularly in java . </s> <section_title_start> colonial era <section_title_end> </s> the first european arrived in the archipelago in 1512 , when portuguese trader , led by francisco serro , portuguese colonialism in indonesia the source of nutmeg , clove , and piper cubeba in the maluku island . dutch and british trader followed . in 1602 , the dutch established the dutch east india company ( voc ) and became the dominant european power for almost 200 year . the voc wa dissolved in 1800 following bankruptcy , and the batavian republic established the dutch east indie a a nationalised colony . </s> for most of the history of indonesia # colonial era , dutch control over the archipelago wa tenuous . dutch force were engaged continuously in quelling rebellion both on and off java . the influence of local leader such a prince diponegoro in central java , imam bonjol in central sumatra , pattimura in maluku island , and bloody aceh war 30-year war in aceh weakened the dutch and tied up the colonial military force . only in the early 20th century did the dutch dominance extend to what wa to become indonesia 's current boundary . </s> the dutch east indie campaign and japanese occupation of the dutch east indie during world war ii ended dutch rule and encouraged the previously suppressed independence movement . two day after the surrender of japan in august 1945 , sukarno and mohammad hatta , influential nationalist leader , proclamation of indonesian independence and were appointed president and vice-president respectively . </s> the netherlands attempted to re-establish their rule , and indonesian national revolution ended in december 1949 when the dutch formally recognised indonesian independence in the face of international pressure . despite extraordinary political , social and sectarian division , indonesian , on the whole , found unity in their fight for independence . </s> <section_title_start> post-world war ii <section_title_end> </s> a president , sukarno moved indonesia from democracy towards authoritarianism and maintained power by balancing the opposing force of indonesian national armed force , political islam , and the increasingly powerful communist party of indonesia ( pki ) . tension between the military and the pki culminated in 30 september movement in 1965 . the army , led by major general suharto , countered by instigating a indonesian mass killing of 196566 violent anti-communist purge that killed between 500,000 and one million people . the pki wa blamed for the coup and effectively destroyed . suharto capitalised on sukarno 's weakened position , and following a transition to the new order drawn-out power play with sukarno , suharto wa appointed president in march 1968 . his new order ( indonesia ) `` new order `` administration , supported by the united state , encouraged foreign direct investment , which wa a crucial factor in the subsequent three decade of substantial economic growth . </s> indonesia wa the country hardest hit by the 1997 asian financial crisis . it brought out may 1998 riot of indonesia # background with the new order 's corruption and suppression of political opposition and ultimately ended suharto 's presidency . in 1999 , east timor seceded from indonesia , following it indonesian invasion of east timor and a indonesian occupation of east timor 25-year occupation that wa marked by international condemnation of human right abuse . </s> since 1998 , democratic process have been strengthened by enhancing regional autonomy and instituting the country 's 2004 indonesian presidential election . political , economic and social instability , corruption , and instance of terrorism in indonesia ( the deadliest being the 2002 bali bombing ) remained problem in the 2000s ; however , the economy ha performed strongly in the last 15 year . although relation among the diverse population are mostly harmonious , acute sectarian discontent and violence remain a problem in some area . a political settlement to an armed separatist conflict in aceh wa achieved in 2005 following the 2004 indian ocean earthquake and tsunami that killed 130,000 indonesian . </s> <section_title_start> geography <section_title_end> </s> indonesia lie between latitude 11th parallel south 11 and 6th parallel north 6n , and longitude 95th meridian east 95e and 141st meridian east 141e . it is the largest archipelagic state in the world , extending from east to west and from north to south . the country 's coordinating ministry for maritime and investment affair ( indonesia ) say indonesia ha 17,504 island ( with 16,056 registered at the un ) scattered over both side of the equator , around 6,000 of which are inhabited . the largest are java , sumatra , borneo ( shared with brunei and malaysia ) , sulawesi , and new guinea ( shared with papua new guinea ) . indonesia share land border with indonesiamalaysia border on borneo and sebatik island , indonesiapapua new guinea border on the island of new guinea , and east timorindonesia border on the island of timor , and maritime border with singapore , malaysia , vietnam , the philippine , palau , and australia . </s> at , puncak jaya is indonesia 's highest peak , and lake toba in sumatra is the largest lake , with an area of 1,145 km2 ( 442 sq mi ) . list of river of indonesia indonesia 's largest river are in kalimantan and new guinea and include kapuas river , barito river , mamberamo river , sepik river and mahakam river . they serve a communication and transport link between the island 's river settlement . </s> <section_title_start> climate <section_title_end> </s> indonesia lie along the equator , and it climate tends to be relatively even year-round . indonesia ha two seasonsa wet season and a dry seasonwith no extreme of summer or winter . for most of indonesia , the dry season fall between may and october with the wet season between november and april . indonesia 's climate is almost entirely tropical climate , dominated by the tropical rainforest climate found in every large island of indonesia . more cooling climate type do exist in mountainous region that are above sea level . the oceanic climate ( kppen cfb ) prevails in highland area adjacent to rainforest climate , with reasonably uniform precipitation year-round . in highland area near the tropical monsoon and tropical savanna climate , the subtropical highland climate ( kppen cwb ) is prevalent with a more pronounced dry season . </s> some region , such a kalimantan and sumatra , experience only slight difference in rainfall and temperature between the season , whereas others , such a nusa tenggara , experience far more pronounced difference with drought in the dry season , and flood in the wet . rainfall varies across region , with more in western sumatra , java , and the interior of kalimantan and papua , and le in area closer to australia , such a nusa tenggara , which tend to be dry . the almost uniformly warm water that constitute 81 % of indonesia 's area ensure that temperature on land remain relatively constant . humidity is quite high , at between 70 and 90 % . wind are moderate and generally predictable , with monsoon usually blowing in from the south and east in june through october , and from the northwest in november through march . typhoon and large-scale storm pose little hazard to mariner ; significant danger come from swift current in channel , such a the lombok strait and sape strait strait . </s> <section_title_start> geology <section_title_end> </s> tectonics , indonesia is highly unstable , making it a site of numerous volcano and frequent earthquake . it lie on the pacific ring of fire where the indo-australian plate and the pacific plate are pushed under the eurasian plate where they melt at about deep . a string of volcano run through sumatra , java , bali and nusa tenggara , and then to the banda island of maluku island to northeastern sulawesi . of the 400 volcano , around 130 are active . between 1972 and 1991 , there were 29 volcanic eruption , mostly on java . volcanic ash ha made agricultural condition unpredictable in some area . however , it ha also resulted in fertile soil , a factor in historically sustaining high population density of java and bali . </s> a toba catastrophe theory at present-day lake toba around 70,000 bce . it is believed to have caused a global volcanic winter and cooling of the climate , and subsequently led to a genetic bottleneck in human evolution , though this is still in debate . the 1815 eruption of mount tambora and the 1883 eruption of krakatoa were among the largest in recorded history . the former caused 92,000 death and created an umbrella of volcanic ash which spread and blanketed part of the archipelago , and made much of the northern hemisphere year without a summer . the latter produced the loudest sound in recorded history and caused 36,000 death due to the eruption itself and the resulting tsunami , with significant additional effect around the world year after the event . recent catastrophic disaster due to seismic activity include the 2004 indian ocean earthquake and the 2006 yogyakarta earthquake . </s> <section_title_start> biodiversity <section_title_end> </s> indonesia 's size , tropical climate , and archipelagic geography support one of the megadiverse country world 's highest level of biodiversity . it flora and fauna is a mixture of asian and australasian realm specie . the island of the sunda shelf ( sumatra , java , borneo , and bali ) were once linked to mainland asia , and have a wealth of asian fauna . large specie such a the sumatran tiger , rhinoceros , orangutan , asian elephant , and leopard were once abundant a far east a bali , but number and distribution have dwindled drastically . having been long separated from the continental landmass , sulawesi , nusa tenggara , and maluku have developed their unique flora and fauna . papua wa part of the australian landmass and is home to a fauna of new guinea closely related to that of australia , including over 600 bird specie . forest cover approximately 70 % of the country . however , the forest of the smaller , and more densely populated java , have largely been removed for human habitation and agriculture . </s> indonesia is second only to australia in term of total endemic specie , with 36 % of it 1,531 specie of bird and 39 % of it 515 specie of mammal being endemic . tropical sea surround indonesia 's of coastline . the country ha a range of sea and coastal ecosystem , including list of beach in indonesia , dune , estuary , mangrove , coral reef , seagrass bed , coastal mudflats , tidal flat , algal bed , and small island ecosystem . indonesia is one of coral triangle country with the world 's most enormous diversity of coral reef fish with more than 1,650 specie in eastern indonesia only . </s> british naturalist alfred russel wallace described a dividing line ( wallace line ) between the distribution of indonesia 's asian and australasian specie . it run roughly northsouth along the edge of the sunda shelf , between kalimantan and sulawesi , and along the deep lombok strait , between lombok and bali . flora and fauna on the west of the line are generally asian , while east from lombok they are increasingly australian until the tipping point at the weber line . in his 1869 book , the malay archipelago , wallace described numerous specie unique to the area . the region of island between his line and new guinea is now termed wallacea . </s> <section_title_start> environment <section_title_end> </s> indonesia 's large and growing population and rapid industrialisation present serious environmental issue in indonesia . they are often given a lower priority due to high poverty level and weak , under-resourced governance . problem include the destruction of peatlands , deforestation in indonesia large-scale illegal deforestation ( causing southeast asian haze ) , over-exploitation of marine resource , air pollution , garbage management , and reliable water supply and sanitation in indonesia . these issue contribute to indonesia 's low ranking ( number 116 out of 180 country ) in the 2020 environmental performance index . the report also indicates that indonesia 's performance is generally below average in both regional and global context . </s> expansion of the palm oil industry requiring significant change to the natural ecosystem is the one primary factor behind much of deforestation in indonesia indonesia 's deforestation . while it can generate wealth for local community , it may degrade ecosystem and cause social problem . this situation make indonesia the world 's largest forest-based emitter of greenhouse gas . it also threatens the survival of indigenous and endemic specie . the international union for conservation of nature ( iucn ) identified 140 specie of mammal a threatened specie , and 15 a critically endangered , including the bali myna , sumatran orangutan , and javan rhinoceros . </s> several study consider indonesia to be at severe risk from the climate change in indonesia . these include unreduced emission resulting in an average temperature rise of around by mid-century , raising the frequency of drought and food shortage ( with an impact on precipitation and the pattern of wet and dry season , and thus indonesia 's agriculture system ) a well a numerous disease and wildfire . sea level rise would also threaten the majority of indonesia 's population who life in low-lying coastal area . impoverished community would likely be affected the most by climate change . </s> <section_title_start> government and politics <section_title_end> </s> indonesia is a republic with a presidential system . following the fall of suharto in 1998 , political and governmental structure have undergone sweeping reform , with constitution of indonesia # constitutional amendment revamping the executive , legislative and judicial branch . chief among them is the delegation of power and authority to various regional entity while remaining a unitary state . the president of indonesia is the [ of state ] and [ of government ] , commander-in-chief of the indonesian national armed force ( tentara nasional indonesia , tni ) , and the director of domestic governance , policy-making , and foreign affair . the president may serve a maximum of two consecutive five-year term . </s> the highest representative body at the national level is the people 's consultative assembly ( majelis permusyawaratan rakyat , mpr ) . it main function are supporting and amending the constitution , inaugurating and impeaching the president , and formalising broad outline of state policy . the mpr comprises two house ; the people 's representative council ( dewan perwakilan rakyat , dpr ) , with 575 member , and the regional representative council ( dewan perwakilan daerah , dpd ) , with 136 . the dpr pass legislation and monitor the executive branch . reform since 1998 have markedly increased it role in national governance , while the dpd is a new chamber for matter of regional management . </s> most civil dispute appear before the state court ( pengadilan negeri ) ; appeal are heard before the high court ( pengadilan tinggi ) . the supreme court of indonesia ( mahkamah agung ) is the highest level of the judicial branch , and hears final cessation appeal and conduct case review . other court include the constitutional court of indonesia ( mahkamah konstitusi ) that listens to constitutional and political matter and the religious court ( pengadilan agama ) that deal with codified islamic law ( sharia ) case . additionally , the judicial commission of indonesia ( komisi yudisial ) monitor the performance of judge . </s> <section_title_start> party and election <section_title_end> </s> since 1999 , indonesia ha had a multi-party system . in all election in indonesia since the fall of the new order ( indonesia ) , no political party ha managed to win an overall majority of seat . the indonesian democratic party of struggle ( pdi-p ) , which secured the most vote in the 2019 indonesian general election , is the party of the incumbent president , joko widodo . other notable party include the golkar ( golkar ) , the great indonesia movement party ( gerindra ) , the democratic party ( indonesia ) , and the prosperous justice party ( pks ) . the 2019 election resulted in nine political party in the dpr , with a election threshold of 4 % of the national vote . the first general election wa held in 1955 to elect member of the dpr and the constitutional assembly of indonesia ( konstituante ) . at the national level , indonesian did not elect a president until 2004 . since then , the president is elected for a five-year term , a are the party-aligned member of the dpr and the non-partisan dpd . beginning with 2015 indonesian local election , election for governor and mayor have occurred on the same date . in 2014 , the constitutional court ruled that legislative and presidential election are to be held simultaneously , starting in 2019. </s> <section_title_start> administrative division <section_title_end> </s> indonesia ha several level of subdivision . the first level is that of the province , with five out of a total of 34 having a autonomous administrative division . each ha a legislature ( dewan perwakilan rakyat daerah , dprd ) and an elected governor . this number ha evolved , with the most recent change being the split of north kalimantan from east kalimantan in 2012 . the second level is that of the regency ( list of regency and city of indonesia ) and city ( list of regency and city of indonesia ) , led by regent ( bupati ) and mayor ( walikota ) respectively and a legislature ( dprd kabupaten/kota ) . the third level is that of the district of indonesia ( kecamatan , distrik in western new guinea , or kapanewon and kemantren in special region of yogyakarta ) , and the fourth is of the village of indonesia ( either desa , kelurahan , kampung , nagari in west sumatra , or gampong in aceh ) . </s> the village is the lowest level of government administration . it is divided into several community group ( rukun warga , rw ) , which are further divided into neighbourhood group ( rukun tetangga , rt ) . in java , the village ( desa ) is divided into smaller unit called dusun or dukuh ( hamlet ) , which are the same a rw . following the implementation of regional autonomy measure in 2001 , regency and city have become chief administrative unit , responsible for providing most government service . the village administration level is the most influential on a citizen 's daily life and handle matter of a village or neighbourhood through an elected village head ( lurah or kepala desa ) . </s> aceh , jakarta , yogyakarta , papua ( province ) , and west papua ( province ) have greater legislative privilege and a higher degree of autonomy from the central government than the other province . a conservative islamic territory , aceh ha the right to create some aspect of an independent legal system implementing sharia . yogyakarta is the only list of indonesian monarchy pre-colonial monarchy legally recognised in indonesia , with the position of governor and vice governor being prioritised for descendant of the sultan of yogyakarta and pakualaman , respectively . papua and west papua are the only province where the indigenous people of new guinea have privilege in their local government . jakarta is the only city granted a provincial government due to it position a the capital of indonesia . </s> <section_title_start> foreign relation <section_title_end> </s> indonesia maintains 132 diplomatic mission abroad , including 95 embassy . the country adheres to what it call a `` free and active `` foreign policy , seeking a role in regional affair in proportion to it size and location but avoiding involvement in conflict among other country . </s> indonesia wa a significant battleground during the cold war . numerous attempt by the united state and the soviet union , and china to some degree , culminated in the 1965 coup attempt and subsequent upheaval that led to a reorientation of foreign policy . quiet alignment with the western world while maintaining a non-aligned stance ha characterised indonesia 's foreign policy since then . today , it maintains close relation with it neighbour and is a founding member of the association of southeast asian nation ( asean ) and the east asia summit . in common with most of the muslim world , indonesia doe not have diplomatic relation with israel and ha actively supported state of palestine . however , observer have pointed out that indonesia ha tie with israel , albeit discreetly . </s> indonesia ha been indonesia and the united nation of the united nation since 1950 and wa a founding member of the non-aligned movement ( nam ) and the organisation of islamic cooperation ( oic ) . indonesia is a signatory to the asean free trade area agreement , the cairn group , and the world trade organization ( wto ) , and an occasional member of opec . during the indonesiamalaysia confrontation , indonesia withdrew from the un due to the latter 's election to the united nation security council , although it returned 18 month later . it marked the first time in un history that a member state had attempted a withdrawal . indonesia ha been a humanitarian and development aid recipient since 1966 , and recently , the country established it first overseas aid program in late 2019. </s> <section_title_start> military <section_title_end> </s> indonesia 's armed force ( tni ) include the indonesian army ( tniad ) , indonesian navy ( tnial , which includes indonesian marine corp ) , and indonesian air force ( tniau ) . the army ha about 400,000 active-duty personnel . defence spending in the national budget wa 0.7 % of gdp in 2018 , with controversial involvement of military-owned commercial interest and foundation . the armed force were formed during the indonesian national revolution when it undertook guerrilla warfare along with informal militia . since then , territorial line have formed the basis of all tni branch ' structure , aimed at maintaining domestic stability and deterring foreign threat . the military ha possessed a strong political influence since it founding , which dwifungsi . political reform in 1998 included the removal of the tni 's formal representation from the legislature . nevertheless , it political influence remains , albeit at a reduced level . </s> since independence , the country ha struggled to maintain unity against local insurgency and separatist movement . some , notably in insurgency in aceh and papua conflict , have led to an armed conflict , and subsequent allegation of human right abuse and brutality from all side . the former wa resolved peacefully in 2005 , while the latter continues , amid a significant , albeit imperfect , implementation of regional autonomy law , and a reported decline in the level of violence and human right in indonesia # west papua issue since 2004 . other engagement of the army include the campaign against the netherlands new guinea to incorporate the territory into indonesia , the indonesiamalaysia confrontation to oppose the creation of malaysia , the indonesian mass killing of 196566 of pki , and the indonesian invasion of east timor , which remains indonesia 's most massive military operation . </s> <section_title_start> economy <section_title_end> </s> indonesia ha a mixed economy in which both the private sector and government play vital role . a the only g20 member state in southeast asia , the country ha the largest economy in the region and is classified a a newly industrialised country . , it is the world 's list of country by gdp ( nominal ) and list of country by gdp ( ppp ) , estimated to be u $ 1.100 ; trillion and u $ 3.740 ; trillion respectively . per caput gdp in ppp is u $ 14,020 , while nominal gross domestic product is u $ 4,120 . the debt ratio to gdp is 29.2 % . the service are the economy 's largest sector and account for 43.4 % of gdp ( 2018 ) , followed by industry ( 39.7 % ) and agriculture ( 12.8 % ) . since 2009 , it ha employed more people than other sector , accounting for 47.7 % of the total labour force , followed by agriculture ( 30.2 % ) and industry ( 21.9 % ) . </s> over time , the structure of the economy ha changed considerably . historically , it ha been weighted heavily towards agriculture , reflecting both it stage of economic development and government policy in the 1950s and 1960s to promote agricultural self-sufficiency . a gradual process of industrialisation and urbanisation began in the late 1960s and accelerated in the 1980s a falling oil price saw the government focus on diversifying away from oil export and towards manufactured export . this development continued throughout the 1980s and into the next decade despite the 1990 oil price shock , during which the gdp rose at an average rate of 7.1 % . a a result , the official poverty rate fell from 60 % to 15 % . reduction of trade barrier from the mid-1980s made the economy more globally integrated . the growth ended with the 1997 asian financial crisis that had a severe impact on the economy , including a 13.1 % real gdp contraction in 1998 and inflation reaching 78 % . the economy reached it low point in mid-1999 with only 0.8 % real gdp growth . </s> relatively steady inflation and an increase in gdp deflator and the consumer price index have contributed to strong economic growth in recent year . from 2007 to 2019 , annual growth ha accelerated to between 4 % and 6 % a a result of improvement in the banking sector and domestic consumption , helping indonesia weather the 20082009 great recession , and regain in 2011 the investment grade rating it had lost in 1997. , 9.41 % of the population lived below the poverty line , and the official open unemployment rate wa 5.28 % . however , in late 2020 , indonesia fell into it first recession in 22 year due to the effect of the global covid-19 pandemic . </s> indonesia ha abundant natural resource like petroleum and natural gas , coal , tin , copper , gold , and nickel , while agriculture in indonesia produce rice , palm oil , tea , coffee , cacao bean , medicinal plant , spice , and natural rubber . these commodity make up a large portion of the country 's export , with palm oil and coal briquette a the leading export commodity . in addition to refined and crude petroleum a the main import , telephone , vehicle part and wheat cover the majority of additional import . china , the united state , japan , singapore , india , malaysia , south korea and thailand are indonesia 's principal export market and import partner . </s> <section_title_start> transport <section_title_end> </s> indonesia 's transport system ha been shaped over time by the economic resource base of an archipelago , and the distribution of it 250 ; million people highly concentrated on java . all transport mode play a role in the country 's transport system and are generally complementary rather than competitive . in 2016 , the transport sector generated about 5.2 % of gdp . </s> the road transport system is predominant , with a total length of . jakarta ha the transjakarta , boasting some in 13 corridor and ten cross-corridor route . rickshaw such a bajaj and becak and share taxi such a angkot and metromini are a regular sight in the country . most of the railway are in java , used for both freight and passenger transport , such a local commuter rail service complementing the inter-city rail network in several city . in the late 2010s , jakarta and palembang were the first city in indonesia to have rapid transit system , with more planned for other city in the future . in 2015 , the government announced a plan to build a high-speed rail in indonesia high-speed rail , which would be a first in southeast asia . </s> indonesia 's largest airport , soekarnohatta international airport is among the busiest in the southern hemisphere , list of busiest airport by passenger traffic serving 54 ; million passenger in 2019 . ngurah rai international airport and juanda international airport are the country 's second-and third-busiest airport respectively . garuda indonesia , the country 's flag carrier since 1949 , is one of the world 's leading airline and a member of the global airline alliance skyteam . port of tanjung priok is the busiest and most advanced indonesian port , handling more than 50 % of indonesia 's trans-shipment cargo traffic . </s> <section_title_start> energy <section_title_end> </s> in 2017 , indonesia wa the world 's 9th largest energy producer with , and the 15th largest energy consumer , with . the country ha substantial energy resource , including of conventional oil and gas reserve ( of which about 4 ; billion barrel are recoverable ) , 8 ; billion barrel of oil-equivalent of coal-based methane ( cbm ) resource , and 28 ; billion tonne of recoverable coal . while reliance on domestic coal and imported oil ha increased , indonesia ha seen progress in renewable energy with hydropower being the most abundant source . furthermore , the country ha the potential for geothermal , solar , wind , biomass and ocean energy . indonesia ha set out to achieve 23 % use of renewable energy by 2025 and 31 % by 2050. , indonesia 's total national installed power generation capacity stand at 55,528.51 mw . </s> the country 's largest dam , jatiluhur dam , ha several purpose including the provision of hydroelectric power generation , water supply , flood control , irrigation and aquaculture . the earth-fill dam is high and withholds a reservoir of . it help to supply water to jakarta and to irrigate of rice field and ha an installed capacity of 186.5 mw which feed into the java grid managed by the state electricity company ( perusahaan listrik negara , pln ) . </s> <section_title_start> science and technology <section_title_end> </s> indonesia 's expenditure on science and technology is relatively low , at le than 0.1 % of gdp ( 2017 ) . historical example of scientific and technological development include the paddy cultivation technique terrace ( agriculture ) , which is common in southeast asia , and the pinisi boat by the bugis and makassar people . in the 1980s , indonesian engineer tjokorda raka sukawati invented a road construction technique named sosrobahu that allows the construction of long stretch of flyover above existing main road with minimum traffic disruption . it later became widely used in several country . the country is also an active producer of passenger train and freight wagon with it state-owned company , the industri kereta api ( inka ) , and ha exported train abroad . </s> indonesia ha a long history in developing military and small commuter aircraft a the only country in southeast asia to build and produce aircraft . with it state-owned company , the indonesian aerospace ( pt . dirgantara indonesia ) , indonesia ha provided component for boeing and airbus . the company also collaborated with eads casa of spain to develop the casa/iptn cn-235 cn-235 that ha seen use by several country . former president b. j. habibie played a vital role in this achievement . indonesia ha also joined the south korean programme to manufacture the fifth-generation jet fighter kai kf-x . </s> indonesia ha a space programme and space agency , the national institute of aeronautics and space ( lembaga penerbangan dan antariksa nasional , lapan ) . in the 1970s , indonesia became the first developing country to operate a satellite system called palapa , a series of communication satellite owned by indosat ooredoo . the first satellite , palapa a1 wa launched on 8 july 1976 from the kennedy space center in florida , united state . , indonesia ha launched 18 satellite for various purpose , and lapan ha expressed a desire to put satellite in orbit with native launch vehicle by 2040. </s> <section_title_start> tourism <section_title_end> </s> tourism in indonesia contributed around u $ 19.7 ; billion to gdp in 2019 . in 2018 , indonesia received 15.8 ; million visitor , a growth of 12.5 % from last year , and received an average receipt of u $ 967 . china , singapore , malaysia , australia , and japan are the top five source of visitor to indonesia . since 2011 , wonderful indonesia ha been the slogan of the country 's international marketing campaign to promote tourism . </s> nature and culture are prime attraction of indonesian tourism . the former can boast a unique combination of a tropical climate , a vast archipelago , and a long stretch of beach , and the latter complement those with a rich cultural heritage reflecting indonesia 's dynamic history and ethnic diversity . indonesia ha a well-preserved natural ecosystem with rain forest that stretch over about 57 % of indonesia 's land ( 225 ; million acre ) . forest on sumatra and kalimantan are example of popular destination , such a the orangutan wildlife reserve . moreover , indonesia ha one of the world 's longest coastline , measuring . the ancient borobudur and prambanan temple a well a toraja and bali , with it traditional festivity , are some of the popular destination for cultural tourism . </s> indonesia ha list of world heritage site in indonesia , including the komodo national park and the ombilin coal mine ; and a further 19 in a tentative list that includes bunaken national park and raja ampat island . other attraction include the specific point in indonesian history , such a the colonial heritage of the dutch east indie in the old town of kota tua jakarta and dutch architecture in semarang , and the list of palace in indonesia of pagaruyung palace , ubud palace , and kraton ngayogyakarta hadiningrat . </s> <section_title_start> demographic <section_title_end> </s> the 2020 indonesian census recorded demographic of indonesia indonesia 's population a 270.2 ; million , the list of country and dependency by population , with a moderately high population growth rate at 1.3 % . java is the world 's most populous island , where 56 % of the country 's population life . the population density is 141 people per km2 ( 365 per sq mi ) , ranking 88th in the world , although java ha a population density of 1,067 people per km2 ( 2,435 per sq mi ) . in 1961 , the first post-colonial census recorded a total of 97 ; million people . it is expected to grow to around 295 ; million by 2030 and 321 ; million by 2050 . the country currently posse a relatively young population , with a median age of 30.2 year ( 2017 estimate ) . </s> the spread of the population is uneven throughout the archipelago with a varying habitat and level of list of indonesian province by human development index , ranging from the megacity of jakarta to uncontacted people in papua . a of 2017 , about 54.7 % of the population life in urban area . jakarta is the country 's primate city and the list of largest city second-most populous urban area in the world with over 34 ; million resident . about 8 ; million overseas indonesian ; most settled in malaysia , the netherlands , saudi arabia , the united arab emirate , hong kong , singapore , the united state , and australia . </s> <section_title_start> ethnic group and language <section_title_end> </s> indonesia is an ethnically diverse country , with around 600 distinct native ethnic group . most indonesian are descended from austronesian people whose language had origin in proto-austronesian language proto-austronesian , which possibly originated in what is now taiwan . another major grouping is the melanesians , who inhabit eastern indonesia ( the maluku island and western new guinea ) . </s> the javanese people are the largest ethnic group , constituting 40.2 % of the population , and are politically dominant . they are predominantly located in the central to eastern part of java and also sizable number in most province . the sundanese people , malay ( ethnic group ) , batak people , madurese people , minangkabau people and bugis people are the next largest group in the country . a sense of indonesian nationhood exists alongside strong regional identity . </s> the country 's official language is indonesian language , a variant of malay language based on it prestige ( sociolinguistics ) , which for century had been the lingua franca of the archipelago . it wa youth pledge and achieved official status under the name bahasa indonesia in 1945 . a a result of centuries-long contact with other language , it is rich in local and foreign influence , including from javanese , sundanese , minangkabau , hindi , sanskrit , chinese , arabic , dutch , portuguese and english . nearly every indonesian speaks the language due to it widespread use in education , academic , communication , business , politics , and mass medium . most indonesian also speak at least one of more than 700 local language , often a their first language . most belong to the austronesian language , while there are over 270 papuan language spoken in eastern indonesia . of these , javanese language is the most widely spoken . </s> in 1930 , dutch people and other european ( totok ) , eurasian ( mixed ancestry ) , and derivative people like the indo people , numbered 240,000 or 0.4 % of the total population . historically , they constituted only a tiny fraction of the native population and remain so today . also , the dutch language never had a substantial number of speaker or official status despite the dutch presence for almost 350 year . the small minority that can speak it or dutch-based creole language fluently are the aforementioned ethnic group and descendant of dutch coloniser . this reflected the primary purpose of the dutch colonial empire , which wa commercial exchange a opposed to sovereignty over homogeneous landmass . today , there is some degree of fluency by either educated member of the oldest generation or legal professional , a specific law code are still only available in dutch . </s> <section_title_start> religion <section_title_end> </s> while the constitution stipulates religious freedom , the government officially recognises only religion in indonesia : islam in indonesia , protestantism in indonesia , roman catholicism in indonesia , hinduism in indonesia , buddhism in indonesia , and supreme council for the confucian religion in indonesia ; with indigenous religion only partly acknowledged . indonesia is the world 's most populous muslim-majority country with 227 ; million adherent in 2017 , with the majority being sunni islam ( 99 % ) . the shia islam in indonesia and ahmadiyya in indonesia respectively constitute 1 % ( 13 ; million ) and 0.2 % ( 200,000400,000 ) of the muslim population . almost 11 % of indonesian are christian , while the rest are hindu , buddhist , and others . most hindu are balinese people , and most buddhism are chinese indonesian . </s> the native of the indonesian archipelago originally practised indigenous animism and dynamism ( metaphysics ) , belief that are common to austronesian people . they worshipped and revered ancestral spirit , and believed that supernatural spirit ( [ might inhabit certain place such a large tree , stone , forest , mountain , or sacred site . example of indonesian native belief system include the sundanese people sundanese ] [ [ sunda wiwitan , dayak people 's kaharingan , and the javanese people kejawn . they have had a significant impact on how other faith are practised , evidenced by a large proportion of peoplesuch a the javanese abangan , balinese hinduism , and dayak christianspractising a le orthodoxy , syncretism form of their religion . </s> hinduism in indonesia influence reached the archipelago a early a the first century ce . the sundanese people kingdom of sunda of salakanagara in western java around 130 wa the first historically recorded greater india kingdom in the archipelago . buddhism in indonesia arrived around the 6th century , and it history in indonesia is closely related to that of hinduism , a some empire based on buddhism had it root around the same period . the archipelago ha witnessed the rise and fall of powerful and influential hindu and buddhist empire such a majapahit , shailendra dynasty , srivijaya , and mataram . though no longer a majority , hinduism and buddhism remain to have a substantial influence on indonesian culture . </s> islam in indonesia wa introduced by sunni islam trader of the shafi ' i fiqh , a well a sufi trader from the indian subcontinent and southern arabian peninsula a early a the 8th century ce . for the most part , islam overlaid and mixed with existing cultural and religious influence that resulted in a distinct form of islam . trade , missionary work such a by the wali sanga and chinese explorer zheng he , and military campaign by several sultanate helped accelerate the spread of the religion . by the end of the 16th century , islam had supplanted hinduism and buddhism a the dominant religion of java and sumatra . </s> catholic church in indonesia wa brought by portuguese trader and missionary such a society of jesus francis xavier , who visited and baptised several thousand local . it spread faced difficulty due to the voc policy of banning the religion and the dutch hostility due to the eighty year ' war against catholic spain 's rule . protestantism in indonesia is mostly a result of calvinism and lutheranism missionary effort during the dutch colonial era . although they are the most common branch , there is a multitude of other denomination elsewhere in the country . </s> there wa a history of the jew in indonesia until 1945 , mostly dutch and some baghdadi jew . since most have left after indonesia proclaimed independence , judaism wa never accorded official status , and only a tiny number of jew remain today , mostly in jakarta and surabaya . at the national and local level , indonesia 's political leadership and civil society group have played a crucial role in interfaith relation , both positively and negatively . the invocation of the first principle of indonesia 's philosophical foundation , pancasila ( the belief in the one and only god ) often serf a a reminder of religious tolerance , though instance of intolerance have occurred . an overwhelming majority of indonesian consider religion to be essential , and it role is present in almost all aspect of society , including politics , education , marriage , and public holiday in indonesia . </s> <section_title_start> education and health <section_title_end> </s> education is compulsory for 12 year . parent can choose between state-run , non-sectarian school or private or semi-private religious ( usually islamic ) school , supervised by the ministry of education and religion , respectively . private international school that do not follow the education in indonesia # 2013 curriculum are also available . the enrolment rate is 93 % for primary education , 79 % for secondary education , and 36 % for tertiary education ( 2018 ) . the literacy rate is 96 % ( 2018 ) , and the government spends about 3.6 % of gdp ( 2015 ) on education . in 2018 , there were more than 4,500 higher educational institution in indonesia , with the top university ( the university of indonesia , bandung institute of technology and gadjah mada university ) and most others located in java . </s> government expenditure on healthcare is about 3.3 % of gdp in 2016 . a part of an attempt to achieve universal health care , the government launched the national health insurance ( jaminan kesehatan nasional , jkn ) in 2014 . it includes coverage for a range of service from the public and also private firm that have opted to join the scheme . in recent decade , there have been remarkable improvement such a rising life expectancy ( from 62.3 year in 1990 to 71.7 year in 2019 ) and declining child mortality ( from 84 death per 1,000 birth in 1990 to 25.4 death in 2017 ) . nevertheless , indonesia continues to face challenge that include maternal and child health , low air quality , malnutrition , high rate of smoking , and infectious disease . </s> <section_title_start> issue <section_title_end> </s> nearly 80 % of indonesia 's population life in the western part of the archipelago , but they are growing at a slower pace than the rest of the country . this situation creates a gap in wealth , unemployment rate , and health between densely populated island and economic centre ( such a sumatra and java ) and sparsely populated , disadvantaged area ( such a maluku island and western new guinea ) . numerous case of racism and discrimination , especially discrimination against chinese indonesian and indigenous people of new guinea , have been well documented ; the latter ha to do with an free papua movement ongoing , decades-long separatist movement . lgbt right in indonesia ha been relatively obscure . however , in the 2010s ( especially after 2016 ) , a wave of anti-lgbt rhetoric ha surged rapidly , putting lgbt indonesian into a frequent subject of intimidation , discrimination , and even violence . </s> <section_title_start> culture <section_title_end> </s> the cultural history of the indonesian archipelago span more than two millennium . influence from the indian subcontinent , mainland china , the middle east , europe , and the austronesian people have historically shaped the cultural , linguistic and religious makeup of the archipelago . a a result , modern-day indonesia ha a multicultural , multilingual and multi-ethnic society , with a complex cultural mixture that differs significantly from the original indigenous culture . indonesia currently hold unesco intangible cultural heritage list eleven item of unesco 's intangible cultural heritage , including a wayang puppet theatre , kris , batik , pencak silat , angklung , and the three genre of traditional balinese dance . </s> <section_title_start> art and architecture <section_title_end> </s> indonesian art include both age-old art form developed through century and a recently developed contemporary art . despite often displaying local ingenuity , indonesian art have absorbed foreign influencesmost notably from india , the arab world , china and europe , a a result of contact and interaction facilitated , and often motivated , by trade . painting is an balinese art , where it people are famed for their artistry . their painting tradition started a classical kamasan or wayang style visual narrative , derived from visual art discovered on candi of indonesia ba relief in eastern java . </s> there have been numerous discovery of megalithic art in indonesia . subsequently , tribal art ha flourished within the culture of nias people , batak people , asmat people , dayak people and toraja . wood and stone are common material used a the medium for sculpting among these tribe . between the 8th and 15th century , the javanese civilisation ha developed a refined stone sculpting art and architecture which wa influenced by hindu-buddhist dharma civilisation . the temple of borobudur and prambanan are among the most famous example of the practice . </s> a with the art , indonesian architecture ha absorbed foreign influence that have brought cultural change and profound effect on building style and technique . the most dominant ha traditionally been architecture of india ; however , chinese , arab , and european influence have also been significant . traditional carpentry , masonry , stone and woodwork technique and decoration have thrived in vernacular architecture , with number of traditional house ' ( rumah adat ) style that have been developed . the traditional house and settlement in the country vary by ethnic group , and each ha a specific custom and history . example include toraja 's tongkonan , minangkabau people 's rumah gadang and rangkiang , javanese style pendopo pavilion with joglo style roof , dayak people 's longhouses , various rumah melayu , balinese architecture and balinese temple , and also different form of rice barn ( lumbung ) . </s> <section_title_start> music , dance and clothing <section_title_end> </s> the music of indonesia predates historical record . various indigenous tribe incorporate chant and song accompanied by musical instrument in their ritual . angklung , kacapi suling , gong , gamelan , talempong , kulintang , and sasando are example of traditional indonesian instrument . the diverse world of indonesian music genre is the result of the musical creativity of it people , and subsequent cultural encounter with foreign influence . these include qanbs and qasida from the middle east , keroncong from portugal , and dangdutone of the most popular music genre in indonesiawith notable hindi influence a well a malay orchestra . today , the indonesian music industry enjoys both nationwide and regional popularity in malaysia , singapore , and brunei , due to common culture and intelligible language between indonesian language and malay language . </s> indonesian dance have a diverse history , with more than 3,000 original dance . scholar believe that they had their beginning in ritual and religious worship . example include war dance , a dance of witch doctor , and dance to call for rain or any agricultural ritual such a hudoq . indonesian dance derive it influence from the archipelago 's prehistoric and tribal , hindu-buddhist , and islamic period . recently , modern dance and urban teen dance have gained popularity due to the influence of western culture , a well a those of japan and south korea to some extent . various traditional dance , however , including those of java , bali and dayak continue to be a living and dynamic tradition . </s> indonesia ha various style of clothing a a result of it long and rich cultural history . the national costume ha it origin in the indigenous culture of the country and traditional textile tradition . the javanese batik and kebaya are arguably indonesia 's most recognised national costume , though they have sundanese people and balinese people origin a well . each province ha a representation of traditional attire and dress , such a ulos of batak from north sumatra ; songket of malay ( ethnic group ) and minangkabau people from sumatra ; and ikat of sasak people from lombok . people wear national and regional costume during traditional wedding , formal ceremony , music performance , government and official occasion , and they vary from traditional to modern attire . </s> <section_title_start> theatre and cinema <section_title_end> </s> wayang , the javanese , sundanese , and balinese shadow puppet theatre display several mythological legend such a ramayana and mahabharata . other form of local drama include the javanese ludruk and ketoprak , the sundanese sandiwara , betawi lenong , and various balinese dance drama . they incorporate humour and jest and often involve audience in their performance . some theatre tradition also include music , dancing and the pencak silat martial art such a randai from minangkabau people of west sumatra . it is usually performed for traditional ceremony and festival , and based on semi-historical minangkabau legend and love story . modern performing art also developed in indonesia with their distinct style of drama . notable theatre , dance , and drama troupe such a teater koma are famous a it often portrays social and political satire of indonesian society . </s> the first film produced in the archipelago wa loetoeng kasaroeng , a silent film by dutch director l. heuveldorp . the film industry expanded after independence , with six film made in 1949 rising to 58 in 1955 . usmar ismail , who made significant imprint in the 1950s and 1960s , is generally considered to be the pioneer of indonesian film . the guided democracy in indonesia saw the use of cinema for nationalistic , anti-western purpose , and foreign film were subsequently banned , while the new order utilised a censorship code that aimed to maintain social order . production of film peaked during the 1980s , although it declined significantly in the next decade . notable film in this period include satan 's slave ( 1980 film ) ( 1980 ) , nagabonar ( 1987 ) , tjoet nja ' dhien ( 1988 ) , catatan si boy ( 1989 ) , and warkop 's comedy film . </s> independent filmmaking wa a rebirth of the film industry since 1998 , where film started addressing previously banned topic , such a religion , race , and love . between 2000 and 2005 , the number of film released each year steadily increased . riri riza and mira lesmana were among the new generation of filmmaker who co-directed kuldesak ( 1999 ) , petualangan sherina ( 2000 ) , ada apa dengan cinta ? ( 2002 ) , and laskar pelangi ( 2008 ) . in 2016 , warkop dki reborn : jangkrik bos part 1 smashed box office record , becoming the most-watched indonesian film with 6.8 ; million ticket sold . indonesia ha held annual film festival and award , including the indonesian film festival ( festival film indonesia ) that ha been held intermittently since 1955 . it hand out the citra award , the film industry 's most prestigious award . from 1973 to 1992 , the festival wa held annually and then discontinued until it revival in 2004. </s> <section_title_start> mass medium and literature <section_title_end> </s> medium of indonesia freedom increased considerably after the fall of the new order , during which the ministry of information monitored and controlled domestic medium and restricted foreign medium . the television market includes several national commercial network and provincial network that compete with public tvri , which held a monopoly on tv broadcasting from 1962 to 1989 . by the early 21st century , the improved communication system had brought television signal to every village , and people can choose from up to 11 channel . private radio station carry news bulletin while foreign broadcaster supply programme . the number of printed publication ha increased significantly since 1998. </s> like other developing country , indonesia began development of the internet in the early 1990s . it first commercial internet service provider , pt . indo internet began operation in jakarta in 1994 . the country had 171 ; million internet user in 2018 , with a penetration rate that keep increasing annually . most are between the age of 15 and 19 and depend primarily on mobile phone for access , outnumbering both laptop and computer . </s> the oldest evidence of writing in the indonesian archipelago is a series of sanskrit inscription dated to the 5th century . many of indonesia 's people have firmly rooted oral tradition , which help to define and preserve their cultural identity . in written poetry and prose , several traditional form dominate , mainly syair , pantun , gurindam , list of hikayat and javanese historical text . example of these form include syair abdul muluk , hikayat hang tuah , malay annals , and babad tanah jawi . </s> early modern indonesian literature originates in sumatran tradition . literature and poetry flourished during the decade leading up to and after independence . balai pustaka , the government bureau for popular literature , wa instituted in 1917 to promote the development of indigenous literature . many scholar consider the 1950s and 1960s to be the golden age of indonesian literature . the style and characteristic of modern indonesian literature vary according to the dynamic of the country 's political and social landscape , most notably the war of independence in the second half of the 1940s and the anti-communist mass killing in the mid-1960s . notable literary figure of the modern era include multatuli , chairil anwar , mohammad yamin , merari siregar , marah roesli , pramoedya ananta toer , and ayu utami . </s> <section_title_start> cuisine <section_title_end> </s> indonesian cuisine is one of the most diverse , vibrant , and colourful in the world , full of intense flavour . many regional cuisine exist , often based upon indigenous culture and foreign influence such a chinese , european , middle eastern , and indian precedent . rice is the leading staple food and is served with side dish of meat and vegetable . spice ( notably chilli ) , coconut milk , fish and chicken are fundamental ingredient . </s> some popular dish such a nasi goreng , gado-gado , satay , and soto ( food ) are ubiquitous and considered a national dish . the ministry of tourism , however , chose tumpeng a the official national dish in 2014 , describing it a binding the diversity of various culinary tradition . other popular dish include rendang , one of the many padang cuisine along with dendeng and gulai . another fermented food is oncom , similar in some way to tempeh but us a variety of base ( not only soy ) , created by different fungi , and is prevalent in west java . </s> <section_title_start> sport <section_title_end> </s> sport are generally male-oriented , and spectator are often associated with illegal gambling . badminton and association football are the most popular sport . indonesia is among the only five country that have won the thomas cup and uber cup , the world team championship of men 's and woman 's badminton . along with olympic weightlifting , it is the sport that contributes the most to indonesia at the olympics indonesia 's olympic medal tally . liga 1 ( indonesia ) is the country 's premier football club league . on the international stage , indonesia national football team wa the first asian team to participate at the fifa world cup in 1938 fifa world cup a the dutch east indie . on a regional level , indonesia won a bronze medal at the 1958 asian game a well a two gold medal at the 1987 southeast asian game and 1991 southeast asian game ( sea game ) . indonesia 's first appearance at the afc asian cup wa in 1996 afc asian cup and successfully qualified for the next three tournament , although they never make the knockout phase . </s> other popular sport include boxing and basketball , which ha a long history in indonesia and wa part of the first national sport week ( indonesia ) ( pekan olahraga nasional , pon ) in 1948 . some of the famous indonesian boxer include ellyas pical , three time international boxing federation super flyweight champion ; nico thomas , muhammad rachman , and chris john ( boxer ) . in motorsport , rio haryanto became the first indonesian to compete in formula one in 2016 . sepak takraw and karapan sapi ( bull racing ) in madura island are some example of traditional sport in indonesia . in area with a history of tribal warfare , mock fighting contest are held , such a caci in flores and pasola in sumba . pencak silat is an indonesian martial art and in 1987 , became one of the sporting event in the sea game , with indonesia appearing a one of the leading competitor . in southeast asia , indonesia is one of the top sport powerhouse by winning the sea game ten time since 1977 , most recently in 2011 southeast asian game . </s> <section_title_start> see also <section_title_end> </s> * list of indonesia-related topic </s> * index of indonesia-related article </s> * outline of indonesia </s> <section_title_start> note <section_title_end> </s>
